Name: Business Analyst
Description: TCG is an award-winning Government technology solutions provider. We are seeking a Business Analyst who currently resides in the Washington D.C. metropolitan area, to join the TCG SharePoint development team.  US Citizenship or US Permanent Resident (Green card) status and the ability to pass and maintain a Federal government (Public Trust) clearance is required for this position.  RESPONSIBILITIES: Providing direct support to the SharePoint development teamActing as a liaison between the SharePoint development team and Federal clientsFacilitating and leading requirements gathering sessions with end usersEliciting and documenting business and system requirementsDeveloping user stories with acceptance criteriaDeveloping test plans, test cases, and test scriptsConducting quality assurance (QA) testing on SharePoint applications REQUIRED SKILLS: Demonstrable understanding of SharePoint Online/2016 and Office 365 out-of-box functionality and its ability to address business needs and improve processes3+ years of Business Analysis experience, specifically supporting software applicationsExperience with Agile/Scrum activities and ceremonies, including backlog groomingAbility to clearly document requirements in user story format with testable acceptance criteriaAbility to facilitate and lead requirements-gathering sessions with customersAbility to analyze, define, and document requirements for business processes and workflows, including generating diagramsAbility to act as a liaison between developers, customers, and other stakeholders during all phases of solution developmentExperience with iterative systems development life-cycle and documentationExperience leading demonstrations of system prototypes and solutions to end usersExperience creating application test plans, test cases, and test scriptsExperience conducting quality assurance testing on software applications to ensure developed features fulfill documented requirementsExperience documenting defects identified during testingAbility to facilitate customer user acceptance testing (UAT) and assist users in troubleshooting issuesClear communication, writing, and presentation skillsAttention to detailInitiative PREFERRED SKILLS: Ability to speak to the capabilities and limitations of SharePoint Online/2016 with Federal clientsExperience using systems for requirements tracking and user story managementExperience using tools for SharePoint testingCBAP, CCBA, or equivalentCertified Scrum Master (CSM) or equivalentExperience with relevant CMMI Level 2 & 3 processes EDUCATION: Bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline Naturally, TCG does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or anything else that makes you part of any group. We discriminate on the basis of talent, ability, commitment, and experience.  We pay competitive wages and provide excellent benefits. We have a 401K plan, a health plan that includes dental and vision benefits, pet health insurance, support for sick-child daycare, book and fitness clubs, a generous training budget for each employee, employee-led (and TCG paid) social events, company charity events, free theater and sports tickets, and much more.  In fact, in 2018 Fortune magazine named TCG as a "Great Place to Work" for the third year in a row and The Washington Post named TCG as a "Top Workplace" for the fourth straight year, based on how our employees feel about the company, the benefits TCG offers, and the work/life balance that our staff are able to achieve. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Resp & QualificationsPURPOSE: At the FEP Operations Center (FEPOC), our customers come first. This newly created position will shape how we engage with our customers, improve the customer experience, and drive customer centricity into the organization. Our goal is to deliver best in class customer experiences while being as operationally efficient and effective as possible.  The FEPOC is the leading data management and digital solution provider to the 35 Blue Cross Blue Shield Plans that participate in the Federal Employee Program (FEP). The business analyst will join a new team supporting the Director Customer Strategic Planning in implementing strategies and processes to engage our customers and deliver a best in class customer experience. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated success in one or more of the following disciplines: project management, customer experience, process improvement, strategic planning, change management, knowledge management and/or customer analysis. PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES: Under the direction of Director Customer Strategic Planning, the principle duties and responsibilities may include, but are not limited to, the following: Program SupportFacilitate customer strategic planning sessions as requested.In partnership with other applicable functional areas, identify, assess and prioritize areas of customer dissatisfaction and propose strategies and action plans to address.Support maintenance of the customer engagement maturity model and corresponding roadmap initiatives.Project ManagementProject manage customer engagement roadmap initiatives, including managing scoping, planning, executing and stakeholder reporting tasks.Support the development of written work products including strategic plans, alternatives analyses, data collections tools, presentations, and talking points.Improve Customer ExperienceBuild strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.Provide a day to day voice of the customer in the business dialogue.Stay current on customer sentiment, mindset, brand perception, industry and competitor landscape and emerging trends.Develop standards and guidelines to track and manage FEPOC touchpoints with customers to ensure professional interactions, accurate and consistent messaging, and appropriate knowledge capture and transfer.Lead journey-mapping sessions, and develop and maintain customer journey maps to understand the customer experience. Summarize key results and evolve learnings into actionable focus areas which result in impactful customer experience improvements.Lead efforts to improve business processes that adversely impact the customer experience.Customer Analysis and ReportingCapture, synthesize, and summarize customer insights.Conduct customer analysis and customer segmentation to support FEPOC strategic planning and account management strategies.Assist product teams in formulating go-to-market strategies.Collect, report and analyze customer success measures to garner actionable insights that will drive strategies around increasing solution/feature usage and user satisfaction.Contribute toward development and analysis of customer surveys.Support knowledge management of customer information. Other duties as assigned Minimum Qualifications:Required:Bachelor’s degree required and 5+ years of strategic planning, customer analysis, management consulting, and/or IT management experience.3+ years of experience managing strategic customer initiatives within a large, matrixed and complex organization.Proficient with Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.Preferred:MBAPrevious IT and healthcare payer industry experience.Demonstrated experience in customer insight analysis, customer centric organizational culture transformation and/or customer experience design and improvement in a B2B environment. Familiarity with journey mapping, user experience design and/or user centered design principles, co-creation or similar strategies to improve customer engagement.Attributes:Strong customer focus.Ability to think conceptually and strategically and learn quickly.Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to creatively represent data visually for strong end effective communication of ideas and recommendations. Strong presentation skills with the ability to present to and influence diverse audiences on strategic initiatives and business opportunities.Possession of excellent research, data gathering, analytical, critical thinking, problem solving and listening skills. Bias towards delivering impactful results.Ability to meet deadlines, adhere to project plans, ensure any conflicts are brought to the attention of the management team, and multi-task and work on several projects simultaneously.Possess flexibility and adaptability to thrive in a dynamic, fluid environment and ambiguous situations. Challenges the status quo, champions and manages change.Ability to interact and network effectively with all levels of staff, including senior leadership, both internal and on the client site. The incumbent is required to immediately disclose any debarment, exclusion, or other event that makes him/her ineligible to perform work directly or indirectly to Federal health care programs.DepartmentDepartment:Equal Employment Opportunity CareFirst BlueCross BlueShield is an Equal Opportunity (EEO) employer. It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information. Hire Range Disclaimer Actual salary will be based on relevant job experience and work history. Where To Apply Please visit our website to apply: www.carefirst.com/careers Closing DatePlease apply before: 12/13/2018Federal Disc/Physical DemandNote: The incumbent is required to immediately disclose any debarment, exclusion, or other event that makes him/her ineligible to perform work directly or indirectly on Federal health care programs. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential duties and responsibilities of the position successfully. Requirements may be modified to accommodate individuals with disabilities.  The employee is primarily seated while performing the duties of the position. Occasional walking or standing is required. The hands are regularly used to write, type, key and handle or feel small controls and objects. The employee must frequently talk and hear. Weights of up to 25 pounds are occasionally lifted. Minimal travel required. Sponsorship in US Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without Sponsorship

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionNetCentrics is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to support our Business Development (BD) team in Herndon, VA. The Business Analyst will be responsible for supporting data analysis, conducting research, preparing BD-related reports and presentations on business opportunities, and overseeing the data accuracy and completeness of BD-maintained data, such as the pipeline, BD performance statistics and measures, and proposal and conference/activity schedules. The Business Analyst will maintain company past performance and other data used to support our proposal efforts, and prepare and complete data calls in support of proposal development. For a hired candidate who exhibits the potential and desire to exceed, demonstrated excellent performance may lead to an Account Manager position. This position is open only to Candidates who are clearable. The hired individual will report directly to the BD Department’s SVP.Requirements:Fully capable to use MS 365 Office Suite Tools: Word, Excel, and Power Point.Education: BA/BS Degree or equivalent.Years of Experience: 1+ years of analyst-related experience.As a contingency to employment at NetCentrics, all candidates who are given offers must successfully pass a full background investigation including criminal history, education and employment verifications.Preferred Qualification Previous experience with the Government procurement process and DFARs.Experience in supporting business development efforts in the Government market in the fields of information technology, cyber security, and/or data analytics solutions and services.Experience in use of DELTEK GovWIN IQ and CRM, and experience in developing presentations and proposal-quality graphics.Self-starter who exhibits attention to detail and expert organization skills**In order to be considered for this position, you must apply directly through our careers site**This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.NetCentrics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: OverviewWe are seeking a Business Analyst supporting our Data Warehouse work at our HQ office in Herndon, VA. Capabilities include complex software and technology services and solutions, as well as end-to-end mission operations abilities, including Software Systems Development, Cyber, Modeling & Simulation, Mission Operations, Signal Intelligence (SIGINT), and Quick Reaction Capabilities (QRC) / Research & Development. The company is headquartered in Herndon, VA, with approximately 3,500 employees across the U.S. and Canada.EEO StatementWe are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Name: Business Analyst
Description: SUMMARY The Business Analyst must use their strong quantitative skills to review, evaluate, develop insights and make recommendations that lead to actionable results that accelerate profitable growth for the company. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESCompiling data from multiple sources to create integrated views that can be used to drive decision making.The ability to analyze data in a meaningful way, to communicate their findings effectively, and recommend solutions with a specific focus on creating more revenue and better profits.The individual requires the ability to work on multiple projects effectively and efficiently while meeting specific deadlines.Recommend improvements to business processes they discover during their analysis.Forecasting: Business Volume, Productivity, Profit and revenueCustomer Satisfaction Scoring: Forecasting, Improve Processes, Support other business unitsRate/Tariffs reflected in databases for Corporate, Commercial (Individual Consumer), and Foreign Agents.Analysis and Pricing: Van Line, Service Centers, Forwarding, Logistics, and RelocationAd-hoc ReportingSpecial Projects on an as-needed basis.Indirect oversight of various operating unitsQUALIFICATIONSMicrosoft Office –Microsoft Word, Excel, and Power Point requiredDatabase access tools such as SQL Select and Auto-Tag preferredAbility to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations.Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.EDUCATION A bachelor’s degree from a four year college in business, management, accounting, economics, statistics, information science, or similar or 4 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Name: Business Analyst

Name: Business Analyst
Description: i360, the leading data and technology provider for the pro-free market public policy and advocacy community, supports organizations that promote free enterprise and smaller government. i360 is a dynamic workplace sitting on the leading edge of public policy, technology, and business, and is seeking team members who are as excited about their cause as they are about building the next generation of political technology.  i360 is seeking a Business Analyst to join its analytics team, which is driven by data and measurement. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or higher3+ years of relevant work experience using Statistical Software like R, Stata, SPSS, Python, or SAS2+ years of experience using SQL to extract and manipulate data from a database2+ years of experience using data to draw actionable insights in a business environmentRole is not eligible for VISA Sponsorship. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree with a quantitative focus or significant experience post-college working with dataDemonstrated ability to innovate in data analytics and data science4+ years of experience using data to draw actionable insights in a businessAPPLY NOW

Name: Operations Analyst

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Description: Job Description Leidos is seeking a Business Analyst as part of a test organization that will be matrixed across Agile teams to support requirements elicitation, agile requirements development, data collection and analysis and will be the primary liaison with end users and internal support teams in Bethesda, MD.  The candidate should be able to understand the business needs and translate them to agile requirements (user stories) for their testability and explain them to testers and developers, when needed. The candidate also needs to take feedback on the requirements from the team to enhance them upon client's approval. Key areas of responsibilities: • Conduct meetings to elicit, define and document requirements from sponsors and end users • Conduct qualitative analysis of existing implementations and provide thoughtful, strategic improvement recommendations • Conduct requirements gathering sessions with client stakeholders using interviews, document analysis, business process descriptions, scenarios, workflow analysis • Decompose business needs into agile requirements • Be responsible for having clear requirements with acceptance criteria for each user story before the sprint starts • Translate requirements into clear acceptance criteria • Articulate business requirements to developers and testers • Identify gaps in processes, opportunities for improvements and automation • Assist the product owner with prioritizing the backlog • Develop and maintain requirements management lifecycle artifacts • Documenting the requirements and keeping track of requirements change • Writing UAT scripts and conducting UAT sessions if needed • Work directly with the PM to ensure that project deliverables are met • Keep updating the requirements documents, as requirements change • Work with automation testers to identify regression test candidates for automation • Participation in daily scrum meetings • Participate in all phases of risk management assessments and software development with emphasis on analysis of user requirements • Supporting our metrics program by keeping track and metrics on all activities hhsnih  external referral eligible  Required Skills: • Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent based on evaluation of academic credentials, training and/or experience) as well as 5 years of related business analysis/requirements gathering • At least 2 years of experience performing as an analyst and tester • Experience with Agile software development frameworks, i.e. Scrum • Experience in drafting detailed requirements • Experience using JIRA and Confluence • Ability to create mockups, Visio diagrams/charts, functional & design documents, Test Scripts • Demonstrated knowledge of all business analysis practices with emphasis on business requirements gathering, facilitation, testing and work flow analysis • Must demonstrate a sense of urgency, and the ability to work independently and proactively in achieving team and individual objectives • Must be comfortable in a dynamic and fast-paced environment • Must have strong attention to detail and an inquisitive mindset • • Ability to quickly grasp and understand technical concepts and systems • Strong verbal and written communication skills • Very strong Analytical and problem solving skills • US Citizenship or US Person (Green Card Holder) is required and must be able to obtain a Public Trust clearance to get a Health and Human Services / Health Resources and Services Administration badge Desired Skills: • Experience working in public health and federal contracting • Experience working on Federal grants systems (HRSA, Grant Solutions, NSF, NIH etc.) • Experience working with Federal customers onsite • Experience with SQL server and experience with writing and executing backend tests using SQL. • Experience with test automation • Experience with 508 compliance testing • PMI-BA certification • Certified Scrum Master or Certified Product Owner

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business AnalystLooking for the next step in your career? Enjoy a challenge? Do you have an ambition for innovation? Want to make a difference? If you join our growing global team, you’ll be working for an industry leader with offices across five continents, in over 47 countries and more than 28 000 employees. You will work with some of the leading world brands across the Fortune 100 and Fortune 500 companies – who are all relying on Dimension Data to help them use the power of technology to achieve their ambition in this digital era.You’ll be part of a team who’s passionate about making a difference to the way technology shapes how we live and work – whether it’s protecting the rhino, connecting the G20 Summit, or revolutionising cycling, giving you the opportunity to do great things.  You’ll be joining a Global Top Employer, recognised for investing in talent because people are at the heart of our success. You provide the skills, passion and ideas, and we’ll provide the platform to realise your ambitions.Great talent. Great teams. Great work. Great opportunities. Want to be part of our team?The Business Analyst works closely with internal clients to identify business requirements. This role requires the ability to interpret business needs and translate them into system requirements. The Business Analyst writes business specifications for product manager’s approval. The Business Analyst conducts internal meetings to review the requirements with the development team and updates requirements as necessary.What you'll be doingMajor Duties & ResponsibilitiesInterviews stakeholders to capture and clarify requirementsApplies best practice methodologies to define, scope, document and validate the requirements of internal and/or external clients for information, processes, information or system changes and improvements or problemsAssists with building business casesActively participates and as required leads sessions to define functional requirements, work flows, and business processes (including meeting co-ordination, initial request handling, requirements gathering, facilitation, etc.)Education/Qualifications RequiredBachelor’s degree in Business or Engineering, or equivalent training in a related field, preferredWork Experience Required2-4 years of experience required or equivalent educationPrevious process assessment work experience strongly preferredWhat would make you a good fit for this role?Skills and Core CompetenciesStrong interpersonal and consultative skillsStrong oral and written communication skillsDemonstrated self-initiative and self-direction in learning activities and professional developmentBroad understanding of business practices and processes, process modeling techniques, relevant process analysis tools and methodologies or systems designJoin our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data. Apply today.Diversity in Dimension Data Dimension Data is an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be unfairly discriminated against on any arbitrary ground including race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected category.

Name: Business Analyst - D2
Description: Job:  Business Analyst - D2 Location: Washington, DC Capabilities: Process & BAAdditional Locations:Travel Requirements: Job Number: JO-1810-9308 AddthisShare  | Facebook  LinkedIn  Google Bookmark  Twitter  |Email this jobCELEBRATE YOUR PERSONALITY AND TEAM SPIRIT.GROW THROUGH YOUR CHOICES.MAKE YOUR MARK. North Highland has a mantra: Unleash Potential Together. For our clients, it means we challenge thinking and build capabilities, so that after each engagement, they are left stronger and inspired to do more. With our colleagues, it means fostering an environment where bringing, shaping, growing and sharing ideas isn’t just encouraged—it’s expected. And within our communities, it means we give of our skills, time and passion to make them more prosperous.  At North Highland, Strategy Consulting helps our clients determine where they should go by designing customized strategies to generate in-year returns and drive innovation, while Management Consulting helps our clients determine how to get there with a focus on process design, change management and project prioritization. Our Delivery Consulting enables our clients to get where they are going by executing on key operational PM, BA, Product and Change Management initiatives.  Within our firm we have a growing competency called Delivery Consulting. This is the team that makes the motor run for our clients with an emphasis on execution work focused on implementing the critical work the client needs, not meeting sales targets for the firm. North Highland offers a wide range of Delivery Consulting work from a single role-based opportunity to delivering complex initiatives as part of larger team. We offer a competitive compensation model designed centered around earned-hour pay. The measurement of a Delivery Consultant’s work is based on the efficacy of the work-product they provide – it’s that simple – and they are able to create and grow their skills in the fields that interest them most. Delivery Consultants talk less and do more, using their talents – of ingenuity, divergent thinking and relentless determination – to build products and services that speak for themselves.  This is a Business Analyst role with responsibility for leading our clients' efforts in implementing multiple IT project initiatives. Job FunctionsWork cross-functionally with key business partners to help establish strategic goals and objectives, project objectives, and set expectations on functional scopeFacilitate meetings with project stakeholders to determine project and application requirementsAnalyze the organization's business model and define its policies and market approachesElicitation of business and user requirements needed to conduct current state analysisReview user stories, system requirements, business rules, and scenario documentation to verify they meet business requirementsDesign business process to articulate functional specifications and standardize the organization's workflowsAnalyze systems and understand business rules required for IT project initiativesSupport development of project plans, project implementation, and post-implementation supportManage stakeholder needs and expectations, and communicate effectively for ongoing project progress visibilityAttend daily scrums to ensure project roadmap is on track and proper organizational alignment is in placeDetermine a prioritization of functional scope and work with delivery teams to set Agile sprint plans and release schedulesResponsible for backlog grooming and reporting, defect management, and risk monitoringQualifications3+ years of experience in business analysis, system analysis and design, or infrastructure design/development/supportLarge, enterprise project experience ranging in size from $1million+Agile Delivery - user story development and backlog groomingExperience working with C-Suite and communicating cross-functionallyHighly motivated and driven with ability to think strategically and take on initiativesAble to work in fast-pace, changing environmentAttention to detail and proven analytical skillsAbility to collaborate with both internal and external partnersRequirements GatheringMeeting FacilitationProcess DesignVersionOne, Rally, RTC or Jira experienceBachelor's degree requiredCBAP Preferred North Highland is a global management consulting firm known for helping clients solve their most complex challenges related to customer experience, performance improvement, technology and digital, and transformation. We add value and support our clients across the full spectrum of consulting, from strategy through delivery. We bring the big ideas, then we make them real. North Highland is an employee-owned firm, headquartered in Atlanta, GA, with more than 3,000 consultants worldwide and 60+ offices around the globe. The firm is a member of Cordence Worldwide (www.cordenceworldwide.com), a global management consulting alliance. For more information, visit northhighland.com and connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook.  North Highland is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, genetic data, or other legally protected status.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Resp & QualificationsPRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:Under the general supervision, the incumbent’s accountabilities may include, but are not limited to, the following:Investigate and analyze feasibility of low to moderately complex enhancements, automations and processes. Analyze, define and interpret business needs and issues by gathering, analyzing, documenting and validating the Business area(s) and user(s) technical (functional/non-functional) requirements. Participates in the creation of complex PRD (Project Requirements Document) which includes defining Business, User, functional and non-functional requirements needed for approval by Business and for use by Design, Development and Testing teams. Participates in creation of Requirements Management Plan (RMP) for complex projects and may create RMP for less complex projects, to define, organize and schedule requirements management and development activities. Participates in requirements analysis and verification sessions for complex projects and may lead requirements analysis and verification sessions for less complex projects. Participates in the tracking and management of open issues and assists in planning for resolution for complex projects. Maintain communications with technical counterparts to adopt best practices and ensure integration of specific application architecture into overall enterprise technology strategy.Lead testing efforts by defining, developing and implementing practices and procedures for complete end user test plans. Ensures all user acceptance tests are conducted and documented according to standards. Identifies and documents system deficiencies and recommends solutions. Responsible for overall success of user acceptance testing, including results verification and release. Coordinates groups of end users who test, evaluate and validate new functions and applications and identify issues in software or services. Ensures continuing operational quality by documenting fixes and enhancements. Providing guidance and training to application end users. Provides ongoing assistance to software developers and testers to resolve defects during the testing process. Participates in the management of the sequencing of releases to meet business needs for less complex enhancements, automations and implementations. May lead sequencing of releases for less complex enhancements, automations and implementations.Troubleshoot systems problems identify cause of problems, work with appropriate group to correct problem. Develop solutions that for low to moderately complex technical and/or business issues. Proactively identifies opportunities and enhancements. Leads development sessions and design reviews in order to ensure design meets user requirements.Participates in the exploration of alternative business solutions for moderately complex processes, programs or applications, and may lead exploration of alternative business solutions for less complex processes, programs or applications to crate, maintain and enhance business value. Works closely with system analysts to help create Proof Of Concepts (POCs) and alternative.Reviews, edits, analyze and create detailed documentation of business systems and user needs. Responsible for writing all documentation in clear and well organized manner. Develops key project deliverables including requirements specifications, use cases, system test cases, training and documentation and user manuals for projects of for low to moderately complex. Supports the production of Requirements Traceability Matrixes (RTM) and RTM gap analysis reports for complex enhancements, automations and implementations. May produce RTM and RTM gap analysis reports for less complex enhancements, automations and implementations.Use project management techniques to establish roles and responsibilities, monitor project and request status and workload, and ensure deliverables of high quality, effectiveness and timeliness. Manages assigned enhancements, automations and implementations from concept through implementation. Creates, develops and maintains project schedules for key deliverables by developing project plan, monitoring milestone completion and coordinating project progress. May lead for less complex enhancements, automations and implementations.QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:Required: This position requires a bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or Business or relevant work experience in business analysis, systems analysis and/or testing background and 3-6 years of direct Business Analyst experience.Experience in business process analysis, Work flow, task analysis, User acceptance testing and requirements analysis.Proven ability to elicit, document, analyze and verify requirements.Strong experience with testing concepts.Technical writing experience and training experience.Prior experience leading business/technology enhancements, automations and implementations.Minimum of 3 years of demonstrated successful use of SDLC methodology or demonstrated knowledge of business processes related to the business area supporting.Must demonstrate understanding of industry standard Business Analysis Best Practices.Experience in accurately modeling requirements using at least one if not more of the following: Functional Decomposition, Data Flow Diagrams, User Context Diagrams, Activity Diagrams, Decision Needs, Workflow modeling, Use Cases, Use Case Model Survey and Use Case Specification, Process Modeling, PrototypingExperience in coaching and mentoring other associates as well as leading small teams of junior analysts.Required Abilities/Skills:Use industry standard requirements gathering and modeling techniques to understand and communicate the needs of the product’s usersRelevant business and systems subject matter expertise. Ability to work independently and as part of a team.Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to build consensus and agreement and bring resolution to contentious issues and entrenched interests. Ability to lead problem-solving discussions.Attention to detail and excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.  Advanced written and verbal communication skills. Excellent organizational skills and ability to set priorities and handle multiple projects concurrently. Proven Project Management skills.High level of analytical and problem solving skillsExtensive PC skills including Microsoft office software such as Word, Power Point, MS Project, Visio, and Excel.Experience with Requirements Traceability Matrixes (RTM) and RTM gap analysis.Preferred:Knowledge of organization and operations of the business area supporting.Understands basic Internet and client/server architectures.Knowledge of the CareFirst Defined Processes.Business Analyst certificationExperience with Requirements Management tools.Experience with healthcare insurance industry, especially BCBS plans.Experience with software testing, test management and defect tracking tools.DepartmentDepartment: Enrollment Business AreaEqual Employment OpportunityCareFirst BlueCross BlueShield is an Equal Opportunity (EEO) employer. It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.Hire Range DisclaimerActual salary will be based on relevant job experience and work history.Where To ApplyPlease visit our website to apply: www.carefirst.com/careersClosing DatePlease apply before: 12/26/2018Federal Disc/Physical DemandNote: The incumbent is required to immediately disclose any debarment, exclusion, or other event that makes him/her ineligible to perform work directly or indirectly on Federal health care programs.PHYSICAL DEMANDS:The associate is primarily seated while performing the duties of the position. Occasional walking or standing is required. The hands are regularly used to write, type, key and handle or feel small controls and objects. The associate must frequently talk and hear. Weights up to 25 pounds are occasionally lifted.Sponsorship in USMust be eligible to work in the U.S. without Sponsorship

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Project Summary: DRT is seeking a very experienced Senior Business Analyst to join our FDA team and support one of our newest customers on the FDA account. This position requires the candidate to be able to wear multiple hats, be able to lead requirements gathering and elicitation, drive high customer satisfaction, and be able to expand the scope of work and generate business growth. Responsibilities:Analyze the configuration of the existing RM/TM tool, (ALM), assess for completeness and effectiveness in developing and documenting requirements and automated test scripting from initiation, design, test cases to deployment as it aligns with established plansDocument the results of the analysis in a gap analysis document and deliver to the clientDevelop recommendations for reconfiguration of current RT/TM or new tools suite that meet client business needs (Global Requirements, Automated Regression Testing, Automated Test Scripting, Dashboards/Reporting)Once the new software is approved and purchased by the government, will install, integrate, test, and validate CVM instances of the solution, including metadata capabilities to support requirements and test management, following the FDA EPLC processes/artifacts for design through implementationWork with government representatives to secure and implement additional instances of the recommended solution(s) and gain approval through the OIMT Software Acquisition Approval processReview existing data models/processes/tools; make recommendations for improvements and ensure Subject Matter Experts are trained in the new Requirements/Testing Management processes/policies/tools; facilitate discussions and workshopsDetermine the most appropriate use of business/technical modeling to solve business issues; determine and create project deliverablesManage multiple high priority items; work independently and excel in a high tempo operational environmentDefine and analyze problems and develop solutions.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Required Experience:Minimum 8 years of experience as a business analyst with 3-5 years as a lead, preferably with the Federal governmentStrong experience in Requirements Management and Test Management Tool configuration and automationHands-on experience working in ALM, JIRA, Confluence, Selenium, Cucumber, Jenkins, TFS is highly desirable.Strong understanding and experience in the full software development lifecycle with proven experience in authoring requirements management plan, RTM, business requirements, project charter, etc.Strong communication skills, meeting facilitation, and documentation experienceExperience working with end users in orchestrating UAT, developing a UAT plan, managing UAT schedule, writing UAT scripts, etc.Experience working alongside vendors and client in evaluating requirements and test automation products and providing the best fit that meets the client needs.Experience with business process analysis and workflow developmentExperience working in an agile environment is preferredExperience conducting an analysis of technical and test requirement artifacts from CDMS, SP, ALM, LAN drives and develop an inventory, then assess how to standardize these into the proposed solutionExperience working in DevOps is preferredEducation and Training:Bachelors Degree in Computer Science/Information Systems/MIS/IT is preferredCBAP certification preferredPMP certification preferredCSM/CSPO certification preferredAWS certifications preferred DRT Strategies, Inc. (DRT) celebrates diversity and is proud to provide Equal Employment Opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetics, disability, or protected veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, DRT complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Sila is seeking an energetic Business Systems Analyst to join our team in Arlington, Virginia. As an Analyst, you will have the opportunity to support clients across varying domains, industries and technologies as you participate in multiple system implementation projects. This role is perfect for a team player looking to take on more responsibility and to fast-track his/her growth towards project management, if desired.The successful candidate must be a self-starter with a proven track record who seeks more career responsibility and new challenges. Prior experience engaging with both client and technical teams, knowledge of project management and SDLC methodologies, and strong facilitation and coordination skills are required. In addition, this candidate coordinates and advances projects even when objectives are not well defined. ResponsibilitiesParticipate in the full lifecycle of system implementation projectsLead and execute efforts to produce documentation to support project delivery. These include: functional specifications, data flow diagrams, test cases, requirements traceability matrices, flow charts, wireframes/mockups, user stories, and use case documentationGather requirements from clients and work with technical teams to determine feasibilityCreate and execute test plans/cases to ensure functionalityMeet and communicate with clients to provide project updates, recommendations and deliverablesCreate and effectively deliver presentations to clientsParticipate in internal initiatives that help shape the growth of SilaRequirements2+ years of consulting experience supporting software development/system implementation projectsDeep understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC). Exposure to Agile methodologies is a plusExperience participating in requirements sessions and testingEnergetic, flexible, eager to learnStrong organizational/data management skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAttention to detail and entrepreneurial spiritCritical thinking and problem-solving skillsAbility to collaborate with teams and work independentlyStrong interpersonal and leadership skillsProficiency in MS Office. Exposure to MS Project and Visio is a plusTravel may be requiredBachelor's Degree in Systems Engineering, Business Information Technology, Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems or related fieldCandidates must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for employment-based visa sponsorship now or in the future.About SilaSila is a technology and management consulting firm that delivers solutions to the worlds leading corporations and Federal government agencies. Our solutions expertise lies in the areas of cybersecurity, risk management, data analytics, software engineering and integration, strategy and transformation, and digital creative services. We are a values-driven company with a culture that fosters collaboration, creativity, and social responsibility. Sila employees are part of a community of vibrant, high-performing contributors who push each other to achieve the highest standard of excellence. Our team members have extensive opportunities to discover their passions and shape their own career paths, and we continually invest in employees growth through innovative training, mentorship, and professional development programs. Staff are quickly immersed in clients business challenges, work closely with emerging technologies to develop impactful solutions to these challenges, and are exposed to a variety of industries and market offerings.We are looking for full-time employees to become an integral part of our growing team. Sila is headquartered in Washington, D.C. and has offices in Chicago, IL; Denver, CO; Seattle, WA; and Shelton, CT. Sila offers a range of great benefits including a comprehensive healthcare package, 401K with matching, paid time off, and paid company holidays, as well as other unique benefits that support our staffs active work/life balance.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Name: Telecommunications Business Analyst
Description: OverviewPeraton is seeking a Telecommunications Business Analyst for a classified program to serve as the customer service point of contact for the telecommunications services within the enterprise and to external vendors.ResponsibilitiesPrimary responsibilities include managing contracts with external telecommunication vendors for products and services; reconciling vendor billing statements with internal billing systems to ensure accuracy of bills and approving and scheduling payments to vendors; working closely with project managers to gather and translate customer telecommunication requirements into Service Level Agreements (SLA); and managing the day-to-day research and resolution of customer comments, questions, and concerns for all telecommunication services providing technical guidance and direction to customers.Other duties include:  Overseeing voice network reconfiguration and billing reconciliations. Ensuring software including network control programs satisfy the communications needs covering both the hardware and software installed. Development of standards for carrier service and equipment. Ensuring that appropriate network documentation exists, including operational instructions. Providing regulatory monitoring and voice network analysis regarding short and long range planning for enterprise systems. Creating, maintaining, and enforcing telecommunication Service Level Agreements (SLA) Customer support and problem resolution for telecommunication services QualificationsRequires Bachelor's (or equivalent) with 5 – 8 years of experience, or a Master's and 3 to 5 years of experience.Working experience gathering and translating customer telecommunication requirements into Service Level Agreements (SLA), managing the day-to-day research and resolution of customer comments, questions, and concerns for all telecommunication services providing technical guidance and direction to customers.Current TS/SCI with poly security clearance. About PeratonPeraton provides innovative, reliable solutions to the nation’s most sensitive and mission-critical programs and systems. Peraton has significant experience providing highly differentiated secure communications, space, and technology solutions to key customers, and has become a trusted partner on missions that are critical to the security priorities of the United States. Capabilities include complex software and technology services and solutions, as well as end-to-end mission operations abilities, including Software Systems Development, Cyber, Modeling & Simulation, Mission Operations, Signal Intelligence (SIGINT), and Quick Reaction Capabilities (QRC) / Research & Development. The company is headquartered in Herndon, VA, with approximately 3,500 employees across the U.S. and Canada.EEO StatementWe are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.

Name: Senior Business Analyst, Client Activation
Description: Rally Health is seeking a Senior Business Analyst with proven background and understanding of business areas, business systems, integration, and client validation to join their high-performing Client Activation team. This is a client-facing position in a fast-paced, collaborative, and detail-oriented environment where all client facing interaction must ensure that a client would recommend Rally.  The Rally Health BA serves as a liaison between the business and development teams, takes ownership for collecting business requirements and configuring systems, supports managers and team members by being the go-to expert to assist with processing, troubleshooting and updating the application, and may act as project leader for designed projects. The BA will also perform client configuration, integration, and API validation in an expanding system architecture.  Requirements for Rally BAs: B.S. degree preferredClient-facing or end-user interaction and collaboration BA/ QA experience is a must have5+ years of industry experience as a BA/ QA professional with a background in functional, integration and regression testing of web applications with at least 3 years being client-facingKnowledge of process flows for data related implementations and processing transactionsCommunicate and coordinate with business, and development teams to maintain existing processes, and to execute new configurationsCollaborate with cross-functional teams to gather functional requirements; translate requirements into specificationsWork closely with trading partners to plan, execute, and implement data exchangeAssist product owner with prioritizing project backlogCollectivity provide development LOE and estimates/timelines for potential upcoming projectsConstruct technical requirements and specifications outlining data transformation; communicate purpose, impact, risk, and gapsTroubleshoot and triage data translation errors; Communicate and reconcile data errorsPlan and coordinate build testing from data import, extract, to backend ingestPartner with business to set priorities, report status, identify and resolve issues in order to meet business milestones/timelinesReport for management data exchange and transaction activity Qualities desired: Problem-solving and analytical skillsAbility to work on multiple projects concurrentlyAbility to work independently and in a dynamic team structureCommunication skills, ability to understand and communicate technical information to business usersComprehend SDLC process from requirement to production deliveryFamiliar with SQL Queries and running stored procedures Why join Rally? On top of an innovative work atmosphere and a chance to help people change their lives, we offer competitive pay, daily catered lunches, and an extensive benefits package for all full-time employees (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). In addition, offer the ability to grow, while truly making an impact in the healthcare system.  Rally Health is committed to ensuring that its workforce reflects America's diverse population. Rally Health knows that such diversity will enrich us with the talent, energy, perspective and inspiration it needs to achieve its mission. Rally Health believes in a policy of equal employment and opportunity for all people based on merit and commitment to the principles of diversity. It is our policy to recruit, hire, train, and promote individuals in all job titles, and administer all programs, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, sex, age, marital status, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family responsibilities, genetic information, disability, matriculation, political affiliation, veteran status, union affiliation, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  Individuals with disabilities and veterans are encouraged to apply. Applicants who require an accommodation related to the application and/or review process should notify Talent Acquisition (recruiting@rallyhealth.com).

Name: BI Analyst
Description: About EAB  EAB is an education best practices firm that uses a combination of research, technology, and services to improve the performance of 1,200+ educational institutions. Headquartered in Washington, D.C., EAB forges and finds the best new ideas and proven practices from its network of thousands of leaders, then customizes and hardwires them into every level of member organizations, creating enduring value.  At EAB, we serve not only our members but each other—that's why we are always working to make sure our employees love their jobs and are invested in their community. See how we've been recognized for this dedication to our employees by checking out our recent awards.  For more information, visit our Careers page.  The Role in Brief BI Analyst (Full Time, Starting Summer 2019) This role is based in Washington, D.C.  Are you a technical problem solver who thrives at figuring out how to best utilize disparate data and turn reports into actionable advice? Can you operate in a fast paced entrepreneurial environment interfacing with multiple stakeholders to lead the development of a product from vision to market?  We are looking for a BI Analyst to join EAB’s Analytics Development team. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to build world-class business intelligence solutions to help our higher education clients better understand and utilize data to improve student outcomes. The critical responsibility of this role is the end-to-end development and maintenance of highly visual and interactive reports and dashboards as part of EAB’s analytics technology solutions. Primary Responsibilities:Design, build, test, deploy and maintain interactive analytic products and features using designated Business Intelligence solutionParticipate in development of data processing flows including data cleansing and data transformationInvestigate and report on complex data interactions to facilitate data research in support of analytics development effortsPartner with product managers and other BI analysts and engineers to define product feature requirementsProvide production-level support and troubleshooting for clients and customer-facing teams, serving as the subject matter expertTriage incoming issues and enhancement requests from customers and internal stakeholdersDefine and document processes, best practices, and strategies for existing and future analytic solutionsProduce customer-facing user guides, support and training documentationBasic Qualifications:Bachelor’s DegreeOutstanding problem solving, quantitative and analytical reasoning skillsExperience creating data visualizations to summarize quantitative informationFamiliar with relational database conceptsStrong written and verbal communication skillsDemonstrated ability to manage projects independently while meeting deadlinesIdeal Qualifications:Experience working with large volumes of dataExperience using SQL to cleanse or transform dataExperience with data modeling and database designHands-on experience developing ETL pipelines or SQL-based data cleansingHands-on experience working with Business Intelligence product such as Tableau, Business Objects, or GoodDataAbility to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical audiencesBenefits: Consistent with our belief that our employees are our most valuable resource, EAB offers a competitive benefits package: Medical, dental, and vision insurance, dependents eligible401(k) retirement plan with company matchGenerous PTODaytime leave policy for community service or fitness activities (up to 10 hours a month each)Wellness programs including gym discounts and incentives to promote healthy livingDynamic growth opportunities with merit-based promotion philosophyBenefits kick in day one, see the full details here. At EAB, we believe that to fulfill our mission to “make education smarter and our communities stronger” we need team members who bring a diversity of perspectives to the table and a workplace where each team member is valued, respected and heard.  To that end, EAB is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we make employment decisions on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

Name: Associate, Quality Assurance/Business Analyst
Description: Associate, Quality Assurance/Business Analyst Location  Washington, DC Department  NCDR Analytics Operations & SolutionsApply NowWELCOME TO THE ACC! We are a 52,000-member nonprofit medical society and teaching institute, dedicated to enhancing the lives of cardiovascular patients through continuous quality improvement, patient-centered care, payment innovation and professionalism. We bestow credentials upon cardiovascular specialists who meet our stringent qualifications, provide professional education and operate national registries for the measurement and improvement of quality care. Above all, our commitment to our members and our patients has driven the College to be a leader in the formulation of health policy, standards and guidelines, and a steadfast supporter of cardiovascular research.  Named as one of Modern Healthcare’s Best Places to Work in Healthcare for the third year in a row, we offer satisfying and challenging work that makes a real difference in people's lives. We offer a collaborative environment where the contributions of our team members are recognized and where you can achieve professional growth and personal fulfillment. JOB OVERVIEW: Work within National Cardiovascular Data Registry (NCDR) Data Analytics team performing Quality Assurance (QA) and business analyst functions for software applications and product offerings to support analysis and reporting of data derived from NCDR’s Registries. MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Document business requirements and use cases working with the stakeholders for product offeringsDevelop and establish quality assurance measures and testing standards for applications, products, and deliverables within the NCDR Data Analytics team.Verify and revise quality assurance standards as needed.Develop and maintain functional, system and user test cases for optimal performance per product specifications.Ensure existing test scripts are revised as applications are enhanced over time.Ensure that testing activities allow applications to meet business products.Create, manage, and document client and user accounts on NCDR's secure ftp server, used as the standard for secure bidirectional file transmissions.Create and maintain Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERDs) of data exports for varies NCDR Registries.Perform related duties and responsibilities as needed.REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor’s degree, preferably in computer science, engineering, physical sciences, health care, information technology, or a related field.4-6 years of work experience.Experience as business Analyst and quality assurance professional.Time management, organizational skills and an ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast paced environment, with strong attention to detail and accuracy in assignments.Superior knowledge of Visio and ExcelProficiency andprofessionalism.
