Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst Category:  Business Analysis (functional and technical) City:  Arlington, Virginia, United States Position ID:  J0818-0030 Employment Type:  Full Time Meet our professionalsCGI: An employer of choice Position Description:CGI Federal is seeking a Business Analyst to be a part of our team for a proprietary COTS product, Momentum Financials®, with our Federal client in located in Rosslyn, VA. Ideal candidates will possess strong analytical skills and will have some experience with federal financial ERP systems (e.g. Momentum Financials®, Oracle Financials, SAP), and knowledge of SQL. It is expected that the analyst will have a solid background in functional analysis, requirements gathering and definition, developing and executing system test plans, and a solid understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC).  This role requires a degree of independent analysis, so self-motivation and the ability to drive and own tasks are imperative. Candidates should have strong writing skills and should be able to communicate effectively and comfortably with all levels of CGI and client management. Top candidates for this position will work well in a collaborative environment and will be eager to learn new functional methods and subject matter. Systems Analysts who are willing to make a long-term commitment to gaining a deep knowledge Momentum Financials® are strongly encouraged to apply. Your future duties and responsibilities:- Requirements Gathering and Documentation Product Configuration and DocumentationTest Case Development and ExecutionTraining Material Development and DeliveryTier 3 Issue Analysis and ResolutionDevelopment of SQL ScriptsData Analysis Required qualifications to be successful in this role:*Secret Clearance 1+ Years of experienceMomentum ExperienceRequirement gatheringTesting Experience Skills:Momentum FinancialsTest Case / Script Development What you can expect from us:Build your career with us.It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.  CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com. You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.  We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.  All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held.  CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI’s legal duty to furnish information.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: CSBS Business Analysts (BAs) are responsible for working closely with business units throughout CSBS to gain in-depth understanding of CSBS*s business strategy, processes, services, and information needs to identify changes that lead to business improvements. Working within a matrix IT team, BAs support a wide range of products and services, large-scale application development, systems integration, operational efficiency improvements, process reengineering, and infrastructure upgrades and deployments. Essential Functions To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and responsibility satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Other duties may be assigned to meet business needs. * Works with business partner to elicit high-level requirements and capture business needs * Clearly articulates and documents business requirements * Assesses the risks of various solutions and prioritizes competing business demands * Manages ongoing relationship with business partner to drive satisfaction with IT * Coordinates project delivery by participating in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions * Obtains key inputs from enterprise architecture teams and identifies solution interdependencies to include integration planning, dependency management and business process mapping * Engages with design team to incorporate usability and user interface needs when designing systems * Proactively resolves customer satisfaction issues * Negotiates contracts, manages relationships, and monitors vendor performance against SLAs * Supports testing by reviewing test plans and scripts for completeness and accuracy Minimum Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual should possess the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed and meet the amount of education, training and/or work experience required. Education and Experience Bachelor*s degree in Information Technology or related field and a minimum of three (3) years business analysis, requirements analysis, software development, or testing experience driving and leading multiple medium to large-scale cross functional projects (or equivalent combination of relevant education and experience) in a multi-vendor, outsourced environment. * Demonstrated experience writing statements of work and evaluating vendor proposals * Demonstrated technical proficiency performing system analysis, modeling and testing * Knowledgeable of project management principles * Knowledgeable of software development life cycle methods, including Agile * Strong listening skills * Ability to write in clear manner * Organized and detail-oriented, able to track and work on multiple projects at once * Consultative working style, able to effectively interface with various levels of leadership * Able to work independently and as part of a team. Working Conditions * General office that will involve long meeting periods from time to time * Some travel required - provided by DiceBusiness Analyst experience

Name: Analyst, Insights & Operations, Recruiting
Description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.Recruiting is a core strategic driver of Facebook's success. We have a world-class team working together to help drive our ambitions and scale to the next level. We are looking for an Analyst, Insights & Operations, Recruiting based in Washington DC.  This full-time position reports into the Lead, Insights & Operations and will be responsible for leveraging data and analytics to identify opportunities to increase the efficiency of the Global Recruitment; identifying processes, resources and tools that improve productivity, performance and compliance. Responsibilities:Support the Global Business Recruiting teams to analyze recruiting data and metrics, identify trends, evaluate effectiveness of recruiting strategies and measure ROIDesign reporting capabilities to enable school and company insights - including reporting ability for different teams, regions, and process areasCommunicate trends and insights to leaders as well as communicate data integrity issues or process gaps to individual team members and leadsEvaluate additional information needs and recommend appropriate system changes or enhancements to meet the needsDraft, maintain and support a variety of reports or queries utilizing appropriate reporting tools, assists recruiting/Business Intelligence team in the development or customization of standard reports for ongoing customer needs, generates ad-hoc reports as requiredIdentify and remediate recruiter practices which put at risk data integrity, as well as provide solutions to prevent such risks in the futureConduct analysis of current business processes and functional requirementsDemonstrate Metrics & Analytics capability to streamline reporting across all regions and pipelines and introduce predictive capabilities around the end-to-end recruitment cycleProvide on-going training to team leads and individuals on analytic tools and dashboards, including but not limited to MS Excel, Salesforce, Tableau, and othersEstablish and maintain relationships to continually improve collaboration with Business stakeholders, including Global Recruiting, People Engineering, Recruiting Operations and related teamsMininum Qualifications:Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in recruitment operations, business intelligence, and/or project management1+ years reporting and analytics experienceTrack record of partnering with business, engineering, and data science teams to deliver data-driven insights and translating those into process improvement recommendationsExperience with recruiting data and data visualization toolsPreferred Qualifications:2+ years' experience in recruitment operations, business intelligence, and/or project managementInterpersonal, communication and leadership skillsDemonstrated track record of building strong working relationships at all levels, across functions and geographic boundariesFlexibility to adapt to changing business situationsAbility and desire to collaborate and work with recruiting stakeholders across different time zonesEffective problem-solving capabilities and refined analytical skillsFlexibility to handle multiple tasks concurrently with acute attention to detailAptitude for learning new technologies extemporaneouslyExperience in Tableau

Name: Business Associate - Government Services
Description: THE COMPANY: JUUL's mission is to improve the lives of the world's one billion adult smokers by driving innovation to eliminate cigarettes. JUUL is the number one US-based vapor product. Headquartered in San Francisco and backed by leading technology investors including Tiger Global, Fidelity Investments and Tao Invest LLC, JUUL Labs is disrupting one of the world's largest and oldest industries.  We're an exceptional team with backgrounds in technology, healthcare, CPG and biotech, and we're growing rapidly to deliver on our mission. We're actively looking to hire the world's best scientists, engineers, designers, product managers, supply chain experts, customer service and business professionals. ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES JUUL Labs is seeking a Business Associate who will report directly to our Senior Business Associate or potentially one of our Senior Directors of Business Development (initially) for the Government Services Business Unit. As part of the Government Services team, you will work closely with our leadership to educate government officials, Veterans, VSO's, Military, Public and commercial Health professionals, First Responders and other Federal, State, and Local government personnel about our mission, emphasize JUUL's potential to benefit public health, and craft the best ongoing business development and education and awareness training framework to help ensure mission success. It is our goal to help government personnel and Veterans understand the enduring social and health repercussions cigarettes have around the world and the role JUUL can play in eliminating them.  Primary responsibilities: Assist Senior Business Associate and JUUL's Government Services leadership with Business Analysis, Business Development, marketing, strategic discovery and interpretation of DoD / VA requirements (e.g. battery safety, netted health security, etc.), conferences and events planning and operations, and government sales activitiesAssisting leadership in determining customer key POCs and advocacy priorities, and strategies based upon experience with the VA, DoD and other government and healthcare organizationsResearch and Identify key governmental relationships at the federal, state and local levels, and maintain key government, consultants and partners POCs spreadsheets and databaseProvide ideas for the development of engagement strategies with public health organizations, VA, Defense Health, VSOs and other stakeholder organizationsConduct business research to help leadership craft strategies to convey JUUL's mission, profile and key performance parameters from available e-cigarette public policy research back to federal and local government officials, and other partiesAssist in the preparation of BD and marketing materials for use by Govt Services teamPERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONSIdeal candidate will have over 3 years of experience in government business development, capture management, marketing, events planning and operations, wellness or pharmaceutical sales experienceExperience in healthcare, pharmaceuticals, wellness or fitness, or health systems industries highly desirable (government or commercial)Experience with VA, DoD, Health and Human Services highly desirableOutstanding written and oral communicator who can convey complex government business research and analysis in simple terms to managementAbility to prepare persuasive, simple documents and presentations for use by staffHigh degree of organization and efficiency with demonstrated attention to detailAbility to work both independently and collaborativelyAn entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for making a mark in fast-paced, growing environmentsHighest ethical standards, integrity, authenticity, credibility and characterProfessional demeanour and ability to interact with persuasiveness and confidenceExperience in or with the U.S. military and with technical or medical systems and biomedical or therapeutic devices industries; or health and wellness industriesEDUCATIONAssociates Degree at a minimum but Undergraduate degree preferredJUULLABS PERKS & BENEFITS: Equity or sharesA place to grow in your career, we'll help you set objectives and meet themSupportive team members and hiring managersReferral bonusesCell phone subsidy, commuter benefits and discounts on JUUL productsExcellent medical, dental and vision benefitsJUUL Labs is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression, disability or veteran status. We comply with San Francisco's Fair Chance Ordinance and do not unlawfully discriminate against applicants with criminal convictions.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Talascend is currently seeking a Business Analyst for a contract opportunity located in Washington, DC. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: Bring best practice and commitment to problem solving including skills to diagnose, evaluate and resolve complex problems and queries, and escalate as appropriate per defined processes.  Elicit stakeholder requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, and workflow analysis.  Possess the ability to distill information based on specific user/business needs as well as decompose high level requirements into detailed functional requirements.  Capture, define, analyze and translate functional and non-functional business requirements into activity diagrams, system use cases and supplemental specifications that contribute to effective software development.  Create wireframes and/or mock-ups to graphically represent the functionality.  Create specification in the form of pseudocode for developing clinical metrics used to measure the quality of the patient care.  Coordinate requirements walk-through and sign-offs, verifying with user representatives/stakeholders that use cases and process models accurately portray specific business needs.  Contribute towards defining best practices, processes, and standards to continuously improve efficiency within the business analysis discipline.  Work with the quality assurance team to validate system acceptance and user acceptance test plans and test scripts to ensure error free applications, tools and reports. Assists in analyzing testing results throughout the project.  Work closely with the technical team to ensure functional requirements are accurate and complete. Ensure detail design documents accurately reflect customer needs and expectations.  Other duties as assigned. POSITION REQUIREMENTS: Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.  Manage changing priorities within a fast-paced dynamic environment.  A willingness, desire and aptitude to learn new technologies.  Excellent analytical skills and ability to gather and analyze business process data.  Demonstrated innovation and creativity in problem solving.  Attention to detail and delivery of quality artifacts.  Ability to work independently, proactive problem solving.  Strive to meet client expectations and customer satisfaction. DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS: Business Analyst certification.  Bachelors degree.  5 + years of general business analysis experience and requirements documentation for JR and 7 + years for SR roles.  2+ years of experience in Use Case diagramming, Business Process Mapping, Sequence and Activity diagramming, and UML required.  2+ years working with large datasets/databases. Strong SQL knowledge.  Ability to understand and/or write XML.  If you are interested in other positions with Talascend, please visit our website at www.talascend.com.  Talascend is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veteran.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: JOB ANNOUNCEMENT Altruista Health, Inc., is seeking a highly qualified candidate to join our dynamic and growing health care technology company as a Business Analyst. Recently named one of Deloittes fastest growing technology companies, Altruista Health is a leading provider of patient-centric and customizable care management solutions for health plans and providers throughout the United States. Driven by a passion for innovation and technology, were building solutions that positively impact peoples lives. If you're looking for opportunities for career advancement while performing meaningful work with great people, come join one of the Washington Metropolitan areas fastest growing companies! Highlights include: A competitive compensation packageHigh quality health care planDental, vision, disability, and life insurance coverage401(k) Plan with matching contributions and no waiting periodPOSITION SUMMARY Under the supervision of the Director, Business Analyst Team, the Business Analyst (BA) will be the key project stakeholder responsible for the conversion of customer business and technical requirements to functional solutions in association with the implementation and/or continued utilization of Altruista Health solutions. Project types include but are not limited to new client installations; upgrades to existing Altruista Health solutions; consultative services engagements, pre-sales initiatives and product development/release management operations. The BA will act as the primary contact between the client, Altruista Health, and other external partners relative to the project business and technical requirements, responsible for requirements elicitation, modeling, management, communication and traceability to functional solutions. Highly skilled as both a business and functional solution expert, the BA applies professional principles, practices, and techniques, leading both Altruista Health and its partner client team members to eliminate barriers and ensure delivery of solutions through best practice recommendations that positively affect the client business operations. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESAct as the primary contact between the client, Altruista Health, and other external partners relative to the project business and technical requirements, responsible for requirements elicitation, modeling, management, communication and traceability to functional solutionsPartner with customer users and subject matter experts to identify and document customer requirements and processes that support their business goals and objectives, utilizing a combination of industry best practices and Altruista Health standard operating proceduresPartner with Altruista Health Product Management, Development and Quality Assurance staff, when necessary, in conjunction with the development of/enhancement to Altruista Health solution features related to customer-defined requirements and product enhancement requestsLeads all product troubleshooting and issue management activities for the duration of any assigned projectsProvide input into the definition and management of project plansSupport solution testing and documentation activities as neededProvide training, internal and external (client), relative to Altruista Health solutions and operational procedures; acts as a mentor to newly hired Altruista Health staff membersPromote organizational improvement efforts through the development of/enhancement to standard Altruista Health implementation and/or product development processes, policies and proceduresSupport the creation of statement of work content, as requested, for assigned projects, ensuring scope, deliverables, assumptions, risks and resource needs are clearly definedEffectively engage with decision-maker level contacts in assigned project organizationsKeep current on Healthcare Information Technology concepts, trends and industry changes, particularly those related to the care coordination and Medicaid/Medicare/Duals domainsOther work related duties as assignedKnowledge and SkillsStrong analytical, requirements management, and decision making skillsMust have excellent knowledge of MS Project, MS Word, MS Excel, MS VisioMaintains a high level of confidence and is able to communicate ideas and influence decisions both horizontally and vertically within the Altruista Health organizationAbility to multitask and prioritize day to day tasks as well as milestones that require focus on deliverables, extensive testing, on-site client workshopsAbility to pay attention to details, clearly define business need and solution approach (standard configuration, workaround, or custom enhancement)Data driven analysis, SQL skills and/or hands on experience with Business Intelligence Reporting Tool is a plusMust be able to able to create user stories and business requirements that are precise, not ambiguous, testable, traceable, and foremost, in line with the high level vision & scope of the projectAbility to work with offshore teams and client in various time zonesAbility to lead others and direct workMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSBachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Healthcare Management or related fieldMasters Degree preferred5-7 years of related professional experienceExperience in the health care domain including Medicaid, Medicare and DualsCare Knowledge of clinical & provider systems is beneficialExperience with SDLC methodologies, best practices standards for creating User Stories, Business Requirements Documents, and Change RequestsExperience with Testing Tools such as HP ALM, JIRA or Bucket etc.BACKGROUND CHECKS/FEDERAL HEALTHCARE PROGRAM EXCLUSION LISTS SCREENING Candidates for this position will be required to undergo a pre-employment background check. All Altruista Health employees are subject to monthly screening to ensure that they have not been excluded from the Federal Healthcare Programs (using the OIG and GSA Exclusion Lists). The Companys pre-employment background check and OIG/GSA Exclusion Lists screening program is administered in compliance with all federal, state and local laws. LOCATION/TRAVEL While this position with Altruista Health is located in Reston, VA, you must be willing to travel to the client location on a regular basis up to 50% travel. EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER Altruista Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly supports diversity in the workforce.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionMicroHealth is seeking a Business Analyst to support our customer in Vienna, VA & Rockville, MD.  Responsibilities Guide the client through joint application design sessions to collect new business requirements.Identify and develop use cases based on client requirements.Verify requirements through analysis, test, demonstration and inspection.Lead and analyze business processes/systems, identify inefficiencies and required controls, document procedures, and track KPIs.Collaborate with internal and external users/customers to elicit business concerns and develop workable solutions.Work with the QA team to prepare test scenarios and data.Document and manage business and functional requirements.Analyze business processes/systems, identify inefficiencies and required controls, document procedures, and track KPIs.Collaborate with internal and external customers to elicit business concerns and develop workable solutions.Work with the QA team to prepare test scenarios and data.Review user stories and acceptance criteria.Organize requirements into related categories to effectively manage and communicate them.Translate business requirements into technical requirements. This includes using powerful analysis and modeling tools to match strategic business objectives with practical technical solutions.Emphasize simplicity and ease of use at all times, especially in implementation.May lead a small team of business analysts or direct activities of others on the project depending on size and scope.Position Requirements:3-7 years of related experienceExperience with Agile methodologiesSound business ethics, including the protection of proprietary and confidential informationStrong analytical, problem-solving, and decision making capabilitiesExcellent written and verbal communication skills to coordinate development efforts with all stakeholders and team membersAbility to write technical documentation to support version control, department SOPs, and collaboration with external entitiesHealthcare knowledge a plusApplicants selected will be subject to a Public Trust background security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to sensitive information. US Citizens or Permanent Residents only. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.Company DescriptionMicroHealth is a Center for Veteran Enterprises (CVE) and a verified Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) that specializes in health information technology and health information management. We are a small disadvantaged business 8(a), Virginia certified small disadvantaged minority-owned business with process maturity assessed at CMMI-Dev Level III. We help health organizations make better use of information technology to support the decisions that ultimately result in better health outcomes for patients, providers, public health and payers. We do this by providing full life-cycle Health Information Technology and Health Information Management Support for Federal & Commercial markets. Our team of Informaticists, Technologist and Health Professionals design, develop and leverage technology as a catalyst to better health outcomes . At MicroHealth, we believe health information technology is less about the technology. It's about the PEOPLE empowered with information to make better decisions; VALUE it brings to patients, providers, public health and payers; and INNOVATION that help improve patient outcomes. Simply put, MicroHealth places health back into health information technology.  Visit https://www.microhealthllc.com to learn more.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Working at ICF Working at ICF means applying a passion for meaningful work with intellectual rigor to help solve the leading issues of our day. Smart, compassionate, innovative, committed, ICF employees tackle unprecedented challenges to benefit people, businesses, and governments around the globe. We believe in collaboration, mutual respect, open communication, and opportunity for growth. If you’re seeking to make a difference in the world, visit www.icf.com/careers to find your next career. ICF—together for tomorrow.  We are looking for talented, highly motivated Business Analysts to join ICF in support of a large, business analysis and management support services contract within a CIO organization. This position will be located at our client site in Arlington, VA.  You will work with a team of 50+ contractors on our program to determine client needs, gather requirements, develop mission metrics, assess solution readiness, perform research and analysis, and provide general program and project support. The candidate will demonstrate excellent client engagement skills with the ability to quickly develop relationships at all levels of the organization. What you will be doing…Conduct business analysis on agency projects. Identify inefficiencies, gaps and desired outcomes in relation to As-Is and To-Be states.Conduct planning, requirements elicitation sessions, and process workshops with client stakeholdersDocument business and system requirements. Identify functional issues and inefficiencies including cross-silo redundancies within the client organization. Work with team to develop business cases including specific business drivers, issues, and analysis results.Develop technical documentation (i.e. business needs statements, technical specifications, etc.) and slides for presentation to agency executives.Conduct research and formulate recommendations, business cases, board cases, and financial or technical feasibility studies.Provide project updates to clients and stakeholders for business and system development purposes.Create and capture metrics that support the organization’s requirements management process and compliance, IT governance, and other business processes and controls.Analyze data shared across the enterprise and capture the relationships among roles, capabilities, and business units.What you will need…Bachelor's degree5+ years of experience working as a business analyst on information technology-focused, complex projectsExperience conducting Business Process Analysis and modeling, process mapping, Gap Analysis, and Process ImprovementExperience developing recommendations, feasibility studies, and market researchRequirements facilitation, formal and informal presentations to senior management and committees.Knowledge of Agile and Waterfall development methodologiesExperience working as an on-site consultantAbility to obtain and maintain a government security clearanceProfessional Skills/Experience:Exceptional verbal and writing skills, including editing and proofreading skillsTeam player with the ability to work in a fast-paced environmentDemonstrated customer service orientation and outstanding level of professionalism in providing client supportSolid oral communication skills, including experience with developing and delivering presentationsProblem solving skills with ability to analyze situations, identify existing, or potential problems and recommend solutionsSolid computer skills with Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project and Visio) and project management software (e.g., Primavera, or similar) ICF offers an excellent benefits package, an award winning talent development program, and fosters a highly skilled, energized and empowered workforce.  ICF is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. (EOE – Minorities/Females/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity)  Pay Transparency Statement: For more information, please click here: https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp_formattedESQA508c.pdf  Virginia Client Office (VA88)

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Who We AreClutch is an established and rapidly growing startup in Dupont Circle, Washington D.C. Our goal is to connect small and medium businesses with the agencies and software solutions that can help them accomplish their business goals.  How does this work? We conduct extensive research on agencies and software in an array of ever-expanding categories – advertising and marketing, web design and development, mobile app development, and IT solutions. We interview past clients to learn about the customer’s experience. We rate the agencies and software based on our findings.  We are the leading online source for research, ratings, and reviews for mobile application developers, and our role as the go-to source for authentic content on B2B services and solutions is expanding to include other IT and digital marketing segments.  We're honored to be featured in the annual Inc. 5000 as one of the top 500 fastest-growing private companies in the U.S. (link is external), as well as in LinkedIn's Top 50 U.S. Startups. (link is external) Who We're Looking ForWe seek entry-level business analysts to join our team. The successful candidate will help expand our coverage of services companies and solutions. You will own an industry segment, expand and develop it, and market your research.  We help you build the skills you need to succeed at Clutch on the job. So, we want utility players who are self-driven, comfortable conducting outreach to recruit companies, and committed to building client relationships.  You’ll have a hand in growing a successful business from the ground up.Responsibilities Managing a service industry segment on our websiteIdentifying, recruiting, and evaluating companies to participate in our researchConducting client reference interviews and publishing the feedback on our site as validated reviewsWorking with companies to market and promote their involvement in our coverageContributing to Clutch’s business development – refining business processes and strategy, enhancing our website, or promoting our work on social media Our Ideal Candidate Requirements Undergraduate degree and 0-3 years of industry experienceStrong written and verbal communication skillsConfidence communicating over the phoneStrong critical thinking skillsStrategic mindsetStrong work ethic and ability to execute in an unstructured work environmentInterest in growing a startupTenacity and perseveranceDesire to work in Washington, DC What We OfferProfessional Development A talented team that is invested in you and your professional successClear career path and growth opportunities within the companyToastmasters membershipProfessional development book club that focuses on both company and personal growth Opportunity to Build Something Direct involvement in building a piece of a rapidly growing companyTangible impact from day oneOwnership of your own projects Company Culture Casual work environmentAccessible office in Dupont Circle, on the Blue, Orange, Silver and Red Metro linesMonthly team bonding activitiesCompensationStarting bi-monthly salary of $2,083 (totals to $50,000/year), with strong growth potentialHealth insurance401K PlanOpen vacation policyCommuter benefitsTo apply for this position, please send a cover letter along with your resume to careers@clutch.co

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionWe have an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst in the Atlanta, GA, Washington, DC, or New York, NY offices at Eversheds Sutherland (US) LLP. We are searching for someone who wants to be a valued contributor and member of a talented and dynamic team of lawyers, paralegals, and staff.  The Business Analyst will work closely with internal customers and clients across many areas of our business to define and manage requirements for several concurrent initiatives. They will be involved in managing these through the full lifecycle of delivery. Responsibilities and Duties:Have a thorough understanding of the full analysis process: o Defining scope  o Identifying project benefits  o Requirements elicitation and management  o Process optimization  o Business change management  o Requirements tractability to business benefits  o Input into testing  o Facilitating user acceptance testing  o Benefits realization Work with the Lead BA/Project Manager to determine the analysis approach to take.Engage with stakeholders at all levels, including clients.Experience working with third parties.Experience in a variety of software development methodologies such as Waterfall and Agile.Influence stakeholders and decision making.Identify and develop initiatives to improve business performance.Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management Information Systems or other computer related field from an accredited college or university.Certification in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA) preferred.Must have five to seven years of experience working in a similarly sized, multi-office legal or professional services organization.Candidates must have excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills. Ability to present ideas in a business-friendly and user-friendly language.Excellent computer skills and knowledge of MS Office Suite with proficiency in Outlook are required. Eversheds Sutherland (US) LLP is committed to promoting diversity and inclusion within our Firm and in the larger legal profession. We believe that diverse skills, knowledge and viewpoints make us a stronger firm. Eversheds Sutherland (US) LLP maintains a policy of affording all employees and applicants equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital or familial status, domestic violence victim status, ancestry, amnesty, citizenship status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Unlawful discrimination, harassment and retaliation will not be tolerated in any of the Firm’s offices or any other work-relatedCompany DescriptionAs a global top 15 law practice, Eversheds Sutherland provides legal services to a global client base ranging from small and mid-sized businesses to the largest multinationals, acting for 72 of the Fortune 100, 61 of the FTSE 100 and 120 of the Fortune 200.  With more than 2,800 lawyers, Eversheds Sutherland operates in 66 offices in 32 jurisdictions across Africa, Asia, Europe, the Middle East and the United States. In addition, a network of more than 200 related law firms, including formalized alliances in Latin America, Asia Pacific and Africa, provide support around the globe.  Eversheds Sutherland provides the full range of legal services, including corporate and M dispute resolution and litigation; energy and infrastructure; finance; human capital and labor law; intellectual property; real estate and construction; and tax.  Eversheds Sutherland comprises two separate legal entities: Eversheds Sutherland (International) LLP (headquartered in the UK) and Eversheds Sutherland (US) LLP (headquartered in the US), and their respective controlled, managed, affiliated and member firms. The use of the name Eversheds Sutherland is for description purposes only and does not imply that the member firms or their controlled, managed or affiliated entities are in a partnership or are part of a global LLP. For more information, visit eversheds-sutherland.com.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: A day in the life? In this role, you will look at how customers do use and could use our software in their fundraising activities. Using that perspective you will share your insight with other team members, recommend improvements to the software, design new features and work flows for customers to use, perform user acceptance testing and work with product managers and developers to bring new ideas to life. Lastly you will use analytics tools to measure the effectiveness and user engagement of these new solutions  Were looking for an all-star analyst who can: Perform analytical work to solve issues and find opportunities to improve the utility of our software for our customers.Collect and analyze qualitative and quantitative feedback from customers through customer interviews, surveys and click tracking tools such as Google Analytics, Intercomm, Kiss Metrics, and FullStory.Translate complex concepts into effective recommendationsDocument functional design, work flow processes , user stories and acceptance test criteriaUse Jira for managing changes to product design, website and processes.Become an expert in our products to provide 2nd tier support to customer success and product teams.Support product development and testingWork cross functionally with all teams across the business, including Product, Development, Marketing, Success, Finance and Sales.About You:You are well educated! You have at least a Bachelors degree. Curriculum in systems thinking and process discipline is a plus.You have up to date experience! You have 4+ years experience in a related position. Familiarity with Agile, Kanban,Jobs-To-Be-Done, Design Sprints and Hook Model, frameworks for Product Development is ideal.You have a Can Do Attitude! You are a creative problem solver, experienced in finding efficient solutions and working with many areas of a business. You can multi-task several projects at once while coordinating communication across teams.You are systems savvy! You can flow chart, draw and entity relationship model, create a data flow diagram, draft a state transition diagram and form a program structure chart. Most of all you know how to break a large complex project or product into small, manageable parts so each may be designed, studied or analyzed in detail.You like innovation! You look for ways to improve processes and to work smarter, not harder! You have the ability to ramp quickly, are a self-learner, work at a fast pace and prioritize a workload.Who are we? In short, we help non-profits unleash generosity! We believe nonprofits have important missions and deserve great software to power their fundraising and fuel their missions. We use data, technology, and the power of networks to eliminate the daily fundraising grind that most leaders endure. Network for Good provides Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) fundraising solutions that have delivered over $1.5 billion to more than 125,000 charities since 2001. Why were hiring? In short, because we are growing! Were growing our team so we can provide more nonprofits with simple solutions to power the good they do. Network for good is a hybrid organization a nonprofit-owned for-profit. In 2013, we became a Certified B Corporation. We have been able to invest in and enhance our offerings and were just getting started! What can you expect? You can expect, growth and innovation and to have fun along the way. You will not only be rewarded for your personal achievements, but you will also have the opportunity to be part of an organization that lives by its motto every day: Do Good. Feel Good.  Weve got perks, too! How about 'Feel Good' Flexible Time Off, Volunteer Paid Time Off and your birthday as Holiday? 401(k) with match, stock options, commuter stipend and fantastic health insurance, too! Were also a jeans every day workplace! Candidates submitting an application must have legal authorization to work in the United States. Network for Good is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, marital or parental status, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: Join CARFAX’s Winning Team as a Pricing Analyst Are you an experienced Pricing Analyst looking for a new and challenging opportunity with a GREAT company? Have you worked in a business/pricing analytics role? Do you have experience developing and enhancing value based pricing models? If so, CARFAX may have your next, and best, opportunity.The CARFAX Culture Our culture offers the unique blend of a high achieving, high-energy workforce in a casual, laid back setting. Our employee focused culture has been recognized and earned CARFAX the honor of being named as one of the “Great Places to Work” 8 times in a row by Washingtonian magazine and additionally by the Washington Post, and nationally by Glassdoor! Are you ready to join a winning team, be inspired daily, and have a blast while doing it? If so, take a detour from your daily grind and apply today! As the Pricing Analyst, you will: Responsible for performing data analysis that helps guide pricing strategy and operations. Proactively analyze product usage, billing and customer data to identify drivers of customer acquisition and churn.Work under supervision of Pricing Manager to develop and enhance value based pricing models that align with pricing strategy.Work with technology teams to streamline reporting and operational pricing processes to reduce time to market.Ensure timeliness and accuracy of input data used in pricing models.Build statistical models to help with value based customer segmentation, churn prediction and anomaly detection.Requirements:Minimum 3 years of experience in a business analytics role.Advanced Excel skills (Pivot Tables, vlookups, conditional sums etc.)Experience querying large databases using SQL.Bachelor’s degree is required, preferred degree in Mathematics, Business Analytics, Economics, or similar fields.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Highly organized with attention to detail.A commitment to learning and continuous improvement.Nice to HaveAt least 1 year of experience in pricing analytics.Master’s degree with a quantitative focus.Experience querying data using Hive and/or Spark.Knowledge of a visualization tool such as MicroStrategyExperience performing statistical analyses such as regression, decision trees, and cluster analysis preferably using R.About CARFAXCarfax, a unit of IHS Markit (Nasdaq: INFO), helps millions of people every day confidently shop, buy, own and sell used cars with innovative solutions powered by Carfax vehicle history information. The expert in vehicle history since 1984, Carfax provides exclusive services like Carfax Used Car Listings, myCarfax, Carfax History-Based Value and the flagship Carfax® Vehicle History Report™ to consumers and the automotive industry. Carfax owns the world's largest vehicle history database and is a nationally recognized top workplace by The Washington Post and Glassdoor.com. Shop, Buy, Own, Sell – Show me the Carfax™. Based in London, IHS Markit is a world leader in critical information, analytics and solutions.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: ERPi is currently seeking a full-time Business Analyst to provide onsite support at our Washington, DC site.The Role: ERPi has been awarded a contract with the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to provide Business Architect and Analyst (BAs) support in a highly collaborative, multi-contractor environment. The program was established to provide on-demand access to comprehensive VA services and benefits in a consistent, user-centric manner through a multi-channel virtual self-service and call center processing framework. This framework is aimed at enabling clients to find uniform information about VA’s benefits and services regardless of the access channel used to complete their transactions with VA. It allows for quick identification of Veterans without having to repeat information and will allow Veterans seamless access to multiple VA service lines.This program supports enterprise programs and applications to include VA Call Centers, VA Contact Centers, CRM Enterprise Platform Support systems and integrations, Knowledge Management, Telephony implementations and enhancements, Interactive Voice Recognition (IVR), and self-service capabilities. The BA will join a larger project team and aid in supporting the VA business customer throughout the software development lifecycle (SDLC) by leveraging industry best practices. The BA performs tasks which structure the enterprise in terms of its governance structure, business processes, and business information; aligns strategic goals and objectives with decisions regarding products and services, partners and suppliers, organization, capabilities, and key business and IT initiatives. Specific tasks may include:Facilitate the elicitation of business requirements and document in designated formatCapture the tactical and strategic enterprise goals that provide traceability through the organization and are mapped to metrics that provide ongoing governanceDefine the set of strategic, core and support processes that transcend functional and organizational boundariesIdentify external entities such as customers, suppliers, and external systems that interact with the business and describe which people, resources and controls are involved in the processesCapture the relationships among roles, capabilities and business units, the decomposition of those business units into subunits, and the internal or external management of those unitsLoad and management requirements in Rational Tools and ensure traceability.Required Skills and Experience: We are looking for a Business Analyst with more than 6 years of proven BA expertise and experience in support of medium to large scale IT transformation projects, providing strategic and advisory consulting services at the executive, operating and field level, preferably in the healthcare vertical and in call/contact center environments. Required skills and experiences include:Bachelor’s Degree and 6 years of BA experience in support of system or software developmentExperience writing requirementsExperience supporting or participating in requirements planning, facilitation, and decompositionExperience with developing business process models and workflow diagramsAbility to diagram and analyze current (as-is) state of a business operation, and to develop a future template (to-be) business process modelDemonstrated analytical skillsExcellent communication and presentation skills (oral and written)Ability to successfully work on multiple projects concurrently (e.g. prioritize work as needed, work with multiple teams and stakeholder groups, etc.)Ability to work on-site daily in Washington, DC without regularly scheduled teleworkAbility to obtain a Public Trust clearanceDesired Skills and Experience:Experience writing requirements as Epics, Sub-Epics and User StoriesAbility to build and validate multiple workflow and process diagrams, define routing of cases, escalation of cases according to Service Level Agreement (SLA) guidelines, closing cases, defining notifications, integrations, text analytics, and dashboards and reports for each user groupExperience supporting data projects that impact customer experience (data migrations, data mapping, data/metrics consolidation, etc.) that are found in phone systems, phone carriers, IVR systems, case management tools and call center tools is a plusExperience with IBM Rational ClearQuest and the IBM Rational Toolset is highly desiredExperience supporting VA and other federal agencyExperience with telecommunications, call center and/or Customer Relationship Management (CRM) solutions is desiredExperience with Agile software development projects is a plusExperience supporting Lean Six Sigma (LSS) projects is a plusClearance: Public TrustABOUT ERPi: ERPi, a Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SVDOSB) specializing in management consulting for the federal government (www.erpi.net). ERPi is undergoing a period of significant growth and offers talented candidates a chance to perform project management, strategic planning, process improvement, quality management, data analysis, and human capital planning on some of the Federal government’s largest and most complex business challenges. Our work environment is highly entrepreneurial and is staffed with some of the brightest and most capable technical and management consultants in the industry. ERPi’s compensation and benefits plan are designed to attract and retain the industry’s most capable professionals and executives. We offer tuition reimbursement for selected graduate schools, 401(k) profit sharing, awards to recognize exceptional performance immediately, customized health plans, and charitable donation matching, in addition to competitive base salaries. EEO Statement: It has been and will continue to be a fundamental policy of ERPi not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, parental status, marital status, citizenship, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military status, veteran status, or any other protected category with respect to recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: About Seneca Resources: Seneca Resources is client driven provider of strategic Information Technology consulting services and Workforce Solutions to government and industry. Seneca Resources is a leading IT services provider with offices in Reston and Richmond, Virginia and Birmingham, Alabama that service clients throughout the United States. The key to our success lies within our strong corporate culture which drives our business. We challenge our staff through engaging work, and we reward our staff through competitive compensation, extensive professional training, and excellent opportunities for career advancement. In turn, we look for only the best and brightest to join our team.  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and value the benefits of diversity in our workplace. Position Title: Business AnalystLocation: Washington, DCEmployment Type: Full TimeCompensation: Extremely CompetitiveRequirements: MS Project, Excel, Bachelors' DegreeDuties and ResponsibilitiesDraft plans, memoranda, briefings, articles, and other documents to support communications to internal and external stakeholdersSupport the review of deliverables pertaining to the projectsConduct research and provide analysis on special topics specific to projectsProvide executive-level briefing materials with talking points and illustrative diagrams; Coordinate Project Status Reviews by collecting and analyzing status inputs, and produce reports based on the resultsProvide ad hoc and recurring outputs to convey the status of the project in terms of cost, schedule, and performancePrepare documents for Integrated Project Teams, Gate review meetings, and ad-hoc meetingsResearch and provide project-specific outputs including, but not limited to: strategy papers, planning documents, issue papers with recommendations, risk analysis, status reports, management reports and briefings, policy papers, and input to project and action plansQualificationsBachelors DegreeRelevant experience, including supervisory, project management experience, and facilitation expertise leading/working requirement definition for Information Technology projectsExperience managing projectsHands on experience in developing and managing project schedules using MS ProjectExperience in developing resource utilization matrix and management briefings SDL2017

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Do you enjoy meaningful work in an environment where you can make an impact, learn and collaborate well with others who are just as passionate about their work as you are? If you consider your strengths to be: highly analytical, creating something from nothing, understanding what needs to be analyzed and going out to get the data, and enjoy making the connection between data and the bigger picture, then we are looking for you!  Corner Alliance, a dynamic, growing consulting firm dedicated to an enriching employee experience, is looking for a Business Analyst with 2-5 years of experience to join our Washington, DC team and work FT onsite in our office. This is an opportunity for an analytical minded person looking to take the next step in their career. You will set up and run a business analytics function in our dynamic company that will inform how we build our company as it grows.  About the Role:  We are growing company and starved for data and information about how to run and improve the business. We need someone to work side by side with the CEO, COO, and leadership team to help set up reporting and analyze the results. You will learn the ins and outs of the professional services business and help launch and manage improvements across the business. You will gather information, create reports, analyze results and provide trends and recommendations based on the data to our professional services organization that focuses on public safety work for Federal government clients. The role is an opportunity for you to join a growing, mission-oriented company. You will report to the Finance & Contracts Director but work with the entirety of our leadership team, including the CEO, to provide data and trends.  Your responsibilities will include: Developing weekly and monthly financial reports for the leadership teamWorking directly with account managers to understand the numbers and trends in their businessesEvaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.Provide proposal pricing support including research and analysisMaintenance and management of our data systems Location:  You will work as part of a team at our HQ DC office.  Required: Bachelors degree in a related field2-5 years experience in an analytical position, business intelligence and/or financial analysisAble to work in Google and Microsoft Office products equally (e.g. Google Sheet and Excel)Demonstrated experience in gathering data, analyzing information, providing results, and reporting on trendsHighly organized and detail-orientedAble to multi-task and prioritize tasksAble to manage up to company leadersComfortable working in an ambiguous environment as we set up this function and as we grow; comfortable asking questions to get information needed to move things forwardA passion for our Values to: Pursue excellence, Take initiative, Be bold, Be curious, Persevere, Collaborate, and Be creativeAble to pass a background check Preferred Experience: Proficiency with Smartsheet, Unanet, and/or TableauPrior work experience in a professional services environmentExposure to government contracting Dont think you have everything for this role but are still very interested? Please dont hold back from applying because you may not have it all. There's no such thing as a perfect candidate. You can learn and grow with us. So, please apply if you consider yourself to be highly analytical and this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day.  About Us:  We are a consulting company that helps federal leaders and non-profit organizations build justifiable, measurable strategies, and communicate effectively with our stakeholders in a digital world.  Our Core Purpose is simple and meaningful: to help leaders transform public safety. And people who thrive at Corner Alliance are individuals who want to impact the world and contribute ideas that can help make a difference to our clients missions.  Corner Alliance offers a comprehensive and competitive benefits package for full time employees including 401k matching (4%), PTO (3 weeks to start, 4 weeks (2-5 years) and 5 weeks (5 years+)), health, dental, vision, short- and long-term disability, FSA accounts, 4 weeks of paid parental leave, 10 paid holidays (including your birthday off), fitness & cell phone reimbursements, monthly all hands update meetings, annual in-person all hands team building day and evening out, an emphasis on quarterly check-ins for professional growth goals, a social team that coordinates monthly events, use of technology like Slack and Basecamp to keep us connected and collaborative, and overall, a company culture dedicated to highly engaged people.  We are committed to improving our environment and are proud of our certification from ISO (the International Standards Organization) for our environmental practices. We believe in actively conserving resources, reducing waste, and recycling materials to promote a healthy and safe workplace for our employees and visitors.  We also pride ourselves on being CMMI (Capability Maturity Model Integration) Level 3 certified and ISO 9001 certified. What these mean for our employees, clients, and job candidates, is we are a company that is highly committed to streamlined processes, continual improvement, and we encourage productive, efficient behaviors that decrease risks and improve quality in our products, services, and new service development.  Corner Alliance, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age or any other basis covered by applicable law.  Send your resume to apply.  Visit us at www.corneralliance.com to learn more.

Name: Business Financial Manager
Description: Req ID 101318BR  Business Title Business Financial Manager  Group MSS  Location USA VIRGINIA Arlington  Clearance Level Needed Top Secret  Category Consulting Services  Job Duties and Responsibilities General Responsibilities:• Provide program management and financial analyst support to a Department of Defense (DoD) agency. Work with project managers and team leads to provide analytical and technical capabilities in support of all aspects of the project life cycle to meet program and product acquisition goals and strategies. Work in a cross-functional team to deliver high-quality output on time and within budget. Work directly with the client to assist with developing and executing research and development projects successfully. Perform tasks in a variety of areas to include: • Manage and monitor program budget execution and perform tracking analysis of commitments, obligations and disbursement performance • Prepare financial information for briefings, presentations, and status reports • Expertise in financial tracking, creating MIPRs/PRs, and financial analysis is required. • Assist in the preparation of phase/expenditure program plans • Assist with the implementation of operational policies and procedures, draft memoranda, and participate in various projects. • Provide quality control of all documents and processes to ensure that all aspects of agency guidelines are followed• Perform project management and monitoring of project schedules and task performance progress ensuring all cost, schedule and technical deliverables are being meet • Interact with clients, government officials and other executives in the private sector• Verbal and written communications must be timely and demonstrate the consistent ability to presents ideas and communicate information in a clear and concise mannerMandatory Skills Requirement:• B.A./B.S. Degree or higher• 4+ years of experience• Extensive experience with MS Office, Excel, Word, Visio, and PowerPoint• Strong written and oral communication skills, detail oriented, strong organizational skills• Experience with the development of acquisition documentation• Proven ability to multi-task and prioritize responsibilities• Excellent attention to details and diligent adherence to deadlines and deliverables• A high-level performer with the ability to be proactive and respond rapidly to changing conditions in a fast-paced environment• Strong organizational skills• Location: on-site in Arlington, VA in a team environment with government and contractor employees• Top Secret ClearanceOther Skills Preferred: • Experience with providing analysis and support to defense research and development programs, including DARPA, ARPA–E, and IARPA preferred• Experience with managing project schedules, risk, and budgets• Knowledge of the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR)• Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification Qualifications Requires Bachelors degree in business, marketing, sales or computer science and five to seven years of experience in software design, technical product support, or consulting.  Degrees See Qualifications  Years of Experience See Qualifications  Position Type Full-Time  Shift Other/Unknown  Overview For more than 40 years, ManTech employees have been solving complex problems for the national security community. We are comprised of approximately 10,000 talented employees around the world. We adhere to the simple, no-nonsense values on which ManTech was founded more than four decades ago, aligning squarely with the mission objectives of our customers. As our customer base continues to expand and diversify, we continue to diversify our workforce and solutions. Half our employees have a military background, and more than 70 percent hold a government security clearance. As a leading provider of innovative technology services and solutions for the nation's defense, security, space, and intelligence communities; we hold nearly 1,000 active contracts with more than 40 different government agencies.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: KeyLogic is seeking outstanding candidates with industry experience to join our expanding team! Business Analyst Location: Washington, DC Job Code: 829 DescriptionKeyLogic is looking to grow our Business Analysis team at multiple locations.  The Business Analyst will support federal clients in the areas of financial management, capital planning, project management and business support services. Duties may include high-level analysis and support related to statutory requirements and compliance, business process re-engineering, IT portfolio reviews, and/or integration of IT investment processes to other procedures and disciplines. Experience/Qualifications:U.S. Citizenship is a requirementExpertise in Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and MS Project)3+years of experience providing internal/external consulting services to management and technical staff in managing IT investments and solving complex IT project management issues in accordance with federal laws, regulations and procedures.Practical knowledge of and experience with supporting project management office operations regarding the management, planning, implementation, and all phases of the capital planning process.Knowledge of process improvement and re-engineering methodologies and principles as applied to process modernization projects.Proven experience in activity and data modeling, developing modern business methods, identifying best practices, and creating and assessing performance measurements.Knowledge of SDLC, Capital Planning (CPIC), Earned Value Management (EVM), and the federal IT budget process.Proven ability to review and analyze cost, schedule, and performance requirements for federal IT investments.Strong verbal and written communication skills and leadership skills.About KeyLogic: KeyLogic is a highly successful provider of professional and engineering services. We specialize in solutions that enable our customers to make better decisions for their organization. KeyLogic’s performance has earned the company a solid reputation for high standards, proactive solutions, and an outstanding commitment to the customer, best exemplified by the fact we have never had a one-time federal customer — all of our customers have provided repeat business.  KeyLogic has achieved seventeen consecutive years of growth since its founding in 1999. Our client list includes the Department of Defense (DoD), where we provide services for the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) and the U.S. Army and Navy, Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), Departments of Labor (DOL), Energy (DOE), Transportation (DOT) and Treasury (including the Internal Revenue Service (IRS)), General Services Administration (GSA), and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA).  KeyLogic has successfully attained a Capability Maturity Model Integration for Development (CMMI-DEV) Maturity Level 3 Rating. CMMI-DEV is a process improvement approach for software engineering and organizational development that provides organizations with the essential best practices needed to meet business goals. Only three-percent of small and medium federal contractors have achieved CMMI Maturity Level 3. KeyLogic joins this distinguished group.  KeyLogic Systems is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled.Previous Applicants:Email:Password: If you do not remember your password click here.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Who We Are Business has changed - so should consulting. We are strategists, technologists, engineers, and designers who bridge the gap between consulting, design, and marketing to create powerful digital experiences for our customer's brands and users.  Recently named as the nations #6 Boutique Consulting Firm by Vault.com, Ignyte is looking for Business Analysts to join our progressive start-up culture and help us build a new type of consulting company. What You'll Do At Ignyte, our Business Analysts are passionate about creating innovative data-driven solutions across various industries that address critical business problems. You'll be challenged daily as you wear multiple hats to drive multiple project types to completion in both a development and business-facing role.  As a Business Analyst, we give you the opportunity to create your own career path based on your interests, the skills you already possess as well as the skills you'd like to have. Your everyday tasks will involve working with prominent start-up CEOs as well as some of the biggest clients in the DC area to understand their business challenges, working with our team to envision a future-state technology solution that addresses our clients needs, and creating requirements to achieve that future state.  Youll work with our firm's leadership from day one to formulate your own job description and career goals. Not sure whered you fit in? Well work with you to figure it out as part of the application process. similar business or technical role"Big 4" consulting experience, product management, and/or a technical background are a plusAbility to gather, validate, and analyze requirements for their viability against the project objectiveAbility to assist and/or facilitate requirements gathering sessions including creating presentation materials as well as presenting directly to client stakeholdersExperience in designing use cases, categorizing requirements, and creating functional and requirement specifications documentsAbility to develop prototypes, wireframes, model requirements, and aid the testing team in test case preparationAbility to prepare end user documentation, training manuals, and knowledge repositories for the user communityAbility to create high-quality presentations, models, and analyses, and other deliverables and present them to clients and upper managementPossession of technical competencies to develop creative and innovative solutions that address clients business problems preferredAbility to assist in proposal writing for business development opportunities as requestedAbility to analyze and synthesize information to draw accurate, logical, and actionable conclusionsHard working, self-motivated individuals who are comfortable handling ambiguity and able to successfully complete tasks within deadlines with limited supervisionExperience working in small- to medium-sized teams to achieve project goals and complete major deliverablesExcellent interpersonal skills to communicate with colleague and executives alikeComfort working with groups, as well as sensitivity to individual, group and organizational dynamicsCreative, big picture thinking while maintaining keen attention to detailAbility to meet deadlinesStrong computer skills (Excel, PowerPoint, MS Word)What You'll GainExperience working with a team of smart and driven professionals at DC's hottest consulting startupInvolvement in a fun and engaging team-oriented atmosphereGain experience and skills in a wide array of areasExposure to business issues and challenges in a variety of industriesOpportunity to leverage your computer
