Name: Business Analyst III
Description: THE COMPANY Fannie Mae provides reliable, large-scale access to affordable mortgage credit in communities across our nation. We are the leading source of funding for housing in America, which means more people can buy or rent a home. We are focused on sustaining the housing recovery, improving our company, and leading change to make housing better.  Join our diverse, high-performing team and make a difference as we work together to enable access to a good home.  For more information about Fannie Mae, visit http://www.fanniemae.com/progress JOB INFORMATION The Business Analyst  III will provide support to the Accounting Operations areas. Examine, assess, and document business  operations and procedures of operating or administrative unit. Relate these  procedures to IT/IS systems and applications that are designed to enable the  operating unit to accomplish its objectives. Assist operating unit staff by  developing reports, downloads, and analyses from discipline-specific systems  and applications. Provide input to IT/IS specialists in development projects to  assist in developing specifications and functionalities in IT systems. KEY JOB FUNCTIONSAssess business operations and processes of assigned office or  business unit to understand procedures, information flows and handoffs,  decisions, communications pathways and the like.Participate in meetings and projects with client staff, project  managers, and developers to automate, upgrade, or expand applications that  accomplish business operations of assigned work unit(s).Create, design, and format technical specification documentation  including architecture diagrams, process flows, and other information or  processes needed to describe required system changes for development, QA, and  other internal customers.May provide support to applications in production by tracking  production problems and troubleshooting them to sustain application in  production.Develop queries, analyses, or reports from applications for  operations or management staff of assigned business unit(s).Provide guidance or technical supervision to less experienced  staff performing similar functions.Create new Business Objects reports and  defect fixes on existing reportsCreating new Tableau dashboards and make  changes to existing dashboardsMigrate the Business Objects Reports  from lower environments to productionEDUCATIONBachelor's Degree or equivalent requiredMINIMUM EXPERIENCE4 years of related experienceSPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLSBachelor's degree in Computer Science,  Computer Engineering, or Management Information Systems preferredStrong Business Objects & Tableau  report development skillsStrong understanding of ETL concepts;  experience in desktop ETL tools, such as AlteryxExperience and strong knowledge of  creating and using complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and validating  reports/backend dataStrong Data Analysis skills with  Database knowledge and experience with database query tools and languagesExperience with complete Software  Development Life Cycle including requirements, design, and development and  testingStrong written and oral communication  and interpersonal skills to effectively work independently as well as in a  dynamic matrix team environment to provide support to business userAbility to work on multiple projects and  flexibility to change priorities when neededEMPLOYMENT As a condition of employment with Fannie Mae, any successful job applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment drug screen and to successfully complete a background investigation.Fannie Mae is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Web Analyst
Description: Join our WINNING team as a Web Analyst Are you an experienced Web Analyst who wants to help CARFAX continue to enhance our products? Do you love empowering product management teams through data analysis? If so, then CARFAX may be you best career move! The CARFAX Web Analyst will be a key contributor in our strategic analysis for CARFAX products and online behavior. This will include collecting, interpreting, and analyzing data for various products that CARFAX has to offer. This person would be the subject matter expert who utilizes Web Analytics and A|B testing tools to help optimize the business. The CARFAX Culture People who work at CARFAX are happy. Our culture offers the unique blend of a high achieving, high-energy workforce in a casual, laid back setting. When you walk around at CARFAX you hear laughter and spontaneous celebrations and you see people in shorts and flip flops refueling themselves with a game of shuffle puck or by taking a few shots on one of the putting greens. Our employee-focused culture has been recognized as one of the “Great Places to Work” six years in a row by Washingtonian magazine and additionally by the Washington Post and Glassdoor! Are you ready to join a winning team, be inspired daily, and have a blast while doing it? If so, take a detour from your daily grind and apply today! As a Web Analyst, you will:Manage the production and distribution of recurring reporting and analysisPerform in-depth analysis of information from multiple data sources and provide insights on findings.Provide Quality Assurance (QA) checks before Product releases, checking for user experience and Analytics implementation.Analyze and communicate the effectiveness of new product launches, site changes, and marketing initiatives.Provide recommendations based on key insights from analysis.Develop appropriate tagging strategy for feature releases and product launchesArchitect/design analytics requirements for development teams to implement on both Web and Mobile Apps.Collaborate with Product, UX/Creative and Developer teams for A|B testing initiativesRequired Skills/Experience:Power user of Google Analytics (GA)Ability to architect and develop GA implementation requirements for DevelopersA|B Testing experience for Web and/or AppsProven track record for problem solving and Quality Assurance (QA) for Product and Analytics implementationsProactive and self-motivated with a strong sense of ownership. Identifies what needs to be done and has a bias toward action.Highly analytical and detail oriented with both web and business analysis skillsAbility to translate, communicate, and distil metrics into a digestible, actionable marketing frameworkFunctional understanding of Javascript and ability to read standard HTML codeResults oriented – strong focus on achieving revenue, conversion, sales and other marketing goals. Ability to use metrics to manage programs and measure successEducation/Qualifications:Minimum 5 years’ experience with Google Analytics. GA Certification preferred.Experience working with GTM Tag Manager preferred.Experience with Adobe Analytics is a bonusBachelor’s degree in related field of study, MBA or commensurate experience preferredAbout CARFAXCarfax, a unit of IHS Markit (Nasdaq: INFO), helps millions of people every day confidently shop, buy, own and sell used cars with innovative solutions powered by Carfax vehicle history information. The expert in vehicle history since 1984, Carfax provides exclusive services like Carfax Used Car Listings, myCarfax, Carfax History-Based Value and the flagship Carfax® Vehicle History Report™ to consumers and the automotive industry. Carfax owns the world's largest vehicle history database and is a nationally recognized top workplace by The Washington Post and Glassdoor.com. Shop, Buy, Own, Sell – Show me the Carfax™. Based in London, IHS Markit is a world leader in critical information, analytics and solutions.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionResponsibilitiesThe Transwestern family of companies together comprise a privately held, diversified real estate services, investment and development organization. A unique approach underlies our success. We do business differently by empowering our team members with the resources and independence to deliver extraordinary results to our clients. It’s simple. We start with hiring hard-working, smart, genuinely good people, and organize them in collaborative cross-functional teams. We give them the support to outperform and the freedom to take ownership as they work to exceed our clients’ expectations. We do business differently, and that makes us Transwestern.The Investment Services Group’s Financial Analyst supports investment sales and finance brokers in the analysis of investment properties, preparation of financial projections, preparation of market comparable/demographics analysis, and designing graphics layout of responses to Requests for Proposals, Broker Opinion of Values and Property Offering Memorandums. This individual will have general knowledge of various real estate asset types, asset cash flows, lease vs. purchase, local investment and property markets and capital markets dynamics. It is also the responsibility of the Financial Analyst not only to exhibit legendary customer service when communicating with tenants, prospective tenants, owners, investors and vendors but also to focus on productivity and results.Experience / Skills / EducationESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:Preparation of long-term cash flow projections and pricing of various property types utilizing Argus, Excel and other valuation programs.Preparation of investment offering memorandums, sales proposals and BOVs, including layout out of graphics.Tour prospective buyers/investors through propertiesWork with property managers, leasing agents, asset managers, to compile necessary information during sales process.Provide thorough analysis of neighborhood characteristics as they apply to potential sale or finance of a specific propertyAnalyze financial terms of prospective deals including debt requirements, return expectations, hold period, etc.Abstracting leases, loan documents and other pertinent legal documents.Compilation of market information and comparable sales and lease information.Assist with preparation of responses to RFP/BOV’s.Ensure the timely production, accuracy and quality of work product.Facilitate and initiate relationships within industry for future business development.Research, analyze, and present various economic and demographic factors key to the underwriting of a neighborhood, market or MSA such as population, affordability, employment and labor force info.Reports to the Executive Managing Director of the Mid-Atlantic Investment Services.REQUIREMENTS:Education:Bachelor's degree in Business Management, Finance, Accounting, or related discipline.Experience: A minimum of 2 years experience in commercial real estate such as property management, investment, finance or investment banking transactions servicing institutional clients.Technical Skills:Computer proficient, including knowledge in the following programs: Argus, In Design, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, ACT!, CoStar, and related market data programs.Strong analytical, writing and organizational skills.Financial modeling expertise.Strong marketing, presentation and communications skills.Thorough understanding of real estate valuation techniques and utilization of valuation programs, including Argus and Excel.Ability to format and source market data for investment and offering memoranda.Personal Skills:Strong analytical, writing and organizational skills.Ability to multi task and juggle multiple projects.Ability to produce quality work in a fast-paced environment.Ability to manage large workloads.Ability to establish strong interpersonal relationships with clients and project team members.Stays up to date on current market conditions, practices, trends and factors that impact real estate investment marketsLocationWashington, District of ColumbiaAPPLY TODAY to be a part of an energetic and motivated team of professionals!Transwestern offers an exciting work environment, competitive salary and excellent benefits, which include medical, dental and vision coverage, as well as a 401(K) plan. Transwestern is an equal opportunity employer. No agencies or phone calls please.

Name: MuleSoft - Senior Technical Consultant
Description: MuleSoft Senior Technical Consultant An Senior Technical Consultant delivers successful projects by providing skilled technical consulting, training and leadership in complex environments. As an Intermediate Developer, you will have project experience with software development and consulting in Enterprise environments. As a team member, you will work directly with project stakeholders throughout the entire life cycle of projects to define, design, and implement solutions on MuleSoft. You will leverage your experience to become a key contributor to our growing MuleSoft practice. As an Intermediate Developer, you will participate in Agile team work using agile methodologies.ResponsibilitiesProvide leadership for MuleSoft projects as a technical specialistGather functional and technical system requirementsDesign and implement MuleSoft based solutionsProvide demonstrations to clients throughout the entire project life-cycleLead teams of Consultants, Partner Resources, and Client Resources on project related tasks ensuring delivery dates are metContribute to IP for MuleSoft technology by developing reusable product extensions and by writing knowledge articles based on project experienceAssist clients in identifying other business opportunities in which the MuleSoft software could provide a solutionRequired Experience1+ years of experience working with the MuleSoft Anytime platform (Equivalent experience with other integration platforms, e.g. TIBCO, WebMethods, Oracle ESB, will considered as well)Experience using other API Management solutions (e.g. Apigee, Mashery, Layer 7) is desirable as well as good understanding of the Enterprise Integration Patterns3+ years of experience in software delivery or software development (Java/Spring preferred)Experience with configuration, deployment, and testing of enterprise software applicationsYOU WILL HAVE AN OPPORTUNITY TOParticipate in the design and delivery of our Mule projects with our customers.Contribute to key phases of the development lifecycle.Identify, analyze and develop interfaces and flows.Assist in the collection and documentation of user's requirements.Assist in the development of logical and physical specifications.Develop solutions by designing system specifications, standards, and programming.Identify and communicate technical problems, processes and solutions.Provide cross-over training as required throughout the company.WHO YOU ARE5+ years of experience working with the Mule platform as a Senior Developer. Mule Cloud experience would be considered an asset. Bonus points for Mule Certification.7+ years of software development experience. Extensive software integration and/or other ESB experience is a must.You have a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a relevant discipline7+ years of experience developing with JavaExperienced writing and running JUnit tests.Extensive experience working with XPath expressions & functions.Working knowledge of XSL/T.Deep understanding of SOA design principles and best practices.Experience with TDD and continuous integration and deployment.Experience with SOAP and REST a must.Have expertise in large distributed systems, legacy experience is considered an asset.Experienced with Git and Subversion.Well versed in integrating mobile technologies.Background in agile and waterfall methodologies.You have excellent verbal, written, and inter-personal communication skills.Strong documentation, analytical and problem-solving skills.Interested and open to business travel.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Summary:Looking for high powered and quantitatively oriented IT Business Analyst to support the Projects in IT Domain. Analyst will be required to analyze specific business problems and drive value in strategic areas of business. What you will get to do:Typically the customers would be Senior Managers / Directors from different Domains located in US, Latin America, and Asia Pacific.The analyst would typically handle a high impact project at any time which should result in bottom line impact.Most of the work would be around business understanding, data understanding, guiding junior analysts in data preparation, working with the statistical team to create models if required and result presentation. The analyst would be required to understand the business model, business brief, and the information available for analysis.Adhoc requirements would need to be fulfilled from time to time as well.High Level of Business analysis skills is necessary.Graduate or Post Graduate from Tier 1 with 0-2 years of experienceIdeal candidate would have strong analytical skills, ability to understand business situations and provide data backed analysis.Basic Requirement:Graduate degree in Computer Science. Must have completed Masters Degree in Computer Science.Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst FP&A
Description: Play a key role in developing the annual Budget and maintaining multiple versions of financial Forecasts. Assist in developing various financial analyses on corporate financial performance and value in support of the Business Operations, Business Technology and Shared Services organizations. Assist in special projects and create ad hoc analysis and reports for leadership. Play a key role preparing and maintaining the annual budget and rolling forecasts by working with budget coordinators across the company and by providing input to budgeting and forecasting assumptions. This input may be based on financial and operational analysis that may include transaction volumes, capital needs, cash flows, new product launches, employee capacity/headcount/staffing, and other similar types of information.Develop and maintain monthly/quarterly corporate financial performance reports and dashboards. Create reports and analysis leveraging FP&A’s technology toolset.Prepare performance analysis for, and participate in, quarterly corporate financial performance reviews with department and executive leadership; analysis may include, but not be limited to, information relating to changes in the Company’s financial position, staffing/capacity, new and/or existing products, marketing activities, and ARC’s value for its  stakeholders and the airline industry. Based on this analysis, identify opportunities to help business leaders meet financial outcomes related to operating plans, departmental objectives/goals and improve ARC’s business value outcomes.Develop ad hoc financial and operational analysis upon request of management.Functional Knowledge Required: Expertise in budgeting, forecasting, and corporate financial and performance reporting. Advanced skills in excel and exceptional analytical and research skills including experience analyzing and manipulating large amounts of financial, competitive, and transactional data. Experience and knowledge with financial modeling techniques (e.g. excel, adaptive insights planning), along with experience in data acquisition techniques (e.g. SQL). Previous experience working in a finance or accounting department is required. Business Expertise Required: Knowledge and understanding of ARC’s fundamental business processes and organizational hierarchy, the products offered by ARC, and ARC’s financial, HR and sales systems. Possess a curiosity of corporate performance and business process improvement. Have an understanding of business strategy concepts and the ability to determine and define measurements for business outcomes. Skills & Abilities Required:Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Management or related field; Master’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Management, or related field3-5 years of experience in budgeting, forecasting, corporate financial reporting and/or data analytics, with knowledge of, and experience with, financial analytics applications and financial data modeling with experience in data acquisitionExperience developing value statements and measuring corporate value a plusIntermediate to advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office – especially ExcelExperience with Adaptive Insights preferredSome experience with data warehousing and/or business intelligence applications preferredExcellent people skills to work with both Finance and non-finance personnel EOE M/F/D/V Females and Minorities Encouraged to Apply

Name: Digital Forensics Analyst
Description: Company Description ThreatConnect® arms organizations with a powerful defense against cyber threats and the confidence to make strategic business decisions. Founded in 2011, ThreatConnect (then called CyberSquared) started servicing government agencies on specialized cybersecurity contracts while building its platform. Officially launched in 2013, the ThreatConnect Platform has grown to more than 20,000 users worldwide. Today, ThreatConnect provides a suite of products designed to meet the threat intelligence aggregation, analysis and automation needs of security teams at any maturity level - built on the industry's only intelligence-driven, extensible security platform. Whether you want to work on building a world-class security platform or as a member of the services team, you will enjoy a career that truly makes an impact. For more information on the benefits of working at ThreatConnect, visit www.threatconnect.com/careers Job Description ThreatConnect is looking for highly motivated and experienced analysts with currently active U.S. Government Top Secret security clearances to fill positions on government contracts within the DC/NoVA/MD region. If you are sought after as an expert in your field and looking for a company that will both value and reward your expertise, take a look at what ThreatConnect has to offer. Requirements The Digital Forensics Analyst will perform a variety of highly technical analyses and procedures dealing with the collection, processing, preservation, analysis, and presentation of computer-related evidence, and is responsible for disseminating and reporting cyber-related activities, conducting vulnerability analyses and risk management of computer systems and recovering information from computers and data storage devices. The Digital Forensic Analyst will use forensic tools and investigative methods to find specific electronic data, including Internet use history, word processing documents, images and other files. This position requires the candidate be proficient in the latest forensic, response, and reverse engineering skills, as well as, astute in the latest exploit methodologies. Additional responsibilities and required skills:**30% Travel (with duration up to 2 weeks) is required for this positionPerform forensic analysis on all common operating system environments, to include, but not limited to, Microsoft Windows, Mac OS, UNIX, Linux, Solaris, as well as embedded systems.Analyze digital media (logs, code, phones, hard drives, memory dumps, etc.) to determine attack vectors and develop mitigation techniques. Identify possible threats based on analysis of digital media.Maintain readiness to divert and deploy teams of contract resources to provide on‐site support and assistance in the event of an exercise or cyber incident.Develop and disseminate engagement reports, technical reports and briefs based on analytic findings.Identify and document tactics, techniques and procedures used by an attacker to gain unauthorized access.Develop procedures and processes to analyze and categorize digital media.Follow industry standard forensic best practices while imaging, preserving, transporting and handling electronic data and associated physical devices.Participate in inter‐agency sponsored community of interest analysis groups, conduct and participate in technical briefings and exchanges.Communicate, coordinate and share information and work closely with NCCIC and other HIRT components.Develop tips, indicators, warnings and actionable information.Support the development of performance metrics.Adhere to the CONOPS and SOPs of the HIRT and Digital Forensics Group (DFG).Assist with preservation and duplication of original media obtained from customers.Assist with maintaining the readiness of all DFG fly‐away kits, storage media and forensic VM analyst images.Assist with maintaining DFG computer equipment and software licensing.Benefits We work hard to reward our employees for their hard work. We offer a competitive benefits package with comprehensive insurance coverage, paid time off, and unique perks designed to help you meet your financial and personal goals.  We are committed to offering an employment experience and benefits package that enables you and your family to grow with us and to share in our success. We love to recognize our employees who have gone above and beyond, and offer incentives like quarterly awards, an employee bonus and referral program, and team-building outings. MEDICAL Full-time employees are eligible for health coverage effective from the first of the next month hired. The premiums are at no cost to the employee. We pay your premiums for individuals and families!  - Medical coverage  - Prescription drug coverage  - Dental coverage  - Vision coverage  - Company-paid short-term and long-term disability  - Company-paid life insurance and AD&D coverage FINANCIAL 401K retirement savings plan with company matching program of up to 6%.  Cell phone reimbursement WORK-LIFE BALANCE - 10 Paid Federal Holidays  - Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO) for vacation/sick time and holidays. 15 days (3 weeks) for new employees with the ability to accrue up to 25 days (5 weeks)  - Birthday day off  - Employee recognition program with quarterly awards  - Employee referral program of up to $5,000 per full-time hired referral  - Education Reimbursement program up to $5,250 for job-related college courses and professional training  - Company-provided refreshments at our Headquarters  - Quarterly events with your geographic team  - Annual company party

Name: Sr. Systems Analyst
Description: Sr. Systems AnalystHighPoint is seeking to hire a knowledgeable and dynamic Data Warehouse Senior Systems Analyst. The major responsibilities include design, develop and validate data warehouse and analytics solutions per business user’s requirements. EDUCATION AND YEARS OF EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or IT preferred• 6-8 years of related current work experienceKNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIREMENTS:• Experience with Data Warehousing design, development, data analysis, and data refresh solutions• Experience writing complex queries• Experience with MS SQL Server, SQL Server Analysis Services (SSIS), Structured Query Language (SQL) and Business Objects• Knowledge and/or experience with Red Gate and Visual Studio is a plus• This job requires interaction with customers, project managers and end-users. The ability to effectively communicate ideas and concepts both verbally and in writing is criticalJOB RESPONSIBILITIES: • Design, develop and deploy data warehousing and analytics solutions per business user’s requirements• Create ad hoc queries or reports to address critical business needs• Design, develop and maintain database objects such as tables, views and stored procedures• Design and develop ETL components from source systems to the data warehouse• Analyze and remedy database and query issues, including performance related• Produce comprehensive documentation for all solutions developed• Conduct peer reviews and independent verification and validation of software solutions produced by other developers• Analyze data to understand gaps, inconsistencies and other quality issues, and devise data quality improvement solutionsPHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:Regularly required to sit for extended periods up to 80% of the time; frequently required to move about to access file cabinets and use office equipment such as PC, copier, fax, telephone, cell phone, etc.Occasionally required to reach overhead, bend, and lift objects of up to 10 lbsSpecific vision abilities required by this job include use of computer monitor screens up to 80% of timeWORK ENVIRONMENT:Individual’s primary workstation is located in an office areaThe noise level in this environment is low to moderatePlease no Corp-to-Corp or 1099 candidates; this position is W-2 onlyWe are unable to sponsor H1B applicants for this roleUS citizenship required as per potential clearance requirementsRelocation will not be offeredSelected applicant will be subject to a background investigationIf you encounter any problems while applying for a position, please submit your resume to recruiting@highpointglobal.comABOUT HIGHPOINT:HighPoint is a growth-oriented firm that provides a unique, differentiated employee culture relative to our Federal market peers. We leverage this growth-oriented and employee-focused culture to attract and retain a higher grade of talent than our peers to be an employer of choice. HighPoint helps government agencies elevate the citizen experience (CX) by improving the touchpoints through which citizens interact with government. We were founded in 2006 by Ben Lanius with the spirit of transforming how agencies connect with and empower citizens to deliver on mission-critical objectives.At HighPoint, our focus is on delivering results that matter. We support and modernize our federal customer’s mission critical systems and functions. Agility is at our core: it is the mantra that drives us to succeed. We work quickly, analytically and deliver on agency priorities.HighPoint is privately held with 350 passionate employees across offices and locations in Indianapolis, Indiana; Baltimore, Maryland; and Reston and Herndon, Virginia.#DI#CJHighPoint, is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Name: Cost Analyst, Mid-Level - DoD
Description: Who we are: Cobec is a management consulting company where people would want to work. A business powered by smart, diverse people passionate about doing meaningful, quality work. A work place valuing the well-being of employees and trusting them to balance work with life. A culture with a level of freedom in communication, open accessibility to leadership, and personal autonomy and responsibility empowering confident employees. The culture that exists at Cobec, and the talented people who drive it, have powered the smart and continued growth of our employees, business, and clients. We are successful because of our people, and we make choices to support them. Work with us: Our entrepreneurial culture drives us to keep up with the latest industry trends, expand our capabilities, broaden our expertise, build our team, and deliver the highest quality solutions to our clients. We are a quickly-expanding company always looking to build strong, enduring partnerships, and are seeking talented professionals to join our team. Become your bestself, work with us! Position: Cost Analyst – DoDLocation - Washington, DC Job Summary This position will provide experienced cost analysis and estimating support for classified Department of Defense programs Years of Relevant Experience The position requires 5-10 years of relevant experience of Cost Estimating experience in the DoD and/or Intelligence Community. Essential Job Functions The following duties are normal for this position. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from this position if the work is similar, related, and/or a logical assignment for this position. Other duties may be required and assigned. Participate in cost teams performing independent cost estimating and cost analysis of classified DoD programs.Assist with identifying and collecting cost data, preparing Work Breakdown Structures, analyzing cost reporting plans, reviewing cost reports, normalizing data, performing statistical regression analysis, learning curve analysis and other analyses, estimating the costs of software development and maintenance, modeling in Microsoft Excel using dynamic formulas, assessing, quantifying, and incorporating cost uncertainty through Monte Carlo discrete event simulation, documenting and presenting results, communicating with stakeholders, and attending various program meetings.Use analysis to support successful program acquisition milestone reviews and prepare/support program budget submittals.Support contract proposal evaluations, negotiations, and acquisition management.Individual will perform cost analyst duties, responsible for overall development, evaluation, and quality assurance of cost estimates, including ad-hoc special studies, in support of investment decisions for information technology systems.Support Earned Value Management (EVM) and Integrated Program Management Reports (IPMR) analysis.Individual will perform cost analysis for program baselines, budget and life cycle cost estimates, feasibility studies and sensitivity analyses, acquisition/contract evaluation and contract solicitation support, and cost performance monitoring and analysis.Individuals will also support process and policy improvement for cost analysis and estimating guidelines.Individuals will be required to contribute effectively to working groups through oral and written communication and cooperative working relationships.Security Requirements Must have DoD Top Secret Security Clearance. Preferred with SCI Eligibility. Education RequirementsBachelor’s degree in a STEM discipline is required.Master’s degree desired.Certified Cost Estimating/Analyst (CCEA) or Professional Cost Estimator/Analyst (PCEA) is desired.Skills RequirementsExperience with Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPointExperience with data collection and analysisAbility to multi–task and work under minimal supervisionExperience with Intelligence Community acquisition process and milestonesPossession of excellent teamwork and collaboration skillsPossession of excellent oral and written communication skillsTravel Occasional travel required as needed by client/s and/or company Total RewardsSalary Range: 80-110k (dependent on experience) Sign-On: This position is eligible for a sign-on bonus up to 10K Benefits:Relax - Recognizing that everyone needs to time to recharge their battery, Cobec offers an impressive combined six weeks of personal, sick, and holiday paid time off (PTO). Our flexible environment supports and embraces your needs for time away, regardless of the reason!Savings - Cobec is committed to making a significant contribution towards each employee’s retirement objective. Our retirement plan consists of 401(k) with Cobec matching and Employer Discretionary Contributions.Health - Cobec provides a choice of three competitive and comprehensive medical plans. Additionally, we provide competitive dental and life insurance, Paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability, and other great supplemental/additional health benefits.Career Support and Development - Cobec believes in lifelong learning. In order to support this belief, we offer benefits such Tuition Assistance and Certification Allowance, Paid Professional Association Memberships, and Internal Training Opportunities from our expert workforce in an effort to continue your professional development.Other Benefits - Pre-taxed healthcare and dependent care spending accounts. Pre-taxed transit and parking plans for our commuters. A company paid mobile device. Company hosted social events for our people and their families. Donation matching program that supports our people in their philanthropic endeavors. Performance based bonuses for our people that go above and beyond. Lastly, for the people that love to give back,Cobec provides opportunities for employees to volunteer and support a local DC charitable organization.Check our reviews on GlassDoor here!

Name: FISMA/FedRAMP Senior Consultant
Description: ABOUT THE ROLEA-LIGN employs a business model that builds on the best of what the largest security firms have to offer, such as the ability to offer high quality professionals a variety of project experience with high profile clients. What sets us apart is that we have eliminated time reporting, chargeability goals, and sales pressure.As a FISMA/FedRAMP Senior Consultant, your primary responsibilities will include standard project execution and client service activities. Senior consultants must have a high level of understanding of the NIST 800 controls and lifecycles of both FISMA and FedRAMP assessments.REPORTS TO: Managing ConsultantPAY CLASSIFICATION: Full-Time, ExemptRESPONSIBILITIESPlan and execute FISMA and FedRAMP engagements, under the direction of a member of the management teamCommunicate effectively to the client, prior to, during, and post on-site visitLead assessments and onsite testingLead scoping calls about system boundariesGather evidence on site, and reviewProvide draft reports to management, within defined timelinesProvide detailed project status reports, weekly to managementOrganize client information on A-LIGN’s driveMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSEDUCATIONMaster’s or bachelor’s degree in cybersecurity, management information systems, computer science, or relevant disciplineEXPERIENCEExperience conducting audits against standardsWork experience in an IT security or audit firm, related to NIST 800-53, NIST 800-171, and/or FedRMAMPCERTIFICATIONCurrently holds at least one of the following: CCSK or CCSP, and one of the following: CISA, CISSP, CISMSKILLSAbility to meet deadlines with a high degree of motivationThrives in a fast-paced environmentExcellent communication skillsAbility to work individually as well as collaborativelyWHAT WE CAN OFFER YOUUp to 50% out of town travelGenerous paid time off planTechnology allowanceVirtual employmentVacation bonus401(k) plan with employer matchingEmployer paid life insurance and disability insuranceEmployer paid health, vision and dentalPaid Office closure December 24-January 1Generous paid holiday scheduleCertification reimbursementCompetitive bonus structureABOUT A-LIGNA-LIGN is a global cybersecurity and compliance firm that assists organizations of all sizes with the ever-changing cyber threat landscape, headquartered in Tampa, Florida. A-LIGN leverages our industry expertise to guide organizations towards security, compliance and privacy services that will enhance their information security to prevent cyber threats, and reduce risk, turning their security into a competitive edge. We are a licensed CPA firm, Qualified Security Assessor Company, HITRUST CSF assessor, accredited ISO 27001 certification body, and accredited FedRAMP 3PAO offering SOC 1: SSAE 18 Examinations, SOC 2: AT 101 Services, PCI DSS Assessment Services, FISMA Security Assessments, ISO 27001 Certifications, FedRAMP Security Assessments, HIPAA and HITECH Services and Penetration Testing and Vulnerability Assessments.COME WORK FOR A-LIGN!

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Description: Job Description Leidos is seeking a Business Analyst as part of a test organization that will be matrixed across Agile teams to support requirements elicitation, agile requirements development, data collection and analysis and will be the primary liaison with end users and internal support teams in Bethesda, MD.  The candidate should be able to understand the business needs and translate them to agile requirements (user stories) for their testability and explain them to testers and developers, when needed. The candidate also needs to take feedback on the requirements from the team to enhance them upon client's approval. Key areas of responsibilities: • Conduct meetings to elicit, define and document requirements from sponsors and end users • Conduct qualitative analysis of existing implementations and provide thoughtful, strategic improvement recommendations • Conduct requirements gathering sessions with client stakeholders using interviews, document analysis, business process descriptions, scenarios, workflow analysis • Decompose business needs into agile requirements • Be responsible for having clear requirements with acceptance criteria for each user story before the sprint starts • Translate requirements into clear acceptance criteria • Articulate business requirements to developers and testers • Identify gaps in processes, opportunities for improvements and automation • Assist the product owner with prioritizing the backlog • Develop and maintain requirements management lifecycle artifacts • Documenting the requirements and keeping track of requirements change • Writing UAT scripts and conducting UAT sessions if needed • Work directly with the PM to ensure that project deliverables are met • Keep updating the requirements documents, as requirements change • Work with automation testers to identify regression test candidates for automation • Participation in daily scrum meetings • Participate in all phases of risk management assessments and software development with emphasis on analysis of user requirements • Supporting our metrics program by keeping track and metrics on all activities hhsnih  external referral eligible  Required Skills: • Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent based on evaluation of academic credentials, training and/or experience) as well as 5 years of related business analysis/requirements gathering • At least 2 years of experience performing as an analyst and tester • Experience with Agile software development frameworks, i.e. Scrum • Experience in drafting detailed requirements • Experience using JIRA and Confluence • Ability to create mockups, Visio diagrams/charts, functional & design documents, Test Scripts • Demonstrated knowledge of all business analysis practices with emphasis on business requirements gathering, facilitation, testing and work flow analysis • Must demonstrate a sense of urgency, and the ability to work independently and proactively in achieving team and individual objectives • Must be comfortable in a dynamic and fast-paced environment • Must have strong attention to detail and an inquisitive mindset • • Ability to quickly grasp and understand technical concepts and systems • Strong verbal and written communication skills • Very strong Analytical and problem solving skills • US Citizenship or US Person (Green Card Holder) is required and must be able to obtain a Public Trust clearance to get a Health and Human Services / Health Resources and Services Administration badge Desired Skills: • Experience working in public health and federal contracting • Experience working on Federal grants systems (HRSA, Grant Solutions, NSF, NIH etc.) • Experience working with Federal customers onsite • Experience with SQL server and experience with writing and executing backend tests using SQL. • Experience with test automation • Experience with 508 compliance testing • PMI-BA certification • Certified Scrum Master or Certified Product Owner

Name: Business Analyst
Description: i360, the leading data and technology provider for the pro-free market public policy and advocacy community, supports organizations that promote free enterprise and smaller government. i360 is a dynamic workplace sitting on the leading edge of public policy, technology, and business, and is seeking team members who are as excited about their cause as they are about building the next generation of political technology.  i360 is seeking a Business Analyst to join its analytics team, which is driven by data and measurement. The ideal candidate is someone who has experience in quantitative analysis whether in market and/or consumer research, or general business analytics. Core responsibilities will revolve around conducting quantitative analyses to answer business questions utilizing large internal databases with the goal of generating original actionable insights for corporate clients.  To be considered, candidates must be creative, passionate about process improvement, and strong technical ability in the following areas: Intermediate knowledge of Excel (including formulas, functions, and pivot tables) and Power PointDemonstrated business communication and writing experienceExperience with Business Intelligence software like TableauAbility to orally present information to professional audiencesDemonstrated leadership or management experienceExperience in and/or knowledge of business analyticsAbility to work independently as well as collaboratively and adapt quickly in a fast-paced environmentAbility to integrate with large and small cross-specialty teams with individuals of varying levels of expertiseAbility to plan and execute multiple time sensitive projects at once, while maintaining a high degree of excellenceStrong attention to detail, including accuracy of data entry A Day In The Life COULD Include: Analyze data using statistical software to inform strategy decisions.Convert complex data and findings from a SQL environment into understandable visualizations and reports.Developing reports, dashboards and presentations to effectively communicate results to internal and external stakeholders.Work collaboratively with other teams and analysts to tackle every step in the analytics process to better serve client needs.Working on specialized research projects as requested.Gather information about best practices in business analytics and implement better ways to solve customer requests. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or higher3+ years of relevant work experience using Statistical Software like R, Stata, SPSS, Python, or SAS2+ years of experience using SQL to extract and manipulate data from a database2+ years of experience using data to draw actionable insights in a business environmentRole is not eligible for VISA Sponsorship. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree with a quantitative focus or significant experience post-college working with dataDemonstrated ability to innovate in data analytics and data science4+ years of experience using data to draw actionable insights in a businessAPPLY NOW

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business AnalystLooking for the next step in your career? Enjoy a challenge? Do you have an ambition for innovation? Want to make a difference? If you join our growing global team, you’ll be working for an industry leader with offices across five continents, in over 47 countries and more than 28 000 employees. You will work with some of the leading world brands across the Fortune 100 and Fortune 500 companies – who are all relying on Dimension Data to help them use the power of technology to achieve their ambition in this digital era.You’ll be part of a team who’s passionate about making a difference to the way technology shapes how we live and work – whether it’s protecting the rhino, connecting the G20 Summit, or revolutionising cycling, giving you the opportunity to do great things.  You’ll be joining a Global Top Employer, recognised for investing in talent because people are at the heart of our success. You provide the skills, passion and ideas, and we’ll provide the platform to realise your ambitions.Great talent. Great teams. Great work. Great opportunities. Want to be part of our team?The Business Analyst works closely with internal clients to identify business requirements. This role requires the ability to interpret business needs and translate them into system requirements. The Business Analyst writes business specifications for product manager’s approval. The Business Analyst conducts internal meetings to review the requirements with the development team and updates requirements as necessary.What you'll be doingMajor Duties & ResponsibilitiesInterviews stakeholders to capture and clarify requirementsApplies best practice methodologies to define, scope, document and validate the requirements of internal and/or external clients for information, processes, information or system changes and improvements or problemsAssists with building business casesActively participates and as required leads sessions to define functional requirements, work flows, and business processes (including meeting co-ordination, initial request handling, requirements gathering, facilitation, etc.)Education/Qualifications RequiredBachelor’s degree in Business or Engineering, or equivalent training in a related field, preferredWork Experience Required2-4 years of experience required or equivalent educationPrevious process assessment work experience strongly preferredWhat would make you a good fit for this role?Skills and Core CompetenciesStrong interpersonal and consultative skillsStrong oral and written communication skillsDemonstrated self-initiative and self-direction in learning activities and professional developmentBroad understanding of business practices and processes, process modeling techniques, relevant process analysis tools and methodologies or systems designJoin our growing global team and accelerate your career with Dimension Data. Apply today.Diversity in Dimension Data Dimension Data is an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be unfairly discriminated against on any arbitrary ground including race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected category.

Name: Business Analyst

US Citizenship or US Permanent Resident (Green card) status and the ability to pass and maintain a Federal government (Public Trust) clearance is required for this position.  RESPONSIBILITIES: Providing direct support to the SharePoint development teamActing as a liaison between the SharePoint development team and Federal clientsFacilitating and leading requirements gathering sessions with end usersEliciting and documenting business and system requirementsDeveloping user stories with acceptance criteriaDeveloping test plans, test cases, and test scriptsConducting quality assurance (QA) testing on SharePoint applications REQUIRED SKILLS: Demonstrable understanding of SharePoint Online/2016 and Office 365 out-of-box functionality and its ability to address business needs and improve processes3+ years of Business Analysis experience, specifically supporting software applicationsExperience with Agile/Scrum activities and ceremonies, including backlog groomingAbility to clearly document requirements in user story format with testable acceptance criteriaAbility to facilitate and lead requirements-gathering sessions with customersAbility to analyze, define, and document requirements for business processes and workflows, including generating diagramsAbility to act as a liaison between developers, customers, and other stakeholders during all phases of solution developmentExperience with iterative systems development life-cycle and documentationExperience leading demonstrations of system prototypes and solutions to end usersExperience creating application test plans, test cases, and test scriptsExperience conducting quality assurance testing on software applications to ensure developed features fulfill documented requirementsExperience documenting defects identified during testingAbility to facilitate customer user acceptance testing (UAT) and assist users in troubleshooting issuesClear communication, writing, and presentation skillsAttention to detailInitiative PREFERRED SKILLS: Ability to speak to the capabilities and limitations of SharePoint Online/2016 with Federal clientsExperience using systems for requirements tracking and user story managementExperience using tools for SharePoint testingCBAP, CCBA, or equivalentCertified Scrum Master (CSM) or equivalentExperience with relevant CMMI Level 2 & 3 processes else that makes you part of any group. We have a 401K plan, a health plan that includes dental and vision benefits, pet health insurance, support for sick-child daycare, book and fitness clubs, a generous training budget for each employee, employee-led (and TCG paid) social events, company charity events, free theater and sports tickets, and much more.  In fact, in 2018 Fortune magazine named TCG as a "Great Place to Work" for the third year in a row and The Washington Post named TCG as a "Top Workplace" for the fourth straight year, based on how our employees feel about the company, the benefits TCG offers, and the work/life balance that our staff are able to achieve. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionBusiness Analyst, US Citizenship is required OneSpring is a group of creative designers and out-of-the box technical problem solvers who believe in delighting clients with an unparalleled approach to visualization. We value critical thinkers, team players with humility and grit.  OneSpring projects, like our clients, span the globe and require big picture focus. As Business Analyst, you'll support complex, multi-disciplinary software projects, plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle in the Federal government space. This includes eliciting requirements, translating business needs to a single consistent vision, translate technical issues, model and document business requirements, act as a communication broker, support test and validation through user acceptance test cases, and represent stakeholders as a surrogate to obtain information and verify decisions. In this role, it's your responsibility to keep all the players coordinated with progress and deadlines in a fast paced and complex environment.  We invite you to learn more… ResponsibilitiesThis role is not for the ordinary or mediocre- we are on the search for a serious and disciplinedBusiness Analyst who creates requirements specifications, analyzes requirements, facilitates elicitation sessions, and gets stakeholders involved at the right times and in the right ways to keep everything moving forward achieving exceptional results in an Agile environment.Ability to adapt and pivot on projects while conducting discovery and requirement research.Effectively communicate with teams and stakeholders in detail all project analysis.Creating concepts that are both usable and intuitive for highly complex and functional problems.Using low fidelity mock-ups and prototypes to visually tell a story solving business needs.Masterful as a "consultant" working with multi-disciplinary and stakeholders guiding them through projects with ease, credibility, confidence and achieving results.Requirements5+ years experience as a Business Analyst in an IT environment and/or Consulting.5+ years in process design and requirement definition and gathering.5+ years conducting and leading both live and virtual JAD sessions.5+ years of leading cross-functional teams and guiding other cross-functional teams.Highly experienced with Eliciting Requirements, Documentation, Business Process Flows, User Stories, and Epics.Proficiency in Agile methodologies.Experience with SDLC.Nice to have user experience design (e.g. wire frames, mock-ups, site maps, etc.).Requirements visualization is a plus (prototyping).Flexible and thrives in a fast pace environment.ToolsMS OfficeMS VisioAtlassian JIRA and ConfluenceVisualization Tools (e.g. Justinmind Prototyper Pro, Axure, iRise, or Protoshare)Education Level 4-year degree in Business Administration, Marketing Communications, Information Systems, Computer Science or equivalent area.  In addition, U.S Citizenship is required. Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information and be able to obtain a government-granted security clearance. Individuals may also be subject to a background investigation including, but not limited to criminal history, employment and education verification, drug testing, and creditworthiness. OneSpring is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or genetic information.Company DescriptionOneSpring is a professional services consulting firm with deep expertise in designing transformational solutions using UX, CX, and Human-Centered Design. We are a group of experience designers and out-of-the box technical problem solvers who believe in delighting clients with an unparalleled approach to solving problems right the first time. We value critical thinkers, creativity, team players with humility and grit. Our goal is to create beautiful and functional solutions that our clients love.  Learn more about OneSpring by checking out our website, http://onespring.net/.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob #: 916861  Apex is currently seeking an experienced professional to fill an IT Business Analyst position for a software development team. Will lead a team of business analysts to gather requirements and/or user stories, conduct analysis of alternatives, write papers, act as Scrum Master, and assist team in Agile transformation. *Duties and Responsibilities: • Coordinate and communicate with other members of the team to ensure overall project goals are being met in relation to business analysis and the BA team. • Responsible for identifying and developing requirements, and establishing requirements traceability to the business vision. • Work closely with the technical team in the definition, testing, training, implementation, and support of functional requirements. • Solicit requirements and user stories through interviews, workshops, and/or existing systems documentation or procedures. • Develop project and communications documents, conduct analysis of alternatives, and develop white papers, roadmaps and case studies. • Serve as Scrum Master, to help build high performing teams, build shippable product and be responsible for leading Agile best practices, specifically Scrum, and project coordination. • Ensure Scrum is understood, and work with the team to solve problems and to drive continuous improvement and business owner satisfaction. • Will organize and facilitate all Scrum related meetings (stand-ups, retrospectives, reviews, demos, etc.). • Work with the team to develop project plans, roadmaps and manage backlog. Communicate team plans, report impediments for escalation, identify risks/concerns to relevant stakeholders to help resolve. • Work with product owners and stakeholders to refine vision and establish goals and metrics. • Update Agile tracking system daily to provide transparency on product and sprint backlogs. Track and communicate team velocity and sprint progress to all affected teams and management. *Education and Years of Experience: • Minimum 7 years of academic and business experience, particularly in a software development environment. • The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's Degree in a technology related field, or other degree. Equivalent combination of education, technical training or work experience is also acceptable. • Experience in Agile methodology required. *Required Skills/Certifications: • Self-starter who can come up to speed quickly. Works with little direction and supervision, makes time for unplanned assignments, and adaptable to changing priorities. • Solid collaboration, multi-tasking and organization skills. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. Leadership abilities a plus. • Detail oriented with strong verbal and written communication skills including technical writing skills. Must be able to communicate effectively and confidently with users, team members and management. • Has strong analytical and problem solving skills, and is able to identify multiple approaches to problem solving and recommend the best solution. • Strong facilitation skills needed. Must be able to elicit requirements from various stakeholders across the organization. • Process driven analysis skills and a background in various requirements elicitation methods needed. • Must possess understanding of software engineering concepts. • Must have experience working in an office setting and possess strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills. • Must be able to multi-task and prioritize assignments in accordance to program goals. • Must be coachable, self-motivated, detail-oriented, and take initiative in performing tasks. • Team player must be able to work professionally and collaboratively with the government customer and other contract members of the project team. • Proficient skills in Microsoft standard desktop applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Project. • Writing Samples may be requested. Desired Skills/Certifications: (Please provide this information in list form) • Experience with and knowledge of Jira • CSM or CBAP certification or equivalent certification desired. EEO EmployerApex is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at 844-463-6178* Minimum 7 years of academic and business experience, particularly in a software development environment. * The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's Degree in a technology related field, or other degree. Equivalent combination of education, technical training or work experience is also acceptable. * Experience in Agile methodology required. *Required Skills/Certifications: * Self-starter who can come up to speed quickly. Works with little direction and supervision, makes time for unplanned assignments, and adaptable to changing priorities. * Solid collaboration, multi-tasking and organization skills. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. Leadership abilities a plus. * Detail oriented with strong verbal and written communication skills including technical writing skills. Must be able to communicate effectively and confidently with users, team members and management. * Has strong analytical and problem solving skills, and is able to identify multiple approaches to problem solving and recommend the best solution. * Strong facilitation skills needed. Must be able to elicit requirements from various stakeholders across the organization. * Process driven analysis skills and a background in various requirements elicitation methods needed. * Must possess understanding of software engineering concepts. * Must have experience working in an office setting and possess strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills. * Must be able to multi-task and prioritize assignments in accordance to program goals. * Must be coachable, self-motivated, detail-oriented, and take initiative in performing tasks. * Team player must be able to work professionally and collaboratively with the government customer and other contract members of the project team. * Proficient skills in Microsoft standard desktop applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Project. * Writing Samples may be requested. Desired Skills/Certifications: (Please provide this information in list form) * Experience with and knowledge of Jira * CSM or CBAP certification or equivalent certification desired.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Andromeda Systems Incorporated (ASI) develops enterprise software used by financial asset managers to monitor, service, and report on financial asset portfolios. Our customers include the US Department of Housing and Urban Development, US Department of Agriculture, Veterans Affairs along with other US agencies and commercial financial institutions. We meet our customers challenges by developing state of the art solutions that bring together the fields of computer science, operations, data science, and the financial industry using the latest industry technologies and business strategies.  ASI is an ISO 9001: 2015 Certified Service Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB). We have been on the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing companies in America for eight years.  We are looking for Business Analysts to join our Financial Services team working onsite at clients office. This position requires a self-starter with good communication skills that works well in a dynamic environment. Responsibilities: Prepare, execute, and document the outcome of customer interviews around simple featuresWrite stories, and create simple diagrams/workflows, wireframes and prototypes and validate them with customersCreate and execute simple test procedures to validate the delivery of software products according to specificationsElicit requirements from the customer in the form of feature requests, use cases, and/or user stories using interviews, observations, and feedback loops with the goal of understanding the customers needsDocument requirements at both broad and granular levels, in text format as feature requests, use cases, user stories, epics, etc., and in graphical format as UML diagrams, data flows, sequence graphs, etc. using tools appropriate to an agile software development lifecycleWork with product managers to design software prototypes and/or wireframes that address customer needs, and serve to validate the teams understanding of the requirementsFacilitate conversations about requirements with software developers, QA, and product managers with the goal of resolving concerns and bringing everyone to a satisfactory understandingDevelop thorough understanding of the internal processes involved in developing, testing, and managing releases to ensure all concerns are represented fairly and accuratelyRepresent simultaneously the interests of the team and those of the customer in all matters pertaining to requirementsWork in a timely fashion in accordance with relevant project timeframes to ensure vital requirements information is available when neededFollow up with the customer through strategic channels in a systematic, courteous manner when clarity is neededBuild or improve analytical processes used to improve the development processRequired Qualifications:Bachelors degree in business, computer science, engineering, information systemsIn lieu of degree, may be currently enrolled in an accredited program towards a Bachelors with equivalent of up to 3 years on-the-job experience as a business analystStrong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skillsPreferred Qualifications:Proficient with: MS Office applicationsJIRABusiness or information systems backgroundWork Authorization/Security Clearance:Must be a U.S. Citizen and qualify for Public Trust ClearanceAAP/EEO Statement Andromeda Systems Incorporated is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. As such, 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5, 41 CFR 60-741.5 as well as 29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A are herein incorporated by reference, to the extent applicable. This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 60-300.5(a) and 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. Moreover, these regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Name: Business Analyst

The Business Analyst will work closely with the project manager, product owners, stakeholders, and development team to review, analyze and evaluate business systems and user needs. The BA will document requirements, assist in the definition of scope and objectives, and help to formulate systems to parallel overall business strategies while working in a fast-paced agile environment. Elicit customer requirements using techniques such as interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysisCollaborate with Product Owners (PO), Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and developers to understand the customer needs and translate that into the product backlog, and work closely with developers to support the Agile development processEvaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needsDefine detailed stories with applicable acceptance criteria in collaboration with the Product Owners and technology team, and ensure that the team understands the requirements to successfully meet business goalsAssist the Product Owner with the development of the team’s backlog in JIRA, thoroughly documenting user stories with all relevant information, and assist with regularly scheduled grooming sessionsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field and 4+ years of experience.Familiar with relational database, ETL and data visualization concepts.Experience with Oracle, Informatica, Tableau and ArcGIS strongly preferredExperience working in a fast-paced Agile environmentAbility to impact operations and effect change without being confrontationalAbility to work independently and with others; Extremely organized with strong time-management skills.Strong presentation skills and self-reliance a must; Detail oriented, analytical and inquisitiveMonitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actionsPrepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trendsInterpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-makingDesign and perform testing of new dashboards and applications created by the technical teamsCreate informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvementConduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issuesAssist where needed in facilitating Agile sprint ceremonies (planning, grooming, retrospectives, demos)Builds a culture of trust with stakeholders and within the scrum team and encourages open communication regarding the work at handCreate an environment of continuous improvement by helping the team identify areas of the development process that can be improved and helping the team commit to and deliver improvements in those processes.Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field and 4+ years of experience.Familiar with relational database, ETL and data visualization concepts.Experience with Oracle, Informatica, Tableau and ArcGIS experience strongly preferredAbility to impact operations and effect change without being confrontationalDetail oriented, analytical and inquisitiveAbility to work independently and with othersExtremely organized with strong time-management skills.Strong presentation skills and self-reliance a must.Security Clearance: Must be a US Citizen and have the ability to obtain a Government Agency clearance. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Join the Non-Profit industry as a Business Analyst and turn customer needs into actionable plans through this open position from Robert Half Technology. To be successful in this Business Analyst role, you should be a self-starter who combines a strong technical understanding with excellent communication and social skills. You will make an impact working with a stable company in the Non-Profit industry. Based in the Arlington, Virginia area, this Business Analyst role is a full-time opportunity. What you get to do every day - Produce creative and accessible solutions for new product requirements - Work with development and QA teams to test and implement new corrections and improvements - Craft comprehensive user stories and profiles - Meet business goals by working closely with development team to invent and analyze product requirements - Assess and review business, technical, and functional requirements - Produce documentation for software solutions, using a customer-focused approach - Work with designers on wire-frames, interactions, and user flows *Technology doesn't change the world. People do.** As a technology staffing firm, we can't think of a more fitting mantra. We're extreme believers in technology and the incredible things it can do. But we know that behind every smart piece of software, every powerful processor, and every brilliant line of code is an even more brilliant person. *Leader among IT staffing agencies** The intersection of technology and people ? it's where we live. Backed by more than 65 years of experience, Robert Half Technology is a leader among IT staffing agencies. Whether you're looking to hire experienced technology talent or find the best technology jobs, we are your IT expert to call.  We understand not only the art of matching people, but also the science of technology. We use a proprietary matching tool that helps our staffing professionals connect just the right person to just the right job. And our network of industry connections and strategic partners remains unmatched.  Apply for this job now or contact our branch office at 888.674.2094 to learn more about this position.  All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.  ? 2018 Robert Half Technology. An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veterans.  By clicking 'Apply Now' you are agreeing to Robert Half Terms of Use. Req ID:* 04510-0010736613Functional Role:* Business AnalystCountry:* USAState:* VACity:* ArlingtonPostal Code:* 22201Compensation:* $75,000.00 to $80,000.00 per yearRequirements:* - Strong familiarity with SAAS - Experience with Constant Contact, Marketo or similar desired - Salesforce.com experience - 3+ years of related experience - Experience translating technical to non technical audiences - Solid grasp of developing requirements and product specifications for new or existing applications - Experience gathering technical requirements from stakeholders

Name: Business Analyst
Description: MOSAIC is seeking a Business Analyst who will support the Army Cyber Command's mission to direct and conduct integrated Electronic Warfare (EW), Information Operations (IO) and Cyberspace Operations to ensure protection activities in and through cyberspace and the information environment.  Job Responsibilities Provides support to the Program Manager to evaluate, review, monitor, and report on program performanceConducts analysis and monitoring of program requirements, performance, schedule, and riskResearches, collects, organizes, and interprets technical data and status relating to programsPerforms data and requirement gathering and business process analysis Minimum Requirements At least three (3) years' experience providing support, evaluating, reviewing, monitoring, and reporting on program performanceExperience providing advice, assistance, and oversight on department and program cost and performance mattersExperienced supporting the planning, developing, coordinating, defending and executing all aspects of the program manager's program fundingDemonstrated experience providing guidance on Department of Defense/Federal regulations and requirements to program staff and customersExperience with developing and maintaining rules of engagement between the program leadership and customer Preferred Special Qualifications Demonstrated experience supporting a PMO Additional Information  Position may start in Fort Belvoir, Virginia then transition to Augusta, Georgia by September 2020 Benefits:Medical, Dental, and Vision InsuranceFlexible Spending Accounts (FSA)401(k) Matching Program10 Paid Holidays and PTOShort-Term Disability and Long-Term Disability paid for by MOSAICTerm Life InsuranceTraining and Career Development Reimbursement OpportunitiesReferral Incentive Program At MOSAIC Technologies Group each team member is a key player. MOSAIC provides consulting and technical services to Government and commercial clients in the areas of management, mission and technology. We know the value of our talent, and we work to provide challenging opportunities for each member that will cultivate careers as well as develop people. Our familial environment, competitive salary and benefits are a few of the ways that we take care of our people. If you believe in supporting your community, growing your career and working with committed colleagues then join us. MOSAIC wants you in the family.
