Name: Business Analyst
Description: KeyLogic is seeking outstanding candidates with industry experience to join our expanding team! Business Analyst Location: Washington, DC Job Code: 829 DescriptionKeyLogic is looking to grow our Business Analysis team at multiple locations.  The Business Analyst will support federal clients in the areas of financial management, capital planning, project management and business support services. Duties may include high-level analysis and support related to statutory requirements and compliance, business process re-engineering, IT portfolio reviews, and/or integration of IT investment processes to other procedures and disciplines. Experience/Qualifications:U.S. Citizenship is a requirementExpertise in Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and MS Project)3+years of experience providing internal/external consulting services to management and technical staff in managing IT investments and solving complex IT project management issues in accordance with federal laws, regulations and procedures.Practical knowledge of and experience with supporting project management office operations regarding the management, planning, implementation, and all phases of the capital planning process.Knowledge of process improvement and re-engineering methodologies and principles as applied to process modernization projects.Proven experience in activity and data modeling, developing modern business methods, identifying best practices, and creating and assessing performance measurements.Knowledge of SDLC, Capital Planning (CPIC), Earned Value Management (EVM), and the federal IT budget process.Proven ability to review and analyze cost, schedule, and performance requirements for federal IT investments.Strong verbal and written communication skills and leadership skills.About KeyLogic: KeyLogic is a highly successful provider of professional and engineering services. We specialize in solutions that enable our customers to make better decisions for their organization. KeyLogic’s performance has earned the company a solid reputation for high standards, proactive solutions, and an outstanding commitment to the customer, best exemplified by the fact we have never had a one-time federal customer — all of our customers have provided repeat business.  KeyLogic has achieved seventeen consecutive years of growth since its founding in 1999. Our client list includes the Department of Defense (DoD), where we provide services for the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) and the U.S. Army and Navy, Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), Departments of Labor (DOL), Energy (DOE), Transportation (DOT) and Treasury (including the Internal Revenue Service (IRS)), General Services Administration (GSA), and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA).  KeyLogic has successfully attained a Capability Maturity Model Integration for Development (CMMI-DEV) Maturity Level 3 Rating. CMMI-DEV is a process improvement approach for software engineering and organizational development that provides organizations with the essential best practices needed to meet business goals. Only three-percent of small and medium federal contractors have achieved CMMI Maturity Level 3. KeyLogic joins this distinguished group.  KeyLogic Systems is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled.Previous Applicants:Email:Password: If you do not remember your password click here.

Name: Business/Financial Management Analyst
Description: LS Technologies, LLC is seeking a Business/Financial Management Analyst to support LS Technologies, LLC Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) customer located in Washington, D.C. Makes recommendations to accurately allocate and re-allocate staffing and budget resources accordingly in order to maintain effective organizational performance and avoid anti-deficiency status.Conducts comparative financial analyses, financial modeling and forecasting, and other statistical qualitative studies to provide trends, projections, and recommendations.Establishes financial goals, timetables, milestones, and other criteria to measure program achievement.Requirements10 or more years of experience as a business or financial management analystExperience with DELPHI and PRISMExperience with FAA NAS systems strongly preferred;Experience or ability to conduct integrated analysis of:Operational and business shortfalls,Trade space and alternatives,Outcomes and benefits realization,Overarching risk to achieving outcomesMust possess exceptional analytical, writing and communication skills;Strong attention to detail, well organized and ability to self-prioritize multiple activities is required;Ability to effectively initiate action, collaborate with others, and drive action items to resolution;Proficiency in developing and presenting, both verbally and in writing, technical information and presentations to non-technical audiences;Job Posted by ApplicantPro

research projects as requested.Gather information about best practices in business analytics and implement better ways to solve customer requests.What You Will Need To Bring With You (Preferred): Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree with a quantitative focus or significant experience post-college working with dataDemonstrated ability to innovate in data analytics and data science4+ years of experience using data to draw actionable insights in a businessWhy work for Koch Companies?A culture that places top priority on integrity and complianceOpportunity for career growth at one of the largest, financially stable companies in the worldEncouragement to challenge the status quo and share knowledgeAccess to professional training and mentoringResponsibilities and rewards based on contributions rather than seniorityContinued company growth due to reinvesting 90% of our earnings Based in Wichita, Kan., Koch Industries, Inc. is one of the largest private companies in America with estimated annual revenues as high as $115 billion, according to Forbes. It owns a diverse group of companies involved in refining, chemicals, grain processing and biofuels; forest and consumer products; fertilizers; polymers and fibers; process and pollution control equipment and technologies; electronic components; commodity trading; minerals; energy; ranching; glass; and investments. With a presence in about 60 countries, Koch companies employ more than 100,000 people worldwide, with about 60,000 of those in the United States. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Primary ResponsibilityThe Business RequirementsAnalyst will assist in the development of User Stories with the Product Ownerto capture requirements using an Agile software development approach. The candidateshall provide support to collect, identify, define, aggregate, conceptualize,and prioritize strategic and nearer-term requirements. The candidate shallprovide requirements support across project team serve as the primary interfacebetween functional staff and information technology staff.The candidate must have asolid understanding of requirements elicitation using User Story andprogressive elaboration. Support shall beprovided in the following areas: • Review and analyze various business and technical documentation including: business requirements, process flows, system designs, and system requirements • Support the development of the Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM) to ensure that all requirements are tested, tracked, and maintained throughout the effort  • Develop and document requirements in the form of User Stories • Assist in the formation of Acceptance Criteria(s) • Collection and organization of information required for preparation of reports and briefings • Preparation of documents, including review for completeness of content and consistency with order, style, and terminology standards • Analytical interpretation of highly specialized technical and analytical information used to compose detailed documentation and reports • Continuously researching and evaluating new technology that could be exploited to better meet user requirements and support organizational goals and objectives

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Reference # : 18-01977 Title : Business Analyst Location : Washington, DC Position Type : Contract Experience Level : Start Date / End Date : 11/26/2018 / 07/31/2019 DescriptionMust be a US Citizen and must be clearable to a MBI (public trust)Position Description The successful candidate will work with our client and other members of our PMO to set-up and facilitate meetings, prepare meeting agendas, produce status reports, document project risks, and produce thorough meeting minutes. As needed, this role will also support ad-hoc requests, on-boarding processes, and administrative tasks like monitoring the completion of tasks by other team members. This is a customer-facing role that requires strong communication skills and proactiveness. Our team is co-located with the customer and Business Analysts may be directly approached by the customer (i.e., this is *not* a back-office role where the Business Analyst is buffered from customer interaction). Required Skills General Logistics Skills: For client meetings, locate meeting space, setup meeting invitation (MS Outlook), secure conference bridge, create agenda, circulate materials, perform roll-call, and take meeting minutes ? specific content will be provided by the client or more senior members of the PMO. Use tools like Jira/Confluence/Ms Excel to help the client track their Pivot software licenses (across multiple environments, vendors, and contracts) such that licenses expirations can be planned for properly and licenses can be renewed in a timely manner. Assist with tasks related to interviewing candidates for other PMO roles ? help perform "phone screens? and set up in-person interviews. Document team risks and issues in Jira, as needed. Help with on-boarding procedures such as obtaining government-furnished equipment for new team members. Support other more senior members of the PMO team in their roles ? requirements, test, financial, analytics, etc. Perform ad-hoc tasks, as needed by the client or other members of the PMO team. Years of Experience ? minimum of 1 year, 2+ years preferred. Quality Assurance Skills: Assist with the creation of weekly status reports ? collect content from other team members, consolidate, follow-up as necessary, review and input into proper template. Perform Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QA/QC) role by performing a thorough review of various Systems Engineering Life Cycle (SELC) documents ? this includes of a review of grammar, sentence structure, terms/acronyms, header/footers, footnotes, font/bullet consistency, etc. While development teams and more senior members of PMO staff are not expected to produce "sloppy work? and "throw it over the fence,? the person in this role will perform a final review of many documents to make sure that work passed to the customer meets high standards. Years of Experience ? minimum of 1 year, 2+ years preferred. Customer Interaction Skills: The Team works on-site in an open office environment shared with the FEMA customer. As a result of this work situation, many client interactions are ad hoc/impromptu, the ability to quickly switch from work tasks to client facing engagement is critical. Consultants need to be able to develop and tailor materials to meet their target audience's level of technical experience (e.g., some of our other stakeholders are not "tech-savvy;? therefore being able to translate technical considerations/constraints into "layman's? terms is critical). Years of Experience ? minimum of 1 year, 2+ years preferred. Time Management Skills: Analysts may be asked to assist with multiple tasks, so they must be able to manage their time effectively to meet various milestones and deadlines for each work stream in addition to participating in weekly client meetings. Analysts must be proactive in preparing for large deliverables (e.g., factoring in time for multiple QA reviews, client feedback, etc.). Years of Experience ? minimum of 1 year, 2+ years preferred.  Preferred Skills  ?Understanding or knowledge of DHS, FEMA, FIMA, and/or NFIP. Years of Experience ? N/A, as this is preferred.  ?Understanding and tactical experience with an IT PMO. Years of Experience ? N/A, as this is preferred. Provide primary job duties: Job Duty 1 with % of time ? General Logistics Skills (see above) ? 35%  Job Duty 2 with % of time ? Quality Assurance (QA) Skills (see above)? 35%  Job Duty 3 with % of time ? Customer Interaction Skills (see above) ? 20%  Job Duty 4 with % of time ? Time Management Skills (see above) ? 10%

Name: Entry Level Business Analyst
Description: A Business Analysts must typically have a demonstrated interest in technology and business, strong problem-solving abilities, and excellent interpersonal skills. Business Analysts will be placed on one of our many projects and could be doing a number of different tasks. We can also consider a Fresh Graduate if you possess the right aptitude to learn and excel. We can also help fresh graduate to hone his/her skills. You should be open to travel and relocation. If you have good knowledge of any Industry like Finance, Insurance, Healthcare or Education, that would be a plus.  FOR MORE INFORMATION PLEASE CALL: 773 770 6307  Email: denver@staffigo.com  Job Description/Responsibilities:  Strong communication and documentation skills (written/verbal).  Ability to communicate clearly and concisely.  Detail oriented with strong analysis, process, problem solving, and critical thinking skills.  Inquisitive and driven to understand the intersection of business processes and information technology systems.  Effective in team setting or as individual contributor Ability to participate with a team to achieve a common goal and the ability to work independently (with little oversight) to achieve a pre-defined goal.  Ability to self-motivate as well as working well with a diverse team.  Ability to multi-task and manage evolving priorities.  Ability to support multiple concurrent project responsibilities.  Ability to interact with all levels of staff with confidence when working with, reporting to, and providing/receiving guidance from team members.  High degree of comfort interacting with a computer and familiarity with MS Word/Excel/Access  Enthusiasm (High Energy) Ability to self-motivate and push yourself to achieve desired results while maintaining a positive attitude.  Willingness and ability to go the extra mile to help the larger team achieve success.  Preferred Skills  Understanding of System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and testing life-cycle, testing procedures, and methodologies.  Information Technology (IT) experience, preferably SQL and/or Programing language (any) experience  Experience or educational background in Health and Human Services, Insurance, Public Welfare or other similar industry.  Hi-Level Responsibilities:  Research and review program policy, business requirements, system requirements, etc. to gain an understanding of project objectives and specifications.  Develop and execute comprehensive quality assurance test plans based on specifications using scenario matrices to thoroughly test software before is released to end users.  Identify, analyze, and document discrepancies/deviations between expected and actual results.  Communicate system functionality issues, including discrepancies between policy and proposed changes, to functional leads and subsystem analysts, and work toward resolution of issues.  Perform peer reviews of Test Scenarios and Scripts.  Qualifications:  Masters Degree in Information Technology.  Must have good knowledge in Finance, Banking, Insurance, Retail or Healthcare and/or benefit administration is a plus.  Excellent writing/documentation, communication, analysis and organizational skills required.  Strong aptitude in both business and technology.  Self-starter with excellent organizational and time management skills.  Fast learner, quality consciousness and committed to deadlines.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionWhat Youll Get to Do:CACI is hiring a Business Analyst in support of the Department of State. The business analyst will be part of a team that supports enterprise software applications, infrastructure, data architecture, cloud services and business intelligence to the enterprise. You should be able to define and document business requirements and translate business requirements to functional, user, and system requirements in support of system development. You'll work as a part of a dynamic team supporting mission critical systems that are being expanded and integrated. More About the Role:In this role, you'll manage and consult with government customers on special projects to generate additional requirements and increase business value. You'll also:Work with multiple stakeholders to understand their business needs for software applications that support their mission.Develop requirements that meet the customers mission/business needs. You'll be responsible for negotiating system requirements with product owners and communicate business process changes that impact the solution. Perform analysis on business or systems processes to identify improvements. Perform analyses and provide recommendations on top level requirements, system requirements, derived requirements, software requirements, and interface designs.Work with team members and client to understand and define needs and develop and recommend solutions.Youll Bring These Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree5+ years' experience as a Business AnalystActive Secret clearanceExperience developing or updating system requirements documentations.Understanding of agile and waterfall software development methodologies and DevOPsExperience using SharePoint and Office 365Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Project, etc) Strong communication skills What We Can Offer You:- Weve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.- Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.- We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.- We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nations highest priorities.- For over 55 years, the principles of CACIs unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.Job LocationUS-Washington-DC-WASHINGTON DCCACI employs a diverse range of talent to create an environment that fuels innovation and fosters continuous improvement and success. At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is proud to provide dynamic careers for employees worldwide. CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Name: Business Analyst

Join a team that is changing the way our customer develops and manages enterprise applications using Agile and DevOps methodologies and enterprise wide modernization.  In this customer facing role, you will analyze, document, monitor and manage the program needs and requirements.  You must be a US citizen in order to be considered for this role. (Spelling, grammar, formatting, structure, etc.).1+year of client-facing experience in consultative environment. You should be able to pivot quickly and serve as a technology translator adapting the message according to technical savviness1+ year of deadline-driven experience managing multiple tasks.Proactive nature and ability to plan for large deliverables.About Us: NewGen is a technology consulting services company solving some of the public and private sectors toughest challenges across Enterprise Management, Cyber Security and DevOps. Business Analysts may work solo with a group of programmers or they may work with other analysts and a project team, depending on the scope and complexity of the project.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Who We Are Business has changed - so should consulting. We are strategists, technologists, engineers, and designers who bridge the gap between consulting, design, and marketing to create powerful digital experiences for our customer's brands and users.  Recently named as the nations #6 Boutique Consulting Firm by Vault.com, Ignyte is looking for Business Analysts to join our progressive start-up culture and help us build a new type of consulting company. What You'll Do At Ignyte, our Business Analysts are passionate about creating innovative data-driven solutions across various industries that address critical business problems. You'll be challenged daily as you wear multiple hats to drive multiple project types to completion in both a development and business-facing role.  As a Business Analyst, we give you the opportunity to create your own career path based on your interests, the skills you already possess as well as the skills you'd like to have. Your everyday tasks will involve working with prominent start-up CEOs as well as some of the biggest clients in the DC area to understand their business challenges, working with our team to envision a future-state technology solution that addresses our clients needs, and creating requirements to achieve that future state.  Youll work with our firm's leadership from day one to formulate your own job description and career goals. Not sure whered you fit in? Well work with you to figure it out as part of the application process. and aid the testing team in test case preparationAbility to prepare end user documentation, training manuals, and knowledge repositories for the user communityAbility to create high-quality presentations, models, and analyses, and other deliverables and present them to clients and upper managementPossession of technical competencies to develop creative and innovative solutions that address clients business problems preferredAbility to assist in proposal writing for business development opportunities as requestedAbility to analyze and synthesize information to draw accurate, logical, and actionable conclusionsHard working, self-motivated individuals who are comfortable handling ambiguity and able to successfully complete tasks within deadlines with limited alikeComfort working with groups, as well as sensitivity to individual, group and organizational dynamicsCreative, big picture thinking while maintaining keen attention to detailAbility to meet Name: Business Analyst
Description: BUSINESS ANALYST  Two to Five Years of Experience  Washington, DC.Overview: The business analyst works either independently or as part of a larger team to conduct a variety of quantitative analyses as required to accomplish client mission objectives. A strong foundational knowledge in statistical analysis, research, and identification of causal factors is a strong plus. Analysis may span a broad spectrum to include: financial, labor force (census), workforce population, project variances, earned value, etc. The business analyst is expected to be able to interpret guidance and identify the most effective manner in which to gather, analysis, and report information and data to promote business decision making.  Efforts may include document authoring, where quantitative analysis is a major component and or facilitation of business process definition activities aimed at capturing processes and identifying areas of improvement. Strong presentation skills both in development of executive level presentations and or support crafting communications strategies is also needed to be successful in this role. Primary Duties: Acts as a liaison between client departments and the project team by:  Opening and maintaining lines of communication to monitor and improve business services  Serving as a single point of contact between departments, offices, and the project team,  Making recommendations for product or service enhancements,  Supporting ideas and recommendations with sound data analysis.  Become an expert in application of relevant federal regulations  Author documents, specifications, presentations as required in support of client operations.  Participates in business process modeling sessions, acting as a documentarian, co-facilitator, facilitator, or subject matter expert in sketch sessions.  Conducts interviews and performs analysis in order to create business cases for projects.  Conducts preliminary requirements analysis for project requests. Reviews requirements, specifications, test, support and training plans to ensure alignment with scope.  Participates in root cause analysis in order to recommend product enhancements or other appropriate actions to improve productivity for both the business units and IT.  May act as a project manager on some projects or tasks.Job Requirements:  BS degree from an accredited four year college or university 2 to 5 years of professional work experience with business process, requirements gathering, project management; research; analysis; and consulting experience.Required Skills/Abilities: Prior Experience Working in a Federal Environment  Exemplary Communication both Oral and Written  Strong Analysis Skills (Quantitative and Qualitative)  Self-Starter and Self-Motivated with a Strong Quality Focus  Collaborative and Works well in Teams  Able to Set and Consistently Meet Deadlines  Ability to Establish and Maintain Effective Working Relationships  Perform Complex and Routine Tasks With Speed and Accuracy  Prepare Studies and Reports Concerning Complex Matters  Train and Develop Peers, Staff, or ClientsDesired Skills/Abilities:  Bachelors degree in business administration (finance), economics, or related field requiring strong writing and quantitative analysis skills  Familiarity with Capital Planning & Investment Control (CPIC)  Certification in a business analysis or process domainNote: This document describes typical duties and responsibilities and is not intended to limit management from assigning other work as desired.

ability to see the big picture and envision possible solutionsAbility to work on multiple projects simultaneouslyAbility to ask strong questions to help the team in better understanding the requirements that may lead to problemsExcellent working knowledge of Agile Application Lifecycle Management tools like JIRA, Rally etc.Strong understanding of various Agile development methodologiesCertified Scrum Master (CSM) or SAFe Agilist (SA) certification Due to the nature of the government contract , US Citizenship is required DESIRED QUALIFICATIONSPMI-ACP® CertificationExperience with Scaled Agile (preferably SAFe) implementationsSAFe Certified Product Owner Skills:Business Analysis What you can expect from us:Build your career with us.It is an extraordinary time to be in business. At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Business Analyst will help formulate and define system requirements. This position requires strong analytical and interpersonal skills. The candidate will be responsible for soliciting and documenting requirements and ensuring they are built into the system to meet customer expectations. This is a client facing position and you will become an expert in communicating application functionality and assisting in documenting requirements, testing and training. Analyze business related issues to formulate and develop new or modified solutions. Consult with users to identify current operating procedures and to clarify objectives and requirements. Assist customer in defining work processes. Develop functional specifications, design specifications, test plans, test reports and security requirements. Identify areas where systems solutions will meet the customer needs. The Business Analyst will document all requirements and testing efforts. Reports directly to Senior Business Analyst or the Project Manager. Essential Functions: · Perform requirements gathering using a variety of techniques to define and document complex business requirements and processes  · Create and maintain requirements documents and specifications  · Create detailed descriptions of user needs and translate them into functional requirements specified in an appropriate level of detail suitable by developers  · Record functional requirements in a repository  · Participate in review sessions with technical and business staff, including all levels of management  · Participate in code review sessions with development staff  · Participate in creation of solutions that meet requirements  · Must be detailed oriented  · Manage and track requirements through the various lifecycle stages from business needs through design and delivery  · Develop necessary software documentation and documentation of meetings and decisions  · Prepare associated testing documentation to include user scenarios, test plans and test reports  · Prepare user documentation on developed software and conduct training, if needed  · Assist in troubleshooting software application issues  · Maintain CMMI level 3 or higher processes and procedures Qualifications/Basic Job Requirements: · This position requires 3 - 5 years of experience as a Functional / System / Business Analyst role in a complex environment preferably a government contract  · The candidate should demonstrate experience gathering requirements and designing the user experience with web applications  · Experience with iterative software development practices specifically the role of use cases in the analysis, development and testing processes  · Strong analytical and problem solving skills  · Strong communication skills to work directly with development staff, users and the client  · Experience with Help Desk support (Tier 1 and 2) is desired  · Experience with tools for requirements management, testing and release management such as Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server (TFS)  · Good working knowledge skills with Microsoft Office Products  · The ability to create and maintain technical documentation and user documentation is important  · Experience working in a CMMI level 3 or higher environment is desired  · Strong verbal and written communication skills are necessary  · Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities  · Proven ability to be flexible and work hard, both independently and in a team environment, in a high pressure on-call environment with changing priorities  · Willingness to occasionally work outside of normal business hours  · Bachelor’s Degrees in Business or Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education Must be US Citizen and must have a government security clearanceCompany DescriptionInterImage is woman-owned small business in business for 22 year. We are headquartered steps from the Ballston Metro station. We offer a full package of health and wellness benefits.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst Job Description Business Analyst Seeking a full time Project Manager / Business Analyst who will be responsible for the implementation of feature enhancements and client data migrations / customizations in our Commercial Real Estate software. Candidates must have experience in one or more of the following areas: Software Project Management, Business Process Analysis & Re-engineering, Enterprise Software Implementation, Real Estate Software, and Commercial Real Estate. Responsibilities: Responsibilities include discovery and analysis of client requirements, aligning business processes with system features, designing reports, making functional recommendations, consulting on best practices, technical specification & documentation, project management, and application testing & support. The Project Manager / Business Analyst will work hands-on with technical and non-technical internal team members, as well as directly with application end-users, and will direct technical resources within the division throughout all phases of each initiative. The Project Manager / Business Analyst is directly responsible for specific deliverables such as managing project plans & timelines, data conversion mapping & business rules, producing mock-ups and technical specifications for new report customizations and new application features, testing/QA, and troubleshooting & support. About CoStar Brokerage Applications: CoStar Brokerage Applications is a division of CoStar Group which develops, implements and supports software exclusively for the Commercial Real Estate industry. CoStar Brokerage Applications provides its users with a web-based, enterprise solution that enables users to manage transactions, client relationships and property/market research. CoStar Brokerage Applications currently serves over 150 firms in North America. Work Experience: Candidates should have 2-5 years of experience in managing software or other technology projects to end users. Required Personal Skills: Experience Managing Technical Implementations and Data Conversions Experience Designing & Documenting Technical Specifications for Web-Based Software Experience with Software Testing / QA Experience with Business Process Analysis & Consulting Understanding of Basic Accounting Practices Detail Oriented and Strong Organization Skills Software Project Management Commercial Real Estate Knowledge Customer Service Skills Time Management Skills PMI Certification or PM Training Required Technical Knowledge: Microsoft Project or Equivalent Basic SQL Server Queries Report Design Experience (Crystal/SSRS/Other) Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Access, Visio) Understanding of database design and relational databases  CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testingSDL2017

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob #: 916861  Apex is currently seeking an experienced professional to fill an IT Business Analyst position for a software development team. Will lead a team of business analysts to gather requirements and/or user stories, conduct analysis of alternatives, write papers, act as Scrum Master, and assist team in Agile transformation. *Duties and Responsibilities: • Coordinate and communicate with other members of the team to ensure overall project goals are being met in relation to business analysis and the BA team. • Responsible for identifying and developing requirements, and establishing requirements traceability to the business vision. • Work closely with the technical team in the definition, testing, training, implementation, and support of functional requirements. • Solicit requirements and user stories through interviews, workshops, and/or existing systems documentation or procedures. • Develop project and communications documents, conduct analysis of alternatives, and develop white papers, roadmaps and case studies. • Serve as Scrum Master, to help build high performing teams, build shippable product and be responsible for leading Agile best practices, specifically Scrum, and project coordination. • Ensure Scrum is understood, and work with the team to solve problems and to drive continuous improvement and business owner satisfaction. • Will organize and facilitate all Scrum related meetings (stand-ups, retrospectives, reviews, demos, etc.). • Work with the team to develop project plans, roadmaps and manage backlog. Communicate team plans, report impediments for escalation, identify risks/concerns to relevant stakeholders to help resolve. • Work with product owners and stakeholders to refine vision and establish goals and metrics. • Update Agile tracking system daily to provide transparency on product and sprint backlogs. Track and communicate team velocity and sprint progress to all affected teams and management. *Education and Years of Experience: • Minimum 7 years of academic and business experience, particularly in a software development environment. • The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's Degree in a technology related field, or other degree. Equivalent combination of education, technical training or work experience is also acceptable. • Experience in Agile methodology required. *Required Skills/Certifications: • Self-starter who can come up to speed quickly. Works with little direction and supervision, makes time for unplanned assignments, and adaptable to changing priorities. • Solid collaboration, multi-tasking and organization skills. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience. Leadership abilities a plus. • Detail oriented with strong verbal and written communication skills including technical writing skills. Must be able to communicate effectively and confidently with users, team members and management. • Has strong analytical and problem solving skills, and is able to identify multiple approaches to problem solving and recommend the best solution. • Strong facilitation skills needed. Must be able to elicit requirements from various stakeholders across the organization. • Process driven analysis skills and a background in various requirements elicitation methods needed. • Must possess understanding of software engineering concepts. • Must have experience working in an office setting and possess strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills. • Must be able to multi-task and prioritize assignments in accordance to program goals. • Must be coachable, self-motivated, detail-oriented, and take initiative in performing tasks. • Team player must be able to work professionally and collaboratively with the government customer and other contract members of the project team. • Proficient skills in Microsoft standard desktop applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Project. • Writing Samples may be requested. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Title:Business AnalystDuration:Full-TimeClearance:SecretLocation:Alexandria, VA & Greenbelt, MDPosition Overview: Swingtech Consulting, Inc. is looking for a Business Analyst / Technical Writer to elicit customer requirements, provide high level customer support, manage IT projects, and produce high-quality documentation for the overall success of the customer’s mission. The candidate must be willing to work on-site in Alexandria, VA and in our Greenbelt, MD headquarters. Must be a USCitizen with Secret Clearance. Job Duties: The Business Analyst manages, tracks, and prioritizes the support issues for the applications specified within the contract. The BA serves as the primary “intake” catalyst for agency’s 9-step web application support and modification processes. ensuring that the development team is focused on Tier 3 efforts for issue resolution management. The BA will effectively serve the customer base and the development team by routing requirements to the developers based on known expertise, and time availability.  The BA will work with the customer to elicit and document requirements for all development efforts, will streamline identified requirements using our Agile-based processes, and will coach teams on adopting Agile practices that are tailored to meet specific business objectives. The role involves working with a wide range of team members and stakeholders on the applications specified within the contract.  The BA will have the capability to use a wide range of programs to create and edit images, diagramming programs to create visual aids, and document processes to design, create, and format documents. He/she will have the capability to explain scientific and technical ideas in simple language for customer applications. The person will meet with customer representatives to establish technical specifications, study drawings, specifications, mockups, and product samples from customer. The BA must:Have 5 Plus years’ experience as a Business Analyst/Technical Writer on IT projects.Have Agile project management experience or a high degree of familiarity with Agile methodologies.Be familiar with project management tools, including Microsoft Project and Jira.Have a high degree of attention to detail.Have experience providing customer support.Have strong written and oral communication skills.Have a strong sense of organization and the ability to manage multiple priorities.Be able to facilitate requirements meetings and software demonstrations.Have strong documentation skills.Create user documentation for a variety of material, including how-to guides, user workflows and instruction manuals for customer.Ensure technical verbiage is easy to understand by the layperson.Prepare charts, graphs, or forms to go along with rough drafts.Write clear and concise policies and procedures.Submit draft copies to customer representatives for feedback.Adjust draft copies as necessary, to finalize and proofread for grammar and spelling.Follow a life cycle called document development life cycle.Provide updates and different editions as necessary.Document Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), Quick Start Guides (QSG).Release the document following final approval from the customer.QA experience is recommendedAdditional Information: The interview consists of General telephonic screening, and in-person team interview. No less than 5 years’ experience, strong communication skills with customer facing abilities is required. This position requires US Citizenship with Secret Clearance. If interested, share your most recent resume along with contact information.

Name: Senior Program Analyst - Knowledge Management
Description: OverviewWe are currently seeking an experienced, dynamic and collaborative professional to serve as a Senior Program Analyst within our Rural Health Care team. Reporting to the Director of Program Development you will:• lead the development, maintenance, and management of the Rural Health Care Division’s knowledge management framework and artifacts. • provide support in project management, business process development, and issue analysis for USAC’s Rural Health Care program to help facilitate effective and efficient program administration and change management.This is an outstanding career opportunity for an individual interested in a genuine professional challenge in support of a public-spirited mission. ResponsibilitiesWorking in a creative and fast-paced environment, the Senior Program Analyst will research, evaluate, and resolve Tier 2 inquiries or requests, including being the intermediary throughout the lifecycle if it requires support from other functional teams. Among others, your responsibilities will include the following:• Serve as the primary point of contact for the Division’s knowledge management work. This includes representing the Division on any cross-Division project teams or communications with external stakeholders. • Identify, collect, synthesize, organize and manage process knowledge in support of business units across the Division.• Determine, evaluate, and prioritize process knowledge requirements and gaps.• Contribute towards building a shared mindset and understanding of knowledge management using the agreed change management approaches.• Assess the sustainability of and review and modify the knowledge management process and framework.• Manage program implementation through a detailed project plan, monitoring, tracking progress and reporting the status to the management team.• Develop project plans that consider all necessary activities including but not limited to those related to information systems, business processes, communication with internal and external stakeholders, documentation, training, and contingency planning.• Act as an expert and resource in the area of Knowledge Management within the Division.• Capture the tactical and strategic program enterprise goals that provide traceability through the organization and are mapped to metrics that provide ongoing governance.• Describe the primary business functions of the enterprise and distinguish between customer-facing, supplier-related, business execution and business management functions.• Capture the relationships among roles, capabilities and business units, the decomposition of those business units into subunits, and the internal or external management of those units. • Apply best practice project management standards to significant program initiatives to ensure milestones are met on time, and associated processes are efficient. Also, manage multiple conflicting priorities while supporting the various process owners.• Collaborate with various internal teams (i.e., IT, stakeholder engagement, operations, etc.) as well as external vendors and consultants to manage timelines and address challenges. • Design new processes and recommend improvements to existing processes, assist in implementation, and create a structure and culture of continuous process improvement across all teams.• Assist management and process owners in the documentation of policies, procedures, job aids, and process flows for manual and automated processes.• Identify business process improvements to advance USAC’s operational efficiencies and regulatory compliance. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:o Assessing current procedures for areas of risk or inefficiency.o Researching regulations on which to base business processes.o Creating and executing plans for operational improvements.• Other specific duties as assigned.About YouThe successful candidate will excel at operating in a diverse and fluid environment, and will be crucial for the success of the Shared Services Division.• You possess a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university.• You have 5 to 7 years of experience in project management, process improvement, business process modeling, process improvement, knowledge management, risk mitigation, and/or customer service, or a commensurate combination of education and experience.• You are proactive and highly organized, with high attention to detail and follow through with the ability to handle multiple, complex tasks and establish priorities.• You possess the ability to work independently without significant guidance and be able to exercise good judgment, knowing when to escalate issues appropriately and make informed business decisions.• You have excellent analytical and proven problem-solving skills.• You demonstrate strong interpersonal skills and have strong verbal and written communication skills, with experience communicating with all levels of employees. • You possess ability to identify, implement, and drive continuous process improvement.• You are proficient in the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Visio, and Project).• A Project Management Professional (PMP) and/or PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA) certification is preferred but not required.  About USACDespite pervasive connectivity in most urban areas in the United States, as of January 2015 the FCC estimated that nearly 55 million Americans across the country had no access to broadband services. Through its administration of the $10 billion Universal Service Fund (USF) programs on behalf of the FCC, USAC works to promote the availability of quality services at just, reasonable and affordable rates and to increase access to advanced telecommunications services throughout the nation. Specifically, the USF programs provide funding for the expansion of telecommunications and broadband access to rural communities and health care facilities, schools and libraries across the country, and low income households. Through program administration, auditing, and outreach, USAC works with contributors, service providers, and program beneficiaries to achieve the program goals articulated by the FCC for each of these programs.The FCC has reformed the USF to support further investment in and access to evolving broadband infrastructure, making the programs a primary vehicle to support this critical national priority. USAC, as the administrator of the USF, plays a critical role in supporting the ambitious vision to ensure that all citizens in the United States have access to high-speed broadband. The organization has approximately 500 employees with an operating budget of more than $200 million. USAC works in close partnership with the FCC and other federal and state partners to support the achievement of the USF program goals.USAC administers the USF programs—High Cost, Lifeline, Rural Health Care, and Schools and Libraries. USAC strives to provide efficient, responsible stewardship of the programs, a key national asset in making important telecommunications and Internet services available to consumers, health care providers, schools, and libraries throughout the United States. The program divisions are supported by additional USAC personnel in Finance, General Counsel, Information Systems, Internal Audit, the Enterprise Program Management Office and Human Resources. Consistent with FCC rules, USAC does not make policy for or interpret unclear provisions of statutes or the FCC’s rules.Universal service is paid for by contributions from telecommunications carriers, including wireline and wireless companies, and interconnected Voice over Internet Protocol providers, including cable companies that provide voice service, based on an assessment of their interstate and international end- user revenues. These contributions are most typically passed through to consumers through a universal service fee line item on their telephone bills.Additional information on USF programs can be found at: http://www.usac.org/about/about/who-we- are/default.aspxUSAC offers a comprehensive benefits package, ongoing professional development opportunities, including vacation and sick leave.USAC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Only principals will be accepted. No agencies please.To apply, please submit a cover letter and resume, click the “Apply For This Job Online” button.USAC employees are passionate about our mission. Our work contributes to the success of all Americans. We’ve worked together to build a culture that is collaborative, ambitious, outcome-oriented, and feedback-focused.

Learn what it means to truly own your career and be a part of a growing organization with a big, bold future. What Will You Do?Advise fast growing companies and well-known enterprises (both publicly traded and privately held) on a wide variety of projects including: IPO preparation, transaction support, carve-outs and/or spin-offs, audit readiness, and new accounting pronouncements.Engage with clients and colleagues on technical accounting and control-related issues to provide research guidance and give recommendations for potential solutions.Create and deliver presentations on technical concepts, project work plans, delivery approach, milestones, and results to client stakeholders.Educate internal and external audiences on Accounting & Transaction Services best practices.Identify, design and implement creative business solutions to continually improve the firm's methodology and approach.Establish credibility as a trusted advisor.Actively participate in career development activities and technical training of staff.What Do You Need to Succeed?Minimum QualificationsBachelor's degree in Accounting.2+ years of professional services experience (public accounting or advisory firm) and/or financial reporting experience with a Fortune 500 organization.Strong knowledge of SEC reporting and U.S. GAAP.Demonstrated knowledge of accounting/audit practices, procedures and reporting standards.Willingness to travel up to 50% or more.Preferred QualificationsMasters in Accounting, MBA, CPA, CIA.Knowledge of Tier 1 accounting packages (i.e. Oracle, SAP, PeopleSoft).Proven ability to lead, motivate and build teams that deliver services and solutions that surpass client expectations.Previous experience leading and executing complex projects in challenging environments.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise Ability to work on site in Santa Fe, NM 5 days a week3-5+ years of experience with Medicaid10+ years experience as business analyst for data warehouse OR business intelligence projects.Experience with large scale system development.Demonstrated ability to understand industry issues and problems, relate them to clients' needs, and propose appropriate solutionsExcellent organization skills, ability to take initiative and work independently or as a member of a small team.Excellent interpersonal skills and relationship building, ability to collaborate and build consensusDesire to continue learning more about healthcare and the technologies supporting healthcare dataStrong presenter, comfortable presenting in front of customers, conveying status, answering Q&ADemonstrated ability to convey complex ideas in an easily understood manner to guide audience through written or verbal communications Preferred Tech and Prof Experience PREFERRED Skills and Experience:Previous experience as a business analyst working with software developersKnowledgeable in technology, specifically data warehousingCompetent in at least one BI technology (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, Tableau)Competent in at least one analytics technology (e.g. SAS, R, SPSS)Competent in at least on geospatial technology (e.g. mapinfo, ESRI)Understanding of both technical and business process MITA requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Name: Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAt Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers financial needs and help them succeed financially. Were looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where youll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.  Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you. Wholesale Banking provides financial solutions to businesses across the United States and globally. Our nine major business lines include Business Banking, Middle Market Banking, Government and Institutional Banking, Corporate Banking, Commercial Real Estate, Financial Institutions Group, Wells Fargo Commercial Capital, Wells Fargo Securities, and the Investment Portfolio. We also have groups in credit risk, group risk, finance, marketing, human relations, and the Wholesale Chief Operating Office that support our businesses.  Team members support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following, and adhering to and if applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business units risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements. Eastdil Secured LLCOverview Eastdil Secured is the foremost provider of financial advisory services to real estate owners. We combine superior capital markets expertise with a deep understanding of real estate fundamentals to execute a wide range of transactions for our clients ultimately producing superior results. By maintaining an effective platform that combines conventional real estate advisory and brokerage with the corporate finance and capital markets expertise of an investment bank, Eastdil Secured creates value for clients through unparalleled advisory services, individually-tailored structures, and marketing/placement programs that set the industry standard. Through the ability to navigate the challenges presented in any economic environment, Eastdil Secured maximizes opportunities with customer-crafted, revolutionary strategies that produce the most optimal and efficient transactions possible.  Our team is dedicated to the sale, financing and recapitalization of all major real estate product types including office, retail, and hospitality, industrial and multifamily properties throughout North America. Widely recognized for our capital markets and real estate expertise, our team is also known for their distinguishing access and credibility, incomparable experience, outstanding client service, and proven track record. Training Analysts start with an in-house training program in Santa Monica before beginning work with the Equity Sales group. The training focuses on financial accounting, cash flow analysis, credit analysis, financial modeling and valuation. Analysts will also receive on-the-job coaching, mentoring and feedback throughout their tenure. Opportunities Opportunities exist in New York, Boston, Santa Monica, Washington DC, Atlanta, Dallas, San Francisco and Chicago based on business need. The analyst program is an initial two-year commitment with an opportunity to stay longer at the firms discretion. ResponsibilitiesWorking closely with senior team members on presentations and financial analysis;Assisting team in underwriting for asset sales and debt placement across all property types;Performing comprehensive and in-depth company, real estate, and market analysis;Due diligence collection and review;Creating pitches, proposals, and marketing materials;Participating in client interactions to gain exposure to key executives and senior bankersRequired Qualifications1+ year of experience real estate experience, financial services experience, or a combination of bothOther Desired QualificationsA current student pursuing a bachelors degree with academic distinction and coursework in economics, financial accounting, corporate finance and/or real estate with anticipated graduation in May 2019.Professional experience through internships, part-time or full-time work and/or extra-curricular activities.Candidates must be able to work in the United States on a permanent basis.Candidates must demonstrate a combination of academic aptitude, quantitative skills, personal motivation, and distinguished written and oral communication skills. It is strongly preferred that your background includes:Dedication to building a career in the financial services industry with a focus on real estate finance;Willingness to work long hours in a demanding, highly focused, collaborative, and team environment;Energetic self-starter who is flexible, organized, conscientious, proactive, and detail-oriented;An individual who demonstrates a sense of personal accountability and urgency for achieving results.DisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.  Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.  Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Company DescriptionCapTech is a national IT management consulting firm that bridges the gap between business and technology. We partner with some of the world's most successful companies to design, develop, and manage technical and digital solutions that delight customers, drive insights, and meet strategic objectives.  At CapTech, youll experience a flat organizational structure based upon a culture of mutual respect. Here, your career path isnt set in stone, and you have unlimited potential for growth and the resources to help you achieve your career goals. If you are creative, technically insightful, drivenand have a passion for the work that we do, then you might be a future CapTecher.  For over five years, we have been in the Top 10 of Consulting Magazines Best Firms to Work For, including #2 for IT Firms and #5 for Work/Life Balance. We are also recognized by Vault.coms Top 50 Consulting Firms and have been on the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing companies for over 10 years.Job DescriptionBusiness Analysts (BA) at CapTech work side-by-side with key business and technical stakeholders to elicit solution requirements, drive the solution design, and ensure the finished product meets the needs of the business. Our BAs work on a variety of projects from mobile and content management systems, to large integration efforts spanning multiple lines of business. CapTech BAs are called upon to provide leadership through experience and help shape the strategy of our clients.  Specific responsibilities for the Business Analyst position include: Quickly become familiar with client business challenges and technologies in order to act as a SME and trusted advisor to client stakeholders.Act as key player in a team environment through all phases of the system delivery lifecycle.Provide connection between technical and business views to ensure that high quality and impactful solutions are delivered for our clients.Perform gap analysis to identify capability gaps within the organization, and propose and evaluate alternative solutions that will fulfill the business needs.Work with client stakeholders to understand high level business needs and elicit detailed requirements using various methods. QualificationsSpecific qualifications for the Business Analyst position include: Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, MIS or equivalent combination of education and experience.Demonstrated progression and growth as a Business Systems Analyst through past career experiences with a minimum of 3 years of experience on IT-related projects.Familiarity with multi-system integration and common issues that can arise when integrating enterprise technologies.Excellent written and verbal communication skills leveraged to interface with senior business leadership and technical resources.Ability to write and perform basic SQL queries preferred.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite as well as change control and defect tracking software.Prior consulting experience preferred. Additional InformationWe offer challenging and impactful jobs with professional career paths. All CapTechers can keep their hands on technology no matter what position they hold. Our employees find their work exciting and rewarding in a culture filled with opportunities to have fun along the way.  At CapTech we offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits package including, but not limited to: Competitive salary with performance based bonus opportunitiesSingle and Family Health Insurance plans, including Dental coverageShort-Term and Long-Term disabilityMatching 401(k)Competitive Paid Time OffTraining and Certification opportunities eligible for expense reimbursementTeam building and social activitiesMentor program to help you develop your careerAt this time, CapTech cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship. Candidates must be eligible to work in the U.S. for any employer directly (we are not open to contract or corp to corp agreements).  CapTech is an equal opportunity employer.  CapTech is a Drug-Free work place.  Candidates must have the ability to work at CapTechs client locations.  All positions include the possibility of travel.  CapTech has not contracted/does not contract with any outside vendors in its recruitment process. If you are interested in this position, please apply to CapTech directly.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Incentive Technology Group (ITG) is a rapidly growing, entrepreneurial, technology company, seeking a motivated  Business Analyst to support upcoming needs in Arlington, VA.  The Agile Business Analyst serves as a translator between technical teams and the client’s business community to collect, clarify, analyze and translate business requirements into documentation and conceptual design from which applications and solutions are developed. This position is within the context of an Agile team employing Scrum development framework. The Business Analyst defines detailed stories and epics, with applicable acceptance criteria in collaboration with product owners and ITG’s technology team, and facilitates meetings with client and internal technical and operational teams.  This position will be working directly with stakeholders, serve in both Business Analyst and Project Manager roles and must be able to communicate effectively via phone and web conferencing as many of stakeholders work remote.  In addition to supporting all phases of the project, this position will also be responsible for authoring content and peer reviewing a wide array of documents, including functional, technical, training as well as marketing, and proposals. Minimum Job Requirements:Bachelors Degree2+ years experience as a business analyst in a fast-paced application development environment1-3 years recent experience working in an agile development environment as a business analyst (i.e., scrum, kanban, etc.)An understanding of the full software development lifecycle (SDLC) including recent successful and demonstrated experience with agile methodologies (Scrum) is expectedExperience facilitating requirements gathering, Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions, capturing client requirements and feedbackRequired Skills:Excellent oral and written communication skillsSolid understanding of various software development cycles (e.g., agile, waterfall,etc.); knowledge of requirements management, configuration management methodologies, along with corresponding support tools, i.e., JIRA, etc.Conceptual understanding of Object Oriented enterprise software system development processes, methodologies, as well as major technologies (such as Java and .Net) and approaches (such as modularity and SOA)Skilled at analyzing existing system documentation to summarize existing system functionality as it relates to the project at handGood understanding of basic system technologies as they relate to the project deliverablesAbility to maintain project plans, resourcing schedules and forecasted activitiesExperience with business process mapping and the use of project management softwareAbility to provide technical assistance and troubleshooting by effectively responding to inquiriesExperience thriving in ambiguous software development environmentsAbility to work well under constantly changing deadlines and prioritiesMust be U.S. Citizen eligible for Secret Clearance

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionBrillient Corporation is seeking candidates to join its Team supporting a federal contract. This position requires U.S. Citizenship or a Green Card holder and the ability to obtain and maintain a Government public trust level security clearance. The candidate must have lived in the United States for at least three out of the past five years prior to your application date. You will also meet the residency qualifications if you lived abroad while on government or military duty or if you were a dependent of a federal employee of military member.  The Brillient employee will work on-site at the government client, Office of Security and Emergency Management (OSEM), Office of Security Operations (OSO). The Business Analyst position requires duties to include a variety of tasks as listed below. Responsibilities (including but not limited to):Provide consulting services to OSEM/OSO to assist in establishing, documenting, maintaining, and maturing Security Programs that comply with Federal, departmental, and agency guidance, regulations, and policies.Serve as a highly proficient technical expert in conducting studies, analyses, and research and evaluating organizational programmatic and administrative processes.Identify and implement organizational strategies to foster program improvement and sustainment.Design and conduct studies, analyses, and research related to organizational programs and operations.Utilize and apply Business Process Improvement methodologies and techniques to OSEM/OSO programs and processes.Identify and recommend industry best practices for organizational diagnosis and business process improvements.Draft, coordinate, maintain and document versions of core business processes and related changes.Develop comprehensive reports, modeling and diagrams of OSEM/OSO business processes to include mapping current and future state end to end processes.Prepare reports, presentations, recommendations and implementation plans related to improving business processes and programs operations.Communicate business strategies and steps with team and management throughout the business evaluation process.EDUCATION REQUIREMENT: Bachelors degree EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENT: This position requires a minimum of five years specialized experience in operations or management; or, clearly demonstrated to the selecting official, through prior job performance or education, an ability to perform the duties of this position. DESIRED EXPERIENCE:Six SigmaBusiness Process Re-engineeringChange ManagementReasonable Accommodation Requests: If you are an applicant with a disability that requires a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the abilityor unable to usethe online application system and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact 703-994-4232 and press #1 for Human Resources.  In order to address your request the following information is needed: NameThe best method for contacting you backThe position titleRequisition/Job Number Upon receipt of this information we will respond to you promptly to obtain more information about your request. Information related to existing profiles or applications will not be provided via this phone number.  EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled Company Overview: Established in 2003, Brillient Corporation (Brillient) is an Information Management, Intelligent Solutions and Business Process Management firm that specializes in providing mission-critical, consulting and technical services, and program/project staffing. Over 70% of Brillients business today is focused on financial services support to federal agencies. We base our fundamental service philosophy on understanding what matters to our clients, how it contributes to their mission success, and how we can deliver the maximum Return on Investment (ROI). On-time delivery, cost/schedule compliance, flexibility and responsiveness, quality of workmanship and client satisfaction are our imperatives - not goals.  Headquartered in Reston, VA, Brillient has over 400 employees deployed at client sites in eight (9) states across all four (4) Continental United States (CONUS) time zones (Virginia mid-Atlantic area, Missouri, California, Maryland, Texas, Pennsylvania, Alabama, Arkansas, and Washington, DC). Our capabilities include Financial and Administrative Support, Program/Project and Performance Management, Big Data Management (e.g., business intelligence and analytical support), Business Process Reengineering (BPR), Cloud Computing, Mobile Apps, Web and Applications Development, and Mission Support Services.  We have partnered with more than 16 Federal agencies over the past decade. Our clients list includes DHS (Transportation Security Administration (TSA), U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) and United States Coast Guard (USCG)), SBA, Department of the Treasury (TREAS), Department of Justice (DOJ), Department of Interior (DOI), Department of Commerce (DOC), Department of Education (DoED), and Department of Energy (DOE). Teaming with Brillient means having a partner with an outstanding track record of quality deliverables, motivated high caliber personnel, and responsive customer service.  #cj

Name: Strategic Materials Program Business Analyst
Description: Job Description: Leidos is looking for people experienced in providing engineering program analysis. This position supports Leidos' role within the nation's nuclear deterrence mission as support contractor to the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) Office of Defense Programs.  This is a full-time contractor-support position located on-site at the NNSA offices in Washington, D.C. Description: The Principal Program Business Analyst will provide analysis and planning within the DOE PPBE system including cost engineering alternatives analysis. This person will provide situational analysis to the Tritium and Materials Management Federal Program Manager, located in the NNSA Albuquerque offices. This person will advise the Federal program manager on matters pertaining to planning, budget, cost, and program integration and assist in advocating and representing the program's interests at NNSA headquarters. Specific duties include:Identifying, assessing, and analyzing program impacts from a cost and budget perspective to inform the PPBE planning process on a 10-year horizon.Communicating complex program and budget planning issues to the Federal program manager, senior leadership, external stakeholders and others with diverse technical understanding.Evaluating program variables and providing assessments to the Federal program manager regarding how well technical plans and solutions are proceeding on schedule and whether deliverables conform to customer requirements, quality control standards, and negotiated metrics.Performing cost engineering projections for proposed alternative program approaches.Facilitating program meetings and discussions. LeadGen  LeadGenNNSA Required Clearance:Active DOE Q and/or DOD TS clearanceRequired Education, Experience, and Skills:Master's degree.13 or more years of program and business management experience in related endeavors.Familiarity with using project management tools and techniques, e.g., EVM.Experience managing interdisciplinary technical and business teams.Experience with cost estimating, cost/benefit analysis, and the DOE PPBE process.Proficiency in budget and cost analysis tools, e.g., Excel.Excellent written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated experience in developing and delivering briefings for senior and executive managers and facilitating high level technical discussions.Desired Education, Experience, and Skills:Program Management Institute certification as a program management professional (PMP)Prior staff experience with NNSA.Nuclear power production or nuclear weapon experience.

Description: JOB TITLE: Program Management, Mid/Program Analyst (Mid) F35 JPO PROJECT OVERVIEW: Project provides support to the F-35 Lightning II Joint Strike Fighter Joint Program Office (JPO) located in Crystal City (Arlington), VA. ALLOWABLE SUBSTITUTION: An AS or AA degree and an additional four (4) years of experience; or an additional eight (8) years of experience may be substituted for a BS or BA degree.At least eight (8) years of experience in program management, technical or business analysis discipline in weapon systems acquisition and life cycle management; and a minimum of four (4) years out of eight (8) of recent work experience related to analysis and planning.At least two (2) years in support of a Major Defense Acquisition Program (MDAP).Familiarity with Service and OSD forms related to PPBS, MilitaryInterdepartmental Procurement Requests, Work Requests, Requisitions, Contract Data Requirements List, and DD254 is required.Demonstrated experience in the program/project status, earned value management and schedules.Demonstrated knowledge of and experience dealing with DoD reporting tools and major reports.WORK LOCATION: Crystal City, VA TRAVEL: None KEY WORDS: DoD, Weapon System and components development, Microsoft Office, Major Defense Acquisition Program (MDAP), program/project status and schedule, Service, OSD, policy, PPBS, life-cycle, DoD 5000, military aircraft programs, international WBB is a technical and management consulting company that provides innovative products and services that solve government and commercial customers toughest problems.
