Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business AnalystInsight Systems Corporation is seeking a Business Analyst for the Feed the Future Knowledge-Driven Agricultural Development (KDAD) Project. This is a Full-time assignment, based in our Washington, DC office.  The Business Analyst (BA) works closely with the client, project management, and technical teams and is responsible for capturing and writing the business and functional requirements. The BA works with the IT Project Manager to outline and quantify deliverables. The BA is the primary liaison with the client and is tasked with understanding their needs and translating those needs into web based content management solutions. The BA has an in-depth understanding of web based systems and Content Management Systems and ensures that there is integration between business requirements and technology. Knowledge of the Drupal CMS preferred.  The Business Analyst also performs workflow analysis and coordinates with the project management team to prioritize deliverables and negotiate on product functionalities. The BA needs a thorough understanding of software development processes – SDLC – along with proven analytical, problem-solving, and conflict resolution skills to help identify, communicate, and resolve issues.ResponsibilitiesThe duties for this position may include, but are not limited to: Working with clients to gather business requirements for building and maintaining Drupal-based CMS solutions.Analyzing, translating, and documenting business and technical requirements.Serving as the liaison between customers and the systems development team.Analyzing information for quality, completeness, and reporting purposes.Developing standard operating procedures (SOPs) and related materials such as FAQs and help materials for Web-based systems.Helping with CMS operations, including QA of posted content, bug tracking, and facilitating communication between the client and the developer/technical support staff.Supporting the Web Portfolio Manager.Tackling other ad hoc tasks as required to operate a community-driven website. Required EducationThe candidate for this position should hold a minimum of a BA or BS.Required ExperienceIn addition to the above educational requirements, the candidate for this position must also have: Experience working with Web CMS technology, particularly DrupalSolid experience writing business and technical requirementsAn ownership mentality over the BA’s areas of responsibilityAn ability to prioritize and track changes in requirements in the context of a large and complex projectAn ability to resolve ambiguity and steer the client toward well-defined requirementsAn ability to track decisions and make sure they are reflected in the requirementsArticulate oral and written communication skillsStrong, client-facing interpersonal skillsStrong time management and organizational skillsStrong analytical and reasoning abilities About Insight Systems CorporationInsight Systems Corporation is a small, woman owned Washington DC-based solutions company that seeks strategic results for the business and information technology missions of its partners: information-intensive enterprises, government agencies and commercial organizations. The Insight team is expert in the "nuts and bolts" of technology, with a focus on using technology as a business tool. Our staff solve real business problems related to knowledge management and technical consulting, and provide a range of services including informational analysis, program management, and information infrastructure services.

Independently analyzes large amounts of data, provide logical options, create and delivery correct documentation, sound work products and deliverable to achieve customer satisfaction. Model highest standards of customer service in all interactions.Manage complex calendars and arrange meetings and appointments Prepare executive level travel arrangements to include mode, lodging, and transportation and prepare travel vouchers upon returnReceive, screen, and accept appointments on behalf of executives using independent judgement of the importance of the meeting and availability of all required. Compile daily briefing books, to include proofreading, printing, and modifying individual documents as needed and directedApply experience and knowledge of office automation and software programs to prepare, track, and route correspondence and reportsPerform functions associated with time and attendanceSetup and maintain audio/visual equipment for telecoms and VTC meetingsCoordinate technology and equipment needs for the customer.Ensure office equipment and other automation requirements are in working orderPerform routine office duties to include maintaining supplies, managing a records database, and filing system  Typical education and experience:Typically requires a high school diploma and five or more years of experience providing executive level assistance to senior level management.QualificationsAbility to prioritize and accomplish multiple and varying assigned administrative tasks under established timeframes, with limited directionSkilled in analyzing administrative functions and work processes to make or develop new, or revise current administrative processes Ability to effectively work across teams to achieve projects completion within timelinesAdvanced Microsoft Office skills and the ability to become familiar with firm-specific programs and softwareStrong written and oral communication skillsExceptional interpersonal skills with experience providing complex administrative support in a high-profile environment with tact and diplomacyExperience effectively managing various projects with multiple deadlinesStrong organizational, project management and problem-solving skills with impeccable multi-tasking abilities

Name: Incident Response Analyst
Description: What you’ll be doing... The Incident Response Analyst provides oversight of incident data flow and response, content, and remediation, and partners with other incident response centers in maintaining an understanding of threates, vulnerabilities, and exploits that could impact networks and assets. Performs real-time proactive security monitoring and reporting on various security enforcement systems, such as SIEM, Anti-virus, Internet contect filtering/reporting, malcode prevention, Firewalls, IDS & IPS, Web security, Anti-spam, etc. Performs the role of primary incident Coordinator for all IT Security events requiring focused response, containment, investigation, and remediation.  · Perform analysis on hosts running on a variety of platforms and operating systems, to include, but not limited to, Microsoft Windows, Mac Operating System (OS), UNIX, Linux, as well as embedded systems and mainframes.  · Monitor open source channels (e.g. vendor sites, Computer Emergency Response Teams, SysAdmin, Audit, Network, Security (SANS) Institute, Security Focus) to maintain a current understanding of Computer Network Defense (CND) threat condition and determine which security issues may have an impact on the enterprise.  · Perform analysis of log files from a variety of sources (e.g., individual host logs, network traffic logs, firewall logs, and intrusion detection system logs) to identify possible threats to network security.  · Leverages tools including Tanium, FireEye suite, GRR, Volatility, SIFT Workstation, MISP, and/or Bro as part of duties performing cyber incident response analysis.  · Track and document CND hunts and incidents from initial detection through final resolution.  · Collect intrusion artifacts (e.g., source code, malware, and Trojans) and use discovered data to enable mitigation of potential CND hunts and incidents within the enterprise.  · Perform forensically sound collection of images and inspect to discern possible mitigation/remediation on enterprise systems.  · Perform real-time CND hunt and incident handling (e.g. forensic collections, intrusion correlation/tracking, threat analysis, and direct system remediation) tasks to support deployable Hunt and Incident Response Teams (IRTs).  · Write and publish CND guidance and reports (e.g. engagement reports) on incident findings to appropriate constituencies.  · Receive and analyze network alerts from various sources within the enterprise and determine possible causes of such alerts.  · Utilizes data analytics tools including Splunk to make sense of machine data in performing responsibilities.  · Correlate incident data to identify specific vulnerabilities and make recommendations that enable expeditious remediation.  · May be required to travel up to 25% of time. What we’re looking for... ·Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline or a minimum of4 years related technical experience.  Must have hands on experience anda professional certification such as GCFA, GNFA, GREM, or GCIH  · Active Top Secret Security Clearance with the ability to obtain a TS/SCI is required. In addition, selected candidate must be able to obtain and maintain a favorably adjudicated DHS background investigation (EOD) for continued employment.  · Familiar with network analytics including Netflow/PCAP analysis.  · Understanding of cyber forensics concepts including malware, hunt, etc.  · Understanding of how both Windows and Linux systems are compromised. Even Better If You Also Have: · DHS Suitability at the SCI level  · Experience using Splunk for system data analytics and monitoring  · Experience performing cyber forensics, malware analysis, cyber hunt, etc.  · When you join Verizon... You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon. Equal Employment Opportunity We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or Veteran status. Different makes us better.

Name: Productivity Analyst
Description: Productivity AnalystRequisition ID: 214770 Project Overview:  Pennsylvania Chemicals is a world-scale facility that will use ethane to produce 1.6 million tonnes of polyethylene per year. The project will involve up to 6,000 workers during its construction and is expected to employ 600 permanent employees when completed. The ethylene / polyethylene complex will be located in the Ohio River Valley north of Pittsburgh. It comprises an ethane cracker and three polyethylene units, plus OSBL including a gas-fired combined cycle cogeneration unit and a large storage-in-transit rail yard.  Key responsibilities will include: Manage project productivity program across all project locations, including performing productivity sampling of the various units on Pennsylvania Chemicals on a routine basis Develop an integrated Six Sigma and Lean Construction program to increase craft productivity and time on toolsReport progress (metrics & dashboards) to Site Management, Contractor management and local building trades representativesIdentify focus areas (work processes or site conditions) for improvementSolicit management and craft input to identify and frame key opportunitiesFacilitate / drive productivity improvement meetings and progressChampion project wide engagement (communications, milestones, recognition, etc.)Coordinate contractor management engagement and participationInterface with Safety, Quality, Performance (KPIs, PMPs) and Cost challenge programsCoordinate lessons learned and best practice programs to assure implementation across the various units within Pennsylvania Chemicals Basic Qualifications Practical work experience in a construction role as a superintendent or field engineerSIX SIGMA Black Belt certification and experience is preferredRecognized degree in an engineering, construction or scientific disciplinesAbility to work under pressure to meet multiple deadlines simultaneouslyAbility to communicate effectively across all levels of the organizationAdvanced skills with Microsoft Suite Applications - Excel, WordShaping tomorrow togetherBechtelis among the most respected engineering, project management, and construction companies in the world. We stand apart for our ability to get the job done right—no matter how big, how complex, or how remote. Bechtel operates through four global business units that specialize in infrastructure; mining and metals; nuclear, security and environmental; and oil, gas, and chemicals. Since its founding in 1898, Bechtel has worked on more than 25,000 projects in 160 countries on all seven continents. Today, our 53,000 colleagues team with customers, partners, and suppliers on diverse projects in nearly 40 countries.An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without  regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected  veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Name: Digital Network Intelligence Analyst
Description: Company Description ThreatConnect® arms organizations with a powerful defense against cyber threats and the confidence to make strategic business decisions. Founded in 2011, ThreatConnect (then called CyberSquared) started servicing government agencies on specialized cybersecurity contracts while building its platform. Officially launched in 2013, the ThreatConnect Platform has grown to more than 20,000 users worldwide. Today, ThreatConnect provides a suite of products designed to meet the threat intelligence aggregation, analysis and automation needs of security teams at any maturity level - built on the industry's only intelligence-driven, extensible security platform. Whether you want to work on building a world-class security platform or as a member of the services team, you will enjoy a career that truly makes an impact. For more information on the benefits of working at ThreatConnect, visit www.threatconnect.com/careers Job Description ThreatConnect is looking for highly motivated and experienced analysts with currently active U.S. Government Top Secret security clearances to fill positions on government contracts within the DC/NoVA/MD region. If you are sought after as an expert in your field and looking for a company that will both value and reward your expertise, take a look at what ThreatConnect has to offer. Requirements This position requires the ability to conduct network analysis and target development which is accomplished with a solid understanding of DNI and DNR analytic techniques. Analysts must be able to perform technical metadata and content analysis of threat adversary automated information systems and format the information for dissemination.  The candidate should have a solid background in several of the following: Network applicationsStrong writing and verbal skillsNetworking protocolsWorking knowledge of TCP/IP networksLog and packet-level tool experienceNetwork attack techniquesOperating system platforms (e.g. UNIX, Linux, Microsoft Windows)Network intrusion analysis and incident responseC/C++/Python Programming  Preferred tools/certs: Wireshark, Nessus, Snort, tcpdump, tcp wrapper, IDS (various), ISS scanner, eEye digital vulnerability scanner, Network +, NSA IAM, One or more of the following certifications: CCISP - Certified Critical Infrastructure Security Professional, CISM - Certified Information Security Manager, CISSP - Certified Information Systems Security Professional, SSCP - Systems Security Certified Practitioner, GIAC - Global Information Assurance Certification, CSP - RSA Certified Security Professional, CPP - Certified Protection ProfessionalClearance required: TS/SCI with favorable polygraphBenefits We work hard to reward our employees for their hard work. We offer a competitive benefits package with comprehensive insurance coverage, paid time off, and unique perks designed to help you meet your financial and personal goals.  We are committed to offering an employment experience and benefits package that enables you and your family to grow with us and to share in our success. We love to recognize our employees who have gone above and beyond, and offer incentives like quarterly awards, an employee bonus and referral program, and team-building outings. MEDICAL Full-time employees are eligible for health coverage effective from the first of the next month hired. The premiums are at no cost to the employee. We pay your premiums for individuals and families!  - Medical coverage  - Prescription drug coverage  - Dental coverage  - Vision coverage  - Company-paid short-term and long-term disability  - Company-paid life insurance and AD&D coverage FINANCIAL 401K retirement savings plan with company matching program of up to 6%.  Cell phone reimbursement WORK-LIFE BALANCE - 10 Paid Federal Holidays  - Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO) for vacation/sick time and holidays. 15 days (3 weeks) for new employees with the ability to accrue up to 25 days (5 weeks)  - Birthday day off  - Employee recognition program with quarterly awards  - Employee referral program of up to $5,000 per full-time hired referral  - Education Reimbursement program up to $5,250 for job-related college courses and professional training  - Company-provided refreshments at our Headquarters  - Quarterly events with your geographic team  - Annual company party

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Number 18008013  Company Nestle USA  Location Arlington, Virginia Working at Nestle: At Nestlé, we pride ourselves in providing training programs that prepare employees for the competitive and ever-changing business world. As the largest Nutrition, Health and Wellness Company in the world, we offer an environment that is diverse, challenging and supportive, including hands-on experience and real-world responsibilities that would serve as the springboard for a successful career. It's because of our collaborative and open business environment that we have been ranked as the number one consumer food products company, in Fortune magazine's annual survey of the World's Most Admired companies, for eight consecutive years. Come join our talented world class team and thrive in a dynamic and supportive culture. Main Purpose of Job: SUPPORTS AND ENABLES NESTLE SALES ORGANIZATION (NSO) ANALYTICS, working with the Create/Sell/Execute teams in identifying business requirements for fact-based decisions. Utilize sophisticated analytic data models to compile analysis and provide recommendations that drives positive ROI for the Nestlé Sales Organization. Assist in translating the business needs into reports/analytics functional requirements. Ensure the outputs are well understood and meet the business needs to deliver results. Identify and communicate business trends, update scorecards and produce ad-hoc reports to enable informed decisions related to improving performance. Responsible for implementing One Source of the Truth, One View of the Truth mindset. Partner with Create/Sell/Execute to assist in the creation of course-correcting actionable plans.  Category Strategy: Product / brand category objectives Provide category or retail actionable insights into the Commercial Planning ProcessSeek root-cause and implications to retail or category Name: Business Analyst

Name: Sr Business Analyst

As a CGI Federal Member, you have the opportunity to be a shareholder at CGI and join a family of 75,000 members strong.  The ideal candidate for this position is a problem solver. As a Business Analyst, you will use your knowledge, skills, and abilities to solve organizational information challenges and will use your critical thinking skills to identify client requirements and translate those into detailed instructions for your development team to execute. The ideal Business Analyst also has strong writing and communication skills, and is able to build relationships with both their team members and client stakeholders. ability to see the big picture and envision possible solutionsAbility to work on multiple projects simultaneouslyAbility to ask strong questions to help the team in better understanding the requirements that may lead to problemsExcellent working knowledge of Agile Application Lifecycle Management tools like JIRA, Rally etc.Strong understanding of various Agile development methodologiesCertified Scrum Master (CSM) or SAFe Agilist (SA) certification Due to the nature of the government contract , US Citizenship is required DESIRED QUALIFICATIONSPMI-ACP® CertificationExperience with Scaled Agile (preferably SAFe) implementationsSAFe Certified Product Owner Skills:Business Analysis What you can expect from us:Build your career with us.It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics. CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Name: Budget Analyst
Description: Req ID 102101BR Business Title Budget Analyst Group MCIS Location USA VIRGINIA Fairfax Clearance Level Needed TS/SCI Category Programs & Operations Job Duties and Responsibilities Become an integral part of a diverse team that leads the world in the Mission, Cyber, and Intelligence Solutions group. At ManTech International Corporation, you will help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement. Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, career and customer oriented Budget Analyst to join our team in Fairfax, VA to provide unparalleled support to our customer and to begin an exciting and rewarding career within ManTech. A qualified candidate will provide senior level on-site project management/lead for a team of budget analysts and contract specialist in support of financial operations. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:•Responsible for the employment, training, motivation and discipline of assigned employees. •Perform as the program budget analyst and administrator for a complex customer services billing system (Remedy).•Review contract documents for information or changes related to invoicing and assigning all cost information in the database of record. •Generate predictable, realistic and auditable monthly billing statements in a timely manner to enable sufficient cash flow in accordance with customer requirements and the contract terms while ensuring compliance with all policies, procedures, laws, regulations and agency guidelines. •Conduct and review circuit billing analysis for accuracy and completeness of the clients billing system. •Identification of discrepancies and/or inconsistencies. •Review, evaluate, and understand variances in order to improve the quality, resolve customer billing issues prior to release and to ensure data integrity and equitable invoicing. •Independently perform complex analysis decomposing highly detailed information from multiple sets of circuit data sources, or when sources are lacking in support of cost and contractual data. •Use multiple analytical reports, techniques and interaction w/various team and staff levels.•Prepare and review Customer account reconciliations to include month end,mid-year reviews and year-end closings. •Draft and coordinate Standard Operating Procures (SOP); which incorporates all contractual agreements, management decisions and client regulations and policies. •Assist in the pricing methodologies for use in the system of charges. •Participate in discussions regarding circuits, customer, process, procedures, policies, regulations and billing related decisions and direction at the executive level to provide billing support and analysis to ensure billing database is operating within agreed and required upon parameters.Security Clearance Requirement:Active/current TS/SCI with Polygraph clearance is required.  Qualifications Position Requirements:Bachelor’s degree (in Business Administration) or equivalent, and ten to twelve years of related (project support and supervisory/management) experience. Degrees Equivalent Experience/Education  Bachelor's Degree Years of Experience 08-10 years w/Bachelors Degree  05-07 years w/Masters Degree Position Type Full-Time Shift Day Overview For more than 40 years, ManTech employees have been solving complex problems for the national security community. We are comprised of approximately 10,000 talented employees around the world. We adhere to the simple, no-nonsense values on which ManTech was founded more than four decades ago, aligning squarely with the mission objectives of our customers. As our customer base continues to expand and diversify, we continue to diversify our workforce and solutions. Half our employees have a military background, and more than 70 percent hold a government security clearance. As a leading provider of innovative technology services and solutions for the nation's defense, security, space, and intelligence communities; we hold nearly 1,000 active contracts with more than 40 different government agencies.

Name: Analyst/Associate - Financial Economics
Description: About Charles River Associates For over 50 years, Charles River Associates has been a premier consulting firm that offers employees a place to learn from a diverse group of consultants, industry experts, and academics. At CRA you will be exposed to leading minds who use economic, financial, and business analysis to solve complex real world problems for an impressive roster of clients, including major law firms, Fortune 100 companies, and government agencies. Through a collegial environment, formal and informal training opportunities, and a broad array of professional development resources, your experience at CRA will open doors for you as you launch your career.  CRA's Financial Economics practice provides financial institutions, legal teams, and regulators with the experience and quantitative analysis capabilities they need to achieve their objectives in regulatory and litigation matters related to consumer finance and risk management. The practice applies rigorous statistical modeling techniques to matters involving a full spectrum of financial issues, including, among others, credit risk, credit scoring, lending discrimination, loan servicing, mortgage securitization, indirect auto lending, credit cards, and student lending. In addition, the Financial Economics practice provides assistance in model validation and model development for matters relating to market risk, model risk, and operation risk. The litigation matters involve many of the same underlying issues, and often include analyses of damages. The Financial Economics practice provides regulatory reviews involving federal financial regulatory agencies, including the CFPB, FRB, OCC, FDIC and HUD. Your Responsibilities All of our practice areas share common themes: conducting sophisticated economic, financial, and strategic analysis in a project based environment; assembling compelling evidence from data and research that support our expert opinions and business recommendations; and working collaboratively with senior-led teams and clients.  The opportunities to contribute to the team in this role may include (but are not limited to): Developing financial and economic analyses or valuation models to support case theoriesDeveloping familiarity with data that serves as input to this analysis, including company financial reporting, regulatory reporting data, and social and economic survey data as well as non-financial measures of organizational performanceInteracting with clients, typically by participating in telephone calls and Webex sessionsProgramming, model building, and regression analysis using statistical analysis programs such as Stata, SAS, R, and/or Python. Other programming skills used include SQL, Access, and ArcGIS.Ensuring reliability of analysis through quality control reviewCheck out our Analyst's blogs about a typical day at CRA and how you can make animpact!Your Opportunities Analysts have the unique opportunity to learn from, and work alongside, some of the most respected scholars, specialists, and industry experts in the world. You will have access to: Internal training programs, includingA weeklong orientation focused on technical skills along with consulting skills and networking (RAC I)A second year multi-day session, focused on creative problem solving and communication (RAC II)Quarterly Tech Labs taught by in-house experts and affiliated professorsGraduate School Workshops, featuring small group Q&A with top admissions officers, to learn about graduate school opportunitiesExtracurricular activities where you can take on a leadership role in recruiting, training, and volunteer activities in the local communityYour Qualifications We are looking for curious, analytical, highly-motivated undergraduates who have majored in economics, finance, data science, mathematics, statistics, or another quantitative discipline. We value knowledge of economic and financial concepts, research experience, quantitative ability, exceptional written and oral communication skills, and a high level of initiative. We expect Analysts to use data to solve client problems, work collaboratively with a team, effectively manage their time and prioritize tasks, and take pride and ownership in their work.  To be considered for this position, we require the following: A cover letter please describe your interest in CRA and how the role matches your goals.Resume - please include current address, email, and phone numberTranscript may be unofficialLetters of referenceCharles River Associates is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer (EEO/AAE): Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled.

Name: Senior Strategic Planner/Business Analyst
Description: The Sr. Strategic Planner/Business Analyst reports to the Director of Strategy & Operations, Raytheon International Inc. (RII), assisting the director in managing the Raytheon International day-to-day operations; the individual shall conduct business data gathering and analysis, and contribute to the development of presentations, whitepapers, speeches, and memorandums in support of senior management decision makers. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business AnalystInsight Systems Corporation is seeking a Business Analyst for the Feed the Future Knowledge-Driven Agricultural Development (KDAD) Project. This is a Full-time assignment, based in our Washington, DC office.  The Business Analyst (BA) works closely with the client, project management, and technical teams and is responsible for capturing and writing the business and functional requirements. The BA works with the IT Project Manager to outline and quantify deliverables. The BA is the primary liaison with the client and is tasked with understanding their needs and translating those needs into web based content management solutions. The BA has an in-depth understanding of web based systems and Content Management Systems and ensures that there is integration between business requirements and technology. Knowledge of the Drupal CMS preferred.  The Business Analyst also performs workflow analysis and coordinates with the project management team to prioritize deliverables and negotiate on product functionalities. The BA needs a thorough understanding of software development processes – SDLC – along with proven analytical, problem-solving, and conflict resolution skills to help identify, communicate, and resolve issues.ResponsibilitiesThe duties for this position may include, but are not limited to: Working with clients to gather business requirements for building and maintaining Drupal-based CMS solutions.Analyzing, translating, and documenting business and technical requirements.Serving as the liaison between customers and the systems development team.Analyzing information for quality, completeness, and reporting purposes.Developing standard operating procedures (SOPs) and related materials such as FAQs and help materials for Web-based systems.Helping with CMS operations, including QA of posted content, bug tracking, and facilitating communication between the client and the developer/technical support staff.Supporting the Web Portfolio Manager.Tackling other ad hoc tasks as required to operate a community-driven website. Required EducationThe candidate for this position should hold a minimum of a BA or BS.Required ExperienceIn addition to the above educational requirements, the candidate for this position must also have: Experience working with Web CMS technology, particularly DrupalSolid experience writing business and technical requirementsAn ownership mentality over the BA’s areas of responsibilityAn ability to prioritize and track changes in requirements in the context of a large and complex projectAn ability to resolve ambiguity and steer the client toward well-defined requirementsAn ability to track decisions and make sure they are reflected in the requirementsArticulate oral and written communication skillsStrong, client-facing interpersonal skillsStrong time management and organizational skillsStrong analytical and reasoning abilities About Insight Systems CorporationInsight Systems Corporation is a small, woman owned Washington DC-based solutions company that seeks strategic results for the business and information technology missions of its partners: information-intensive enterprises, government agencies and commercial organizations. The Insight team is expert in the "nuts and bolts" of technology, with a focus on using technology as a business tool. Our staff solve real business problems related to knowledge management and technical consulting, and provide a range of services including informational analysis, program management, and information infrastructure services.

Name: Principal Consultant - Senior Data Analytics /Business Analyst
Description: Who Are We? TeraThink has celebrated over 15 years of successful delivery of innovative and transformative consulting services to the federal government. We specialize in information technology and management consulting that has a purpose and makes a difference. Our teams are focused on providing exceptional service and solving our clients toughest challenges.  Our leadership team has a vast amount of experience and boasts a highly successful track record of delivering results within their respective solution areas and industries. Each leader adheres to a lead by the way you want to be led philosophy, which emphasizes transparency and open-door approachability. Who Are We Looking For? At TeraThink, we put our employees first and we expect nothing but your best in return. Our company believes in the importance of growth, passion, character, and of course - fun! Our positive work environment encourages team members to find enjoyable and challenging work in order to bring out the best in each individual. We look for dedicated team members who want to be a part of growing this incredible company. The best candidates are those who always look to go above and beyond and challenge themselves to achieve more each day. Sound Like You? Do you want to excel in your career and enjoy what you do? Then come join our growing team of brilliant professionals at TeraThink. What Youll Do TeraThinks Performance Management team primarily utilizes Tableau 10.1 desktop and server (a COTS Business Intelligence (BI) tool). The Data Analytics Consultant will act as the liaison between the performance management team and dashboard clients from a specific department to help them implement metrics. The analyst must have strong analytical skills and knowledge of best practices related to metric development. Responsibilities will include gathering requirements, uploading data and creating visualizations/metrics in Tableau, demonstrating new capabilities, and promoting the EPMS Dashboard as the tool for conducting performance management at our client. Job Responsibilities:Contribute to use of performance management frameworks and methodologiesDefine KPIs, metrics and collect dataImplement metrics in TableauPrepare data for upload into SQL databasesPerform data analysisInteract daily with clients and project managementEliciting and analyzing data requirements based off of client feedback and developing detail documentationAbility to interpret data (raw data), data definition, analyze the results using statistical techniques in order to design data visualizations and reporting with detail and accuracyIdentify, analyze, and interpret trends/patterns with complex data setsProvide translation between the data analyst and technical team members and requirementsAbility to solicit business requirements in order to determine what kind of data analysis should be conductedAcquire data from data sources and maintain databaseFacilitate meetings and display strong presentation skillsSupport weekly status reportingWhat Were Looking ForPer client requirements, must be a U.S. citizen, hold an interim DoD Secret (or higher) security clearanceLocal candidates onlyCandidate will have a Bachelor's degree, or higher, in a related fieldThe ideal candidate must have 3+ years of experience in a functional (or business analyst) role, including defining metrics and collecting dataThe candidate will have advanced data analysis skills, requirement gathering skills, presentation skills and facilitation skillsExperience with Tableau (or similar COTS BI tools). This includes using BI/dashboard tools for data analysis; implementing a BI/dashboard tool; advising on strategies for BI/dashboard tools; and defining performance management best practicesKnowledge and experience using Tableau or similar Business Intelligence toolsExperience defining key performance indicators (KPIs) and metricsExperience benchmarking complex government processes and or metricsAdvanced data analysis skills utilizing MS Excel (including pivot tables and formulas)Advanced facilitation skills with both large and small groupsStrong data visualization skillsAdvanced presentation skills utilizing MS PowerPointWhat We'd Like to SeeTableau (or other BI Tool) CertificationKnowledge of SQL and stored proceduresKnowledge of and skill with performance management frameworks and methodologies (Balanced Scorecard, Baldridge etc.)Why TeraThink is a Great Place to WorkBenefits:  We love coming to work every day. Our benefits and work-life balance provide employees with much more than just the essentials they keep us happy in and outside of work.  A health insurance plan is provided at no cost for employees.  Employees enjoy federal holidays off in addition to 18 days of Paid Time Off (20 days after 2 years of service, 25 days after 5 years of service).  Our 401k is at a 4% match on a 5% contribution which has immediate vesting because we want you to stay here because you love it not for an invested 401k match. And we know you will love it!  Visit the Benefits page for a full list of benefits offered by TeraThink. Perks:  In addition to a top-notch benefits package, we host outings at The National Zoo, Escape Room, Top Golf, and holiday parties with swanky themes such as Casino Night. Our employees are also provided the opportunity to enjoy numerous perks such as: Multiple high-definition TVs at our offices with plentiful snacks to enjoy in the café areasBreakaway activities such as foosball, darts, and shuffle boardTeraThink sponsored FitBit and steps challenges, with prizesQuarterly shipments of snack boxes to our employees working on client siteSeason tickets to local sports teamsCell phone and commuter reimbursements We also embrace recognition as a way to showcase the great work that takes place at our company each day. As a way of shining light on our hard-working employees, we often provide gift cards for achieving major project milestones, attaining personal certifications, or as a thank you for employees who give back to the community. Our Focus on Professional & Team Growth:  We focus on encouraging constant learning, growth and innovation, and support Communities of Practice so that team members can dedicate time to learning new tools or solutions as while as getting to know employees on other projects. We provide each employee with an annual contribution amount to use towards learning and growth. We also encourage our team to participate in our TeraThink blog and share our knowledge with various communities of learning.  We strive to provide our employees, whether on client site or in our internal offices, with the best possible work experience. We keep a pulse on our team by sending out frequent micro-surveys that allow team members to provide feedback and thoughts. This frequent feedback allows our agile company to make changes and continue to adjust in any areas to provide team members with the best TeraThink.  Whether it is our events, benefits and perks, open communication, culture of recognition and growth; we want team members to be happy and fulfilled in their careers at TeraThink. Our future is you.  TeraThink is a proud equal opportunity employer. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, ancestry, color, sex, religion, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, protected veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender identity, familial status, political affiliation, or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

Name: Senior Digital Attributes/Fusion Analyst
Description: Req ID 101421BR Business Title Senior Digital Attributes/Fusion Analyst Group MCIS Location USA MARYLAND Bethesda Clearance Level Needed TS/SCI Category Intelligence Job Duties and ResponsibilitiesEntering ManTech’s 50th year, we hold the distinct honor of being named a “Top 100 Global Technology Company” by Thomson Reuters. We understand that in order to hold this distinct honor, we must provide our employees with the opportunity to break through barriers. We reinvest in our employees through rich educational opportunities such as 100% paid tuition for qualifying Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees, rich training and certification programs allowing our employees to obtain industry best certifications, a variety of Communities of Practice (COPs) where employees can exchange knowledge and much more, along with a vast array of instruction and resources needed for personal and professional development through our very own ManTech University. In addition to those amazing benefits, ManTech also has a fully dedicated Career Mobility team to provide you with guidance and assistance to continue to grow your career with ManTech.  Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, career and customer oriented Senior Digital Attributes/Fusion Analyst to join our team in the Bethesda, MD area to provide unparalleled support to our customer and to begin an exciting and rewarding career within ManTech. Position Responsibilities: · The Contractor shall lead an effort to perform exploitation of identity attributes identified within media devices.  · The Senior position will provide oversight and direction to individuals performing Digital Attribute (DA) functions.  · The Contractor shall develop methodologies, tradecraft, and procedures for conducting identity exploitation of media at rest, to include detecting, extracting, adjudicating and combining biographic/digital attribute data for reporting, dissemination, and data basing. Qualifications: · BS/BA plus six (6) years of experience in IC or law enforcement targeting, forensic analysis, or Identity Intelligence, or, eight (8) years of experience in IC or law enforcement targeting, forensic analysis, or Identity Intelligence to include experience leading a related effort in lieu of a BS/BA degree.  · Knowledge, expertise, and training in intelligence targeting and analysis.  · Experience demonstrating a working understanding of computer forensics principles, file systems, and forensics tools.  · Experience in preparing and presenting briefing presentations to senior Government and Law Enforcement officials.  · Experience performing link analysis, using various techniques, tools and Methodologies.  · Knowledge and experience using IC and/or Law Enforcement databases for conducting multi-source analysis.  · Experience writing, reviewing, and editing intelligence reporting. Highly Desired Qualifications: · Experience analyzing operating systems using forensic tools such as EnCase, FTK, Axiom, and others. Clearance: · Must possess an active TS/SCI w/ a CI Polygraph. Qualifications Requires Bachelors degree and seven to nine years of related experience with a minimum of four years experience in one or more of the following: computer network penetration testing and techniques; computer evidence seizure, computer forensic analysis, and dat recovery; computer intrusion analysis and incident response, intrusion detection; computer network surveillance/monitoring; network protocols, network devices, multiple operating systems, and secure architectures. Ability to obtain a security clearance. Degrees See Qualifications Years of Experience See Qualifications Position Type Full-Time Shift Day Overview ManTech International Corporation is comprised of approximately 7,300 talented employees who use advanced technology to help government and industry meet some of their greatest challenges around the world. We adhere to the simple, no-nonsense values on which ManTech was founded more than four decades ago, aligning squarely with the mission objectives of our customers. As our customer base continues to expand and diversify, we continue to diversify our workforce and solutions. Nearly half our employees have a military background, and approximately 70 percent hold a government security clearance. As a leading provider of innovative technology services and solutions for the nation's defense, security, health, space, and intelligence communities; we hold nearly 1,100 active contracts with more than 50 different government agencies.

and facilitate project meetings and presentations to all types of diverse audiencesCollaborate closely with technical team to implement the requirements, provide necessary guidance to testers during QA processElicit and clearly document business and systems requirementsAssess business process and system inefficienciesRequired SkillsAn Associates degree in the related fieldAt least 7 years of business and system analysis, preferably with Federal SystemsDemonstrated experience and abilities establishing knowledge-based systems and using knowledge sharing methods to ensure the free flow of information between all parties (end users and development team) participating in development effortsDemonstrated experience providing full lifecycle documentation for software development projectsHas experience implementing Agile methodology in the development of software applicationsFamiliar with the Agile/Scrum practices and approachSolid experience and knowledge of version and project management software ( i.e. Team Foundation Server, SVN, etc.)Excellent oral communication and writing skillsFlexible, highly motivated, self-started who is able to handle multiple projectsExpert knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, especially Visio Strong leadership as well as oral and written communication skills are requiredDeveloped problem-solving and analytical abilitiesStrong customer service and interpersonal skillsExcellent presentation & communication skills in both oral and written formGenuine desire to learn is essentialExperience working in the Federal GovernmentCandidate must be eligible to obtain a Secret ClearanceDesired SkillsISO 9001:2000 or CMMI training preferred This position is located in Washington, DC. Our solutions empower sound decision-making and management practices, to enable government agencies to serve effectively as good stewards of taxpayer dollars while meeting their mission. At NetImpact Strategies, Inc. we are passionate about what we do and take pride in our work every step of the way. Commitment and accountability are at the core of our relationships. We believe in doing the right thing because it is the right thing to do.  NetImpact Strategies, Inc. provides results oriented services. Working collaboratively with our clients, we provide solutions that address the unique needs of each client. The successful outcome of our efforts is measurable results.  NetImpact Strategies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Name: Business Analyst
Description: We are currently seeking a motivated, career and customer oriented Business Analyst to join our team in Alexandria, VA to begin an exciting and challenging career with Unisys Federal Systems.  Description and Responsibilities:  Primary duties are to support web and mobile application software development projects. Will work with both customer and development team members to write user stories, define goals, document requirements and analyze business functions in order to become an expert in the business domain. The Business Analyst will identify business work flow and determine stakeholder needs. In addition, they will author test case specifications, requirements traceability documentation and contribute to the compilation and execution of test plans. Must support and contribute to the Agile practices adopted by the development team.RequirementsRequirements:  BS and 5 years or equivalent  5 to 7 years of experience supporting software development projects  Strong customer engagement skills and comfortable communicating with both product owner  Ability to communicate with technical team members to translate requirements into technical terminology  Ability to write functional requirements, technical requirements in User Stories with complete descriptions, acceptance criteria and any wireframes as required  Demonstrated experience in conducting working sessions for requirements gathering  Demonstrated experience in developing technical options and recommendations  Demonstrated ability to work well in a team environment, collaborate with various people and organizations to develop win/win results  Experience with tools such as Team Foundation Studio or JIRA  Experience working with AWS cloud technologies  Experience working with AWS cloud technologiesAbout UnisysDo you have what it takes to be mission critical? Your skills and experience could be mission critical for our Unisys team supporting the Federal Government in their mission to protect and defend our nation, and transform the way government agencies manage information and improve responsiveness to their customers. As a member of our diverse team, you ll gain valuable career-enhancing experience as we support the design, development, testing, implementation, training, and maintenance of our federal government s critical systems.  Apply today to become mission critical and help our nation meet the growing need for IT security, improved infrastructure, big data, and advanced analytics. Unisys is a global information technology company that solves complex IT challenges at the intersection of modern and mission critical. We work with many of the world's largest companies and government organizations to secure and keep their mission-critical operations running at peak performance; streamline and transform their data centers; enhance support to their end users and constituents; and modernize their enterprise applications. We do this while protecting and building on their legacy IT investments. Our offerings include outsourcing and managed services, systems integration and consulting services, high-end server technology, cybersecurity and cloud management software, and maintenance and support services. Unisys has more than 23,000 employees serving clients around the world.  Unisys offers a very competitive benefits package including health insurance coverage from first day of employment, a 401k with an immediately vested company match, vacation and educational benefits. To learn more about Unisys visit us at www.Unisys.com. Unisys is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) - Minorities, Females, Disabled Persons, and Veterans.  #FED#Associated topics: analyze, bi, business analytic, business systems analyst, examiner, financial analytic, investment analytics, investment fund, market, refine

Name: Research Analyst - International Development
Description: OverviewIMPAQ International is a public policy research and program implementation firm that has extensive experience providing quality research, capacity building, monitoring and evaluation, program implementation in the areas of health, economic growth, workforce development, governance, justice, and rule of law. IMPAQ has successfully implemented a diverse portfolio of domestic and international projects, including numerous multi-million dollar, multi-year projects for clients such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), the U.S. Department of Labor (DOL), the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), the World Bank, the Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC), other government clients, and many private foundations, including the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.  IMPAQ’s mission is to bring together exceptional people to develop innovative and rigorous approaches to evaluate the real-world impact of social policies and programs. IMPAQ offers five locations: our Corporate Headquarters in Columbia, Maryland, rated one of America’s Best Small Cities; Downtown Washington, D.C., Boston, Massachusetts, Seattle, Washington and a Bay Area office in Oakland, California. IMPAQ has a diverse and collegial work environment and is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/Disability/Veterans).  IMPAQ is seeking a full-time Research Analyst who will conduct and support Senior Analysts and Associates in a broad range of activities including data analysis, program assessments, project monitoring and evaluation, project management, and technical tasks within its International Development Division, in areas, including, but not limited to: economic growth, democracy and governance, education, health, civil society, agriculture, food security, land tenure, natural resources management, energy, workforce development and child labor.  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the U.S. on a full-time basis. Employment-based visa sponsorship (including H-1B sponsorship) is not available for this position.ResponsibilitiesSupport Senior Analysts and Research Associates with various aspects of project implementation, including evaluation design, preparation for data collection, programming and testing of survey instruments, and review and analysis of qualitative and quantitative data using various software program;Construct, clean, manage, and document large datasets for both internal and project purposes;Assist Senior Analysts and Research Associates in writing, compiling, editing, and formatting assigned portions of project reports;Support the creation of customized and presentation-quality reports from data analysis results;Lead literature reviews, summarizing information on key topic areas and publications;Support Senior Analysts and Research Associates in managing administrative and operational project tasks (e.g., workplans, budgets, subcontracts);Conduct research, gather intelligence, and support preparation of technical proposals and other business development-related deliverables;Contribute to and advance IMPAQ's international reputation as a leading research and evaluation firm. QualificationsDegree in Economics, Public Policy, Public Health or Political Science highly desired;Bachelor’s degree plus 5 years or a Master’s degree plus 3 years required;Relevant experience in a developing country context highly desired;Relevant experience working in an international development for-profit or non-profit desired;Experience in proposal preparation, particularly for USAID, USDA, DOL ILAB, MCC desired;Experience and knowledge of data analysis and data management techniques using STATA, SAS, Access, Excel, and/or other databases is highly desirable. Name: Productivity Analyst
Description: Productivity AnalystRequisition ID: 214770 Project Overview:  Pennsylvania Chemicals is a world-scale facility that will use ethane to produce 1.6 million tonnes of polyethylene per year. The project will involve up to 6,000 workers during its construction and is expected to employ 600 permanent employees when completed. The ethylene / polyethylene complex will be located in the Ohio River Valley north of Pittsburgh. It comprises an ethane cracker and three polyethylene units, plus OSBL including a gas-fired combined cycle cogeneration unit and a large storage-in-transit rail yard.  Key responsibilities will include: Manage project productivity program across all project locations, including performing productivity sampling of the various units on Pennsylvania Chemicals on a routine basis Develop an integrated Six Sigma and Lean Construction program to increase craft productivity and time on toolsReport progress (metrics & dashboards) to Site Management, Contractor management and local building trades representativesIdentify focus areas (work processes or site conditions) for improvementSolicit management and craft input to identify and frame key opportunitiesFacilitate / drive productivity improvement meetings and progressChampion project wide engagement (communications, milestones, recognition, etc.)Coordinate contractor management engagement and participationInterface with Safety, Quality, Performance (KPIs, PMPs) and Cost challenge programsCoordinate lessons learned and best practice programs to assure implementation across the various units within Pennsylvania Chemicals Basic Qualifications Practical work experience in a construction role as a superintendent or field engineerSIX SIGMA Black Belt certification and experience is preferredRecognized degree in an engineering, construction or scientific disciplinesAbility to work under pressure to meet multiple deadlines simultaneouslyAbility to communicate effectively across all levels of the organizationAdvanced skills with Microsoft Suite Applications - Excel, WordShaping tomorrow togetherBechtelis among the most respected engineering, project management, and construction companies in the world. We stand apart for our ability to get the job done right—no matter how big, how complex, or how remote. Bechtel operates through four global business units that specialize in infrastructure; mining and metals; nuclear, security and environmental; and oil, gas, and chemicals. Since its founding in 1898, Bechtel has worked on more than 25,000 projects in 160 countries on all seven continents. Today, our 53,000 colleagues team with customers, partners, and suppliers on diverse projects in nearly 40 countries.An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without  regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected  veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Name: Senior IT Strategic Analyst
Description: Resp & QualificationsPURPOSE: Purpose of this position is to provide analytical, presentation, staff and facilitation support for the IT Strategy Director. This position will focus on leading complex analysis, development and delivery of the three year IT Strategy in conjunction with the IT Leadership Team. The three IT strategy will expand our capabilities, tools and processes to enable the organization to realize new and diverse opportunities PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES: Develop and maintain strategies to manage and improve the effectiveness, efficiency and costs of the Operations Center. Recommends to senior and executive leadership when and where to make optimal investments in capabilities to support enterprise strategies and tactical goals.  Conduct research; consult with all levels of management and colleagues within and outside the IT organization to develop and present executive level presentations. Actively interacts with senior IT management and IT colleagues to translate corporate/functional business and information objectives into IT financial/strategic/tactical business plans.  Scope and plan the underlying analyses that will yield critical answers to key questions for driving IT Strategy. Understand the required data set to complete the analysis and procure it accordingly. Analyze data and translate findings into meaningful product and member insights, integrating relevant business knowledge as well as learning from other projects/sources. Deliver timely with minimal support. Leverage MS Office tools to capture and communicate the findings and implications of the analysis to upper management clearly. Acts as general contractor within the IT organization to consult and develop appropriate support for IT centric projects; integrate activities with business units, corporate departments, and IT departments to ensure the successful implementation and support of project efforts.  Facilitate communication between all key IT groups and the customer community through creation of IT Metrics & Status reporting mechanisms and participation in meetings. QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS: This position requires a BS or equivalent technical training and a minimum of 8-10 years experience of IT and business experience in strategic planning, This position requires familiarity in information security, configuration management, networking, databases, systems operations and applications and knowledge of financial management. This position requires strong strategic and tactical planning and organizing skills. The incumbent must also possess strong problem analysis skills and be decisive as well as flexible. Excellent oral and written communication skills are essential. Ability to present and discuss technical and non-technical information in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others, and gains understanding. Possess strong management, business planning, and development skills. Demonstrates solid teamwork and an ability to communicate and persuade peers and management at all levels; and thrive in a cross-functional environment. Additionally, the incumbent must have the ability to identify priorities and achieve results with a sense of urgency.  Experience in project management and execution of multiple projects, with working knowledge of applications development lifecycle.  Demonstrated leadership experience, during which two or more of the following occurred: successfully developed and implemented new technologies and work processesdemonstrated high competency in project management and the execution of multiple or large projectsdemonstrated competency in strategic thinking and leadership with strong abilities in relationship managementdemonstrated leadership of multidiscipline, high-performance work teams/groupsdemonstrated competency in developing efficient and effective solutions to diverse and complex business problemsDepartmentDepartment: Enterprise and Infrastructure Equal Employment Opportunity CareFirst BlueCross BlueShield is an Equal Opportunity (EEO) employer. It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information. Hire Range Disclaimer Actual salary will be based on relevant job experience and work history. Where To Apply Please visit our website to apply: www.carefirst.com/careers Closing DatePlease apply before: 12/5/2018Federal Disc/Physical DemandNote: The incumbent is required to immediately disclose any debarment, exclusion, or other event that makes him/her ineligible to perform work directly or indirectly on Federal health care programs. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The employee is primarily seated while performing the duties of the position. Occasional walking or standing is required. The hands are regularly used to write, type, key and handle or feel small controls and objects. The employee must frequently talk and hear. Weights of up to 25 pounds are occasionally lifted. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential duties and responsibilities of the position successfully. Requirements may be modified to accommodate individuals with disabilities. Sponsorship in US Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without Sponsorship

Name: Digital Network Intelligence Analyst
Description: Company Description ThreatConnect® arms organizations with a powerful defense against cyber threats and the confidence to make strategic business decisions. Founded in 2011, ThreatConnect (then called CyberSquared) started servicing government agencies on specialized cybersecurity contracts while building its platform. Officially launched in 2013, the ThreatConnect Platform has grown to more than 20,000 users worldwide. Today, ThreatConnect provides a suite of products designed to meet the threat intelligence aggregation, analysis and automation needs of security teams at any maturity level - built on the industry's only intelligence-driven, extensible security platform. Whether you want to work on building a world-class security platform or as a member of the services team, you will enjoy a career that truly makes an impact. For more information on the benefits of working at ThreatConnect, visit www.threatconnect.com/careers Job Description ThreatConnect is looking for highly motivated and experienced analysts with currently active U.S. Government Top Secret security clearances to fill positions on government contracts within the DC/NoVA/MD region. If you are sought after as an expert in your field and looking for a company that will both value and reward your expertise, take a look at what ThreatConnect has to offer. Requirements This position requires the ability to conduct network analysis and target development which is accomplished with a solid understanding of DNI and DNR analytic techniques. Analysts must be able to perform technical metadata and content analysis of threat adversary automated information systems and format the information for dissemination.  The candidate should have a solid background in several of the following: Network applicationsStrong writing and verbal skillsNetworking protocolsWorking knowledge of TCP/IP networksLog and packet-level tool experienceNetwork attack techniquesOperating system platforms (e.g. UNIX, Linux, Microsoft Windows)Network intrusion analysis and incident responseC/C++/Python Programming  Preferred tools/certs: Wireshark, Nessus, Snort, tcpdump, tcp wrapper, IDS (various), ISS scanner, eEye digital vulnerability scanner, Network +, NSA IAM, One or more of the following certifications: CCISP - Certified Critical Infrastructure Security Professional, CISM - Certified Information Security Manager, CISSP - Certified Information Systems Security Professional, SSCP - Systems Security Certified Practitioner, GIAC - Global Information Assurance Certification, CSP - RSA Certified Security Professional, CPP - Certified Protection ProfessionalClearance required: TS/SCI with favorable polygraphBenefits We work hard to reward our employees for their hard work. We offer a competitive benefits package with comprehensive insurance coverage, paid time off, and unique perks designed to help you meet your financial and personal goals.  We are committed to offering an employment experience and benefits package that enables you and your family to grow with us and to share in our success. We love to recognize our employees who have gone above and beyond, and offer incentives like quarterly awards, an employee bonus and referral program, and team-building outings. MEDICAL Full-time employees are eligible for health coverage effective from the first of the next month hired. The premiums are at no cost to the employee. We pay your premiums for individuals and families!  - Medical coverage  - Prescription drug coverage  - Dental coverage  - Vision coverage  - Company-paid short-term and long-term disability  - Company-paid life insurance and AD&D coverage FINANCIAL 401K retirement savings plan with company matching program of up to 6%.  Cell phone reimbursement WORK-LIFE BALANCE - 10 Paid Federal Holidays  - Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO) for vacation/sick time and holidays. 15 days (3 weeks) for new employees with the ability to accrue up to 25 days (5 weeks)  - Birthday day off  - Employee recognition program with quarterly awards  - Employee referral program of up to $5,000 per full-time hired referral  - Education Reimbursement program up to $5,250 for job-related college courses and professional training  - Company-provided refreshments at our Headquarters  - Quarterly events with your geographic team  - Annual company party

Name: Senior Language Enabled Analyst-Spanish
Description: Req ID 101726BR  Business Title Senior Language Enabled Analyst-Spanish  Group MCIS  Location USA MARYLAND Fort Meade  Clearance Level Needed TS/SCI  Category Intelligence  Job Duties and Responsibilities Entering ManTech’s 50th year, we hold the distinct honor of being named a “Top 100 Global Technology Company” by Thomson Reuters. We have earned this and many other accolades over the years for our dedication to serving the missions of our nation’s most important customers: U.S. Intelligence, Defense and Federal Civilian agencies. All know us as a trusted partner offering best-in-class solutions in cyber, data collection & analytics, enterprise IT, and systems and software engineering tailored to meet their specific requirements.Become an integral part of a diverse team in the Mission, Cyber and Intelligence Solutions (MCIS) Group. Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, mission oriented Spanish Language Enabled Analyst, in the Ft. Meade, Maryland area, with strong Customer relationships. At ManTech, you will help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.The IMS Division provides cyber solutions to a wide range of Defense and Intelligence Community customers. This division consists of a team of technical leaders that deliver advanced technical solutions to government organizations. Our customers have high standards, are technically adept, and use our products daily to support their mission of protecting national security. Our contributions to our customer’s success is driving our growth.As a Spanish Linguist you will perform a full range of activities in processing material or participating in situations requiring a general professional Linguist capability in one or more of the following languages:SpanishResponsibilities include, but are not limited to:Translation, interpretation and transcription of work that is mostly information and non-technical in nature such as reports, memos, correspondence, audio, or oral communication.Gisting/summarization to identify and accurately summarize factual points as well as abstract conceptsTriage documentation to isolate pertinent factual and nuanced informationInterpret accurately with proper mode/registerAdhere to interpretation protocolsReview audio material with high-degree of accuracy and expressionProvide analytical and operations support to AOR specific teams focusing on Counterintelligence or Counterterrorism topics Provide analysis, research, and intelligence production support, aiding in the composition of weekly operational briefings and productsEngage in analytic exchanges, briefings, and training within the intelligence community to enhance assigned productsAnalyze the CI/CT capabilities, vulnerabilities, and threats within geographic AORs identifying intelligence gaps/new lines of effortProvide technical inputs to requests for assistance (RFA), requests for support (RFS), and requests for information (RFI), analyze data, lead tenders, working papers in a production formatConduct intelligence traffic queries seeking mission exploitation leads. Support development of collection priorities, intelligence reviews, and corresponding Analyst Notebook chartsConduct weekly, monthly, and quarterly operational briefings. Develop and maintain knowledge of assigned target set environment according to CiAO Standard Operating Procedure (SOP)Research and analyze existing and developing CI, CT, political, military leadership, security and military issues for AOR, and produce intelligence products to meet planned or tasked production requirements.Position Requirements:Bachelor’s degree and/or 8 years of intelligence analyst and relevant Linguist experience, at a minimum in:SpanishInteragency Language Roundtable (ILR) 3/3 proficiency in reading and writingNative-level Cultural and Language experience and expertise (Desired)Security Requirements:Active TS/SCI Security Clearance is required Qualifications Requires Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience, and five to seven years of relevant experience, US citizenship and ability to obtain security clearance.  Degrees Equivalent Experience/EducationBachelor's Degree Years of Experience 11-13 years w/High School Diploma05-07 years w/Bachelors Degree02-04 years w/Masters Degree Position Type Full-Time  Shift Day  Overview ManTech International Corporation is comprised of approximately 7,300 talented employees who use advanced technology to help government and industry meet some of their greatest challenges around the world. We adhere to the simple, no-nonsense values on which ManTech was founded more than four decades ago, aligning squarely with the mission objectives of our customers. As our customer base continues to expand and diversify, we continue to diversify our workforce and solutions. Nearly half our employees have a military background, and approximately 70 percent hold a government security clearance. As a leading provider of innovative technology services and solutions for the nation's defense, security, health, space, and intelligence communities; we hold nearly 1,100 active contracts with more than 50 different government agencies.

strongly desiredOutstanding communication and customer service skillsEffective in a high-paced work environment, requiring multi-tasking to meet multiple deadlinesExperienced and comfortable communicating with clients at the management and executive level (e.g., Office Managers, Controllers and Dealer Principals)Practiced and professional communication skills in a corporate setting    CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work. All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment including 401K matching, paid time off to re-energize, donate your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement to name a few.  At CDK, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide. Whether you want to work on building a world-class security platform or as a member of the services team, you will enjoy a career that truly makes an impact. Requirements Cyber Fusion analysts, working closely with incident handlers, reverse engineers, and intelligence analysts, monitor current attack and threat information to identity those that are relevant to the enterprise; identify traffic patterns that define potential attacks; differentiate between anomalous traffic patterns caused by unauthorized activity. These experts have knowledge of firewall and other security policies and functionality to block unwanted traffic and dealing with attackers, as well as how an attacker would thwart such detection devices.
