Name: CND Fusion Analyst
Description: Company Description ThreatConnect® arms organizations with a powerful defense against cyber threats and the confidence to make strategic business decisions. Founded in 2011, ThreatConnect (then called CyberSquared) started servicing government agencies on specialized cybersecurity contracts while building its platform. Officially launched in 2013, the ThreatConnect Platform has grown to more than 20,000 users worldwide. Today, ThreatConnect provides a suite of products designed to meet the threat intelligence aggregation, analysis and automation needs of security teams at any maturity level - built on the industry's only intelligence-driven, extensible security platform. Whether you want to work on building a world-class security platform or as a member of the services team, you will enjoy a career that truly makes an impact. For more information on the benefits of working at ThreatConnect, visit www.threatconnect.com/careers Job Description ThreatConnect is looking for highly motivated and experienced analysts with currently active U.S. Government Top Secret security clearances to fill positions on government contracts within the DC/NoVA/MD region. If you are sought after as an expert in your field and looking for a company that will both value and reward your expertise, take a look at what ThreatConnect has to offer. Requirements The Fusion Analyst will work as a Fusion Analyst within the Joint Forces Headquarters (JFHQ) DODIN J2 team. The Fusion Analyst will provider high-level and long term analysis beyond that of basic event and intrusion analysis to include investigation of exploits, vulnerabilities, tactics, techniques, and procedures used by attackers. The analyst will coordinate with other members of the J2 and within the DoD to ensure threat intelligence and shared cyber situational awareness is an actionable part of the organizations defensive posture.  Additionally, the candidate will coordinate with members of intrusion analysis, incident response, vulnerability assessment, external assessment, and cyber threat analysis teams to expand the capabilities of the organization and provide more effective services to its subscribers. This includes accepting requirements for additional analytical capabilities and adjusting current infrastructure or the development of software to enhance detection capabilities, automate common analytical and response tasks to achieve greater analytical economy.  Additional responsibilities and required skills: Review IA TTPs and policiesAbility to conduct traffic analysis at the host and network levelAbility to work in a team environmentKnowledge of a variety of security concepts and procedures Understanding of adversarial TTPs Understanding of CYBERCOM policies and doctrineAbility to draft, modify and create SOP for use of other team membersAbility to create tailored products for different consumers Desired Education / Experience B.S. Comp Science, related degree, or equivalent experienceCertifications Desired: GCIH and CEHMaintain DoD 8570.01M StandardsMust have at least 4 years experience in Cyber Security Clearance: Must have current TS/SCI Benefits We work hard to reward our employees for their hard work. We are committed to offering an employment experience and benefits package that enables you and your family to grow with us and to share in our success. Name: IT Technology Analyst
Description: OverviewWe are seeking a Technology Analyst supporting our IT Strategy & Architecture work at our HQ office in Herndon, VA.The Technology Analyst will work with solution architects to define and document the need for corporate and program aligned technology solutions and translate those requirements into technology initiatives targeted at cloud based deployments. The Technology Analyst will participate in multiple solution architecture projects simultaneously The Technology Analyst will document solution requirements using user stories or other applicable techniques QualificationsREQUIRED:BA or BS degreeOne year or more years of system, solution, or business analysis in IT related work Familiarity with or use of current cloud technologies Experience working in an Agile environment a plusSolution / System design experience a plusProficient with Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, Excel and Word)Bachelor’s Degree In Computer Science Or Related Field (Or Equivalent Experience) preferableExcellent analytical and problem-solving skillsExcellent oral and written communication skills, especially in a client interaction contextAbility to work independently and within a team with excellent time management and reporting skills About PeratonPeraton provides innovative, reliable solutions to the nation’s most sensitive and mission-critical programs and systems. Peraton has significant experience providing highly differentiated secure communications, space, and technology solutions to key customers, and has become a trusted partner on missions that are critical to the security priorities of the United States. Capabilities include complex software and technology services and solutions, as well as end-to-end mission operations abilities, including Software Systems Development, Cyber, Modeling & Simulation, Mission Operations, Signal Intelligence (SIGINT), and Quick Reaction Capabilities (QRC) / Research & Development. The company is headquartered in Herndon, VA, with approximately 3,500 employees across the U.S. and Canada.  EEO StatementWe are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Name: Business Analyst
Description: At Zoomdata, we recognize that today's "big data" is tomorrow's normal data, and it shouldn't take a data scientist to make it useful. Zoomdata allows users to explore and gain insights from a wide variety of data sources, visualizing billions of records in the blink of an eye. We turn data into perspective, and empower our customers to fully realize the potential of their evolving, real time analytics. Job Function: Big data and embedded analytics are two of the hottest trends in enterprise software today. In this position you will play a key role in our product team, and help us maintain our lead as an innovator in this industry.  You will own Translate product roadmap into detailed functional and non-functional requirements, specifications, and/or prototypesWork closely with Engineering, Product Management, and UX teams to deliver new features and product releasesProvide backlog management, iteration planning, and elaboration of the user storiesProvide an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of Release and Sprint GoalsResearch and analyze the market, the users, and the roadmap for the productFollow our competitors and the industry You will bring Previous working experience as a Business Analyst, Product Manager, or Product Owner for 3+ yearsHands on data and analytics experience, preferably on a modern data stack - including streaming, non-relational stores; with experience of systems such as Hadoop, Impala, Spark, NoSQL, Elastic, Solr, BigQuery, Redshift, etc.Experience eliciting requirements from stakeholders and customers and translating them into technical terminologySharp analytical and problem-solving skillsExcellent communication, organizational and time management skillsBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience You will hit it out of the park with Knowledge of modern data sources and analyticsExperience with Tableau, MicroStrategy, or other BI toolsFamiliarity with Linux, Cloud deployment architectures, and Enterprise Security requirementsExperience working in a larger multi-scrum team organizationCustomer facing experience as a sales / solutions engineer or professional service consultant Zoomdata hires builders with creative minds, and the drive to make a positive impact by unlocking the secrets hidden in Big Data. With the right approach, we provide our team with the best tools and try to stay out of their way! We believe that when you give smart people the freedom to do smart things, you will get outstanding results.  In 2016, Gartner named us a Cool Vendor, and Dresner Advisory Services ranked us #1 out of 16 vendors in their Big Data Analytics Market Study (it was Howard Dresner himself who coined the term "business intelligence" in 1989). Forrester named us one of The Six Providers that Matter Most in the Forrester Wave for Native Hadoop BI Platforms. And, we've kept the momentum going in 2017 by debuting as a Visionary in the Gartner Magic Quadrant.  Zoomdata is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.SDL2017

Name: Research Data Analyst
Description: RSG is seeking a Research Data Analyst. This position is based in our Arlington, Virginia or White River Junction, Vermont office. AS A RESEARCH DATA ANALYST You are part of a team that applies smartphone-based GPS survey research and analytics with the goal of better understanding behavioral change due to transportation innovation and technology. Your team conducts market research in sectors such as public and private transportation, household travel behavior, future mobility, autonomous vehicles, transportation network companies (TNC), and mobility service providers (MSP). You work on all phases of the market research process including designing and implementing research approaches and survey questionnaires; administering surveys and monitoring data; performing data preparation and database management; conducting analysis; and writing reports and presentations based on findings. You are interested in working on survey datasets in conjunction with different types of datasets such as massive passively-collected location data, commercial marketing data, and publicly available demographic or geospatial data.  You are curious about the future of transportation mobility and its many economic and social implications. You are a strong blend of practical technical skills, research-based analytic skills, and solution-oriented implementation skills. You are a team-player, self-motivated, a clear and concise communicator, and dedicated to high-quality work. You understand that the pace of technology and the resulting insights from data are changing quickly, thus requiring an attitude of flexibility and adaptability. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONSBachelors degree or higher in a relevant field of study such as statistics, math, economics, engineering, geography, market research, data science, or a similar field0-5 years of professional experienceInterest and/or experience in transportation, travel behavior analytics, and survey market researchInterest and/or experience in using Python, R, SQL, PostgreSQL, GitHubOutstanding communication and teaming skills with colleagues and clientsAbility to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of formats (e.g., email, reports, presentations)Ability to prioritize multiple competing objectives and deadlines across projectsBENEFITS100% employee-owned company with Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)Award winning culture and workplace flexibility: http://www.whenworkworks.org/workplace-awards/rsg-2, http://reviews.greatplacetowork.com/rsgCompetitive benefit package Periodic travel is required. Position is based in Arlington, Virginia or White River Junction, Vermont.  RSG is not currently accepting H-1B applicants for this position. EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled.  To Apply: Please visit our employment page: http://rsginc.com/join-us

Name: Agile Business Analyst
Description: Job Description: Savan Group is looking for an Agile Business Analyst to be a member of an enterprise IT Program Management Office (PMO). The PMO will be responsible for providing enterprise IT architecture, risk management, capital planning, systems development lifecycle (SDLC), and program reporting services to the Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO) and supporting programs. The Agile Business Analyst will help to support governance and enterprise management for a service-based IT PMO offering for a federal client with a specific focus on supporting the development, training and support of federal government managers in their understanding of and implementation of new tools and methodologies, particularly those associated with Agile. Responsibilities:Provide PMO services to assist the client in collaboration with several IT services and solutions.Partner effectively with the client and contractor teams to facilitate and drive organizational maturity in a collaborative fashion.Support enterprise risk/issue management, enterprise reporting, and strategies for aligning project execution with the organizations strategic plan.Develop and support IT governance processes, including but not limited to the organizations implementation of key IT programs and policies.Provide feedback on processes including improvement opportunities and impacts to the overall portfolio of IT projects.Help coordinate gate reviews from the inception of the project to closeout.Develop standards and templates to support the management of IT projects and measure/report their progress.Provide program management support to include reporting, presentations, process definition, and program coordination.Job Location: 100% on client site (Washington D.C.) Anticipated Start Date: December 2018 Required Qualifications:8+ years of professional experience.4+ years of related IT and PMO experience.4+ years of experience working for the Government as a consultant or similar environment.Experience Delivering projects using Agile methodologies and Waterfall methodologies.Experience Coaching, Mentoring and training Project Managers in new methodologies and Project Management best practices.Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.Ability to work well independently and with a team.B.S. in business, economics, computer science, or related degree.US Citizenship required.Application Process: Submit your resume, cover letter, and salary requirements via email to hq@savangroup.com. Applicants selected for an interview will be notified via email or phone. Savan Group, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. For more information about our company, please visit our website at www.savangroup.com.

Name: SME Intelligence Analyst
Description: Req ID 102275BR Business Title SME Intelligence Analyst Group MSS Location USA VIRGINIA Sterling Clearance Level Needed TS/SCI Category Intelligence Job Duties and ResponsibilitiesManTech is seeking Top Talent as a SME Intelligence Analyst. Provides all-source intelligence analysis on topics related to homeland security, including, but not limited to, border security, counter terrorism, and critical infrastructure protection. Prepares finished analytic products, assessments,briefings, and other written or oral products on current threats and trends based on the sophisticated collection, research, and analytic trade craft of all sources of classified and unclassified information, including intelligence collection INTs, open source, law enforcement, and other government data. Identifies gaps in available intelligence information and engages with collection managers on strategies to meet intelligence requirements through Intelligence Community collection disciplines. Employs Intelligence Community analytic standards and appropriate trade-craft, methodologies and techniques and applies specialized subject matter expertise to prepare assessments of current threats and trends for consumers from senior US officials to state and local and private sector customers.Collaborates with analysts across the Intelligence Community, law enforcement, and other agencies on products, working groups, and other information sharing forums. Qualifications Required:Experience as an all-source analyst in an Intelligence Community agency producing finished, all-source analytical intelligence products in accordance with IC analytical standards, trade-craft, sourcing, and classification requirements. Experience collaborating/coordinating all source-analytic assessments with agencies across the IC;Experience using IC analytic systems and tools such as classified message databases, Analyst Notebook/i2, Web Intelligence Search Engine (WISE), or Palanatir.Written and verbal communication skills that have led to the ability to write for a variety of audiences.Candidates must be well organized, team focused, and possess critical thinking skills.Candidates will have strong interpersonal skills to work effectively with government and industry personnel at all levels of seniority. MUST BE A US CITIZEN AND ABLE TO OBTAIN AND MAINTAIN A CBP BI. POTENTIAL TO BE SPONSORED FOR A TOP SECRET/SCI CLEARANCE.Desired:At least 10 years’ experience in all-source-intelligence analysis at the national level.Familiarity with unique DHS systems and databases.Familiar with tools including: TAC, Next Gen Trident,Lucky Search Service, PULSE, HOTR/CHROME, Harmony, BI2R Active TS/SCI clearance. Qualifications Requires Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, and five to seven years of related experience including comprehensive knowledge of intelligence and or counterintelligence. Degrees Equivalent Experience/Education Bachelor's Degree Years of Experience 11-13 years w/High School Diploma  05-07 years w/Bachelors Degree  02-04 years w/Masters Degree Position Type Full-Time Shift Day Overview For more than 40 years, ManTech employees have been solving complex problems for the national security community. We are comprised of approximately 10,000 talented employees around the world. We adhere to the simple, no-nonsense values on which ManTech was founded more than four decades ago, aligning squarely with the mission objectives of our customers. As our customer base continues to expand and diversify, we continue to diversify our workforce and solutions. Half our employees have a military background, and more than 70 percent hold a government security clearance. As a leading provider of innovative technology services and solutions for the nation's defense, security, space, and intelligence communities; we hold nearly 1,000 active contracts with more than 40 different government agencies.

Name: Business Financial Analyst
Description: Job Number: R0039768 Business Financial Analyst, MidKey Role:  Prepare program and budget reports, financial presentations, and other materials to support the Navy client in programming, budgeting processes, and basis of estimates. Assist with analyzing program and budget information for submission to the client. Assist with the preparation of capabilities requests, point papers, briefing charts, spreadsheets, memos, and other documents within prescribed timelines for review and analysis. Assist with the interpretation of requests for data and facts, acquire, analyze, prepare presentations of program and budget data for use in program decision-making, and assist with the analysis of funded requirements combined with the execution history and the analysis and reporting of planned versus actual requirements and funding. Develop and maintain funding profiles for programs, projects, or contracts. Analyze budget or financial planning for an organization, organizational unit, program, or expenditure or cost center to identify potential variances. Assist with monitoring expenses against budgets for the government with strategic business planning and analyze financial data and transactions for appropriate use.  Basic Qualifications:  -Experience with business management, budget planning, budget preparation, or budget execution for acquisition programs  -Experience with the preparation of reports that reflect programs or project status in areas of cost, schedule, and performance  -Ability to obtain security clearance  -BA or BS degree  Additional Qualifications:  -2 years of experience with NAVSEA  -Experience with Navy ERP  -Experience with PBIS, AUTODOC, STARS, Prisms, or Cobra  -Certified Defense Financial Manager (CDFM) or DAWIA Level I Certification in Business or Financial Management  Clearance:  Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Name: Business Analyst - Case Management
Description: Req ID: 24208     At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.     NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Business Analyst - Case Management to join our team in Washington, District of Columbia (US-DC), United States (US).       Responsibilities include the following:Interact with the business stakeholders to gather, analyze and document requirements related to case management solution including user interaction, workflows, reports, dashboards, etc.Guide the development team in developing a fully functional solution by way of providing feedback, testing the application, creating dummy data, etc.Stand in project manager, assisting the project manager in day to day PM activitiesDemo the application to the users, gather feedback, communicate effectively to the project teamAssist in preparing end user training materials and train the trainers in the application   Required Skills include:In-depth experience in business requirements gathering with extensive experience in functional testing, documentation, trainingAbility to work well with the team and create a conducive atmosphereExperience in working in Agile projects   Desired Skills: Expertise / Knowledge of Parole Management / Prisoner ManagementExperience in SQL and T-SQL / PL/SQLExperience in .net / MS Dynamics CRM    Technical Specifications:At least 5 years of related experience in eliciting, documenting and reviewing requirementsAbility to lead the project team in the absence of the Project ManagerAbility to write functional test cases and test the applicationFamiliarity with defect management tools such as JIRA   Education: Bachelor’s Degree with an advanced degree preferred10 Yrs. Minimum Experience in IT with focus on Requirements gathering, analysis, documentation, conducting UAT and training         This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.About NTT DATA Services    NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.     NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 100,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 85 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.     NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result.

Join our team of collaborative self-starters focused on delivering practical and efficient solutions to help our client keep U.S. borders safe and facilitate trade and travel. As part of our high-performing team, you will augment our vital work to provide “eyes and ears” technology to protect our nation. This includes budget tracking, assisting with the solicitation process, and tracking progress and deliverables. You will also support the environmental planning and real estate team with general project activities. Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: PC Network, Inc. is currently seeking a Sr. Business Analyst to join our team in Washington, DC. Job Description: The Sr. Business Analyst is responsible for the collection, analysis, documentation and coordination of Client's business requirements on multiple projects and programs.The candidate is responsible for analyzing the business requirements and developing functional, nonfunctional, business rules and uses cases that that align with SDLC process.The candidate will document functional and nonfunctional requirements in partnership with IT leads and stakeholders to assist in the development and delivery of the solution. Local (MD/DC/VA) candidate  The candidate should be able to communicate with and coordinate efforts among various team members and serve as a liaison between the business users and the application development team as well as:  Participate in meetings and projects with client staff, project managers, and developers to automate, upgrade, or expand applications that accomplish business operations of assigned work unit(s).  Create, design, and format specification documentation including current and future state business process flow diagrams, functional and nonfunctional requirements, use cases, user stories, business rules, and other information or processes needed to describe required system changes for development, QA, and other internal customers.  May provide support to applications in production by tracking production problems and troubleshooting them to sustain application in production.  Develop queries, analyses, or reports from applications for operations or management staff of assigned business unit(s).  Migrate identified requirements to the requirements repository tool (Client Quality Center) and produce a requirements traceability matrix.  This position requires a successful drug screen and background check. To be considered for the position you must be eligible to work in the United States without sponsorship. We do not provide relocation assistance.  Be a Part of the PCN Team  Inquisitive. Honest. Collaborative. Our customers use these words to describe the PCN team. We understand that our employees are the foundation of our success now and in the future. Because of this, we encourage our team members to be individuals, supporting teamwork, entrepreneurism, and authenticity. We look for individuals who seek enriching experiences and challenges in their projects and career. Our philosophy of a successful employee includes making resources and tools readily available such as mentors and continuing education to facilitate long term success.  PCN is a rapidly growing IT services company based in Center City Philadelphia. We support our customers in over 20 countries and strive to be the top DDI managed service provider in the world. Visit our website www.PCN-inc.com for more information.  Equal Employment Opportunity Policy Statement  PC Network provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, PC Network complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, and transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.  PC Network expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of PC Network employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including termination.

Name: UX Business Process Analyst
Description: Are you interested in expanding your career through experience and exposure, all while supporting a mission that seeks to ensure the security of our nation and its allies? If so, then Northrop Grumman is the place for you. As a leading global security company, we provide innovative systems, products and solutions to our customers worldwide. We are comprised of diverse professionals that bring different perspectives and ideas, understanding that the more experiences we bring to our work the more innovative we can be. As we continue to build our workforce we look for people that exemplify our core values, leadership characteristics, and approach to innovation.Northrop Grumman Technology Services sector is seeking a UX Business Process Analyst3to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. This position will be located in McLean, VA. The qualified applicant will become part of Northrop Grumman's Department of State (DOS) Consular Systems Modernization (CSM) Program, for the Bureau of Consular Affairs (CA). This initiative is intended to modernize and consolidate the operational environment under a common technology framework in order to better support the services provided to CA's customers. UX Business Process Analyst will be responsible for describing the overall user experience, defining the workflow models and working with the architecture and sprint teams to ensure an effective and high quality user experience.Roles and Responsibilities:Assist in applying common best practices for the industry to the customer using a knowledge base to create conceptual business models and to identify relevant issues and considerations in selecting application software packages.Assess the operational and functional baseline of an organization and its organizational components, and help to define the direction and strategy for an engagement while ensuring the organizational needs are being addressed.Analyze business and technical processes to formulate and develop new and modified business information processing systems, such as production and inventory control systems, financial tracking systems, marketing and human resources systems.Represent the business unit to define requirements and business cases for the technology developments.Coordinate with business and technology teams, ascertaining system requirements, such as program functions, output requirements, input data acquisition, and system techniques and controls.Work with multiple teams on various projects within an Agile environmentWork directly with customers and project teams to gather requirements through user research, stakeholder interviews, workshops, etc.Develop/create applicable user flows, journey maps, page flows, wireframes, and other artifacts as neededTranslate research findings into design recommendations to quickly improve product designs early in the design cycleLeverage UX methodologies for uncovering user needs and identifying opportunities for improvementActively engage stakeholders through group facilitation and workshopsUnderstand and align the needs of our stakeholders, clients, and usersProvide thought leadership towards emerging UX best practices, trends, and technologies TSCSMBasic Qualifications:To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below:Bachelor's degree in a related field (computer science) and at least 8 years' experienceAt least three years of experience working in a collaborative team and directly with developers for implementation of UX designsSolid understanding of Accessibility (Section 508 Compliance)Extensive experience designing web application interfaces in an agile environmentKnowledge and adoption of UX industry best practices, including user-centered design methodologiesFamiliarity with HTML5 and CSS3 and understanding of web based user interface patterns based on JavaScript, Angular JS, NodeJS, BootstrapStrong visual and interaction design proficiency, as well as a superior understanding of current front-end coding practicesStrong design fundamentals including information design, interaction design, visual design, industry UX/UI standards across platforms, and UX best practicesExperience in user research, user interface design, information architecture, usability testing, human factors, and other related disciplinesExcellent communication skills, both verbally and in writing to effectively interact with multiple teams both internal and externalFluency in mobile platforms, including design guidelines for native applicationsDemonstrated proficiency with industry standard design tools (e.g., Adobe Photoshop, et. al)Proficient use of common rapid prototyping tools (e.g., Axure Pro, Balsamiq, et. al)Awareness of new trends in interactive design, development, and digital platformsMust have a current, active Secret (or higher) clearance. An interim may be considered.Preferred Qualifications:Candidates with these desired skills will be given preferential consideration:Advanced experience working with Bootstrap, JavaScript, Angular, React, NodeJS, responsive web design and development, and native mobile developmentAdvanced knowledge of usability, accessibility (Section 508 Compliance), Search Engine Optimization (SEO), and other standard best practicesExperience in cloud based environments including deploying solutions on public/hybrid cloudsExperience with IBM Rational Collaborative Lifecycle ManagementScaled Agile Framework experience; working as a part of a SCRUM TeamBackground in Agile Software Development, specifically software user story developmentExperience using engineering environments and tools that support agile development, and especially SAFe, such as JIRA, Rally, VersionOne, ConfluenceSupports all Agile teams to ensure effective end-to-end capability threads are being implementedNorthrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Name: Associate Telecommunications Pricing Analyst
Description: ResponsibilitiesThe General Services Administration (GSA) currently manages telecommunications acquisition programs that provide more than $2 billion of services annually to more than 130 government agencies. The current generation of national and regional programs—including Networx, WITS3 and more than 80 Local Service Agreements—will expire in 2020. GSA is in the process of establishing a single new program, GSA Enterprise Infrastructure Solutions (EIS), to replace all of these. This program is planned to serve as a flexible, solution-oriented vehicle that will allow agencies to define, acquire and manage the networks serving their individual mission needs over its 15 year contract life.  As described by GSA, EIS is: A comprehensive solution-based vehicle to address all aspects of Federal Agency information technology telecommunications, and infrastructure requirements.Planned to be available for Agency use in FY2017 with a 15-year period of performance.The first contract to implement GSA’s Network Services 2020 (NS2020) strategy. Noblis will be assisting federal agencies in the transition to EIS. Join the Noblis team with our excellent reputation for helping clients make complex telecommunications procurement decisions. Clients depend on us to help them anticipate, conceive, architect, assess, prove, deploy, and manage mission-critical technology-based infrastructures, while lowering operating costs. Position Description: Noblis is looking for a Junior Pricing Analyst with experience with the pricing of telecommunications services and solutions in the commercial/federal telecommunications market or economic analysis. Individuals will contribute to a high-performance team supporting the GSA Network Services Program and the Enterprise Infrastructure Solutions (EIS) acquisition vehicle as well as government agencies using that vehicle. Responsibilities include preparing Statements of Work/Request for Proposals; evaluating vendor responses for compliance with government requirements and cost reasonableness; writing evaluations for review by the government; and making recommendations with regard to source selection decisions and contract modifications.  Candidates will work with accomplished Noblis experts to provide a wide range of consulting services and expertise, including systems engineering, strategic IT infrastructure technology planning, acquisition strategy, requirements development, source selection support, operations planning, policy development, and program management support. As part of a Noblis team, candidates will work closely with government clients to understand current issues and challenges, generate practical and effective solutions, and assist with acquisition/deployment/management of those solutions, typically working “on the government side of the table” as an unbiased, trusted partner. Engagements may vary from single-agency focused solutions to major government-wide technology programs.  Technical Conduct detailed price analysis relative to telecommunications network services, equipment and related labor support. Requires conducting market research on services and prices from various sources such as government contract data, public Internet and proprietary price databases. Must be effective analyzing large data sets and databases.Working independently with general instruction, adapt and apply Noblis’ principles, concepts, processes, tools and methodologies to develop price structures (i.e. CLINs), document pricing requirements for large telecom service contracts and Statements of Work (SOWs) and develop Independent Government Cost Estimates (IGCEs).Review price proposals for conformance and compliance with contract requirements, analyze and conduct comparative analysis and provide recommendations for fair and reasonable pricing.Develop briefings and respond to questions concerning pricing analysis and price structures for components of Federal telecommunications services.Develop and apply knowledge of Federal acquisition practices and regulations to the competitive best value procurement of telecommunications services.Communication and InterpersonalDemonstrate verbal and written communications skills sufficient to understand and articulate requirements for pricing telecommunications services and network-enabled IT services via government-wide acquisition vehicles.Prepare and/or contribute to technical reports, memos, analyses and briefings. Plan and manage assigned deliverables.Support meetings, inter-team communication, and issue resolution with the client and internal/project stakeholder groups. Visit and potentially work at customer sites. Work closely and collaboratively with Noblis team leaders and members.  QualificationsA Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a discipline such as Electrical or Systems Engineering, Telecommunications, Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Operations Research, Business Administration or Accounting preferred.0-3 years of relevant work experience in telecommunications, government IT pricing, or economics.Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills. Proven results-oriented problem solving abilities.Skills with MS Excel, Access, SQL and Word.Ability to work in a dynamic team-oriented environment, demonstrate teamwork and initiative, and function productively in the face of new assignments and the re-prioritization of existing assignments.Applicants selected may be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.Noblis is an equal opportunity employer. OverviewNoblis and our wholly owned subsidiaries, Noblis ESI and Noblis NSP, are solving difficult problems that help our government and our country. We bring the best of scientific thought, management, and engineering expertise with a reputation for independence and objectivity. We support a wide range of government and industry clients in the areas of national security, intelligence, transportation, healthcare, environmental sustainability, and enterprise engineering. Learn more at noblis.org/about. Why work at a Noblis company? Our employees find greater meaning in their work and balance the other things in life that matter to them. Our people are our greatest asset. They are exceptionally skilled, knowledgeable, team-oriented, and mission-driven individuals who want to do work that matters and benefits the public.  Noblis has won numerous workplace awards. Noblis maintains a drug-free workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race.

Name: Senior Intelligence Analyst
Description: Req ID 101636BR Business Title Senior Intelligence Analyst Group MCIS Location USA VIRGINIA Chantilly Clearance Level Needed Secret Category Intelligence Job Duties and Responsibilities  Entering Mantech's 50th year, we hold the distinct honor of being named a "Top 100 Global Technology Company" by Thomson Reuters. We have earned this an many other accolades over the years for our dedication to serving the missions of our nation's most important customers: U.S. Intelligence, Defense and Federal Civilian agencies. All know us as a trusted partner offering best-in-class solutions in cyber, data collection & analytics, enterprise IT, and systems and software engineering tailored to meet their specific requirements.  Become an integral part of a diverse team that leads the world in Mission, Cyber, and Technology Solutions (MCIS) Group. Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, mission oriented Senior Intelligence Analyst, in the Chantilly, VA area with strong Customer relationships. At ManTech International Corporation, you will help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.  The FSS Division provides cyber solutions to a wide range of Defense and Intelligence Community customers. This division consists of a team of technical leaders that deliver advanced technical solutions to government organizations, Our customers have high standards, are technically adept, and use our products daily to support their mission of protecting national security. Our contributions to our customer's success is driving our growth.  As the Intelligence Analyst, you will have an intelligence analysis background, preferably with experience in a law enforcement environment. Must have demonstrated subject matter expertise in at least one of the primary areas of terrorism / counter-terrorism and law enforcement facilitation, and a fundamental understanding of how proactive intelligence synthesis and analysis interacts with their subject matter expertise. Additionally, a strong understanding of the application of intelligence principles to law enforcement work and an exceptional ability to build and maintain effective relationships with local law enforcement and security entities. Functional Responsibilities include:Provides specialized intelligence and threat analysis and production support.Accesses and performs research on designated automated intelligence databases for the purpose of identifying information of interest to the customer, down-loading the identified information to an appropriate medium, and editing the information into format(s) to be specified by the customer.Provides intelligence and threat analysis of the information that is tailored to the customer's requirements.Develops I&TS documents, summaries, reports, presentations and other designated products in support of the customer's I&TS requirements.Presents briefings to key personnel (to include General Officers and SES personnel) designated by the customer.May provide leadership to lower level employees. Minimum/General Experience: 6 years’ experience in intelligence and threat analysis.  Security Requirements: U.S. Citizenship and Active Secret Clearance. Qualifications Requires Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, and five to seven years of related experience. Degrees Equivalent Experience/Education  Bachelor's Degree Years of Experience 11-13 years w/High School Diploma  05-07 years w/Bachelors Degree  02-04 years w/Masters Degree Position Type Full-Time Shift Day Overview ManTech International Corporation is comprised of approximately 7,300 talented employees who use advanced technology to help government and industry meet some of their greatest challenges around the world. We adhere to the simple, no-nonsense values on which ManTech was founded more than four decades ago, aligning squarely with the mission objectives of our customers. As our customer base continues to expand and diversify, we continue to diversify our workforce and solutions. Nearly half our employees have a military background, and approximately 70 percent hold a government security clearance. As a leading provider of innovative technology services and solutions for the nation's defense, security, health, space, and intelligence communities; we hold nearly 1,100 active contracts with more than 50 different government agencies.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Requisition Number 18-0189  Post Date 10/25/2018  Title Senior Financial Analyst  City Herndon  State VA  Description ABOUT THIS ROLE:The primary functions of this position are to help Northwest Federal Credit Union to maintain, monitor, and control the liquidity and interest rate risk of the Credit Union through properly managing the investment portfolio and cash positions of the Credit Union. This position will also assist in monitoring and maintaining the Credit Union’s financial position within the governance provided by the Board of Directors and appropriately report the positioning according to these constraints to Executive Team, Financial Management Committee, and Board of Directors. Further, this position will be responsible for assisting in efforts related to financial strategy and operations under the guidance of the Vice President – Finance and Chief Financial Officer. Additional functions of this position are to help Northwest Federal Credit Union to create a budget and tracking budget performance, assist in the preparation and presentation of business analyses for projects, and preparation and presentation of continual interest rate and spread analysis to ensure credit union vitality. This position is directly responsible for producing accurate cost modeling for proposed projects, counter party credit risk analysis for vendors, and interest rate projections. Additionally, this position will assist in managing the budgeting process and help to provide monthly updates for cost center managers, Executive Management, and Board of Directors as directed. This position works directly with Accounting and Risk Management functions to ensure the financial integrity of the credit union. This position also serves as a back-up to the Vice President - Finance. DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:Assists with the management and maintenance of the Investment Portfolio through providing analysis on investments and cash positions Responsible for assisting in the compilations of monthly investment and liquidity reports for consumption by Executive Management and Board of Directors Assists with the management and maintenance of cash positions including borrowing and arbitrage through monitoring forecasted cash flows Review Credit Union financial reports and investment portfolio to ensure that the Credit Union is operating within governance parameters as dictated by the Board of Directors and regulatory authorities Actively monitor, report, and advise on operations and risk mitigation strategies related to balance sheet management including investments, loans, deposits, and borrowings in terms of interest rate risk, liquidity risk, and other financial risks faced by the Credit Union Act as the Subject Matter Expert on investment accounting and cash flows to assist in the explanation and documentation of strategies related to the investment portfolio or cash management Assists with market analysis on interest rates to ensure that the credit union’s rates are in line with strategic business drivers, are appropriate given desired net interest margin, and are not out of line with market conditions Perform costing analysis on all changes in rates to ensure profitability of products and services mix and helping to control the cost of funding Assist in the preparation of presentations for the Board of Directors, Financial Management Committee, and Executive Management as required Perform costing and qualitative analysis for proposed projects through properly communicating with stakeholders, integrating information and data into analysis, and forecasting to produce final work products that can be utilized by all levels of stakeholders Assists in the preparation of the annual budget and operational plan – interfacing with business lines, SVP’s, various other stakeholders Responsible for monthly budget performance reports that are presented to Cost Center Managers, Executive Management, and Board of Directors Responsible for performing research on causes of variations in budget performance, capital expenditures, and encumbrances Perform Analysis to determine the financial risks of vendors through proper counter party credit reviews Perform market analysis on interest rates to ensure that the credit union’s rates are in line with strategic business drivers, are appropriate given desired net interest margin, and are not out of line with market conditions Assist in reviewing lower level staff work to ensure consistency, relevance, and accuracy of work as required Remains cognizant of Name: Management Consultant (Cost Modeling) (CIVP5)
Description: Civilian - E3s Civilian Division employees support clients across the Department of Commerce, Department of Justice, Department of Transportation, General Services Administration, National Institutes of Health, and more. We enable our employees to use innovative technologies, proven best practices, and efficient processes to provide exceptional service to our Federal clients. With careers in IT program management, acquisition and category management, shared services planning, and education and training, our employees can advance their careers, collaborate with their teams, and deliver excellent mission results.Our client is striving to be more cost efficient, and thereby more effective, in delivering IT services to all customers and stakeholders.  To achieve this objective, they are mapping all IT costs across the organization to the Business Relationship Management (BRM) tool. This mapping of costs to IT services using BRM and aligning to the Technology Business Management (TBM) Taxonomy will allow the organization to assign total cost of ownership for all IT costs. Specifically, it will allow for the assignment of total cost of ownership for technical development and maintenance of enterprise services and products, investments, as well as the associated unit cost. This should ultimately improve the quality of enterprise IT services and improve accuracy of cost estimates when providing them via the BRM and aligned to the TBM Taxonomy.  Furthermore, by mapping all the IT costs to the BRM, the client will be able to identify enterprise cost efficiencies throughout the organization and allow for the understanding of the enterprise IT costs. By mapping all the IT costs to the TBM Taxonomy, it will be feasible to compare costs of delivering IT services to industry standards and thereby make more effective determinations regarding the most efficient method of delivering IT services.  The cornerstone of IT cost alignment to the BRM and TBM taxonomy is ensuring that there is communication and coordination across all IT in the organization to ensure consistent business rules are applied to the agreed upon technical framework.  This effort will focus on creating a methodology and executing against that framework to assign costs the BRM, TMB, IT services, and IT projects. This will allow IT to be based upon data-driven decisions and also to understand the business value it provides to support the mission.  E3 is looking for a Management Consultant to support an opportunity within the Department of Commerce.  Job duties to include but not limited to: Develop and maintain cost models as requiredDevelop and maintain cost estimation tools as requiredCompare estimates against government and industry leading practicesAssist in the formulation of Cost Benefit AnalysesDevelop briefing packages for program reviews for current and budget year statusReview and analyze program office budget requests for consistency with management guidanceInterpret and assess the impact of updates to budget requestsAssist with development of life cycle Program Office Estimates (POE) for all major IT investmentsAssist in the formulation of IT budget based upon POEAssist with formulation of re-usable pricing model and charge-back model that support cost recovery efforts IT services across USCBAssist in data collection, data tracking, and document production by developing and producing IT service costs reports, graphs, and chartsAssist with IT budget formulation and execution to include all phases of the budgetPrepare templates to include detailed data for each IT service, including usage, metrics, and trends5+ years of consulting experienceAdvanced MS Excel skills (Macros, Pivot tables, etc)Experience with Cost Model development/maintenanceExcellent written, presentation and verbal communication skillsBS degree or aboveCertified Government Financial Manager (CGFM) or Certified Cost Estimator certificate E3 Federal Solutions (E3) specializes in helping Federal clients solve their most challenging business problems. Our motivated and technology-enabled workforce utilizes proven management and technical consulting practices and applies agile principles and data-driven decision making to enable our clients to better meet mission requirements. We create significant value for our clients by bringing subject matter expertise across the Federal marketplace in the disciplines of Acquisition Lifecycle Management, Program Management Support Services, Systems Engineering and Technical Assistance, and Facilities and Engineering Management. Excellence, Accountability, Community, Humility and Integrity are the core values of E3 as we become recognized leaders in the management consulting community as trusted partners to Federal agencies and to industry. We are an organization that offers both our employees and clients an exceptional experience; our culture is contagious, and we always maintain a genuine reputation.  As an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer, E3 Federal Solutions (E3) is dedicated to making all employment decisions without regard to race, color, sex (including gender and transgender status), age, religion, national origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, registered domestic partner or civil union status, gender identity, medical condition, genetic information, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. E3 hires and promotes individuals solely on the basis of their qualifications for the job to be filled.

Name: Cyber Intelligence Analyst - Bilingual - Japanese
Description: LookingGlass has an immediate opening for a motivated Cyber Intelligence Analyst with fluent Japanese writing and reading skills to join LookingGlass’ world-class Global Security & Intelligence division.  As a Cyber Intelligence Analyst, you will collect information to identify threats, and generate intelligence to assess risk in relevance to client needs. Intelligence activities can include researching current and emerging threats issues covering physical security, cyber security, reputation risk and compliance issues. Activities may also include, malware analysis, campaign assessment, data collection and analysis, and network forensics. OVERVIEW OF POSITION:Learn and employ LookingGlass patented technology to identify relevant intelligence collected from the InternetAnalyze the intelligence identified by LookingGlass technology, based on client-specific criteria, to assemble relevant findings and analysisAssist in customer care and all aspects of the production of our range of deliverables and information productsIdentify and communicate improvements to the client delivery process and department productivityQUALIFYING REQUIREMENTS:Fluent Japanese reading and writing skills;Bachelor's degree required;Adept in performing online research, OSINT or computer/database searching;High degree of knowledge of Social Media Platforms, blogs, IRC, message boards;Ability to collect, authenticate, validate and document online evidenceProficient with at least one investigative tool, such as Whois, Ping, Traceroute, etc.Knowledge of IPv4, IPv6, DNS records, E-mails Headers, P2P;Possession of excellent team leadership, development, and client relationship skills;Proficient in MS Office programs;Relevant experience in intelligence, technology, cyber-security; prior experience in military intelligence and/or financial industry is preferred.DESIRED SKILL SETS:Basic understanding of HTML and/or website design;Excellent writing/verbal communication skills;High standard of excellence, professionalism, and a passion for customer service and satisfaction;Knowledge of Japanese business, cyber threat landscape;Knowledge of cyber-crimes and fraudulent activity targeting the technology or financial services industries;Knowledge and interest in policy issues, current events and security risks that may impact commercial enterprises.CERTIFICATIONS REQUIRED: NoneEOE/AA/M/F/Veteran/Disability Employer

Name: Signature Reduction Intelligence Analyst
Description: Req ID 102096BR  Business Title Signature Reduction Intelligence Analyst  Group MCIS  Location USA MARYLAND Fort Meade  Clearance Level Needed TS/SCI  Category Intelligence  Job Duties and Responsibilities Entering ManTech’s 50th year, we hold the distinct honor of being named a “Top 100 Global Technology Company” by Thomson Reuters. We have earned this and many other accolades over the years for our dedication to serving the missions of our nation’s most important customers: U.S. Intelligence, Defense and Federal Civilian agencies. All know us as a trusted partner offering best-in-class solutions in cyber, data collection & analytics, enterprise IT, and systems and software engineering tailored to meet their specific requirements.Become an integral part of a diverse team in the Mission, Cyber and Intelligence Solutions (MCIS) Group. Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, mission oriented Signature Reduction Intelligence Analyst at Ft. Meade, with strong Customer relationships. At ManTech, you will help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.The IMS Division provides cyber solutions to a wide range of Defense and Intelligence Community customers. This division consists of a team of technical leaders that deliver advanced technical solutions to government organizations. Our customers have high standards, are technically adept, and use our products daily to support their mission of protecting national security. Our contributions to our customer’s success is driving our growth.Duties include but are not limited to:Assess and develop recommendations for current and future SR requirements by conducting mission and SR requirements analysis. Support the daily management and oversight of the Signature Reduction (SR) / Operations Security (OPSEC) Program. Shall conduct and write an annual assessment of the SR/OPSEC Program (to include subordinate organizations) to ensure compliance with current DoD, Army, INSCOM, and 902d MI Group SR policies. Support the maintenance, issuance and recovery, inventories, and turn-in of the SR/OPSEC Program items and assist subordinate organizations. Shall write, staff, and track SR/OPSEC Program documents. Provides intelligence support for contingency operations, battle staff and operational-level planning, joint and multi-lateral training exercises, and strategic engagement policy throughout the Areas of Operational Responsibility (AOR) and Areas of Interest (AOI). Monitors and analyzes all strategic and operational aspects of political, military, and economic developments for the countries in the AORs and AOIs. Assesses future and on-going political-military developments, military capabilities and doctrine, weapons acquisitions, and employment of military forces within each country. Researches, authors, and coordinates threat assessments to support the Commander and other senior leadership as well.Position Requirements:Bachelor’s degree and/or 4 years of intelligence analyst experience, at a minimum.Security Clearance Requirements:An active TS/SCI Security Clearance is required Qualifications Requires Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, and five to seven years of related experience.  Degrees Equivalent Experience/EducationBachelor's Degree Years of Experience 11-13 years w/High School Diploma05-07 years w/Bachelors Degree02-04 years w/Masters Degree Position Type Full-Time  Shift Day  Overview For more than 40 years, ManTech employees have been solving complex problems for the national security community. We are comprised of approximately 10,000 talented employees around the world. We adhere to the simple, no-nonsense values on which ManTech was founded more than four decades ago, aligning squarely with the mission objectives of our customers. As our customer base continues to expand and diversify, we continue to diversify our workforce and solutions. Half our employees have a military background, and more than 70 percent hold a government security clearance. As a leading provider of innovative technology services and solutions for the nation's defense, security, space, and intelligence communities; we hold nearly 1,000 active contracts with more than 40 different government agencies.

Name: Agile Portfolio Analyst
Description: The College Board, the national educational organization, is conducting a search for an Agile Portfolio Analyst for our IT department. This position is based in our Reston, Virginia office.  Named by Fast Company as one of the most innovative education companies, the College Board is a mission-focused organization. This job requires a strong focus on improving educational opportunities and outcomes, particularly for disadvantaged students, in the context of a competitive business environment.  The Agile Portfolio Management Office within the College Board Information Technology division is seeking an Agile Portfolio Analyst to work closely with Agile Portfolio Managers, Agile Coaches, and stakeholders from the business, IT, and Ops to support Agile Portfolio Management for College Board as part of the College Board's Agile Transformation. This position will support the various College Board portfolios of work with a focus on Demand (Work Intake) Management, Portfolio Management, and Results Management. This role will also support the aggregation of portfolio planning and delivery metrics into succinct, meaningful information radiators that can be used to communicate progress, manage risks and issues, and provide actionable decision-making tools. To support that effort, the Portfolio Analyst will play a key role in ensuring the accuracy of data to produce reliable reporting. The Agile Portfolio Analyst will also play a role in the configuration and administration of tools that support the Agile Transformation.  We are looking for a collaborative, positive, enthusiastic, pragmatic servant leader who demonstrates strong creativity and innovative thinking, demonstrates adaptability and agility, is passionate and/or knowledgeable about the education industry as well as technology trends, and can synthesize and communicate information across a wide range of stakeholders. What you'll doSupport analysis and management of College Board portfolios of work with a focus on Demand (Work Intake) Management, Portfolio Management, Program Management, and Results Management.Support the facilitation and coordination of efforts toward the establishment of portfolio definitions including their structure, roles, and processes.Partner with Portfolio Managers, Product Managers, and Product Owners to prioritize and sequence work in relation to roadmaps. Understand business goals, initiatives, and features. Effectively work with Product Managers, Product Owners and Scrum Masters to align and support business strategy, planning, and delivery.Support Portfolio Managers in day to day tasks of managing various portfolios of work.Facilitate portfolio reviews as necessary and ensure that portfolio health, issues and risks are effectively managed and visualized to meet business expectations. Ensure adequate oversight and coordination of dependencies across features and resolve impediments.Demonstrate the ability to access data, analyze data outputs, and visualize the results to provide meaningful information radiators that provide good optics and insights. Build dashboards and reports based on data sets from various sources such as JIRA. Be able to produce crisp, integrated Reporting and Dashboards for portfolio stakeholders.Provide tool support to all portfolio stakeholders. Utilize JIRA, Confluence and other tools to facilitate effective work intake and delivery.Serve as a subject matter expert in the tool implementation that supports the Agile work intake, planning, and delivery system. Help with the deployment and support of tools such as JIRA and Confluence.Support teams as necessary in managing the delivery of work for the various portfolios.Facilitate organizational retrospectives as necessary.Works closely with the Agile Center of Excellence, providing feedback on processes, policies, procedures, training, and tooling changes to better support the enterprise Agile transformation.Foster collaboration between Program, IT, and Operations teams.Build a trusting and safe environment where challenges can be raised in an objective manner with a focus on problem solving.Propose solutions to problems and challenges, raising them up effectively to appropriate parties for resolutionAbout youMinimum 4 to 6 years of related experience and Bachelor's degree/equivalent required .MS or MBA highly desirable.Strong business leadershipKnowledge and experience in managing and operating organizational level work intake, planning, reporting, and financial analysis systems.Experience in organizational level data management.Understanding of Agile frameworks, business process modeling, and data modeling.More about youUnderstanding of Agile concepts and best practices, as well as an ability to become a SME in College Board's Agile work management system.Strong attention to detailStrong verbal and written communication skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsExperience in process analysis.Strong organizational skillsExperience in JIRA (or a JIRA like platform)High proficiency in Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, Access, and Outlook) is requiredStrong attention to detailBenefits We offer our employees an outstanding benefits package, which includes 4 weeks of paid time off, a generous retirement savings plan, health and pet insurance, tuition reimbursement and ongoing professional development and training.  Mission The College Board's mission is to connect students to college success and opportunity. We are a not-for-profit membership organization committed to excellence and equity in education. Among our best-known products are the SAT®, PSAT/NMSQT®, and Advanced Placement Program®. The College Board is committed to diversity in the workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The College Board participates in E-Verify, a service of DHS and SSA, where required. Please understand that only qualified applicants will be contacted.

Name: Digital Analyst/Business Analyst
Description: Digital analyst/business analyst to work full time on our digital research team, which focuses on digital performance measurement and intelligence for international news websites and digital content. Looking for a contractor who would be available to start work on premises in Washington, DC.  This is a primarily non-technical role which requires knowledge of internet technologies and services and query construction, but does not require programming or advanced coding skills. The ideal digital analyst/business analyst will have the following skills and background knowledge:  + Minimum of three years of experience working with web analytics and online/search advertising in content distribution (non-sales) digital environment.  + Training or minimum 1-year experience in journalism, digital content creation, and content distribution, in order to provide contextually relevant analyses of digital products.  + Excellent communication skills and experience working in an international and diverse environment. Foreign language skills are a plus.  + Demonstrated experience using MS Excel in statistical applications.  + Demonstrated experience with enterprise-level web analytics tools and services like Adobe Analytics/Sitecatalyst/Omniture, Google Analtyics, Comscore etc.  These tasks are the types of work the digital analyst/business analyst will be assigned:  + Data Collection – Gather, maintain, and provide daily, weekly, monthly and cumulative tracking of data from a range of digital properties, products and services, including quantitative and qualitative data.  + Data Analysis – Conduct analyses and investigations of raw data collected by applying analytical methods from mathematics, science, engineering, social science, and business and provide advice and insight about probable effects of alternative solutions to problems; develop statistically valid trends monthly and cumulatively from the data collected, perform relevant statistical analysis, and develop models on collected data as requested; review and conduct comparative analysis of information and provide weekly and monthly reports; analyze data from web analytics tools and other digital metrics reporting tools to inform decisions on effectiveness of content, syndication, and promotional campaigns.  + Serve as a team member in an Agile product development environment associated with one or more product areas, ensuring robust, flexible, scalable technical solutions are architected, developed and implemented  + Provide customer service, support and training for staff on new and existing technologies and platform systems related to the above technologies.  This position requires US Citizen that can get a Public Trust clearance. This position will also offer some telecommute options

Name: Business Analyst IV
Description: THE COMPANY Fannie Mae provides reliable, large-scale access to affordable mortgage credit in communities across our nation. We are the leading source of funding for housing in America, which means more people can buy or rent a home. We are focused on sustaining the housing recovery, improving our company, and leading change to make housing better.  Join our diverse, high-performing team and make a difference as we work together to enable access to a good home.  For more information about Fannie Mae, visit http://www.fanniemae.com/progress JOB INFORMATION Examine, assess, and document business operations and procedures of operating for administrative unit. Relate these procedures to IT/IS systems and applications that are designed to enable the operating unit to accomplish its objectives. Assist operating unit staff by developing reports, downloads, and analyses from discipline-specific systems and applications. Provide input to IT/IS specialists in development projects to assist in developing specifications and functionalities in IT systems. KEY JOB FUNCTIONSAssess business operations and processes of assigned office or business unit to identify inefficiencies in procedures, information flows and handoffs, decisions, communications pathways and ways in which systems supporting these can be enhanced.Participate in meetings and projects with client staff, project managers, and developers to automate, upgrade, or expand applications that accomplish business operations of assigned work unit(s).Create, design, and format technical specifications including descriptive text, process flows, and other information needed to describe required system changes for development, QA, and other units; serve on project team accomplishing these functions.Provide support to applications in production by tracking production problems and troubleshooting them to sustain application in production.Develop queries, analyses, or reports from applications for operations or management staff of assigned business unit(s), or develop specifications for such queries or analyses to be performed by others.Serve as team, project, or technical lead in project involving definition of business processes or development of technical/business specifications for new or modified business management or operational software.EDUCATIONBachelor's Degree or equivalent requiredMINIMUM EXPERIENCE6 years of related experienceSPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLSExcellent Power Point skills.Ability to distill large amounts of information into summary level and make recommendations based on the research.Excellent writing skills.Experience with developing different types of reports (status, informational, analytical, other).Ability to come up to speed quickly on previously unknown topics.Excellent organizational skills.EMPLOYMENT As a condition of employment with Fannie Mae, any successful job applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment drug screen and to successfully complete a background investigation.  Fannie Mae is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Strategic Materials Program Business Analyst
Description: Job Description: Leidos is looking for people experienced in providing engineering program analysis. This position supports Leidos' role within the nation's nuclear deterrence mission as support contractor to the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) Office of Defense Programs.  This is a full-time contractor-support position located on-site at the NNSA offices in Washington, D.C. Description: The Principal Program Business Analyst will provide analysis and planning within the DOE PPBE system including cost engineering alternatives analysis. This person will provide situational analysis to the Tritium and Materials Management Federal Program Manager, located in the NNSA Albuquerque offices. This person will advise the Federal program manager on matters pertaining to planning, budget, cost, and program integration and assist in advocating and representing the program's interests at NNSA headquarters. Specific duties include:Identifying, assessing, and analyzing program impacts from a cost and budget perspective to inform the PPBE planning process on a 10-year horizon.Communicating complex program and budget planning issues to the Federal program manager, senior leadership, external stakeholders and others with diverse technical understanding.Evaluating program variables and providing assessments to the Federal program manager regarding how well technical plans and solutions are proceeding on schedule and whether deliverables conform to customer requirements, quality control standards, and negotiated metrics.Performing cost engineering projections for proposed alternative program approaches.Facilitating program meetings and discussions. LeadGen  LeadGenNNSA Required Clearance:Active DOE Q and/or DOD TS clearanceRequired Education, Experience, and Skills:Master's degree.13 or more years of program and business management experience in related endeavors.Familiarity with using project management tools and techniques, e.g., EVM.Experience managing interdisciplinary technical and business teams.Experience with cost estimating, cost/benefit analysis, and the DOE PPBE process.Proficiency in budget and cost analysis tools, e.g., Excel.Excellent written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated experience in developing and delivering briefings for senior and executive managers and facilitating high level technical discussions.Desired Education, Experience, and Skills:Program Management Institute certification as a program management professional (PMP)Prior staff experience with NNSA.Nuclear power production or nuclear weapon experience.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Project Summary: DRT is seeking a very experienced Senior Business Analyst to join our FDA team and support one of our newest customers on the FDA account. This position requires the candidate to be able to wear multiple hats, be able to lead requirements gathering and elicitation, drive high customer satisfaction, and be able to expand the scope of work and generate business growth.
