Name: Senior Business Analyst, Client Activation
Description: Rally Health is seeking a Senior Business Analyst with proven background and understanding of business areas, business systems, integration, and client validation to join their high-performing Client Activation team. This is a client-facing position in a fast-paced, collaborative, and detail-oriented environment where all client facing interaction must ensure that a client would recommend Rally.  The Rally Health BA serves as a liaison between the business and development teams, takes ownership for collecting business requirements and configuring systems, supports managers and team members by being the go-to expert to assist with processing, troubleshooting and updating the application, and may act as project leader for designed projects. The BA will also perform client configuration, integration, and API validation in an expanding system architecture.  Requirements for Rally BAs: B.S. degree preferredClient-facing or end-user interaction and collaboration BA/ QA experience is a must have5+ years of industry experience as a BA/ QA professional with a background in functional, integration and regression testing of web applications with at least 3 years being client-facingKnowledge of process flows for data related implementations and processing transactionsCommunicate and coordinate with business, and development teams to maintain existing processes, and to execute new configurationsCollaborate with cross-functional teams to gather functional requirements; translate requirements into specificationsWork closely with trading partners to plan, execute, and implement data exchangeAssist product owner with prioritizing project backlogCollectivity provide development LOE and estimates/timelines for potential upcoming projectsConstruct technical requirements and specifications outlining data transformation; communicate purpose, impact, risk, and gapsTroubleshoot and triage data translation errors; Communicate and reconcile data errorsPlan and coordinate build testing from data import, extract, to backend ingestPartner with business to set priorities, report status, identify and resolve issues in order to meet business milestones/timelinesReport for management data exchange and transaction activity Qualities desired: Problem-solving and analytical skillsAbility to work on multiple projects concurrentlyAbility to work independently and in a dynamic team structureCommunication skills, ability to understand and communicate technical information to business usersComprehend SDLC process from requirement to production deliveryFamiliar with SQL Queries and running stored procedures Why join Rally? On top of an innovative work atmosphere and a chance to help people change their lives, we offer competitive pay, daily catered lunches, and an extensive benefits package for all full-time employees (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). In addition, offer the ability to grow, while truly making an impact in the healthcare system.  Rally Health is committed to ensuring that its workforce reflects America's diverse population. Rally Health knows that such diversity will enrich us with the talent, energy, perspective and inspiration it needs to achieve its mission. Rally Health believes in a policy of equal employment and opportunity for all people based on merit and commitment to the principles of diversity. It is our policy to recruit, hire, train, and promote individuals in all job titles, and administer all programs, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, sex, age, marital status, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family responsibilities, genetic information, disability, matriculation, political affiliation, veteran status, union affiliation, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  Individuals with disabilities and veterans are encouraged to apply. Applicants who require an accommodation related to the application and/or review process should notify Talent Acquisition (recruiting@rallyhealth.com).

Name: Business Associate - Government Services
Description: THE COMPANY: JUUL's mission is to improve the lives of the world's one billion adult smokers by driving innovation to eliminate cigarettes. JUUL is the number one US-based vapor product. Headquartered in San Francisco and backed by leading technology investors including Tiger Global, Fidelity Investments and Tao Invest LLC, JUUL Labs is disrupting one of the world's largest and oldest industries.  We're an exceptional team with backgrounds in technology, healthcare, CPG and biotech, and we're growing rapidly to deliver on our mission. We're actively looking to hire the world's best scientists, engineers, designers, product managers, supply chain experts, customer service and business professionals. ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES JUUL Labs is seeking a Business Associate who will report directly to our Senior Business Associate or potentially one of our Senior Directors of Business Development (initially) for the Government Services Business Unit. As part of the Government Services team, you will work closely with our leadership to educate government officials, Veterans, VSO's, Military, Public and commercial Health professionals, First Responders and other Federal, State, and Local government personnel about our mission, emphasize JUUL's potential to benefit public health, and craft the best ongoing business development and education and awareness training framework to help ensure mission success. It is our goal to help government personnel and Veterans understand the enduring social and health repercussions cigarettes have around the world and the role JUUL can play in eliminating them.  Primary responsibilities: Assist Senior Business Associate and JUUL's Government Services leadership with Business Analysis, Business Development, marketing, strategic discovery and interpretation of DoD / VA requirements (e.g. battery safety, netted health security, etc.), conferences and events planning and operations, and government sales activitiesAssisting leadership in determining customer key POCs and advocacy priorities, and strategies based upon experience with the VA, DoD and other government and healthcare organizationsResearch and Identify key governmental relationships at the federal, state and local levels, and maintain key government, consultants and partners POCs spreadsheets and databaseProvide ideas for the development of engagement strategies with public health organizations, VA, Defense Health, VSOs and other stakeholder organizationsConduct business research to help leadership craft strategies to convey JUUL's mission, profile and key performance parameters from available e-cigarette public policy research back to federal and local government officials, and other partiesAssist in the preparation of BD and marketing materials for use by Govt Services teamPERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONSIdeal candidate will have over 3 years of experience in government business development, capture management, marketing, events planning and operations, wellness or pharmaceutical sales experienceExperience in healthcare, pharmaceuticals, wellness or fitness, or health systems industries highly desirable (government or commercial)Experience with VA, DoD, Health and Human Services highly desirableOutstanding written and oral communicator who can convey complex government business research and analysis in simple terms to managementAbility to prepare persuasive, simple documents and presentations for use by staffHigh degree of organization and efficiency with demonstrated attention to detailAbility to work both independently and collaborativelyAn entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for making a mark in fast-paced, growing environmentsHighest ethical standards, integrity, authenticity, credibility and characterProfessional demeanour and ability to interact with persuasiveness and confidenceExperience in or with the U.S. military and with technical or medical systems and biomedical or therapeutic devices industries; or health and wellness industriesEDUCATIONAssociates Degree at a minimum but Undergraduate degree preferredJUULLABS PERKS & BENEFITS: Equity or sharesA place to grow in your career, we'll help you set objectives and meet themSupportive team members and hiring managersReferral bonusesCell phone subsidy, commuter benefits and discounts on JUUL productsExcellent medical, dental and vision benefitsJUUL Labs is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression, disability or veteran status. We comply with San Francisco's Fair Chance Ordinance and do not unlawfully discriminate against applicants with criminal convictions.

Name: Project Coordinator/Junior Business Analyst

Although this position allows for telecommuting 2-3 days per week, candidates must reside in the Washington, DC metropolitan area and be able to commute into Washington, DC several times a week for in-person meetings.  In this position, you will be expected to excel under pressure and prove your high value daily. A collaborative and organized approach, ability to influence, exceptional communication skills, and a positive attitude are key requirements.  You will interact with staff at all levels in a fast-paced environment, remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful and efficient. A high level of professionalism and discretion is crucial to this role.  US Citizenship and the ability to obtain a Federal government security clearance is required for this position. offsiteScribe as required to document meeting minutes and action itemsWhere appropriate, support the Business Analyst and Quality Assurance teams in both defining software needs and testing the applicationSupport the production of documents such as agendas, reports, memos, and PowerPoint presentations in a timely and accurate mannerCreate and adjudicate comments, updates, and feedback for a variety of presentations, complex reports, confidential correspondence, and filesCoordinate meeting details (room setup, ordering of food, and other associated tasks)Perform various clerical duties including responding/creating emails, photocopying, mailing, and faxing documentsCreate and handle presentations, complex reports, confidential correspondence, and files REQUIRED SKILLS: US Citizenship and the ability to pass a Federal government clearanceMinimum of four (4) years of experience, assisting in the preparation and analysis of financial reports and the development of complex project schedules.Superb oral and written communication skillsExcellent interpersonal and listening skillsThe ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with changing prioritiesAbility to identify process gaps and initiate improvement opportunities within areas of responsibilityExcellent organizational skills and ability to manage time effectively and efficientlyDemonstrated ability in developing exceptional customer and internal stakeholder relationshipsExcellent PC skills (MS Word, MS Excel, MS Project, MS PowerPoint) PREFERRED SKILLS: Understanding of Federal governmentUnderstanding of Agile Scrum EDUCATION: Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Information Systems, Public Policy, Public Administration, or a related discipline Naturally, TCG does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or anything else that makes you part of any group. We discriminate on the basis of talent, ability, commitment, and experience.  We pay competitive wages and provide excellent benefits. We have a 401K plan, a health plan that includes dental and vision benefits, pet health insurance, support for sick-child daycare, book and fitness clubs, a generous training budget for each employee, employee-led (and TCG paid) social events, company charity events, free theater and sports tickets, and much more.  In fact, in 2018 Fortune magazine named TCG as a "Great Place to Work" for the third year in a row and The Washington Post named TCG as a "Top Workplace" for the fourth straight year, based on how our employees feel about the company, the benefits TCG offers, and the work/life balance that our staff are able to achieve. Name: Business Management Analyst

From requirements analysis, design, and implementation to operations and training TUVA's personnel are well-versed in best practices across Enterprise IT, Mission Support Services, and Specialized Technologies.  The Business management analyst will provide analytical services to coordinate projects more efficiently and develop structured procedures. Conducting research, analyzing financial data, and assisting in preparation to formulate recommendations. Business management analysts identify issues and ways to generate better results by analyzing data from a range of sources. Developing solutions and alternative practices based on the data gathered, in addition to recommending new systems or organizational changes to improve the business. Gather and organize information to be utilized to resolve and or the procedure to be improved performance. Name: Business Requirements Analyst
Description: Primary Responsibility  The Business Requirements Analyst will assist in the development of User Stories with the Product Owner to capture requirements using an Agile software development approach. The candidate shall provide support to collect, identify, define, aggregate, conceptualize, and prioritize strategic and nearer-term requirements. The candidate shall provide requirements support across project team serve as the primary interface between functional staff and information technology staff. Requirements The candidate must have a solid understanding of requirements elicitation using User Story and progressive elaboration. They shall assist in identifying the business areas that require technology and shall assist in applying the appropriate level and type of IT development to support missions and objectives. Support shall be provided in the following areas:  · Review and analyze various business and technical documentation including: business requirements, process flows, system designs, and system requirements  · Support the development of the Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM) to ensure that all requirements are tested, tracked, and maintained throughout the effort  · Develop and document requirements in the form of User Stories  · Assist in the formation of Acceptance Criteria(s)  · Collection and organization of information required for preparation of reports and briefings  · Preparation of documents, including review for completeness of content and consistency with order, style, and terminology standards  · Analytical interpretation of highly specialized technical and analytical information used to compose detailed documentation and reports  · Continuously researching and evaluating new technology that could be exploited to better meet user requirements and support organizational goals and objectives  (255, 255, 255); -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px;'>

Name: Technology Business Management Analyst
Description: Grant Thornton is seeking an Associate to join its Financial Management service line and take an active role in engagement execution, project management and key business development activities.  Grant Thornton Public Sector helps executives and managers at all levels of government maximize their performance and efficiency in the face of ever tightening budgets and increased demand for services. We give clients creative, cost-effective solutions that enhance their acquisition, financial, human capital, information technology, data analytics, and performance management. For more information, visit grantthornton.com/publicsector.  At Grant Thornton, our professional staff applies traditional, cutting-edge approaches and methods to a variety of analyses. As part of our team, the Associate will utilize various methodologies and models to execute client projects. ESSENTIAL DUTIES:Work closely with client to shift to a Technology Business Management (TBM) framework to help manage IT spending as well as make changes to the Activity Based Costing (ABC) models.Provide guidance on transitioning existing ABC work done to date into a new TBM specific software solution.Provide recommendations for implementing and configuring the chosen software solution and transition the existing ABC data into the new software.Import and validate current available ABC data and model methodology, including mappings and allocations.Build and disseminate standards dashboards and ad-hoc reports as needed in order to satisfy client requirements to ensure budget and accounting process map to TBM.Maintain ABC data added to models and add additional ABC data as it becomes available.Assess data and report gaps.Develop a TBM roadmap for generating and enhancing the most important data sets first and eventually all necessary data sets as identified by the client.Gather new data for inclusion into models and monitor role-based access privileges.Utilize mastery of Technology Business Management framework and knowledge of Activity Based Costing (ABC) models.Meet or exceed targeted billing hours (utilization).Assist with business development activities, such as proposals, capture, account teams, whitepapers, conferences, and/or other thought leadership materials.Experience with Technology Business Management (TBM) frameworks and Activity Based Costing (ABC) models.Experience providing guidance on transitioning ABC data to new TBM specific software solutions.4-5 plus years of relevant/specialized experienceBachelor degree in Finance, Accounting, IT is required.Masters degree or relevant certification also preferred.At least 2-3 years’ federal business consulting experienceBachelor’s Degree required from an accredited college or university in a related field.Ability to obtain and maintain certain job-related certifications if no job-related advanced degrees.U.S. citizenship may be required. Ability to work in the United States indefinitely required.Travel may be required.Ability to work overtime required on occasion.Ability to sit in an office environment for long periods of time.Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance.Ability to communicate clearly in writing and verbally.Ability to obtain and maintain firm independence and abide by firm ethics requirements.Meet or exceed continuing professional education (CPE) requirements. Grant Thornton LLP is the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International, one of the six global accounting, tax and business advisory organizations. Grant Thornton’s Public Sector, based in Alexandria, VA, is a global management consulting business with the mission of providing responsive and innovative financial, performance management and systems solutions to governments and international organizations. Visit Grant Thornton’s Public Sector at www.grantthornton.com/publicsector.  It is Grant Thornton’s policy to promote equal employment opportunities. All personnel decisions, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, benefits and termination, are made without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Name: Agile Business Analyst
Description: Overview: IntelliWare is an award-winning business with an immediate opening for skilled Agile Business Analysts to support a federal agency. The Agile Business Analyst will assist in Product Owner engagement, backlog management, and acceptance criteria definition. The Agile Business Analyst will also serve as a knowledgeable resource in advising the Scrum Team on tools and techniques to improve the development, collection, analysis, and reporting of information. The project is focused on the development of the TSA Technology Infrastructure Modernization (TIM) program. Work location is in Calverton, MD with some travel to Annapolis Junction, MD. Clearance: None. Must be a U.S. Citizen. Responsibilities: Analyze broadly-defined high-level epics, capabilities, and features to create a well-organized, value-driven framework to provide the required business value in the Product Backlog.Work with Scrum Master/ scrum team to write individual user stories and acceptance criteria that are clear, concise, and easy to understand and implement/ test by the development/ test team.Identify related user stories and epics, group them into themes as necessary and document the interrelationship and associated business process flows as necessary (coordination with the business process modeler).Assist Scrum Master in facilitating sprint planning sessions, reviews, and retrospectives.Serve as the Product Owner and facilitate communication with the developers and testers on assigned Scrum Team.Ability to enhance team spirit; proficient in teamwork -- coordination, collaboration, facilitation, and information sharing.Possess excellent oral and written communication, problem solving, and diplomatic skill sets.Must be detail oriented, self-starter, able to work independently without constant direction.Ability and willingness to work with challenging clients and provide effective communication for successful architecture development.Required Skills and Qualifications:3 – 5 years of functional experience as a business analyst on projects focused on Agile software development.2 years of experience writing user stories/ acceptance criteria and maintaining Scrum backlogs.Experience in Agile/Scrum and in supporting Agile efforts.Excellent organizational and communication skills.Ability to work effectively independently and with a team.Proficient in MS Office suite.Agile Certification (PM/PO, Agilist, Scrum Master, etc.).Bachelor Degree in IT, Business, or Management OR 5 years of broad/diverse background and experience in business analysis, functional requirements management, IT systems test and evaluation, and/or IT operations.IT testing and evaluation skills is preferred.Location: Calverton, MD. Some travel to Annapolis Junction, MD, will be required. Company Profile: IntelliWare is a privately-owned company founded to provide business and technical services to government and commercial clients. Our business philosophy is to hire the brightest, yet humble, people we can find and provide them with the team, training, and support they need to exceed our customers’ mission requirements. Our experienced, cleared, and professional workforce receives compensation and benefits that are intended to be among the best in our industry.

Name: Accenture Flex - Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job descriptionAccenture Flex offers you the flexibility of fixed duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE’s 100 Best Companies to Work For and DiversityInc’s Top 50 Companies for Diversity lists.  As an Accenture Flex employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture’s clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today’s biggest business challenges. You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programsA Business Systems Analyst is responsible for driving the functional design and delivery of technology-based business solutions. They own the definition of business requirements and the functional design of major components of a software application. They have some management-level responsibility for the solution and are often responsible for supervising the day-to-day efforts of a small team of less experienced business systems analysts working on smaller components of the overall application development. A Business Systems Analyst Level 2 must be able to define and communicate project standards and guidelines around the application design, as well as understand generally accepted System Development Life Cycle methodology. This individual will often lead meetings with business owners to define application requirements, will help define and structure new system processes, and must have knowledge around system building concepts, technical architecture, program/project management, and application quality assurance. As a Business System Analyst specific responsibilities may include:· Ownership for gathering, refining and prioritizing requirements from product manager and/or business owners through meetings, questionnaires or interviews· Assess current business systems and define work items to identify and implement functional requirements· Translate business requirements into systemic requirements and detailed functional designs· Assist project management with definition of scope and management of application architectural designs· Maintain deep familiarity with systems development lifecycle· Work with development and test teams to ensure completeness and feasibility of functional specifications· Ensure business owners have understanding of design approach and system functionality to attain business sign-off· Assist project management with articulation of work level, estimating order of magnitude, and identifying resource requirements· Work with project team members to troubleshoot and resolve system issues in a timely manner· Organize and lead change management and issue resolution meetings with product management, test, and development teams+ Basic qualificationsBasic Qualifications: Bachelor's DegreeMinimum of 3 years of IT Business Analysis with Banking experienceMinimum of 3 years Business Analysis with Agile, Scrum, Data Analysis experience and UML experienceProfessional Skill Requirements:Excellent interpersonal skillsExcellent communication skillsBe able to drive/display ownership/proactive behaviorShould be able to communicate effectively in English (Oral and Written) across a broad spectrum of cultural differencesShould be able to communicate effectively in the local language (Oral and Written) across a broad spectrum of cultural differences, where required Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.  Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.  Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.  Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status

OBIM HART is a 4 year program valued at $100M to provide DHS with an enhanced, scalable, modular and multimodal identity management system.Roles and Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:Set up cost control system, and monitor and control costs on contracts Perform analyses and prepare reports in order to ensure contracts are within the negotiated and agreed-upon parameters and government cost control guidelinesPrepare budgets for contract work and perform or assist in financial analyses such as funding profiles, sales outlook, and variance analysis Responsible for ensuring adequate funding availability by maintaining accurate records of expenditures.RELOCATION ASSISTANCE IS NOT AVAILABLE FOR THIS REQUISITION.Basic Qualifications: To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below:Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, or related area with 3 year experience - OR - Master's degree with 1 year of experienceStrong PC skills required with high level of Excel skills, specifically ability to insert pivot table, vlookups, and conditional formatting, etc.Prior financial analysis and/or reporting experience especially in regards to procurementStrong communication skills and ability to prioritize requirementsAbility to obtain and maintain a Secret level security clerance is required. US Citizenship is a prerequisite. Name: Associate Business Analyst
Description: Job Title: ​Associate Business Analyst Department/Division: Scholarships and Programs Location: Washington, DCJob DescriptionThe Associate Business Analyst plays an essential role on the Scholarships and Programs Operations team, providing day-to-day support and maintenance for the Salesforce (STAR), Enterprise Scholarship Application (ESA), and related systems. The Associate Business Analyst also supports internal and external constituents and works collaboratively with the Senior Business Analyst to identify, document, prioritize, and resolve related system issues.  The Associate Business Analyst is a self-starter and focused team player, with a unique ability to delineate user system requirements and processes and translate those requirements and processes into user-friendly solutions. The Associate Business Analyst is a naturally curious investigative problem-solver, focused on supporting Scholarships and Programs Operations technology in maximizing its current system-related business processes to ensure system maturation and user productivity. The position requires strong verbal and written communication skills, as well as demonstrated interest in supporting and cultivating the transformation scholar/award data into powerful information to be leveraged by UNCF stakeholders to increase overall scholarship program management efficiency and effectiveness.Responsibilities and DutiesSupports Salesforce (STAR) Platform: Provides assistance and user support for the Salesforce CRM and related third-party solutions managementProficiency in, or knowledge of Salesforce administrative tasks including, and not limited to, profiles, roles, security, workflows, validation rules, approvals, formulas, custom objects, reports, and dashboardsSupports email solutions (including, but not limited to, Vertical Response and Mailgun)Supports report, dashboard, and list view configurations for Scholarships and Programs end-usersSupports Scholarships and Programs reports using various reporting tools and technologiesConducts and supports routine data clean-up tasks following best practices to ensure data integrity, including, but not limited to, de-duping, address updates, and related data clean-upAssists in training staff and end-users and participates in creating documentation, user manuals related to the use of Salesforce Supports home-grown Enterprise Scholarship Application (ESA) system: Monitors, tracks, and documents system performanceAnalyzes user-reported bugs and researches issues for potential root-cause(s) system issuesProvides system maintenance and quality assurance to ensure user satisfactionSupports regular system upgrades, patch management and user acceptance testing (UAT)Assists in user training and participates in creating documentation, user manuals, and artifactsRequirementsBachelor's degree from four-year college or university;IT Project Management preferred, and minimum three years of experience in related field ​Additional RequirementsSelf-starter with a passion for business process analysis, data management/stewardshipAbility to work collaboratively cross-organizationally as well as independentlyNaturally curious, investigative problem-solver and capable researcherFamiliarity or experience working closely within team settings in a non-profit or similar organizationProficiency with report design and developmentAbility to prepare and present analysis in a professional formatExperience with and an ability to adjust to new IT solutions and platformsTo ApplyClick here

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Title: Business Analyst  Location: Sterling, VA  Type of Employment: Full Time  Salary: DOE + full benefits "As of June 17, 2018, we ranked 11th as one of the Washington Post Top 150 Workplaces" “An REI BA materializes customer's wishes by helping the customer know what they really want opposed to what they think they want. We need you to be ready to contribute in a fast paced, solution oriented, agile environment. At REI, we're looking for a BA who’s done the impossible so many times, it's second nature to them!  As a BA at REI, you'll work with some of the best-known government agencies, such as GSA, NASA, HRSA and DARPA, you'll even have the opportunity to work with State and local government! You can be an Business Analyst anywhere, but at REI your analysis is transformational. You'll have the chance to work with some of our Influence the solution at the company that was ranked 7th in 2016 Washington's Post Top Workplace.” "REI Systems is an Equal Opportunity Employer (Minority/Female/Disability/Vet)" Opportunity Requires: You should be a highly motivated, self-driven professional.You will work closely with clients to elicit and understand business needs, define requirements, write user stories, groom product backlog and develop prototypes for the proposed solution.You will be challenged and expected to work in an agile team environment.Your effectiveness is determined by the quality of your participation, which includes, idea generation, creativity, problem solving, documentation and communication abilities. As the Business Analyst, you will study existing business processes, programs and/or legacy systems in their native environments and perform a comprehensive analysis of existing problems and understand the areas for improvement. One of the key responsibilities of this role is to thoroughly understand the business process and propose solution concepts that can address and meet the stated business needs. You are a partner to our clients and as such expected to understand their mission and how we can make an impact!  Your day to day: At customer system functional reviews, you will facilitate reconciliation of differences voiced by the customer with those in the system proposal reducing scope creep or impacts to the delivered system’s quality.In the office, you will contribute in analysis and design of the proposed solutions while facilitating the development of multiple solution options to address the business needs.At system implementation meetings with test engineers and developers, you will ensure both teams understand the customers functional and technical requirements so the desired customer features are what is built, reliable and delivered.You will also Identify and understand customer expectations as part of the requirements gathering process and act as the primary point of contact for all communication needs during the requirements gathering phase with the customer.At customer status meetings, you will ensure that previous customer program decisions are reviewed, new ones are recorded with stakeholder participating to maintain program focus of extended efforts and continuity if customer or company personnel changes occur.You will lead agile ceremonies such as product backlog grooming, scrum and release planning ceremoniesYou will prepare project documentation like meeting minutes, business process documents and other process workflow diagrams as required. What you bring to the team: Positive Attitude. Self-Motivation. Curious Creativity. Personal Desire.3 - 5 years of experience working with an Agile implementation team writing user stories, grooming product backlog, planning out release planningExperience with full software development life cycle of Agile IT projects.Hands-on experience with MS Office, especially Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPointRelevant experience working with web based applications and modern web technologiesExcellent Communication, Interpersonal and presentation skills Education and Training Bachelor’s degree in business and management, human resources, information systems, computer science, or another related fieldMaster’s degree in related field may be substituted for three years’ experienceEmployer will accept a suitable combination of education, training or experienceprovided by Dice Agile Implementation, User stories, Product backlog, software development, Web based applications, web technologies, US/GC Highly preferred

Name: Business Analyst IV
Description: THE COMPANY Fannie Mae provides reliable, large-scale access to affordable mortgage credit in communities across our nation. We are the leading source of funding for housing in America, which means more people can buy or rent a home. We are focused on sustaining the housing recovery, improving our company, and leading change to make housing better.  Join our diverse, high-performing team and make a difference as we work together to enable access to a good home.  For more information about Fannie Mae, visit http://www.fanniemae.com/progress JOB INFORMATION Examine, assess, and document business operations and procedures of operating for administrative unit. Relate these procedures to IT/IS systems and applications that are designed to enable the operating unit to accomplish its objectives. Assist operating unit staff by developing reports, downloads, and analyses from discipline-specific systems and applications. Provide input to IT/IS specialists in development projects to assist in developing specifications and functionalities in IT systems. KEY JOB FUNCTIONSAssess business operations and processes of assigned office or business unit to identify inefficiencies in procedures, information flows and handoffs, decisions, communications pathways and ways in which systems supporting these can be enhanced.Participate in meetings and projects with client staff, project managers, and developers to automate, upgrade, or expand applications that accomplish business operations of assigned work unit(s).Create, design, and format technical specifications including descriptive text, process flows, and other information needed to describe required system changes for development, QA, and other units; serve on project team accomplishing these functions.Provide support to applications in production by tracking production problems and troubleshooting them to sustain application in production.Develop queries, analyses, or reports from applications for operations or management staff of assigned business unit(s), or develop specifications for such queries or analyses to be performed by others.Serve as team, project, or technical lead in project involving definition of business processes or development of technical/business specifications for new or modified business management or operational software.EDUCATIONBachelor's Degree or equivalent requiredMINIMUM EXPERIENCE6 years of related experienceSPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLSExcellent Power Point skills.Ability to distill large amounts of information into summary level and make recommendations based on the research.Excellent writing skills.Experience with developing different types of reports (status, informational, analytical, other).Ability to come up to speed quickly on previously unknown topics.Excellent organizational skills.EMPLOYMENT As a condition of employment with Fannie Mae, any successful job applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment drug screen and to successfully complete a background investigation.  Fannie Mae is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Business/Financial Management Analyst
Description: LS Technologies, LLC is seeking a Business/Financial Management Analyst to support LS Technologies, LLC Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) customer located in Washington, D.C. The individual will manage and track financial aspects for all budget appropriations, authorizations, obligations, and expenditures, to include both Facilities and Equipment (F&E) and Operations funding sources. Responsibilities:Maintains control and oversight of the formulation and execution activities; to include requirements gathering, analysis, classification, prioritization, distribution, funds certification, financial tracking, and reporting.Analyzes trends and developments in planning, programming, and budget execution in order to develop recommendations concerning the execution of a number of separate and substantive program accounts. Provides expert guidance, instruction, and recommendations to address diverse, complex issues that often cross organizational boundaries.Identifies and resolves challenging problems or issues that may span multiple projects or programs and may involve or affect more than one Directorate, Line of Business, or Service Unit.Performs budget and planning integration in support of efficient management and fiscally responsible business operations. Projects consolidated short and long-term needs; prepares budget justifications and financial plans; justifies resource requirements in order to meet cost performance goals.Identifies and analyzes the financial impacts of various projects, programs, and plans. Makes recommendations to accurately allocate and re-allocate staffing and budget resources accordingly in order to maintain effective organizational performance and avoid anti-deficiency status.Conducts comparative financial analyses, financial modeling and forecasting, and other statistical qualitative studies to provide trends, projections, and recommendations.Establishes financial goals, timetables, milestones, and other criteria to measure program achievement.Requirements10 or more years of experience as a business or financial management analystExperience with DELPHI and PRISMExperience with FAA NAS systems strongly preferred;Experience or ability to conduct integrated analysis of:Operational and business shortfalls,Trade space and alternatives,Outcomes and benefits realization,Overarching risk to achieving outcomesMust possess exceptional analytical, writing and communication skills;Strong attention to detail, well organized and ability to self-prioritize multiple activities is required;Ability to effectively initiate action, collaborate with others, and drive action items to resolution;Proficiency in developing and presenting, both verbally and in writing, technical information and presentations to non-technical audiences;Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Name: Business Data Analyst
Description: Responsibilities : Lead elicitation sessions and gather and analyze business requirements with product owners and other business stakeholders. Analyze new data sources of structured/semi-structured and unstructured data for integration into the application. Analyze existing data sources to assess the impact of new requirements. Perform feasibility studies and assess potential technologies, as needed. Create and document functional requirements including process flows, data movement from source to target destinations, and related table/data definitions and transformations. Design and document end-to-end solutions, translating and allocating all functional requirements into an appropriate design for data integration working with the Data Architects, Developers, and QA and BI Ops teams. Set up and facilitate cross-functional requirements and design sessions. Track and drive approval of requirements and design documents. Guide development staff through the software development lifecycle providing insight into the functional requirements and solution design. Support the project’s broader vision, goals and objectives. Understand interdependencies between the project teams and activities and provide input on priorities, dependencies, tasks/effort required, and risks. Coordinate activities with internal teams and partners. Look for opportunities to improve team’s development processes and deliverable to support decreasing time to market and overall system maintainability. Required Skills: At least ten (10) years of experience as a Business Analyst/Data Analyst 3+ years of experience with Teradata, Oracle, SQL Server or similar database platform Solid experience with writing technical and functional requirements Strong capabilities understanding data models and rules as related to supporting business and functional requirements Strong capabilities using Visio, PowerPoint, Excel, and SQL Query tools Solid experience on Data warehouse and/or BI projects Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related course of study required or equivalent work experience. Preferred Experience: Previous experience in marketing campaign management and reporting/BI - provided by DiceData Analysis, Teradata, Oracle, SQL Server, SQL Queries, Data warehousing, Business intelligence, requirements gathering, etc.

Name: Business Analyst Associate
Description: Business Analyst Associate Location  Washington, DC Department  Registry & BI Product DevelopmentApply NowWELCOME TO THE ACC! We are a 52,000-member nonprofit medical society and teaching institute, dedicated to enhancing the lives of cardiovascular patients through continuous quality improvement, patient-centered care, payment innovation and professionalism. We bestow credentials upon cardiovascular specialists who meet our stringent qualifications, provide professional education and operate national registries for the measurement and improvement of quality care. Above all, our commitment to our members and our patients has driven the College to be a leader in the formulation of health policy, standards and guidelines, and a steadfast supporter of cardiovascular research.  Named as one of Modern Healthcare’s Best Places to Work in Healthcare for the third year in a row, we offer satisfying and challenging work that makes a real difference in people's lives. We offer a collaborative environment where the contributions of our team members are recognized and where you can achieve professional growth and personal fulfillment. JOB OVERVIEW: Our team members have the opportunity to partner with doctors, hospitals, and other cardiovascular healthcare providers to ensure everyone has access to healthier lifestyle choices and proper healthcare. We are a critical component that enables our business lines to connect with communities of professionals who make a lifesaving impact every day. Our main focus is on supporting our customers who use our off the shelf and custom built applications. As a key member of our team, you will communicate internally with product managers, internal and third-party developers, as well as internal and external customers who use our products and services. Your efforts will be instrumental to drive strategy around future product releases and product evolution to add value for our end users. In this role, you will:Bring best practice and commitment to problem solving including skills to diagnose, evaluate and resolve complex problems and queries, and escalate as appropriate according to defined processes.Elicit stakeholder requirements using interviews, document analysis, workshops, and workflow analysis.Possess the ability to distill information based on specific user/business needs as well as decompose high level requirements into detailed functional requirements.Capture, define, analyze and translate functional and non-functional business requirements into activity diagrams, system use cases and supplemental specifications that contribute to effective software development.Create wireframes and/or mock-ups to graphically represent the functionality.Create specification in the form of pseudocode for developing clinical metrics used to measure the quality of the patient care.Coordinate requirements walk-through and sign-offs, verifying with user representatives/stakeholders that use cases and process models accurately portray specific business needs.Contribute towards defining best practices, processes, and standards in an effort to continuously improve efficiency within the business analysis discipline.Work with the quality assurance team to validate system acceptance and user acceptance test plans and test scripts to ensure error free applications, tools and reports. Assists in analyzing testing results throughout the project.Work closely with the technical team to ensure functional requirements are accurate and complete. Ensure detail design documents accurately reflect customer needs and expectations.Other duties as assigned.Essential knowledge, skills and abilities:Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.Manage changing priorities within a fast-paced dynamic environment.A willingness, desire and aptitude to learn new technologies.Excellent analytical skills and ability to gather and analyze business process data.Demonstrated innovation and creativity in problem solving.Attention to detail and delivery of quality artifacts.Ability to work independently, proactive problem solving.Strive to meet client expectations and customer satisfaction.Preferred education and experience:Bachelor’s degree withKnowledge of Healthcare industry and medical terminology.5 + years of general business analysis experience and requirements documentation.2+ years of experience in Use Case diagramming, Business Process Mapping, Sequence and Activity diagramming, and UML required.2+ years working with large datasets/databases.Ability to understand and/or write XML.The American College of Cardiology (ACC), a 52,000-member nonprofit medical society, is dedicated to enhancing the lives of cardiovascular patients through continuous quality improvement, patient-centered care,payment innovation andprofessionalism. The ACC provides professional education and operates national registries for the measurement and improvement of quality care.ACC offers competitive salaries and excellent benefits, including a generous retirement plan, commuting subsidies, flexible work schedules, and more. For more information, please visit www.acc.org/jobsACC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. EOE/AA including Vets and Disabled.

Name: Senior Business Analyst

The Division partners with stakeholders across GW to equip students, staff and faculty with the technology know-how and tools necessary to achieve academic excellence. Reporting to the Assistant Director, Mobile & Web Development, the Senior Business Analyst works within the Division's Mobile & Web Services department.  The Senior Business Analyst will help support the roadmap for Mobile & Web Development services by collaborating across the Division and external stakeholders. Along those lines, this position will be responsible for the following duties: Serve as a subject matter expert for Workflow and Integration tools which aid the university community.Work to gather, document, and communicate requirements and assist in the execution of the tasks related to SharePoint service improvement and workflow efforts.Assist in assessing new technologies as they relate to Business Process Automation technologies and frameworks that support the enterprise and improve the overall customer and employee experience.Applies a strong knowledge of the Microsoft SharePoint platform in support and improvement of the enterprise SharePoint service.Help develop relationships across the University to establish a community of users to maximize the understanding and application of the SharePoint environment. The position is based at GW's Virginia Science & Technology campus in Ashburn, VA but may require travel to the Foggy Bottom campus located in Washington, DC. The incumbent may perform other related duties as assigned. The omission of specific duties does not preclude the supervisor from assigning duties that are logically related to the position. Degree must be conferred by the start date of the position. Degree requirements may be substituted with an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. (e.g. Bamboo, Nintex)Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with stakeholders, testers, end users, and developers to develop, refine, and communicate requirements.Excellent written and oral communication skills.Experience supporting full software development lifecycle (business process, requirements, design, development, testing, deployment, training) Typical Hiring Range $66,900 - $106,900 How is pay for new employees determined at GW?SDL2017

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Overview Every day at Employer, we enable hundreds of thousands of people to take on our nations most important work. Were a company founded on a diverse set of capabilities and skills, bound together by a single promise: we never stop solving our nations most complex challenges. Our team of engineers, analysts, developers, investigators, integrators and architects work tirelessly to create innovative solutions. We continually push ourselvesto respond, to adapt, to go further. To look ahead to the changing landscape and develop new and innovative ways to serve our customers.  Employer works with U.S. government customers in defense, intelligence, civilian, health care, and state and local markets. Our high-caliber employees are rewarded in many waysnot only through competitive salaries and benefits packages, but the opportunity to create a meaningful impact in jobs and on projects that matter.  Employers talented and robust workforce14,000 strongstands ready to welcome you to the team. Lets make an impact together.  Employer is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled and other protected categoriesResponsibilitiesAir Force Business - Capabilities Lifecycle Management (B-CLM) Projects supports Office of the Deputy Under Secretary of the Air Force, Management and Deputy Chief Management Office (SAF/MG) in developing more effective and efficient ways to support Air Force business operations and refine the development of Defense Business System (DBS) requirements supporting the Business Mission Area (BMA) Information Technology (IT). This position will support SAF/MG's business mission transformation efforts seeking to make the USAFs organize, train, and equip responsibilities more effective for our warfighter through the development and adoption of more efficient business/mission practices and performance measures. Additionally SAF/MG is responsible for guiding the Air Force to reduce overall cost of operations consistent with direction from the Office of the Secretary of Defense and the Office of Management and Budget.  The depth of support required for an individual project can range across a collection of skills (from Master Black Belt to data capture experts) and span varied timeframes (weeks to months) for individually chartered projects. Projects will often involve defining information requirements and information technology requirements to acquire enabling capabilities. Work performed under this contract may have associated specialty government or contract support skills assisting in a project, with expectation of complementary action and effective teaming to successfully improve processes and performance within Air Force core mission areas.  The Black Belt is a recognized authority across multiple areas of expertise. Provide leadership at a high technical and programmatic level for teams to accomplish customer sponsored projects, including new program development. Leadership comprises problem definition, identification of avenues of approach, identification of applicable resources, and execution of tasks within the project. Black Belt facilitators will be capable of mentorship and facilitation of moderate to highly complex problem-solving using diverse methods and tools with a focus on achieving needed customer outcomes. Works with Functional SMEs to understand business processes. Capable to evaluate the current state and identify the areas of improvement. Participates in workshops and captures Business Process Activities, Business Rules, Information Assets, IT Functional Requirements and Transformation Actions. Collaborates with SMEs to sanitize and finalize requirements. Documents requirements in the form of Scenarios and Use Cases. Enters and conducts analysis activities on requirements. Identify Measures of Effectiveness and Measures of Performance for Business Process Activities. Schedule meetings, workshops and facilitates collaboration between different Functionals. Manages review and approval of deliverables.  Specific responsibilities: Conduct process improvement facilitation using structured problem solving methods (from continual process improvement to major business process re-engineering)Utilize advanced methods of developing and managing enterprise level and enterprise-wide organizational strategic alignment and deploymentDrive organizational change managementPerform project managementPerform process modeling and related data captureQualificationsBlack Belt (BB) certification with experience in continual improvement methods to facilitate and mentor major initiatives. Methods to be used span Lean Six Sigma, Business Process Re-engineering, Theory of Constraints, and/or other Structure Problem Solving methodologies. Must have experience chartering projects, working with Champion/Sponsor to define scope & deliverables, and lead teams using DMAIC, DMADV, and other approaches as appropriate. Candidate is required to have experience in MS Visio, iGraphx, or other process modeling tools to document current and future state processes and possess a minimum of two years of process improvement facilitation experience.  The selected candidate will also have experience in developing effective performance metrics and measurements, to align with strategic priorities and performance standards, to include governance methods to assure performance objectives are met. Project and/or program management experience is required.PMI PMP certification is desired. Knowledge or experience with Air Force Services Development and Delivery Process (SDDP)/BCAC and various Change Management techniques is a plus.  Relevant experience, including supervisory, project management experience, and facilitation expertise leading/working requirement definition for Information Technology projects. Candidate must have a minimum of 5 years experience with a Bachelor's degree or 3 years of experience with a Master's degree. The Business Analyst 4 requires a Master Black Belt certification and over five years of industry experience transforming large international corporations in the application of lean principles, methodologies, and tools including modernization of supporting business systems. Options

Name: Business Development Operations Analyst
Description: A World-Changing CompanyAt Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.The RoleAs a Business Development Operations Analyst, you do more than just support our leaders; you track and stabilize projects, remove roadblocks, and anticipate needs to free up your team to focus their time and attention on the problems they are best equipped to solve. This position requires a combination of administrative, project management, process optimization, and execution skills.In this role, you will be responsible for handling a variety of professional and personal administrative responsibilities such as: expenses, travel, and calendaring. You leverage your strength in organization and thrive off of enabling the people you support to be as productive and impactful as possible. You maintain incredible accuracy and flexibility when completing any given task and are committed to seeing every project through to its completion. You take ownership and step up when things go wrong; even if a problem is outside your area of expertise, you make the first move to fix it.Communication is one of your greatest strengths and you excel at constructing order out of chaos.You will also be responsible for driving projects forward and owning their outcomes, either via delegation or direct ownership. You will need to be innovative, self-motivated, collaborative, and capable of dealing with complex interpersonal dynamics. You will be a part of a team of talented individuals who are just as passionate about supporting one another as they are about Palantir’s mission. You thrive in situations with many different people and many different points of view. You're open to new ideas and not afraid to learn from failure.Ability to learn new skills and technologies to deliver the most effective solutions, and break down technical work into pieces that you both understand and can re-articulate to others.Extraordinary judgment and composure in high-pressure situations.Ability to recognize inefficiencies and compensate on-the-fly across your own projects or those owned by people you supportMeticulous attention to detail, including maintaining accurate records and diligently tracking key project metrics.Enthusiasm for supporting internal projects and senior leadership, bringing order and efficiency to critical internal initiatives.Strong organization skills with an ability to adapt, navigate complexity, and multitask in a rapidly changing environment.Extraordinary communication, teamwork and interpersonal skills.Excellent computer skills, proficiency with Microsoft products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)Palantir is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Name: Business Analyst II
Description: JOB INFORMATION Examine, assess, and document business operations and procedures of a financial management, product, or trading unit. Relate these procedures to IT/IS systems and applications that are designed to enable the operating unit to accomplish its objectives. Assist operating unit staff by developing reports, downloads, and analyses from discipline-specific systems and applications. Provide input to IT/IS specialists in development projects to assist in developing specifications and functionalities in financial IT systems. KEY JOB FUNCTIONSAssess procedures and business processes in a financial management, accounting, transactional, or business operations unit for methods of automating them or improving existing applications supporting them.Participate in meetings with financial management, Accounting, or product management staff and application developers and project managers to plan development or upgrades of applications used by their offices or business units.Participate in planning testing and acceptance of newly developed financial management software by client group who will be using it.May provide support to applications in production by tracking and troubleshooting problems and ensuring continued and efficient operation of application in production, and full access by its users.Develop queries, analyses, or reports from financial management applications for operations or management staff of assigned business unit.Qualifications:EDUCATIONBachelor's Degree or equivalent requiredMINIMUM EXPERIENCE2+ years of related experienceSPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS2+ years of related requirements/analysis experienceExcellent communication skills (written and verbal)Ability to document highly complex business processesAbility to translate high level business requirements into functional and system requirementsWork with development teams to create or refine design documentation.Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, Finance, Economics or related fieldExcellent knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)/ & Agile methodologyKnowledge of requirement tools, such as DOORS, JIRA , desiredStrong analytical skillsAt least one of the two required:Technical knowledge and experience such as programming (Web Services, C++, Java, SAS, Hadoop, Python or R)Financial Mortgage Industry experience / Secondary Mortgage experience such as accounting, pricing, valuation, loss allowance, loss forecast or home price forecast

Name: Watson Health - Business Analyst Lead
Description: Job Description As a Lead Business Analyst, you will provide subject matter expertise both internally and externally to the data warehouse center of excellence and customers alike. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand their problems, and find innovative solutions for the broader market. You must be able to communicate with all areas of the company. You will work with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements. You may be asked to travel as is necessary. You will oversee day-to-day activities of the business analyst team responsible for specifying business requirements to support the technical design and application development of healthcare reporting solutions. Essential Responsibilities:Lead a multi-disciplinary team of Business Analysts in a rapid and ever changing business environment.Lead the customer through steps of Agile/Iterative Methodology associated with the delivery of BI solutions; Requirements, Design, Development, System Test, User Acceptance Test and OperationsResponsible for facilitating customer Requirement Analysis Sessions (RAS) and is responsible for capturing and documenting customer business process models (BPM)Acts as a representative from the business area and to identify and refine their requirements for information, informing the creation of a warehouse data modelInteracts with functional users and data stewards/SME to ensure that all the proper questions have been identified and answered satisfactorilyClarify issues relating to scope and business requirements for project team (including technical implementation team, project management and client management)Assists Quality Assurance team with development, execution, and documentation of test casesWorks to identify and document data quality issuesAssists Data Modelers and Data Analysts in assuring requirements are traceable between the source data and target tables/entities in the respective data modelsLeads RAS sessions with clientsWorks with Implementation and Development leads to translate and map business requirements to technical requirements/specificationsDefines scope of work for work proposed to meet business requirementsDefine business requirements for change requests, investigate issues/defects and define remediation requirementsOversee the day to day activities of the Business Analysis team including but not limited to assignments, scheduling, performance evaluationPlays a role in the accounts leadership team, communicating across technical and delivery towers, in support of the Account Executive's ability to deliver on the contract requirements. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Ability to work on site in Santa Fe, NM 5 days a week3-5+ years of experience with Medicaid10+ years experience as business analyst for data warehouse OR business intelligence projects.Experience with large scale system development.Demonstrated ability to understand industry issues and problems, relate them to clients' needs, and propose appropriate solutionsExcellent organization skills, ability to take initiative and work independently or as a member of a small team.Excellent interpersonal skills and relationship building, ability to collaborate and build consensusDesire to continue learning more about healthcare and the technologies supporting healthcare dataStrong presenter, comfortable presenting in front of customers, conveying status, answering Q&ADemonstrated ability to convey complex ideas in an easily understood manner to guide audience through written or verbal communications Preferred Tech and Prof Experience PREFERRED Skills and Experience:Previous experience as a business analyst working with software developersKnowledgeable in technology, specifically data warehousingCompetent in at least one BI technology (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, Tableau)Competent in at least one analytics technology (e.g. SAS, R, SPSS)Competent in at least on geospatial technology (e.g. mapinfo, ESRI)Understanding of both technical and business process MITA requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Entry level business analyst
Description: Business analysts are sometimes referred to as management analysts, business continuity planners or business operations specialists. A business analyst identifies and analyzes an organization's business processes for the purposes of building a software application or platform, improving productivity, minimizing risk or waste, or developing a new product or service line. Business analysts must interface with several departments and job titles to glean information about how a process operates, and analysts are often involved in high-level discussions with company owners, clients, upper management and other important stakeholders.  FOR MORE INFORMATION PLEASE CALL: 773 770 6307  Email: denver@staffigo.com  Job Description/Responsibilities:  Strategy & Planning  Assist in the planning, design and development of new applications and enhancements to existing applications.  Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end-users to define business requirements and systems goals, and identify and resolve business systems issues.  Ensure compatibility and interoperability of in-house computing systems.  Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.  Acquisition & Deployment  Assist in the deployment of new applications and enhancements to existing applications.  Create system design proposals.  Perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions.  Create systems models, specifications, diagrams and charts to provide direction to system programmers.  Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems.  Provide orientation and training to end-users for all modified and new systems.  Other duties as assigned.  Qualifications:  Masters Degree in Information Technology.  Must have good knowledge in Finance, Banking, Insurance, Retail or Healthcare and/or benefit administration is a plus.  Excellent writing/documentation, communication, analysis and organizational skills required.  Strong aptitude in both business and technology.  Self-starter with excellent organizational and time management skills.  Fast learner, quality consciousness and committed to deadlines.

Name: Salesforce Sr. Business Analyst
Description: At Rainmaker Associates, we are problem solvers. We’re passionate about helping people solve problems and overcome challenges so that they can achieve their potential.We take initiative and own the problemWe take the customer’s success personally and advocate for them (even though they may fight it)We value hard work and smart thinkingWe team up with each other, our customers and our partners We love to make an impact, to leave our mark, to take on a challenge, to master something new, to “figure it out”, to muscle through  We hate futility & monotony, to waste clients’ money, to leave the job undone, when we point out the cliff and they jump off!  If you share these values, then you can be a Rainmaker!  The Salesforce Business Analyst (BA) facilitates requirements gathering sessions to gain an understanding of our customer's current state processes and technology and the implementation work that follows. As part of the project team, they will discover our customer's current pain points, and uncover gaps in process and CRM best practices. From the discovery the BA will work with their team to design a solution and be responsible for developing an implementation plan in the form of user stories, conduct customer reviews to obtain approvals. The BA should be able to produce detailed business cases, process diagrams, wireframes and other context diagrams.A Certified Salesforce Consultant, the BA should have the capability to gather both technical and business information and develop implementation needs and options. The BA is responsible for operating within and presenting information to a C-level/Sr. Manager audience or a technical team. The BAwill be responsible for implementing Safesforce.com functionality and will providing guidance and direction to technical teams, testing teams and business stakeholders during the implementation. Requirements Business Analysts will work remotely (with limited onsite time) with customers to obtain requirements, develop designs, and implement salesforce.com, including integrations with other related cloud computing solutions.  Required skills include: Build a clear requirements development approach for each customer engagement.Strong understanding of Salesforce’s capabilities and limitations and can clearly communicate those to customers.Lead discovery workshops, which includes the facilitation of large audiences, solution presentations, and solution demonstrations.Responsible for identification and inventory of customer process pain points, other requirements and gaps in best practices.Perform analysis of complex business information into technical implementation components.Perform business process modeling, user experience modeling/wireframes and basic technical architecture diagramming.Comfortable building and demonstrating prototypes in Salesforce.Strong presenter to C Suite/Sr. Manager level audiences as well as technical teams.Comfortable with heavy involvement in user acceptance test planning.Effectively leverage multiple implementation team types (User experience, Change Management, Developer Communities)Has hands on experience in several mid-size and larger implementations using salesforce.com in some of the following areas: System Release Management, Implementation & AdoptionData migration and integration concepts, tools and designWorking knowledge of Salesforce.com’s VisualForce/API/Apex programming languageSalesforce.com Force.com platform developmentSalesforce.com Communities and MobileSalesforce.com Marketing CloudSalesforce.com Service CloudSalesforce.com Sales CloudEducation and Required ExperienceCertified Salesforce.com Admin or Developer with either Sales Cloud or Service Cloud Consultant certificationsB.S. degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, MIS or equivalent3+ years experience as a Business Analyst or Systems Consultant for a professional services consulting organization.Experience with Salesforce.com configurationExperience with Agile delivery methodologiesKnowledge of Salesforce.com custom development preferredKnowledge of CPQ applications and concepts preferredExperience with other CRM software (Siebel, Clarify, Vantive, Peoplesoft, NetSuite, RightNow, etc.)Strong presentation and communication skillsLocated and able to work in the U.S. from a home office and able to travel up to 25%Looking for a full-time positionBenefits Fun, progressive, team environment. Everyone learns, everyone shares, everyone helps, everyone benefits, especially our customers! Opportunity to contribute, lead and develop beyond your role. Great entrepreneurial growth environment. MedicalLTDLifeDentalMatching 401KPaid Vacation/Sick TimeWork from home as desiredGet the day off on your birthday!

Name: Business Requirements Analyst
Description: Primary Responsibility  The Business Requirements Analyst will assist in the development of User Stories with the Product Owner to capture requirements using an Agile software development approach. The candidate shall provide support to collect, identify, define, aggregate, conceptualize, and prioritize strategic and nearer-term requirements. The candidate shall provide requirements support across project team serve as the primary interface between functional staff and information technology staff. Requirements The candidate must have a solid understanding of requirements elicitation using User Story and progressive elaboration. They shall assist in identifying the business areas that require technology and shall assist in applying the appropriate level and type of IT development to support missions and objectives. Support shall be provided in the following areas:  · Review and analyze various business and technical documentation including: business requirements, process flows, system designs, and system requirements  · Support the development of the Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM) to ensure that all requirements are tested, tracked, and maintained throughout the effort  · Develop and document requirements in the form of User Stories  · Assist in the formation of Acceptance Criteria(s)  · Collection and organization of information required for preparation of reports and briefings  · Preparation of documents, including review for completeness of content and consistency with order, style, and terminology standards  · Analytical interpretation of highly specialized technical and analytical information used to compose detailed documentation and reports  · Continuously researching and evaluating new technology that could be exploited to better meet user requirements and support organizational goals and objectives  (255, 255, 255); -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px;'>
