Name: Senior Strategic Planner/Business Analyst
Description: The Sr. Strategic Planner/Business Analyst reports to the Director of Strategy & Operations, Raytheon International Inc. (RII), assisting the director in managing the Raytheon International day-to-day operations; the individual shall conduct business data gathering and analysis, and contribute to the development of presentations, whitepapers, speeches, and memorandums in support of senior management decision makers. On behalf of the Director of Strategy & Operations, the Sr. Strategic Planner / Business Analyst shall interface across the international Raytheon BD community, including engaging Regional Integration Directors, Customer Account Managers, business program and capture leaders, and additional members of the Integrated Country Teams. The position requires the ability to adapt and prioritize in a fast-paced, high-energy, and high-volume environment. Key responsibilities include:Support executive travel engagement preparation; coordinate the development of executive travel books, business white papers, customer meeting talking points. Track and coordinate preparatory sessions with executiveSupport the research, data analysis, and creation of high-consequence presentations to include compiling and editing standard corporate reports (i.e. Global Business Development Monthly Report, Corporate Board Input, and Earnings Calls input) on behalf of Raytheon International Inc.Interface and liaise with Global Business Development Communications team; track international branding, marketing, and press release activityIn coordination with RII executive team, assist in managing, monitoring, and tracking performance of International Representatives and ConsultantsWork across BD community to understand the pipeline of business opportunities, priorities and program execution requirements; and support pipeline and bookings reviews, assessing current international pursuits and newly developed business opportunitiesSupport on-boarding, training, and audits, as necessarySpecial projects as assignedRequirements:Bachelors degree; preferably in business administration, marketing, or international affairsA minimum of four years of experience in defense/military, international affairs, business, and/or marketingStrong business acumen and sound judgmentExcellent organization and written and verbal communication skillsResults orientation and attention to detail, with the ability to see how details fit with executive-level prioritiesUnderstanding of the relationships needed to execute international business development successfully and the factors that drive international business and customer relationsFlexible schedule and ability to travel internationallyExperience partnering and working closely with geographically dispersed team membersAdvanced computer skills using Microsoft Office PowerPoint, including Excel (filtering, pivot tables, etc.)Experience with internet research using both subscription websites and search enginesAbility to work independently and lead coordinated efforts to drive organizational tasks to successful conclusionDesired Qualifications:Working experience with the US government in international and/or defense policy; experience in acquisition processes and procedures a plusStrong interpersonal skills with special focus on cross-cultural issues and understanding; ability to successfully manage sensitive issuesRelevant experience in developing critical relationships at a senior levelAbility to work in a highly matrixed environment, including with senior Raytheon personnelUnderstanding of Raytheons solutions and overall product portfolio, technologies and servicesUnderstanding of Raytheon processes for conducting international business, including development of an international bookings plan, country strategies, coordination of international pursuits, Enterprise Raytheon Pipeline Manager (E-RPM), and the Opportunity Management System (OMS)This position requires either a U.S. Person or a Non-U.S. Person who is eligible to obtain any required Export Authorization. 118810Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Name: Senior Business Development Analyst
Description: Senior Business Development Analyst At TransUnion, we are proud to work closely with our lending customers to help them serve the millions of Americans seeking a better life for themselves and their families.” – Steve Chaouki, EVP of Financial Services What we’ll bring:A work environment that encourages collaboration and innovation.Flexible time off, workplace flexibility, an environment that welcomes continued professional growth through support of tuition reimbursement, conferences and seminars.Our culture encourages our people to hone current skills and build new capabilities, while discovering their genius.What you'll bring:2-4 years professional experience in an analytical/quantitative position depending on educational backgroundHigh level of competency with Excel, familiarity with MS Access and/or other data management toolsExcellent quantitative and problem solving skills and strong verbal and written communications skillsSolid organizational skills and high degree of comfort managing multiple assignmentsProven track record for completing assignments on time and desire to produce high quality workDriven by intellectual curiosity and independent thinking with a positive “can do” attitudeBachelor’s degree with a focus in Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, Engineering, or one of the hard sciencesWhat we'd love to see:Working knowledge of the U.S. mortgage industryPrior management consulting experience is preferredMaster’s degree with a focus in Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, Engineering, or one of the hard sciencesImpact you’ll make:You will assist in providing customer analytics and insights to support the sales cycle as well as be responsible for developing and maintaining a mechanism to track recent wins/pipeline and revenue. You will be part of a team focused on key interactions with leading customers and business partners and the design and delivery of market-driven solutions. Your key impact will include the following: Project Coordination:You will perform project management and coordination tasks, assigning and coordinating project activities for cross-functional teams, developing project plans and status reports and serving as the communications point for the projectRelationship Building:You will build trust with business partners (internal and external), customers, key decision makers, and project sponsors by meeting individual commitments and collaborating with cross-functional teamsResearch:You will conduct general market research activities by collecting and analyzing data to better describe our organization, the industries we serve, as well as our customers and business partnersYou will build a solid understanding of the internal and external data sources available to fuel research projects and support/ refute key hypotheses Analysis:You will mine internal and external data for industry and customer trends, and business opportunitiesYou will develop forecasting models (under different assumptions and scenarios) to support growth initiativesCommunication:You will understand key communication objectives (internal and external) and an effective path to meeting themWith management’s supervision, you will create client- and executive-ready materials (e.g., agendas, memos, discussion guides, marketing collateral, and PowerPoint presentations) We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability status, veteran status, marital status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: Principal Business Analyst
Description: As a current employee you know Amtrak connects businesses and communities across the country and we move America’s workforce toward the future. The safety of our passengers, our more than 20,000 colleagues, the public and our operating environment is our priority and the success of our railroad is the result of you.By living the Amtrak values and actively embracing and fostering diverse ideas, backgrounds and perspectives, together we will honor our past and make Amtrak a company of the future. SUMMARY OF DUTIES:The Principal Business Analyst works in a lead technical capacity with our business partners and other IT organizations to align technology solutions and/or processes with Information Technology and business strategies. Demonstrates an informed knowledge within the function to resolve problems and assist with improvement of processes, on an ongoing basis. Supports several moderately complex business processes. May be allocated part time to one or more enterprise project initiatives of moderate to highly complexity. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Proactively seeks to establish and maintain cooperative partnerships with multiple organizations across Amtrak including business partners, business services officers, architecture, software development and testing.Responsible for assisting in the governance of IT disciplines. Collects, analyzes and documents service management related activities.Leads, guides and provides cross functional (from the requirement domain) project oversight for the business analysis staff.Provides tactical (day-to-day) requirement development guidance, based on the strategic SDLC model (ADM), for the business analysis staff.Directly handles requirement development tasks associated with high profile, high priority Amtrak strategic initiatives.Via high level requirement development, oversees the business analysis role within the demand management framework.Helps lead planning sessions related to projects or new technologies to implement process improvement within the functional area. Documents discussions and agreements. Facilitates gate reviews, change advisor boards, and IT operational meetings.Establishes liaison relationship with business partners and IT departments in order to provide process solutions to meet user needs.Assesses process improvements opportunities utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to assist in identifying priorities and advises on options.Provides factual content, analysis and other information to guide development projects and enhancements activities.Investigates, resolves and escalates problems. Monitors and analyzes metrics to ensure customer satisfaction and vendor performance.Promotes an understanding of IT Service Management roles, processes and activities to business units and IT departments. Supports and participates in formal AMTRAK reporting.communicate with and coordinate efforts among various team members and serve as a liaison between the business users, Amtrak Architecture, CoE, packetized delivery and the application development team as well as: Participate in meetings and projects with client staff, project managers, and developers to automate, upgrade, or expand applications that accomplish business operations of assigned work unit(s).Create, design, and format specification documentation including current and future state business process flow diagrams, functional and nonfunctional requirements, use cases, business rules, and other information or processes needed to describe required system changes for development, QA, and other internal customers.Do solution design based on the requirement documents in ECC/BPC/Ariba/Concur and be able to configure the system to address the requirements, as may be requiredManage QA process, ensure requirement traceable matrix, test cases and test scripts are done in accordance with requirements. Co-ordinate UAT and release management.Assesses process improvements opportunities utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to assist in identifying priorities and advises on business process and configuration options. May provide support to applications in production by tracking production problems and troubleshooting them to sustain application in production.Develop queries, analyses, or reports from applications for operations or management staff of assigned business unit(s).Migrate identified requirements to the requirements repository tool (HP Quality Center, JIRA or other tools) and produce a requirements traceability matrix.Will assists with security compliance activities in ECC/GRC/Solution ManagerEDUCATION: Bachelor's degree in Business or applicable field, specialized training or equivalent work experience.WORK EXPERIENCE:Relevant technical experience in Subject Matter Expert (business analysis) capacity.Familiar with IIBA guidance and approach to requirement developmentWorking knowledge within IT operations and/or Service Management functions.Requirement development through various techniques (JRD, process flow, general elicitation).Developing and managing to requirement development schedules that incorporate into the broader project schedule.Must possess excellent customer service, strong communication and interpersonal skills, work well with others in an integrated team environment, and must be self-motivated.Experience with development and reporting towards KPI's and knowledge of industry best practice/industry benchmarks.Strong analytical skillsPREFERRED WORK EXPERIENCE:Master's degree in Information Technology, or equivalent.Vendor Management experience.Knowledge of Six Sigma/LeanITIL CertificationCOMMUNICATION AND INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:Must have excellent oral and written communication skillsSF:LIRequisition ID:37287Band Zone:D1H Posting Location(s):District of Columbia; Maryland; VirginiaPersonnel Area:DC04Job Family/Function:Information Technology Relocation Offered:No Education Requirements:Bachelors DegreeTravel Requirements:None Employment Experience Requirements:5 - 7 years of experienceYou power our progress through your performance.We want your work at Amtrak to be more than a job – we want it to be a fulfilling experience where you find challenging and rewarding opportunities, respect among colleagues, competitive pay, benefits that protect you and your family, and a high performance culture that recognizes and values your contributions and helps you reach your career goals.We proudly support and encourage U.S. Veterans to apply for Amtrak job opportunities.All positions require pre-employment background verification, medical review and pre-employment drug screen. Amtrak is committed to a safe and drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing. All new hires are required to undergo a hair drug test which detects the presence of illegal drugs for months prior to testing. We appreciate your cooperation in keeping Amtrak safe and drug-free. In accordance with DOT regulations (49 CFR section 40.25), Amtrak is required to obtain prior drug and alcohol testing records for applicants/employees intending to perform safety- sensitive duties for covered Department of Transportation positions. If an applicant/employee refuses to provide written consent for Amtrak to obtain these records, he/she will not permitted to perform safety-sensitive functions.Note that any education requirement listed above may be deemed satisfied if you have an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.Amtrak is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome all to apply. We consider candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability (including blindness), or veteran status.

Name: Junior Business Analyst
Description: *Please apply on our website: https://chk.tbe.taleo.net/chk05/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=C2PORTFOLIO&cws=1&rid=8417*  We are currently seeking a Junior Business Analyst in Washington, D.C with an active Secret Clearance. JOB DESCRIPTIONProvide general staff support with a logistics business operation focus to SEA 06L senior leadership and four division managersGather/analyze data for SEA 06L programs and compile into reports that facilitate required management actions necessary to formulate solutions for any problems identifiedIdentify business trends utilizing real data, compile analysis reports that are delivered to managers/developers and then follow-up on all resultsWork independently with some guidance to ensure effective communications between SEA 06L senior leadership and division managers that facilitate process improvementCreate direct channels of communication to software and application developers that get the job done with minimal managerial interjectionFacilitate the implementation of a comprehensive management plan for each project and regular stakeholder meetings to keep all interested parties updated on program/project progressThis position serves as an interface within the NAVSEA 06L program office on day-today project issues and assists program managers with development of solutions to address problems with project goals and strategies; provides expertise in doing specific project tasks; manages task products to ensure adherence to requirements; facilitates completion of specific tasks within scheduling and budgetary parameters; and develops presentations and leads meetings on specific subtasks as directedREQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEAt least two years of specialized business operations experience, preferably in logistics or product support managementStrong math (statistics) skills, analytical aptitude and extensive MS Excel skillsGeneral understanding of NAVSEA logistics, policies, processes and proceduresAbility to synthesize large amounts of data and identify key trendsAbility to present data in a logical, concise mannerExceptional written and verbal communication skillsDirect client support experience in a fast-paced environmentEffective multi-tasking skillsDESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEIT technical backgroundMS ProjectREQUIRED EDUCATION BA or BS degree or equivalent, and two to four years related experience. REQUIRED SECURITY CLEARANCE Active secret clearance is required.  Job Type: Full-time  Experience: Business Analysis: 2 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required)

Name: Business Analyst I
Description: KeyLogic is seeking outstanding candidates with industry experience to join our expanding team! Business Analyst I Location: Washington, DC Job Code: 1072 DescriptionKeyLogic Systems is seeking an experienced IT Governance professional. The Business Analyst I will support the management consulting activities alongside the project/program manager, technical staff, and federal client for Capital Planning and Investment Control (CPIC) at The Department Of Labor (DOL). The position requires an ability to take initiative and a willingness to work in a flexible, fast-paced environment.Job Functions:Oversight of the Department's IT investment portfolio in accordance with OMB Circular A-130, Management of Federal Information Resources.Conduct Select-Control-Evaluate reviews of the Department’s IT investments by performing analysis of cost, schedule, and performance and adherence to CPIC reporting requirements.Support the Department’s IT budget process by evaluating IT budget requests, Major IT Business Cases and the IT Portfolio Summary in accordance with annual DOL and OMB guidance.Update and maintain DOL templates/tools/guides to assist federal project managers in meeting internal and external reporting CPIC requirements.Support on-going process improvement and provide anticipatory service to the federal client.Assist group facilitation, communications, training, and other forms of knowledge transfer.Requirements:Bachelor's Degree.At least 3 years of experience providing internal/external consulting services to management and/or technical staff in managing IT projects.Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate effectively to a diverse group of team members, stakeholders, and senior leadership.Experience in data analysis and report design/development.Knowledge of the Select, Control, and Evaluate phases of the CPIC process.Knowledge of IT project management concepts such as earned value management (EVM), cost benefit analyses, and risk management.Intermediate knowledge of MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint required. MS Project desired.Experience with eCPIC desired but not required.PMP certification desired but not required.About KeyLogic:KeyLogic is a highly successful provider of professional and engineering services. We specialize in solutions that enable our customers to make better decisions for their organization. KeyLogic’s performance has earned the company a solid reputation for high standards, proactive solutions, and an outstanding commitment to the customer, best exemplified by the fact we have never had a one-time federal customer — all of our customers have provided repeat business. KeyLogic has achieved seventeen consecutive years of growth since its founding in 1999. Our client list includes the Department of Defense (DoD), where we provide services for the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) and the U.S. Army and Navy, Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), Departments of Labor (DOL), Energy (DOE), Transportation (DOT) and Treasury (including the Internal Revenue Service (IRS)), General Services Administration (GSA), and the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA). KeyLogic has successfully attained a Capability Maturity Model Integration for Development (CMMI-DEV) Maturity Level 3 Rating. CMMI-DEV is a process improvement approach for software engineering and organizational development that provides organizations with the essential best practices needed to meet business goals. Only three-percent of small and medium federal contractors have achieved CMMI Maturity Level 3. KeyLogic joins this distinguished group. KeyLogic Systems is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled. Previous Applicants:  Email:  Password:  If you do not remember your password click here.

Name: Business Financial Management Analyst
Description: Overview: Based in McLean, VA, IronArch Technology is a management consulting company that focuses on providing innovative solutions and best practices to government and commercial clients. Our core offerings include Enterprise IT Solutions, Financial Management and Audit Readiness, and Advisory Services. IronArch is not your typical consulting company. We have a value-driven culture that shapes the way we work together and with our clients. Our corporate values include: · Responsiveness - To each other, customers, partners· Work Ethic - Accomplish the mission - ALWAYS· Integrity Our word is our commitment· Respect - Treat people the way you want to be treated· Professionalism - Perception is reality · Servant Leadership - Put others before yourselfA great opportunity exists to support the Department of the Navys (DON) Office of Financial Operations (FMO) in Washington, DC. FMO, under the Assistant Secretary of the Navy, Financial Management and Comptroller (ASN, FM&C), acts on behalf of the DON and is responsible for financial and accounting matters. FMO leads financial programs and activities that are designed to improve the way the DON does business and support the warfighter. ResponsibilitiesDevelop financial reporting tools that track financial plans against execution using accounting data;Support data calls with senior leads to collect Financial Improvement and Audit Readiness (FIAR) program requirements;Develop draft budget impact statements in response to pending budgetary reductions;Prepare multi-year cost estimates, detailed execution reports, and issue papers in support of Secretariat Review Board (SRB);Create executive level briefings about current and future FMO budgetary issues; andParticipate in process improvement efforts for FMO planning and execution processes, conducts data analytics / tool development / briefing support for other FMO divisions.What You Need for this Position: Experience with DoD and/or Federal GovernmentActive or Interim Secret ClearanceAbility to develop or recommend policy, procedures, and instructions concerning budget formulation, budget justifications and presentations, and budget execution.Ability to perform a wide range of analytical, technical, and advisory functions related to the budgetary processes.Experience in federal financial management systems for the analysis and graphic presentation of budget data, status of funds reports, budget execution requirements, and trend analyses.Ability to communicate orally and in writing to develop budget requests as well as background documentation for presentation.Other Desired Experience and Certifications: Bachelors Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or Operations Research / Industrial Engineering 4-6 years of combined experience in federal financial management, program management, process improvement, and cost analysisExperience with developing financial budgetsExperience with preparing multi-year cost estimatesExperience with Business Process ImprovementHigh skill level in Microsoft Excel and PowerPointCertified Defense Financial Manager (CDFM)Certified Government Financial Manager (CGFM)Certified Public Account (CPA)Certification in Lean Six Sigma (LSS)Certified Cost Estimator / Analyst (CCEA)Whats In It for You: · A culture where people truly enjoy the work they do and the people they do it with· Highly competitive PTO allowance· 401k· Health Club reimbursement · Multiple Medical, Dental, and Vision Plan Options to meet your needs · Employer-paid Short/Long-term disability · Annual training reimbursement program to allow you to focus on your career growth and development If you are interested and have the appropriate experience, please apply today!IronArch Technology is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by e-mailing humanresources@ironarchtech.com.IronArch Technology will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because such employee or applicant has inquired about, discussed, or disclosed the compensation of the employee or applicant or another employee or applicant. This provision shall not apply to instances in which an employee who has access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of such employees essential job information of other employees or applicants as a part of such employees essential job functions discloses the compensation of such other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to such information, unless such disclosure is in response to a formal complaint or charge, in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or is consistent with the contractors legal duty to furnish information.

Name: Health Business Analyst
Description: Job Number: R0042278Health Business Analyst, MidKey Role:Participate in the analysis of qualitative and quantitative healthcare data. Analyze the development of solutions to complex client problems. Review demographic, financial, quality, and cost data and perform stakeholder analysis and best practice research. Leverage independent judgement and collaborate with subject matter experts and others to inform decisions.Basic Qualifications:-Experience with hospital, health system, and integrated health delivery network policies and trends-Experience with applying lean or other healthcare methods to assess and recommend improvements in processes, policies, or procedures-Experience with Microsoft Office, including Word and PowerPoint -Ability to conduct independent research and draft client-ready deliverables-Ability to obtain a security clearance-MA or MS degree in Hospital Administration, Healthcare Administration, or Business Administration with a concentration in healthcareAdditional Qualifications:-Possession of excellent oral and written communication skillsClearance:Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.Were an EOE that empowers our peopleno matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or veteran statusto fearlessly drive change.

Name: Application System Analyst III
Description: General SummaryUnder limited supervision gathers and analyzes user needs for developing and modifying clinical or business applications in the healthcare environment. Includes providing complex application support, writes documentation and specifications. Analyzes complex results, proposes solutions and/or recommendations in addition to building, configuring and/or modifying applications using existing application tools. Principal Responsibilities and Tasks The following statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. These are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all job duties performed by personnel so classified.  Performs and coordinates complex analysis, design, development, testing and support services for assigned application applications.  Responsible for and oversees day to day tracking and follow-up on issues and questions of daily operations.  Performs and coordinates application analysis and impact analysis of new or different applications, processes or changes.  Provides complex application support and guidance to end users and provides technical guidance to less experienced personnel. Serves as point of contact for resolution of complex application problems. Able to quickly assess problems and identify resolutions.  Coordinates development of application testing scripts and conversion plans. Participates in testing as assigned.  Makes recommendations and provide alternatives with regards to various development and support initiatives.  Prepares written documentation of various types; application documentation, analytical reports, functional specifications, training manuals, status reports, etc. Creates, evaluates and instructs/teaches other.  Participates and/or leads projects, estimates costs, time frames, staffing requirements and prepares cost justifications for assigned project. Uses status reports for project oversight.  Validates the designing for each application assigned, under the control of the change management application and user development request.  Prepares and validates complete applications documentation for operations and sets programming specifications for user departments. Provides input and assists with the development of departmental policies and procedures as they relate to the use of clinical applications.

Name: Management Analyst (U.S. Border Patrol)
Description: LMI seeks mid-level management analysts to support a federal program management office in Northern Virginia. Join our team of collaborative self-starters focused on delivering practical and efficient solutions to help our client keep U.S. borders safe and facilitate trade and travel. As part of our high-performing team, you will augment our vital work to provide “eyes and ears” technology to protect our nation.  You will support one of our client’s portfolio managers. Each portfolio comprises projects that acquire and maintain technology, including communications, sensor, and surveillance systems and the infrastructure that supports them. You will compile management information from the component projects including scope, cost, schedule, performance, and quality to provide visibility into deployment progress. Representative responsibilities: Manage and report on cost, schedule, quality, and performance goalsCoordinate project status reviewsMonitor status of deliverablesManage the action item database to resolution, and monitor risk management activitiesWork with Integrated Product Teams (IPTs) and Working Groups to develop and maintain program and project plans and chartersSupport data calls to the component projects for information neededRespond to data calls with portfolio informationSupport development, execution, and management of Service Level Agreements (SLAs), Memorandum of Agreement/Understanding (MOA/MOU), and Inter-Agency Agreements (IAAs)Develop responses to internal and external inquiriesAbility to pass a government background investigation, including financial, criminal, residential, educational, foreign affiliation, prohibited substance use, and employment verifications; active U.S. Customs and Border Protection background investigation preferred. Please note that only U.S. citizens are eligible for a suitability determination.Previous work with CBP’s Integrated Fixed Tower (IFT), Remove Video Surveillance Systems (RVSS), Mobile and Agent-Centric Systems (MACS), or Field Surveillance Services (FSS) portfolios is a plus.3 to 10 years of experience and a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in business, management, finance, or information managementProficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.Ability to communicate clearly with a variety of stakeholders.Ability to effectively solve problems.Strong communication skills, both oral and written.A true team player who maintains a positive attitude in a dynamic environment.Prior experience in project management support preferred.

Name: Techical Business Analyst
Description: Working at ICF Working at ICF means applying a passion for meaningful work with intellectual rigor to help solve the leading issues of our day. develop information system documentation to support efficient operations; prepare reports and written findings and recommendations; and monitor changes.Depending on experience level, serve as a lead for 1-5 other analysts.Basic Qualifications:2+ years working in a project/program management environment as a Business Analyst, Management Analyst, Project Coordinator, or Junior Project Manager.Capable of working in an environment that is demanding, sometimes stressful and requires independent thinking, problem resolution and responsible actions with minimal direct oversight by senior management.Ability to obtain a favorable adjudicated background investigation through FEMA’s Personnel Security Division.Preferred Skills and/or Experience:Experience working within a large-scale federal IT PMO or Portfolio management environment.“Power User” of Microsoft Excel and/or Microsoft SharePoint. Name: Business Solutions Analyst
Description: SUMMARY: The incumbent will provide first level support for the management and maintenance of the Association s databases and database applications. Responsibilities will include: Serving as the main point of contact for data manipulation and extraction using various relational database tools and techniques; Develops and maintains reports for end-users; Participating in new process and application design for those applications; Managing and providing support to management and end-users regarding the appropriate use of Association applications; Ensuring that end users are well-versed in the database and applications, developing and coordinating classroom training as necessary; PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES Communicates with staff to identify and resolve issues related to the Association s Database Applications and ensuring all needs are maintained and tracked through MBA s technical support database. Maintains and develops reports for end-users using standard Report Writing Tools used by MBA (Aptify, Crystal, Business Objects, SSRS). Tests and troubleshoots new and existing applications. Consults with and advises users of the various options and opportunities. Works directly with end-users to resolve conflicts and inappropriate solutions usage. Develops and manages data extraction efforts to ensure accuracy and deployability. Plays a key role as an advocate for database integrity by ensuring that systems and procedures are sufficient to support a sound database structure and reliable content. Regularly provides training to new and existing staff members. Maintains knowledge of processes and custom database-related applications utilized by Accounting, Membership and Education staff. Maintains familiarity for standard Report Writing Tools used by MBA (Aptify, Crystal, Business Objects, SSRS) Provides first line support for the resolution of all issues related to the Association s business applications. Assists in the creation, configuration, and ongoing maintenance of AMS modules, custom applications, and processes utilized by assigned departments. Provides pre-conference support and remote conference support related to AMS-driven activities in the areas of membership registration, conference registration, badge printing, and reporting. Perform other duties as assigned. SPECIFICATIONS: Bachelor s degree or equivalent experience. Two or more years experience supporting users and utilizing database applications in multi-user relational database environment. Experience with Customer Support/Service using Aptify or other comparable enterprise level association management system. Two or more years experience with SQL, specifically related to creating and maintaining queries, triggers, and other SQL objects. Knowledge of Crystal Reports, SSRS, SQL, and ODBC databases required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as highly effective interpersonal skills required. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability. - provided by DiceSSRS, SQL, Crystal Reports, ODBC, Aptify

Name: Lead Senior Supply Chain Analyst
Description: OverviewDecisive Analytics Corporation is looking for a LeadSenior Supply Chain Analyst to join our team in Arlington, VA!  The goal of this work is to advance the DoD supply chain towards precision and reliability. Additionally, to improve supply chain precision and reliability by reducing the level of variability across the five supply chain process areas of Plan, Source, Maintain/Repair, Deliver, and Return. Improvements can be implemented to reduce supply chain. By reducing variability of the supply chain, the DoD will be able to plan with a higher degree of confidence, which can remove a significant amount of reliance on less efficient and herculean efforts such as overly relying on inventory safety stocks and expediting of materiel.ResponsibilitiesManage multiple distribution functions including supply chain, logistics planning, distribution center operations, and traffic.Ensure sourcing efforts meet business goals and objectives.Responsible for an integrated flow of materials and services from initial sourcing through production planning and scheduling, as the beginning of a supply chain management business focus.Work with functional leaders to perform analysis and identify areas for performance improvement.Manage and support implementation of strategic initiatives.Manage activities related to global sourcing, supplier selection, product delivery specifications, and quality.Develop, implement, and maintain policies, procedures, and material control systems to reduce costs, streamline procedures, and implement solutions.Ensure the availability of materials in the supply chain, as scheduled, and the maintenance of inventory at minimum acceptable levels.Responsible for sourcing and supplying raw materials, utilities and outside services, as well coordinating global procurement efforts.Develop and maintain working relationships with global supply chain partners.Design and implement business metrics to monitor, track, and report sourcing project progress. QualificationsMinimum of 15 years working within the USN/USMC Aviation communities with a focus on programming and budgeting, NAVAIR operations, NAVSUP weapon system support, Defense Logistics Agency operations, and Depot Supply Chain management.Bachelors degree is Supply Chain Management or related field.DoD Secret clearance required.Experience with the following skill sets: Demand forecastingInventory managementKnowledge of models utilized to determine retail and wholesale spares allowancesKnowledge of cataloging and provisioning requirementsOperational and industrial supply support Preferred Qualifications: Experience of benefit in the following assignments: OPNAV (preferably N41 or N98)NAVAIRNAVSUP WSS Philadelphia (preferably Operations N98)DLA (headquarters or subordinate commands)FRC, Type Commander, or Fleet supply chain oversight and management EEO statementAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status or disability.VEVRAA Federal Contractor

Name: Business Development Senior Analyst
Description: Tracking Code  3256  Job DescriptionLatham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a Business Development Senior Analyst to join our winning team, located in Washington, D.C. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.  The Business Development Senior Analyst will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham’s comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more. In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.  The Business Development Senior Analyst is responsible for leveraging his or her research and analysis skills to support our internal client’s efforts to engage, retain and expand new and existing firm relationships, and to target and secure new clients and referral sources. In close collaboration with the Business Development Manager, practice office leadership and global Business Development colleagues, the Business Development Senior Analyst supports progress against key market priorities and objectives, including global strategic goals and initiatives affecting the market.  The successful Business Development Senior Analyst is accountable for developing internal reports for specific markets or practice initiatives to aid in driving revenue growth. The position will require collaboration with the Market Team and across the Business Development Department as well as other functional departments at the firm. The individual must be a self-starter and motivated to excel. Responsibilities Include:Researching, analyzing and reporting of key data to support market, industry and client analysis and targetingDelivering research and analysis to support new business, client programs and client feedback initiatives, may include oral presentationsDeveloping recommendations based on financial reporting, market and client analysis, and business development strategies for target industries and companiesAssisting with the development and maintenance of written communications and collateral materials that support the firm’s business development strategySpecific Requirements:Strong research and analytical skillsStrong oral and written communication skillsProfessional interpersonal skills and ability to interact effectively with people at all organizational levels at the firmAbility to work in a highly matrixed department and in a collaborative team environmentStrong customer service focus and skillsStrong time management skills and ability to prioritize effectivelyStrong Microsoft Office skills, particularly PowerPoint and ExcelHigh degree of discretion and independent judgmentExperience with Bloomberg, Capital IQ, Thomson, PitchBook, VentureSource, and other research tools a plus A Bachelor’s degree is required and a minimum of five (5) years of progressive research and analysis experience is preferred. Occasional travel may be required.  Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the "Apply Now" link.  Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.Job Location  Washington, District of Columbia, United States  Department  Business Development  Position Type  Full-Time/Regular

Name: UX Business Process Analyst
Description: Are you interested in expanding your career through experience and exposure, all while supporting a mission that seeks to ensure the security of our nation and its allies? If so, then Northrop Grumman is the place for you. As a leading global security company, we provide innovative systems, products and solutions to our customers worldwide. We are comprised of diverse professionals that bring different perspectives and ideas, understanding that the more experiences we bring to our work the more innovative we can be. As we continue to build our workforce we look for people that exemplify our core values, leadership characteristics, and approach to innovation.Northrop Grumman Technology Services sector is seeking a UX Business Process Analyst3to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. This position will be located in McLean, VA. The qualified applicant will become part of Northrop Grumman's Department of State (DOS) Consular Systems Modernization (CSM) Program, for the Bureau of Consular Affairs (CA). This initiative is intended to modernize and consolidate the operational environment under a common technology framework in order to better support the services provided to CA's customers. UX Business Process Analyst will be responsible for describing the overall user experience, defining the workflow models and working with the architecture and sprint teams to ensure an effective and high quality user experience.Roles and Responsibilities:Assist in applying common best practices for the industry to the customer using a knowledge base to create conceptual business models and to identify relevant issues and considerations in selecting application software packages.Assess the operational and functional baseline of an organization and its organizational components, and help to define the direction and strategy for an engagement while ensuring the organizational needs are being addressed.Analyze business and technical processes to formulate and develop new and modified business information processing systems, such as production and inventory control systems, financial tracking systems, marketing and human resources systems.Represent the business unit to define requirements and business cases for the technology developments.Coordinate with business and technology teams, ascertaining system requirements, such as program functions, output requirements, input data acquisition, and system techniques and controls.Work with multiple teams on various projects within an Agile environmentWork directly with customers and project teams to gather requirements through user research, stakeholder interviews, workshops, etc.Develop/create applicable user flows, journey maps, page flows, wireframes, and other artifacts as neededTranslate research findings into design recommendations to quickly improve product designs early in the design cycleLeverage UX methodologies for uncovering user needs and identifying opportunities for improvementActively engage stakeholders through group facilitation and workshopsUnderstand and align the needs of our stakeholders, clients, and usersProvide thought leadership towards emerging UX best practices, trends, and technologies TSCSMBasic Qualifications:To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below:Bachelor's degree in a related field (computer science) and at least 8 years' experienceAt least three years of experience working in a collaborative team and directly with developers for implementation of UX designsSolid understanding of Accessibility (Section 508 Compliance)Extensive experience designing web application interfaces in an agile environmentKnowledge and adoption of UX industry best practices, including user-centered design methodologiesFamiliarity with HTML5 and CSS3 and understanding of web based user interface patterns based on JavaScript, Angular JS, NodeJS, BootstrapStrong visual and interaction design proficiency, as well as a superior understanding of current front-end coding practicesStrong design fundamentals including information design, interaction design, visual design, industry UX/UI standards across platforms, and UX best practicesExperience in user research, user interface design, information architecture, usability testing, human factors, and other related disciplinesExcellent communication skills, both verbally and in writing to effectively interact with multiple teams both internal and externalFluency in mobile platforms, including design guidelines for native applicationsDemonstrated proficiency with industry standard design tools (e.g., Adobe Photoshop, et. al)Proficient use of common rapid prototyping tools (e.g., Axure Pro, Balsamiq, et. al)Awareness of new trends in interactive design, development, and digital platformsMust have a current, active Secret (or higher) clearance. An interim may be considered.Preferred Qualifications:Candidates with these desired skills will be given preferential consideration:Advanced experience working with Bootstrap, JavaScript, Angular, React, NodeJS, responsive web design and development, and native mobile developmentAdvanced knowledge of usability, accessibility (Section 508 Compliance), Search Engine Optimization (SEO), and other standard best practicesExperience in cloud based environments including deploying solutions on public/hybrid cloudsExperience with IBM Rational Collaborative Lifecycle ManagementScaled Agile Framework experience; working as a part of a SCRUM TeamBackground in Agile Software Development, specifically software user story developmentExperience using engineering environments and tools that support agile development, and especially SAFe, such as JIRA, Rally, VersionOne, ConfluenceSupports all Agile teams to ensure effective end-to-end capability threads are being implementedNorthrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Name: Business Analyst - Remote
Description: SemanticBits is looking for a Business Analyst capable of thriving on a scrum-based agile software development team; to help understand what users need and document those needs in the form of implementable and testable user stories. You will be part of a highly talented, dynamic development team that will be using a set of modern technologies (AngularJS, Node.js, RoR, MongoDB, ElasticSearch etc.), human-centered design, and DevOps approaches.  SemanticBits is a leading company specializing in the design and development of digital health services, and the work we do is just as unique as the culture we’ve created. We develop cutting-edge solutions to complex problems for commercial, academic, and government organizations. The systems we develop are used in finding cures for deadly diseases, improving the quality of healthcare delivered to millions of people, and revolutionizing the healthcare industry on a nationwide scale. There is a meaningful connection between our work and the real people who benefit from it; and, as such, we create an environment in which new ideas and innovative strategies are encouraged. We are an established company with the mindset of a startup and we feel confident that we offer an employment experience unlike any other and that we set our employees up for professional  success every day. feedbackCollaborate with Visual/UI designer during the usability testing sessions and add/update stories based on user responseBreakdown the roadmap into epics and group user stories under themWork criteria which reasonably covers all areas necessary for complete testing of the new functionalityAct as an interface and customer advocate to ensure customer, stakeholder and user needs are being addressedCollaborate with and support developers during their design and development efforts to provide support for their analysis of the storyProvide additional support and guidance to clients during the implementation phase to include development of training resourcesParticipate as a member of the Development teamValidate that product deliveries meet customer requirements and drive product demosRepresent the customer and users during backlog grooming sessions and internal demosImprove and expand knowledge and skill sets with regard to current trends and changes in software development industry and be up to date with latest design trendsProactively contribute to the quality of the product by seeking and proposing new or alternative approaches to address the requirementsParticipate in Sprint Planning, Sprint Reviews, Scrum Meetings and other agile activitiesRequirementsExperience as a Business Analyst/User Researcher on an agile software development teamBS or BA degreeExpertise with JIRA, Confluence, and the rest of the Atlassian suiteExpertise in creating wireframes using BalsamiqExperience in Human Centered Design approach for developing digital servicesExcellent communication and mentoring skillsBenefitsGenerous base salaryThree weeks of Paid Time OffExcellent health benefits program (Medical, dental and vision)Education and conference reimbursement401k retirement plan. Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: National Trust Community Investment Corporation (NTCIC) enables tax credit equity investments that support sustainable communities nationwide. NTCIC raises and invests money in connection with federal and state historic tax credits (HTC), new markets tax credits (NMTC), solar tax credits (ITC), and private equity sources. NTCIC is a wholly owned for-profit subsidiary of the National Trust for Historic Preservation.  NTCIC seeks a Business Systems Analyst to support the IT infrastructure (MSP in place), manage new business system implementations (new phases of Salesforce and document management system), and act as company administrator for business technology applications (Salesforce, custom SQL database, document management). Prior experience in the financial services or related industry is preferred. Duties include: Review, analyze and evaluate business systems and user needs; document business and systems requirements; define scope and objectives for expanding data management and IT system needs; manage systems development and operations to parallel overall business strategies; and maintain policies and procedures. Works closely with Senior Management and external IT and business application consultants. Name: Business Financial Analyst
Description: Technomics is a growing employee-owned, decision analytics company that specializes in cost and economic analysis to facilitate better decisions faster. We enable a wide range of clients across the Federal government, from senior level policy makers to program managers, to choose smartly, buy effectively and operate efficiently. We deliver practical, credible and defensible results offering actionable insights by applying data-driven and analytics-based approaches in combination with multidisciplinary talent, subject matter experts, and tangible and repeatable assets in the form of databases, models, approaches and techniques.  Our employee-owners pride themselves on their ability to apply deep analytical rigor and innovative thought that assist clients in understanding and solving a myriad of challenging resource planning and management problems. Essential Responsibilities:Annual Task planning to include coordination, tracking, assembly and assessment of Individual Task Management Plans as related to government and contractor activities.Analysis of Monthly financial reports from government field activities and contractors and development of a monthly assessment report.Data gathering using Navy Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and other tools to respond to various financial inquiries including funds commitment, obligation, expenditure and funds expiration.Develop correspondence, spreadsheets, and routine program analysis reports; maintain routine financial databases, and generate reports and documentation as directed.Perform other general administrative and program management tasks as directed by the customer. Interface with customers and coordinate tasks with other contractors / Navy activitiesMinimum Requirements: Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics and at least 5 years of job-related experience or equivalent.  Position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a SECRET level Security Clearance. Preferred Qualifications: Specific experience in DoD Logistics financial / budget support, including funds status accounting and reconciliation, obligation phasing plans or equivalent, and development and maintenance of finance metrics is required. Experience in use of the Navy Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) web-hosted tools is highly desired. Knowledge of the Planning, Programming, Budgeting and Execution (PPBE) process, Navy financial / budgeting policies and procedures related to Operation & Maintenance, Navy (O&MN), Other Procurement, Navy (OPN), and Ship Construction, Navy (SCN) appropriations is required. Liaison with Navy Field activities/ISEA’s and shipbuilders is required to support Individual Task Management Planning funding requests, document tracking and funding modifications.  Special Skills: Strong organizational and technical management skills, and attention to detail; excellent interpersonal skills with outstanding written and oral skills. PC skill in MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint is required, with particular skill in Excel.

Name: Managment Analyst-Governance
Description: Job Description: Leidos is seeking a Management Analyst-Governance Secretariat to support the customer in development and oversight of strategic and programmatic plans, policies, and processes. Position is located in Bethesda, MD. Candidates must currently possess a TS/SCI Polygraph security clearance.  Primary Responsibilities  The Management Analyst-Governance Secretariat team member must quickly develop a broad understanding of the projects and initiatives of his/her assigned committee(s) and its leadership, and must be able to set priorities in work assignments. The successful candidate must project a professional demeanor, utilizing oral and written communication skills of the highest quality. Interpersonal skills are extremely important as this position requires working with a senior professional staff and high-level government leadership across a number of agencies. The successful candidate must be self-motivated, flexible, and willing to take the initiative on tasks supporting the leadership team. Responsibilities include: Establishing and consolidating proposed working group agenda items from across a diverse, highly technical communityProposing and recommending working group agendas to the board chairman (SES level)Organizing and participating in board and project agenda review meetingsCommunicating with board and project members and other external customers, answering questions and providing information, as necessaryServing as the principal contact person, coordinating all communications to speakers regarding speaking schedules, notes requirements, clearance requirements, and audio visual equipment policiesResponding to written and verbal inquiries and providing follow-up communicationsManaging all Board and Projects committee activity, including maintaining committee rosters and committee member contact and e-mail addresses, sending meeting announcements and materials, and encouraging member participationCommunicating with/alerting appropriate members of the board and projects, sharing pertinent information. Managing board and project activities including drafting meeting minutes and resolutions and maintaining board actions historyTracking and reporting on status and completion of assigned actionsCompiling information on board meeting topics and participants, distributing assignments based on commitments, providing follow up as required Basic Qualifications  Requires Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, Information Technology, a closely related Engineering or IT discipline, Accounting, Business, English, Finance, Management, or Political Science. The candidate must have BS degree and 12 - 15 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 10 - 13 years of prior relevant experience. May possess a Doctorate in technical domain.experience consulting and supporting either mission programs and/or consulting with senior level customers. Furthermore, the candidate must possess 5 or more years of experience with IC programs or projects, which include 5 years+ experience analyzing IT-related programs or projects in one of the following categories: organizational efficiencies, organizational operations, organizational procedures and protocols, or organizational risks. Must possess outstanding verbal and written communications skills.  Preferred Qualifications  Ability to adapt in response to shifts in customer priorities. Experience collaborating with diverse IC stakeholders to drive consensus and forward progress. Certifications: PMP, DAWIA Level III, or COTR Level 3.

Name: Agile Business Analyst
Description: Job Number: R0042733 Agile Business AnalystKey Role:  Lead the collection, capture, and management of mission user needs from prioritization through concept development and user story writing to support development and deployment as a business analyst subject matter expert. Facilitate the gathering of business-focused requirements to support a product team and product owner in defining the backlog and ensuring the user's perspective is considered. Work with the product owner and users to determine the operational objectives of business needs and elicit requirements. Distill complex business processes into clear and actionable user stories with thorough acceptance criteria. Name: Operations Risk Analyst III
Description: THE COMPANYFannie Mae provides reliable, large-scale access to affordable mortgage credit in communities across our nation. We are the leading source of funding for housing in America, which means more people can buy or rent a home. We are focused on sustaining the housing recovery, improving our company, and leading change to make housing better.Join our diverse, high-performing team and make a difference as we work together to enable access to a good home.For more information about Fannie Mae, visit http://www.fanniemae.com/progressJOB INFORMATIONIdentify, measure, and monitor the company's operational risk in how its transactions and infrastructure function. Assess risks from unauthorized trading, software or hardware failures, lack of oversight of operations, or contingencies that would prompt disaster recovery programs. Assess threats to data integrity and security of networks and the consequences of failures or breaches. Recommend or implement risk mitigation strategies or practices.KEY JOB FUNCTIONSStudy and review business processes in assigned business unit; examine documentation and flow of work through systems. Assess adequacy of internal controls, documentation, backup/redundancy, and disaster recovery procedures intended to ensure continuing and secure operations. Where required by internal policies or external agencies, develop documentation of business processes and safeguards. May prepare reports for inclusion in larger mandated report(s). Facilitate presentations and workshop sessions on process analysis, risk identification, assessment, control and mitigation. May use formal process improvement methodologies (such as six sigma) to assess and improve operating procedures in work unit(s). Confer with business unit management and staff by scoping business problems, analyzing processes, losses and risk exposure and sharing lessons learned. Identify key problem drivers, and reinforce operational procedures with appropriate internal controls. As needed, participate in disaster recovery effort as technical resource.EDUCATIONBachelor's Degree or equivalent requiredMINIMUM EXPERIENCE4 years of related experienceSPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLSExperience with risk management frameworks, including the three lines of defense, requiredAdvanced Excel and data visualization skills (e.g. Tableau) requiredExperience with PowerPoint and ability to create effective presentations requiredKnowledge of data analytics and reporting, including the ability to develop and analyze key metrics requiredKnowledge of Compliance and data quality assurance assessment strongly preferredTesting/Audit experience preferredExperience with operational risk management frameworks and execution, strongly preferredExperience with the design and execution of operational incident/event programs, strongly preferred Experience with the preparation and delivery of presentations to senior executives, preferred Strong collaboration and negotiation skills Strong problem solving and analytical skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Highly adaptable and comfortable with managing competing prioritiesEMPLOYMENT As a condition of employment with Fannie Mae, any successful job applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment drug screen and to successfully complete a background investigation.Fannie Mae is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Project Manager Business Analyst
Description: BlueForce, Inc., is seeking candidates for a Project Manager Business Analyst position. BlueForce, Inc. is supporting the Bureau of International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs (INL) in Washington, DC. INL works to keep Americans safe at home by countering international crime, illegal drugs, and instability abroad. INL helps countries deliver justice and fairness by strengthening their police, courts, and corrections systems. These efforts reduce the amount of crime and illegal drugs reaching U.S. shores.

Name: Business Analyst with Sailpoint
Description: Our client, an international financial institution based in Washington, DC has a position available for a Business Analyst w/SailPoint: Roles and Responsibilities: Play key role in the implementation of the Identity and Access Management (ICAM) work program, integrating in-house systems and third-party applications for provisioning, de-provisioning and access certification using SailPoint tool. Interface with the business clients to understand and document business needs and requirements relating to the development and maintenance of the ICAM work program. Strong experience with SailPoint tool and experience in IAM implementation for onboarding, provisioning and de-provisioning and Certification of financial applications. Identify business requirements by working primarily with the major stakeholders and lead the collection, analysis, documentation and coordination of the ICAM business and compliance requirements. Create and assign tickets to the development team for production support and provide requirements for enhancements or configuration changes. Work with the ICAM team architect and development team for detailed walkthrough, documentation of ICAM functional requirements, process flows and test use cases to ensure functional, business and compliance requirements are met. For new applications, collaborate with business and IT stakeholders (PMO, OIS, EA) to determine if solutions currently exist (internally or externally) or whether new solutions are feasible to meet ICAM requirements. Tracking and project co-ordination for deliverables. Design, review test cases and obtain UAT sign-off for new Treasury applications on-boarding and work-flows and certifications and provide support to the business client, answering client questions and training new users. Document and manage issues and actions for applications and projects related to applications and authorization work-flows. Act as a liaison between stakeholders, service manager, technical lead and IT support teams (network, information security, service desk, web, infrastructure, DBA). Specific Requirements: Master's degree in Computer Science or Finance, with a minimum of 5 years relevant technical and business work experience. 3-year experience with Identity and Access Management (IAM) domain with superior understanding of Identity Management concepts, identity management including provisioning, de-provisioning and Certification, RBAC model; understanding of business controls, gap analysis, compliance and audit requirements. Ability to understand Identity and Access Management platforms, key concepts cloud infrastructure and access controls for cloud-based applications. Superior verbal and written communication skills to translate business needs and ability to convey business requirements and technical needs in a clear, concise, and effective manner. Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in continually changing and fast paced environment; strong self-starter that can work independently as needed. Prior working experience with financial systems. If interested, please reply with your updated (Word version) of your professional resume to andrew.reggia@nttdata.com Contractor Benefits Medical Dental Vision 401(k) *Benefits are available only to W2 Contractors. *This is not a remote based position. *In person interview. *Open to C2C NTT DATA Services is a leading IT services provider and global innovation partner with 130,000 professionals based in over 50 countries. NTT DATA recently acquired Dell Services. NTT DATA Services emphasizes long-term commitment and combines global reach and local intimacy to provide premier professional services, including consulting, application services, business process, IT outsourcing, and cloud-based solutions. We are a part of NTT Group, one of the world's largest technology services companies, generating more than $100 billion in annual revenues and partner to 80% of the Fortune 100. Visit www.nttdataservices.com to learn how our consultants, projects, managed services, and outsourcing engagements deliver value for a wide range of businesses and government agencies. Name: Senior Information Analyst
Description: The College Board, the national educational organization, is conducting a search for a Senior Information Analyst for our IT department. This position is based in our Reston, Virginia office.  Named by Fast Company as one of the most innovative education companies, the College Board is a mission-focused organization. This job requires a strong focus on improving educational opportunities and outcomes, particularly for disadvantaged students, in the context of a competitive business environment.  The Reporting group within Data Services of the College Board seeks a Senior Information Analyst with strong analytical and technical skills to support the organization's efforts in the areas of data management and services in the transformation of legacy systems to Cloud services.  The Senior Information Analyst must work with Reporting team to communicate and engage with the business units to develop a strong understanding of their reporting, data and product needs. From this understanding, the Analyst will work with the business and the technology teams to help define requirements for a project, identify data dependencies and/or relationships to develop logical and physical data models, create data flow and system activity diagrams, and write specifications for managing enterprise information. Specifications may include business rules, source to target mappings, supplemental specifications, BI reporting specifications, and/or use cases. The Analyst must also be able to work with architects, engineers and DBAs to ensure that the business and technical requirements are being met throughout the development process.  The Senior Information Analyst will be given very complex data-related problems and must solve them using a variety of technical and analytical skills and be able to document and standardize the processes for solving those problems. A successful candidate will be able to generate efficiencies and mitigate risk through sound technical analysis and will generate value for the business by providing solutions to their business problems.  The candidate will be knowledgeable in the Agile methodology and will interact closely with the Agile team and other stakeholders to shape, identify, prioritize, and realize project requirements in the delivery of business solutions. What you'll do:Communicate with and understand business goals and requirements, and work to create data solutions that add value to the business.Demonstrate a strong attention to detail, high degree of initiative, and excellent documentation and communication skills.Support product managers to ensure that all aspects of the information analysis and requirements gathering process are completed with the highest degree of accuracy and quality, including the development and socialization of key project artifacts.Develop and participate in the review of requirements, data mappings, use cases and other artifacts and clearly communicate to both the business and technical team members the system requirements. Demonstrate the ability to define, analyze and translate functional and non-functional business requirements into activity diagrams source to target mappings, system use cases and supplemental specifications.Demonstrate an understanding of database modeling and technical design, database builds, and stored procedures.Demonstrate the ability to access data (SQL), analyze data, and be able to create the logical data model for incoming data. Expertise in understanding and writing SQL scripts.Support ad hoc data requests as required as part of DevOps team.About you:Bachelor's Degree in computer science or related field.Possesses at least 5-7 years or more of relevant work experience.Very strong SQL coding skills. Expertise in understand and writing SQL.Working knowledge of DBMS client software (MS SQL, Oracle (Toad), MySQL) is required.Experience with procedural SQL languages such as T-SQL or PL/SQL.Strong knowledge of relational database systems, data structures and data modeling concepts.Working knowledge of strong and evolving competence in several programming languages and technologies (especially in NodeJS, JavaScript), working knowledge of multiple tools sets, technologies and implementation environments (preferred).Knowledge/working experience with XML and JSON.Ability to understand business needs and translate them into technical specifications.Strong analytical skills with demonstrated experience providing information, reports and analyses from unstructured and vague business questions and problems.Experience in data management, data quality, and data automation.Experience in project documentation and the design of process and data flow diagrams. Understanding of business process modeling, data provisioning modeling, entity relationship modeling and dimensional modeling.Hands-on experience with AWS services (preferred).Excellent oral and written communication skills, willing to communicate with business users to clarify requirements.High proficiency in Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, Access, Visio and Outlook) is required.Ability to deliver quality products in a fast-paced team-oriented unit.Knowledge of System Development Life Cycle.Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize projects and information.Experience working on an Agile team.Knowledge of Jira and Wiki.Benefits We offer our employees an outstanding benefits package, which includes 4 weeks of paid time off, a generous retirement savings plan, health and pet insurance, tuition reimbursement and ongoing professional development and training. Mission The College Board's mission is to connect students to college success and opportunity. We are a not-for-profit membership organization committed to excellence and equity in education. Among our best-known products are the SAT®, PSAT/NMSQT®, and Advanced Placement Program®. The College Board is committed to diversity in the workplace and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The College Board participates in E-Verify, a service of DHS and SSA, where required. Please understand that only qualified applicants will be contacted.

Name: Business Systems Analyst - ISR
Description: Title: Business Systems Analyst - ISRID: 180185Location: Washington, DCDescriptionBusiness Systems Analyst  Business Analyst  VISTA Technology Services, Inc. (VISTA) is currently seeking a business analyst to work in Arlington, VA (Crystal City and Pentagon).
