Job Requirements: Responsible for the coordination and completion of assigned tasks to support DoD projects over a project’s life-cycle, applying depth and breadth of experience in information  technology (IT) department. Extensive experience and judgment is demonstrated applying a wide variety of project management principles, practices, and procedures. Demonstrates comprehensive knowledge of programmatic, fiscal, and legal governance in guiding subordinates and advising Government management in all phases of project management.Coordinates deadlines and monitoring activities on project execution, gate reviews, technical baselines and milestone reviews, and status updates in written and oral manner. Reviews and provides edits to artifact of Vendor subordinates to ensure relational information and program or policy information remains relevant to reporting status, Government formats, and formal reviews.Plans, organizes, and integrates data and relevant information in to achieve critical milestones, reviews and project completion over a project’s life-cycle. Responsible for advising Government managers on calculated or known changes in status, logistics and/or crucial data influencing the progress of projected and realized events.Prepares reports for Government management regarding status, issues, risks, financial and other requested data, per Government direction. May also review artifacts or contributions made by subordinate Contractors prior to submission to Government management.Ensures procedures and database tools or applications are followed, IAW Government direction.Using databases, web-portals, applications, and project management tools, assists the Government in developing responses to ad hoc internal and external assignments, ensuring accuracy and technical merit.Integrates and validates project data and liaisons within and across departments or experts to acquire and report pertinent facts, relational information, or statistical impact to timelines, financial execution/spend plans.Advanced communication skills to address quasi-technical and programmatic elements to ensure accurate and timely information to Government management.Required Job Qualifications: Minimum Education Requirement: Bachelor’s Degree  Experience: 4+ Years in DoD Project Management and/or Program Management Office  (PMO)/Program Executive Office (PEO), or DoD HQ Program Management/Action Officer  Clearance: DoD Secret Highly Desired but not required: Experience as a Pentagon Action officer with 2+ years working at the Pentagon for Department HQ  Experience working with Army Installation Status Report  VISTA offers a strong compensation package and a competitive leave package. A generous benefit plan includes medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, tuition assistance and employer matching 401(k) plan.  Government executives utilize VISTA for information technology, management consulting, decision support systems and a broad portfolio of analytical services. Our focus on real property helps our clients gain the greatest value from money they spend on buildings, land and infrastructure.  To learn more about VISTA and to apply for this position, please visit our website at www.VISTAtsi.com.  VISTA is an AA/Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Disability/Veterans Employer

We are proud of our ability to help shape tomorrow, while ensuring today's U.S. and coalition forces can carry out their critical missions and tasks. Control quality, cost, and schedule for all deliverables and work products. Interfaces and coordinates with various government and contractor stakeholders to ensure efficient cooperation. Name: Configuration Management Analyst HLOF4
Description: HLO - E3s Homeland Operations (HLO) Division employees bring domain knowledge, specialized insight, and operational expertise to support Department of Homeland Security (DHS) customers. Our team provides rapid, innovative, and specialized solutions that enable our DHS clients to succeed at meeting dynamic mission objectives. Our careers include mission operations, data analytics, operational assessments, requirements management, financial/budget management, strategic communications and planning, stakeholder engagement and facilitation services, acquisition support, systems engineering and technical assistance (SETA), and business process reengineering.E3 Federal Solutions, LLC seeks Configuration Management Analysts to join our team in support of our projected work with the Department of Homeland Security - Transportation Security Administration - Secure Flight Work Program.  The Configuration Management (CM) Analysts will be responsible for configuration baseline management, CMDB Ownership, and defining and ensuring that CI controls and processes are followed for application code releases into non-production and production environments. Define, roll out and steward the appropriate change release management methodologies and processes as well as the use of automation tools such as Ansibel/Puppet/Chef/etc.Work with multiple teams to meet acceptance criteria, and gathering/documenting release requirements.Communicate and report on release items, keeping them on track and schedule.1+ years of experience and/or High School diploma/GED2 Years experience with configuration managementExperience with automated CMDB toolICAgile Certified Professional (ICP)Experience with Agile, DevOps. Must be a U.S. Citizen and currently hold an ACTIVE Secret or Interim Secret security clearance.Experience with RatClear Case, Gradle, Jenkins, AIX, RedHat Linux. E3 Federal Solutions (E3) specializes in helping Federal clients solve their most challenging business problems. Our motivated and technology-enabled workforce utilizes proven management and technical consulting practices and applies agile principles and data-driven decision making to enable our clients to better meet mission requirements. We create significant value for our clients by bringing subject matter expertise across the Federal marketplace in the disciplines of Acquisition Lifecycle Management, Program Management Support Services, Systems Engineering and Technical Assistance, and Facilities and Engineering Management. Excellence, Accountability, Community, Humility and Integrity are the core values of E3 as we become recognized leaders in the management consulting community as trusted partners to Federal agencies and to industry. We are an organization that offers both our employees and clients an exceptional experience; our culture is contagious, and we always maintain a genuine reputation.  As an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer, E3 Federal Solutions (E3) is dedicated to making all employment decisions without regard to race, color, sex (including gender and transgender status), age, religion, national origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, registered domestic partner or civil union status, gender identity, medical condition, genetic information, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. verbally and in writing, technical information and presentations to non-technical audiences;Education BS in Business, Finance, System Engineering or related field required  Travel 0 - 20% LS Name: Industry X- 3DEXPERIENCE Senior Business Analyst
Description: Job descriptionIndustry X.0 -Level  9 – 3DEXPERIENCE Senior Analyst: The digital revolution is changing everything. It’s  everywhere – transforming how we work and play. Are you reacting to the  disruption each day or are you leading the way as a digital disrupter?  Accenture Digital is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life  across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of  digital, you’ll create it, own it and make it a reality for clients looking to  better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises.  Join us and become an integral part of our experienced digital team with  the credibility, expertise and insight clients depend on. Industry X.0 A new area within Accenture Digital is Industry X.0, an  advanced, digitally enabled, innovative, planning and  investment approach for manufacturing and asset-intensive industries  In your role within our Industry X.0 team, you’ll help  clients take advantage of significant market opportunities as digital technology  moves into the core of industry in product development and manufacturing  environments. You’ll help them transform their product, manufacturing and  product related services value chains in Products, Communications, Media, High  Tech, Aerospace & Defense, Chemicals, Mining, Oil & Gas and Utilities.  As part of Accenture Digital, you’ll benefit from tailored career  management and specialist skills that will fuel your ambitions in the Industry  X.0 space.  Responsibilities of the 3DEXPERIENCE  Senior Analyst may include: Provide  Technical- and Domain-Expertise on complex projects.Participate  in requirements gathering and specifications creation.Participate  in the technical design, supporting the technical architect.Development:  configure the applications based on the functional and technical design.Deployment  / Implementation: Diagnose and resolve defects. Contribute to, and  prepare, implementation plan details. Execute the implementation  plan.Documentation:  Document the configuration and architecture.Validation  Tests: Conduct unit testing and functional and integration testing,  including preparation of test cases/scenarios and test data.Maintenance:  Analyze, design and produce solution enhancements.Coaching  of workstream team(s).Successfully  supporting the management team in different project workstreams.Programming:  Write new, or modify existing, process extension based on physical design  and/or programming specifications. This includes documenting the code.Reporting:  Progress status and issues.Meet  travel requirements, up to 80%.+ Basic qualificationsBasic Qualifications:1  + years of professional experience programming with 3DEXPERIENCE or other  Dassault Systèmes products, including 1 + years of professional experience  programming with JAVABachelor’s  Degree in Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science  or related degree.Preferred Qualifications: API development.Systems Implementation  methodology knowledge (Agile Methodology, Waterfall).Data migration experience.Team management experience.Excellent communication  (written and oral) and interpersonal skills.Collaboration skills.Ability to work in a team  environment.Flexibility.Time management skills. All of our consulting  professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen,  technical and professional skills development. You’ll also have  opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of  specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training  programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills  faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training  conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The  sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an  unbeatable platform from which to build a career.  Applicants for employment in the US  must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require  sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and  with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other  non-immigrant status).  Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated  Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of  Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All employment decisions shall be  made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin,  ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender  identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status  or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.  Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our  service men and women.

Name: IT Business Analyst/Business Architects (MUST BE CLEARABLE)
Description: IT Business Analyst/ Business Architects Understand and apply Agile development methodology as it applies to requirements management Based on the analysis, document as-is business processes, identify gaps, and develop to-be business processes Work with the technical team to develop technical solutions for the identified business requirements Evaluate legacy and competing solutions to identify gaps and areas for improvement Document system requirements based on the identified technical solution Facilitate reviews of requirements to get approval on the documented requirements Prepare instruction and process manuals Support the development team to effectively test software applications Evaluate procedures on an ongoing basis to ensure they are up to date and reflect newly adapted practices. Conduct research and analysis to understand cause, effects, and impact of system problems Interview users and perform research to gather user needs, problems, and requirements to understand goals Participate in Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions with business users / SES managers Evaluate legacy and competing solutions to identify gaps and areas for improvement Facilitate reviews of requirements to get approval on the documented requirements Working on software development projects, infrastructure, SaaS and/or Cloud solutions ; Applying analytical skills to determine business value and document accurate business requirements and present these requirements in a manner that is concise, measurable and flexible enough to meet project needs; Ability to communicate well within cross-functional teams and to be the bridge between technical teams Good written and verbal interpersonal skills to build relationships with users, Identify software system capabilities, research on vendors/contractors online or through interviews to evaluate their capabilities in different areas, and provide recommendations. Research on alternatives to TeamMate (or TeamMate+), the audit software currently used by the Office of Audits. Has software developer background and understands at a high-level how the implement the major technical capabilities. Requirement gathering and analysis utilizing Use Case development, joint requirements development sessions with stakeholders and Unified Modeling Language (UML) Diagrams (Use Cases, Business Rules and Process Flow). In providing solutions to user requirements, follows industry-standard best practices throughout the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC). - provided by DiceSEE BELOW

Name: Agile Business Analyst
Description: About ExcellaExcella Consulting is a leading provider of Agile software development and data and analytics solutions to clients in the federal, commercial and non-profit sectors. We believe that great work leads to great things –- our experts measure success by the positive impact we make on our clients, community, and colleagues. We are growing fast and need passionate, innovative people who love working with technology and are ready to make an impact.  Here's what you can expect from us: We care about our employees. In fact, The Washington Post and The Washington Business Journal consistently rank us as a "Best Place to Work."You'll work with great people who love what they do: our team includes published authors, certified trainers, and internationally renowned speakers.We have a "bring your own device" workplace and will share the cost of a new computer of your choice -- Mac or PC. It's up to you.We'll invest in your career by providing 3 days of paid professional development every year, including travel and registration fees to attend classes and conferences, in addition to tuition assistance for degrees and certifications.Starting day one, every employee is bonus eligible and receives 17 days of paid vacation.You can bike, drive, or metro to work -- our commute reimbursement plan has you covered.We cater dinner once a month, and always have healthy snacks available!You'll have fun! We hold monthly happy hours and events all year long, including a summer weekend getaway for you and your family OverviewWe are looking for thought leaders in Agile Business Analysis to join our team who have a desire to deliver valuable software application solutions which meet client needs. Our business analysts are team-oriented, collaborative, and focus on delivering value in everything we do. We use agile methods to analyze, define and document business requirements for software solutions which align with organizational goals and help our clients achieve their desired outcomes.ResponsibilitiesExperience working independently to deliver results.Requirements elicitation: Apply different techniques to facilitate meetings and workshops, create a shared understanding with stakeholders, and engage team-members without using reams of paper or electronic documents.Requirements analysis: Collaborates with stakeholders and product teams to decompose large epic stories into features and user stories that can be understood and approved by members of the development team.Requirements documentation: Requires a strong experience managing product backlog and product roadmap.Strong experience creating user stories and acceptance criteria to express requirements.Familiarity with Scrum process and role of Product Owner.Experience providing product management support such as prioritization and backlog grooming.Conduct testing such as functional testing, user acceptance testing (UAT), automated acceptance testing (AAT), and specification by example.Strong interpersonal skills to engage team members, clients, and stakeholders and communicate business expectations to the technical development expert in ways they can produce desired outcome.Builds trust and respect, establish relationships, and develop rapport with technical and non-technical team members. QualificationsB.A. or B.S. (focus in Computer Information Systems, Business Management, Engineering, or related area of study is a plus)4+ years’ experience in IT or related industryPrior consulting and client management experience is a plusExceptional interpersonal and communication skills (verbal, written, and presentation)Strong knowledge of office productivity toolsExcellent organizational skills and detail orientationStrong analytical aptitude, and an ability to structure complex or undefined business problemsUnderstanding of change management practices In addition, we are seeking individuals with applicable certifications such as CBAP, CCBA, CSM, CSPO, CSP, and ITIL.

Name: Analyst
Description: Qualifications Bachelors degree in related major, finance degree a plus  At least 2 to 4 years relevant Finance experience, ideally in the real estate industry  Advanced Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools, especially Excel, and ideally with Argus  Familiarity with CoStar  Ability to quickly learn Brookfield analytic and reporting systems  Excellent interpersonal, analytical and problem solving ability  Strong written and verbal communication skills  Self-motivated and proactive, both with respect to managing workload and own professional development  Ability to handle large volume of work; good organizational skills and ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines Scope of Responsibilities Financial Analysis, market analysis, and preparation of presentations for management review  Prepare cash flow projections and discounted cash flow and valuation analysis of existing properties  Prepare annual budgets and cash flow projections for corporate business plan  Prepare Monthly Leasing Book , which includes monthly updates of leasing activity, updating stacking plans, expiration schedules and debt summaries  Assist in the preparation of quarterly reports for Board and Investor presentations  Research credit strength of existing and potential clients  Maintain database of lease and sales comps  Perform analysis of proposed leasing transactions in support of leasing team and for deal approvals  Assist in compiling market data and preparing quarterly market reports  Plan and assist with the due diligence process for acquisitions  Coordinate with asset management, lease administration, corporate services, marketing, and investor relations and provide them with necessary information so they can perform their business functions

Name: Business Strategy Analyst
Description: Job Number: R0039630 Business Strategy AnalystKey Role:  Provide clients with strategy, policy, and program analysis and data analytics to ensure alignment with Navy and DoD objectives. Assess client program linkages to strategy, identify gaps or seams and provide data and research-informed recommendations to enhance outcomes, and inform high-level reporting requirements. Work across all facets of the data management life cycle, including request, receipt, extraction, cleaning, coding, computation, and results write-up to help clients comprehend the meaning behind their data. Develop and adapt measurement strategies to meet evolving data needs from key stakeholders. Assist with the development of briefings, point papers, talking points, and presentations to inform senior leader decisions. Develop and coordinate working groups to keep the client informed of actions being taken by all relevant stakeholders.  Basic Qualifications:  -3+ years of experience in a professional work environment  -Experience with the collection, manipulation, statistical analysis, and visualization of large data sets  -Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word  -Ability to develop and present compelling data visualizations and summaries to support research-informed decision-making  -Ability to contribute in a dynamic, team-oriented environment  -Ability to work independently, collaboratively, creatively, and analytically in a problem-solving environment  -Active Secret clearance  -BA or BS degree  Additional Qualifications:  -Experience with DoD, Navy, or Service staff as military, civilian, or contractor, including Joint Staff, OPNAV, and Navy SYSCOMs  -Experience in working with analytical tools, including Rstudio, STATA, or SPSS  -Experience with design thinking and human-centered design methodologies  -Knowledge of key Navy programs and systems currently in service and under development  -Ability to use statistical programming languages, including R or Python and VBA  -Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills  -MA or MS degree preferred  Clearance:  Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.  Were an EOE that empowers our peopleno matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or veteran statusto fearlessly drive change.NMC

Name: Salesforce Business Systems Analyst Sr
Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a Senior Salesforce Business Analyst for the Enterprise CRM Program team to contribute to the success of implementation and evolution of the bank?s Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platforms. The Senior Salesforce Business Analyst will play a vital role supporting a large-scale CRM program to ensure the timely delivery of innovative solutions to address complex business objectives across the enterprise. The position will collaborate between business groups and technology teams and will be responsible for working with cross-functional teams to assess and design business models, gather business requirements, integrate technology, develop training and implementation materials, and provide post-implementation support. *Responsibilities:** + Provide program management and conduct business and systems analysis on a variety of projects and initiatives in the Enterprise CRM Program  + Collaborate with business partners, subject matter experts and other team members to define and document high-level business needs and detailed requirements  + Define and implement improvements to business process and ad-hoc projects in the face of ever-changing marketplace and consumers.  + Create and maintain business process flow maps and diagrams to facilitate understanding of business needs and translate to technology solutions  + Define scope of projects and timelines associated with the completion of initiatives  + Develop and maintain relationships and communications with other team members and internal partners  + Conduct meetings and facilitate collaborative discussions to develop requirements and new functionality needs  + Serve as point of contact for user support and problem solving  + Lead efforts to investigate, analyze, and resolve application issues related to system functionality  + Review and validate test plan approaches as well as participate in system testing *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications:** + Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience  + 6-8 years business analyst experience with utilizing program management methodology  + 3-5 years? experience working with CRM systems  + 3-5 years? experience with system testing *Preferred Qualifications** + Excellent analytical, quantitative, and problem solving skills with the proven ability to communicate and influence effectively at various levels of the organization  + Proven leadership skills and ability to lead others in defining requirements and identifying solutions  + In depth knowledge of business operations and processes for multiple businesses  + Sharp focus on achieving results; persists at completing tasks despite challenges; ability to achieve results and navigate through ambiguity  + Well-organized; plans activities and consistently follows up  + Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment  + Proficient in MS Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint  + Salesforce Administrator Certification (or ability to obtain within one year)  + Project management  + Agile methodology  + Sales processes and methodologies  + Six Sigma or other process improvement methodologies  + Financial services industry experience *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** United States*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180038418*Other Locations:** Minnesota-MN-Richfield U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Analyst
Description: CVP (https://www.cvpcorp.com/) is a rapidly growing information technology (IT) and business strategy consultancy that helps clients Navigating Change. CVP recently made Inc. Magazines 5000 Fastest Growing Companies list for the eighth time and is a 2017 Washington Post Top Workplace. If culture is important to you, CVP is where you want to work. CVP is based on a culture of teamwork, respect, and flexibility. With a collaborative and diverse work environment and a strong team of smart, engaged professionals, we pride ourselves on a culture that not only promotes inclusion and open communication, but also personal and professional growth.  Founded in 2003, our team of 300+ professionals supports clients in the healthcare, national security and public sectors in achieving their mission goals by delivering improved business efficiency, workforce optimization and innovative technology solutions. Our seasoned professionals provide experience-based solutions across our four core competencies: Agile Systems Integration, Cybersecurity, Performance Transformation and Analytics, and Training and Strategic Communication.  CVP is seeking highly talented Analysts to join our growing team in the Baltimore, MD and Washington, D.C. Metropolitan areas. This is an exciting career opportunity for a professional with an interest in consulting, business analysis, data analysis, business management, and strategic planning. The ideal candidate is entrepreneurial, innovative, analytical, and has a strong interest in how technology solves matters of great national importance, especially in healthcare, national security, and digital government.  Job Responsibilities Assimilate quickly into CVPs consultative approachUtilize analytical skills to solve interesting and complex problemsGain an understanding of the clients goals and daily objectives, help to measure and define success, and ensure a consistent approach to solving problemsCollaborate with the project team to perform business analysis Requirements Eligibility to obtain a government security clearanceCoursework or equivalent seminar in statistical analysisClear and concise verbal and written communication capabilities; effective team and client collaborationAbility to listen and capture information in a fast-paced environment, ensuring that critical points are notedAbility to research and confidently assemble an argument and back it up with evidenceAdvanced MS Excel skills or other database skillsBachelors Degree Desired Skills Proficiency in SQLUp to one year of relevant experience CVP Vision  CVP aims to be a nationally recognized, trusted advisor for our clients in addressing our nations most critical needs. We seek to be the kind of firm that is a sought out destination for passionate and talented professionals who share our core values: Intense Client FocusMutual RespectIndividual Responsibility and GrowthUncompromising Integrity To be considered immediately for this opportunity, please submit your resume on your college career website.  Customer Value Partners, Inc. is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor and an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

Name: Analyst
Description: Analysts contribute to the firm by conducting much of the initial research and development of deliverables for various client engagements. Through their role, Analysts develop strong research, presentation, and client communication skills.  We are currently looking to add a few more Analyst (Recent Graduate) level professionals to our team who have an interest in management consulting, and a background in analysis, problem solving, and critical thinking.  The ideal candidate would be someone with strong business acumen and relevant skills who is interested in taking on a role in business strategy, utilizing their specialties to add unique perspective and value to client projects.Primary Responsibilities:  Engagement Delivery Regularly interface with DayBlink Clients in a professional and personable mannerCreate the appropriate deliverables required for the completion of various client projects,Provide exceptional value to our clients on engagements of varying sizes, scope, and industry.Utilize your personal skill-set and knowledge base to develop impressive personal brand-identity to maximize your value to the firmComply with DayBlink standards for all client deliverables and continually hone your business acumen and consulting skillsPrepare and present clear, high-quality presentations, reports, and other documents in an engaging and effective manner as required by each project Business and Practice Development Expand skill set and knowledge base in area(s) of concentration that are of interest to youSynthesize lessons from past engagements, emerging technology, processes, or strategies, or industry knowledge to contribute to the firm’s thought leadershipIdentify new skills and experience required by the firmSupport the recruitment process by maintaining a relationship with your alma mater and all potential alumni/ae groups to generate quality referralsRequired Skills & Proficiencies: Required of all Team Members Fanaticism for quality and strict attention to detailProven work-ethic and comfortability with significant work loadComfortability with autonomy and a work environment that requires you to hold yourself accountableCalm and likeable demeanor under normal and high-pressure circumstancesStrong oral and written communication skills; ability to prepare and deliver high quality presentation documentsStrong interpersonal skills and ability to work well, collaborating effectively in team environmentQuick learner; strong technical acumen and ability to learn new technologies and technical concepts quicklyHighly comfortable with change, ambiguity and dynamic work environmentsProficiency in MS Office packageWillingness to travel up to 80% Preferred SpecializationsDayBlink expects all team members to contribute to our collective consulting knowledge as generalists prepared to take on a wide variety of client projects and internal initiatives. From time to time, our projects require us to look for generalists who also maintain specific certifications (CPA, CISM, CISSP, PMP, CSM, SHRM etc…) and domain expertise (cyber-security, finance, accounting, agile transformation, data science, digital transformation, etc…). Anyone with expertise in a specific field or subject in addition to more general consulting experience is encouraged to apply as our needs and opportunities are constantly evolving.Education and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree required; Preference for fields relevant to our current needs.0 – 2 years of relevant experience; Preference for candidates with previous experience in management consulting, advisory, professional services.Strong track record of success in previous relevant internships, full-time jobs, and extracurricular involvement; Preference for candidates who were promoted early, recognized for their achievements, and can provide quality samples of deliverables/projects they created. Job Specifications Location: Washington, DC | Philadelphia, PASalary Range: $60,000 – $65,000 Base Salary + 30% Max Bonus + Industry Leading Benefits About DayBlink ConsultingDayBlink is a boutique management consulting firm with headquarters in the Washington, DC Metro area. We were founded in 2013 with the intention of bringing innovation to the management consulting industry by utilizing an on-going promotion system and a hybrid consulting, venture capital, and philanthropic model. We are a firm of talented and entrepreneurial professionals with experience from varying backgrounds dedicated to solving our clients’ problems in a more effective and strategic manner. We have been recognized nationally for our company culture, our employee satisfaction, and the quality of our work. We are growing and want you to be a part of our team!

Name: Intelligence Analyst (Junior level)
Description: Job Description:No two career paths will ever look the same. At Leidos, we know the most talented and diverse IT and engineering professionals will always have a multitude of career choices; your time at Leidos will be a wise investment in your career and in yourself.Our Civil business is helping to modernize and manage infrastructure, systems and controls, and cyber security for civilian agencies and commercial clients around the globe. With core competencies in information technology, energy and environment, complex logistics, and specialized engineering, we solve technical challenges and implement newfound efficiencies on a number of programs!Protect yourself and your family, with the benefits of working for a world-class employer. When you join Leidos, you join a Fortune 500 company and one of Ethisphere Institute's "World's Most Ethical Companies" Leidos...We strive to make the complex clear.***Applicant must have an ACTIVE "Top Secret" security clearance***What You'll Get to Do:-Provide intelligence analysis services to the Counterintelligence Division (CD).-Assist with thorough research and analysis of various transactions for threats to US national security. This written intelligence analysis shall be completed using Intelligence Community (IC) standards and other guidance.-The analyst will conduct extensive, comprehensive research and basic analysis.-In addition, he/she will assist with researching and analyzing transactions of ongoing programs and projects as assigned; assess threats both to the United States and specific departments, evaluate telecommunication license applications for implications to the broader telecommunication market and must assess if license request will impact law enforcement equities or present national security issues; conduct in-depth research and analysis of specified foreign merger, acquisition, or investment transactions.You'll Bring These Qualifications:-Requires a BA degree or equivalent experience and less than 2 years prior relevant experience.-Minimum of 5+ years of intelligence analysis experience in support of the Intelligence Community.-Experience using analytic techniques and tools to identify trends, fill information gaps, develop assessments (e.g. Palantir).-Experience analyzing and evaluating intelligence against a wide range of data sources.-Substantial knowledge of intelligence operations, procedures, techniques and terminology of the IC; knowledge of developing and presenting products and information.-Experience with Interagency Collaboration.-Excellent oral and written communications; ability to argue a position and effectively share concepts with other IC entities. -Proficient in utilizing basic computer applications and intelligence related automation to support analytical efforts and product development.

Name: Analyst
Description: Updated June 4, 2018  Beyond20 is seeking an Analyst to join our growing training and consulting practice based in Washington, DC. This position will be based in our downtown office and report to the Director of Services.  The successful candidate will be a key player on our team - coordinating day-to-day activities and tasks while serving as point of contact for consulting and training initiatives. Name: Analyst
Description: Analyst  Our OrganizationTHRUUE is a growing consulting firm that offers strategy creation, change management, and leadership transformation services that result in reimagined purpose, improved performance, increased impact, engaged employees, and sustained relevance. We collaborate side-by-side with our clients to create great strategy and realize a high-performance culture.We value: Client Centeredness: we are passionate people who love consulting and, as a matter of personal and professional integrity, are dedicated to meeting or exceeding our clients’ expectations. We feel we have been successful only when we earn the trust and respect of our clients, with whom we establish long-term professional relationships.Reflection: we believe in the value of gathering input and considering multiple perspectives as a key part of the considered decision-making process. As part of the services we provide to our clients and the way we operate as professionals, THRUUE prioritizes moments of reflection and deliberate thinking.Trustworthiness: we embrace openness as a key building block for respect and collaboration. In every engagement, we seek to present the unvarnished truth in an appropriate and helpful manner, including respecting personal and professional confidences. We value openness as the foundation for trust.Inventiveness: we thrive on new ideas and generative teamwork, collaborating with one another to make connections and build on our clients’ efforts. The right individual will not only have 1-3 years of experience as a consultant, and also looking for an opportunity to push themselves to grow in new contexts by joining a small and ambitious boutique firm. deep curiosity and passion for learningThrive in challenging situations and enjoy pushing themselves to growAre focused on ensuring the highest quality work is delivered to their client Divergent thinkers welcome.Role and Responsibilities: Provide direct support to managers and senior staff during all stages of client engagements and keep team members informed of progressConduct market research and collect/analyze both qualitative and quantitative dataSupport interviews with internal stakeholders and subject matter expertsLeverage your knowledge of business and strategy frameworks, as well as past consulting experience, in deliveryDevelop project-related materials (e.g. research reports, presentations, white papers, etc.)Participate in client workshops (i.e. coordinate logistics, create presentation materials, take notes, and assist lead facilitators as needed)Provide creative insights and observations to help identify and resolve issues critical to clients’ strategic and operational successSkills and Qualifications:Undergraduate degree with 1-3 years of work experience, previous consulting experience requiredDeliverable creation experience with a history of increasing responsibilityStrong research, analytical, and conceptual skills and an ability to learn and adapt quicklyExcellent oral and written communication skills and interpersonal skillsComfortable engaging with C-Suite-level clientsAbility and willingness to travel to client sites as neededAbility to work both autonomously and collaborativelySelf-motivated with strong intellectual creativity and curiosityClient-focused orientation with a commitment to high quality work and a strong attention to detailHigh energy level, with a strong sense of commitment and pride for workProfessional integrity and cultural sensitivityStrong PowerPoint and Excel skills U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Information: Individuals seeking employment at THRUUE are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation. You will be given the opportunity to provide the above information in order to help us comply with federal and state Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action record keeping, reporting, and other legal requirements.  Interested applicants please complete the online application.

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: We are looking for a strong business analyst with a solid background in supporting the creation of SaaS products in an Agile environment. While Vibrent is a healthcare technology company, the candidate need not have specific healthcare experience. The ability to analyze a business strategy, break it down into executable parts of an implementation roadmap, and write and analyze agile user stories is key to this role. We are looking for someone with the experience, confidence, and skills requisite with this special opportunity.  This role is a full-time role in our Northern Virginia office. This position reports to the Director of Product Management.  Responsibilities: Business analyst in an agile development process working daily with user experience designers, visual designers, and software engineers to make strategic and tactical decisions about product functionality, balancing appropriate tradeoffs between business goals, user goals, scalability/maintainability, time-to-market, and process efficiency.Write "Agile user stories" and acceptance criteria for feature additions and enhancements to the product platform.Help the Director of Product Management manage the backlog and user story priorities.Write and analyze business intelligence and analytics requirements.Develop presentations and communications materials.Analyzes and documents client's complex business requirements and processes; constructs conceptual data and process models, including data dictionaries and volume estimates to communicate requirements.Provides time estimates for project related tasks. Name: Agile Business Analyst

The Agile Business Analyst will assist in Product Owner engagement, backlog management, and acceptance criteria definition. The Agile Business Analyst will also serve as a knowledgeable resource in advising the Scrum Team on tools and techniques to improve the development, collection, analysis, and reporting of information. proficient in teamwork -- coordination, collaboration, facilitation, and information sharing.Possess excellent oral and written communication, problem solving, and diplomatic skill sets.Must be detail oriented, self-starter, able to work independently without constant direction.Ability and willingness to work with challenging clients and provide effective communication for successful architecture development.Required Skills and Qualifications:3 – 5 years of functional experience as a business analyst on projects focused on Agile software development.2 years of experience writing user stories/ acceptance criteria and maintaining Scrum backlogs.Experience in Agile/Scrum and in supporting Agile efforts.Excellent organizational and communication skills.Ability to work effectively independently and with a team.Proficient in MS Office suite.Agile Certification (PM/PO, Agilist, Scrum Master, etc.).Bachelor Degree in IT, Business, or Management OR 5 years of broad/diverse background and experience in business analysis, functional requirements management, IT systems test and evaluation, and/or IT operations.IT testing and evaluation skills is preferred.Location: Calverton, MD. Some travel to Annapolis Junction, MD, will be required. Company Profile: IntelliWare is a privately-owned company founded to provide business and technical services to government and commercial clients. The ideal candidate would be familiar with security technologies, systems integration, systems development. Preferred Skills:Required Qualifications:BS degree in an IT or Engineering field, 8-10 years of progressive experience in leading efforts in planing, designing, building and/or operating systems in IT or Cybersecurity.Demonstrated experience in a client facing consultative role - Product Manager, Systems Engineer, Technical Solutions Architect.Expert knowledge of key cybersecurity domains including but not limited to IDAM, Network Security, Application development, security engineering, network security, etc.Strong logical/critical thinking abilities, especially analyzing existing application and systems architectures.Ability to translate business requirements into technology solutions and architecture plans.Ability to analyze operational requirements, business needs, and operational data to support the development of applications and systems.Proven experience leading the development of technology roadmaps, conducting product overviews, providing detailed reporting, backlog and documentation for enterprise technology solutions.Ability to identify and determine software, services and process necessary to exact into sustainable cyber solutions.Strong desire to apply new and emerging techniques and technologies to solve complex cyber security related tasks.Experience working within an Agile and/or Dev/Ops framework.Familiar with concepts of big data, big data processing and analytic systems.Strong communication (written & verbal), influence and negotiating skills.Desired Qualifications:Understanding of Cybersecurity organization practices, operations risk management processes, principles, architectural requirements, engineering threats and vulnerabilities, including incident response methodologiesExperience with Customer Relationship Management software is a plusSecurity certifications such as CISSP or Security+ are a plusExperience with IDAM, BlockChain, and Rapid Prototyping.Closing Statement: XOR Security offers a very competitive benefits package including health insurance coverage from first day of employment, 401k with a vested company match, vacation and supplemental insurance benefits.  XOR Security is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). M/F/D/V. Name: Digital Strategist / Data Analyst
Description: Position Overview  This position is responsible for collecting and analyzing digital analytics across all of the client’s channels and communicating key findings to the organization’s senior leadership team and to colleagues in the Communications department. The major tasks include analyzing data, interpreting results, and developing clear analysis that tells the story behind the numbers for the client’s external communications activities. This role is located in Washington, DC and the individual will report to a manager in the digital team in Communications. Responsibilities  • Uses analytics to make recommendations to optimize performance of client digital properties, including website, newsletters, and social media. Analyze the data and trends to improve SEO and inform content strategies.  • Proactively collaborates with various team members to plan, execute, and evaluate content performance and A/B testing across channels.  • Communicates results effectively by telling the story behind the data and developing actionable recommendations.  • Tracks and measures metrics across the digital suite of tools at the organizational, project, campaign, and content level.  • Works to improve data methodology by applying statistical methods to reduce “noise” and improve results.  • Generates, writes, and distributes analytic reports for Communications and program staff that result in a better understanding of client’s audience and provide insight into trends to help strategic planning.  • Develops benchmarking for client’s digital properties.  • Responds to requests for metrics from colleagues across the Communications department; prepares presentations on metrics.  • Defines traffic and engagement baseline measurements for client websites and other digital channels; suggests improvements in content production and placement that could help increase client’s audience reach, engagement, and impact.  • Educates colleagues on identifiable trends based on analytics and provides overviews of effective communications tactics and lessons learned.  • Presents to all levels of staff to help inform colleagues about the value of analytics, new data and analysis, results of testing, and best practices.  • Contributes to and participates in tasks and special projects as assigned. Requirements  • Bachelor’s degree with a focus on statistics, mathematics, computer science, marketing or similar degree experience preferred.  • A minimum of four years of applicable professional experience required.  • Strong strategic and tactical analytics and metrics understanding and skills, honed by previous digital analytics experience in either the for-profit or nonprofit arena.  • Significant experience configuring and using tag management and data management platforms required.  • Demonstrable expertise in Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Twitter analytics, and Facebook Insights is required.  • Experience with business intelligence platforms required. Other analytics software experience is a plus.  • Understanding of digital marketing best practices including developing and optimizing measurement frameworks for content marketing campaigns, cross-channel advertising efforts, email marketing campaigns, as well as SEO requirements.  • Proven experience using SQL to effectively manipulate various data sets, clean and prepare data for analysis, and query data for scheduled and on-demand reporting needs.  • Analytical programming experience including predictive analytics, modeling, and forecasting is preferred.  • Strong technical aptitude with the ability to analyze data, interpret information and trends in large amounts of data to develop actionable recommendations  • Proficiency with data programming of some kind (R, Python, etc.) is preferred.  • Strong project management and organizational skills. Able to handle multiple projects simultaneously, set priorities, organize time and identify resources for projects.  • Team player. Ability to work in groups and individually to meet goals. Ability to understand organizational structures and effectively work through administrative systems.  • Solid communication skills—must be able to work one-on-one with staff to inform, convince, and encourage.  • Presenting/public speaking experience a plus.

Name: Operations Risk Analyst IV
Description: Fannie Mae provides reliable, large-scale access to affordable mortgage credit in communities across our nation. We are the leading source of funding for housing in America, which means more people can buy or rent a home. We are focused on sustaining the housing recovery, improving our company, and leading change to make housing better.Join our diverse, high-performing team and make a difference as we work together to enable access to a good home.For more information about Fannie Mae, visit Identify, measure, and monitor the company's operational risk in how its transactions and infrastructure function. Assess risks from unauthorized trading, software or hardware failures, lack of oversight of operations, or contingencies that would prompt disaster recovery programs. Assess threats to data integrity and security of networks and the consequences of failures or breaches. Recommend or implement risk mitigation strategies or practices.THE COMPANY Fannie Mae provides reliable, large-scale access to affordable mortgage credit in communities across our nation. We are the leading source of funding for housing in America, which means more people can buy or rent a home. We are focused on sustaining the housing recovery, improving our company, and leading change to make housing better.  Join our diverse, high-performing team and make a difference as we work together to enable access to a good home.  For more information about Fannie Mae, visit http://www.fanniemae.com/progress JOB INFORMATION Identify, measure, and monitor the company's operational risk in how its transactions and infrastructure function. Assess risks from unauthorized trading, software or hardware failures, lack of oversight of operations, or contingencies that would prompt disaster recovery programs. Assess threats to data integrity and security of networks and the consequences of failures or breaches. Recommend or implement risk mitigation strategies or practices. KEY JOB FUNCTIONSStudy and review business processes in assigned business unit; examine documentation and flow of work through systems.Confer with business unit staff on business problems or the execution of unusual transactions. Coordinate across business and corporate units, and with customers in ensuring that these less common transactions or exchanges are executed appropriately.Where required by internal policies or external agencies, develop documentation of business processes and safeguards. May prepare reports for inclusion in larger mandated report(s).Plan and facilitate presentations and workshop sessions on process analysis, risk identification, assessment, control and mitigation. May use formal process improvement methodologies to assess and improve operating procedures in work unit(s).Confer with business unit management and staff by scoping business problems, analyzing processes, losses and risk exposure and sharing lessons learned. Identify key problem drivers, and reinforce operational procedures with appropriate internal controls.As needed, participate in or play technical lead in disaster recovery effort.Measure and analyze performance improvement results in a business or corporate unit. Support overall IT control practices, and remediation action plan execution, and integration and systems development life cycle testing and systems certification.EDUCATIONBachelor's Degree or equivalent requiredMINIMUM EXPERIENCE6 years of related experienceSPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLSExperience with operational risk management frameworks and execution, requiredExperience with risk management frameworks, including the three lines of defense, requiredExperience with the design and execution of risk and control self-assessment programs, strongly preferredExperience with the design and execution of scenario analysis programs, strongly preferredExperience with risk measurement and capital methodologies, strongly preferredExperience with the preparation and delivery of presentations to senior executives, preferredStrong collaboration and negotiation skillsStrong problem solving and analytical skillsStrong written and verbal communication skillsHighly adaptable and comfortable with managing competing prioritiesEMPLOYMENT As a condition of employment with Fannie Mae, any successful job applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment drug screen and to successfully complete a background investigation.  Fannie Mae is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Position: Financial Analyst Location: Washington, DC Clearance: Secret clearance (active ideal; must be a US Citizen) Summary: The individual will serve as a Financial Analyst within the Space Communications and Navigation (SCaN) Program at NASA HQ. The SCAN Network Services Division is responsible for several major development projects that implement and transition new capabilities, technologies and systems into the SCaN network infrastructure. These projects encompass major activities that can span multiple NASA field centers and even countries. In managing this broad portfolio of major projects, the program support specialist that will be able to provide programmatic and financial support to enable more effective management of these projects. Responsibilities:Manage and track budget costs and expenditures for large-scale projects. Review details of expenditures versus metrics, and work with support personnel nationwide to determine variance explanations and background information to support the data. Assist in analyzing data, providing recommendations based on statistical analysis, and creating reports.Support the Program with implementing budget processes and procedures, including supporting the distribution of funds, developing and reviewing phasing plans and contribute to the budget formulation process.Generates presentations, charts, graphs, correspondence, spreadsheets, and other similar documents related to technical development activities. Proofreads and provides technical editing to a number of deliverables. Compile comments from multiple stakeholders into a cohesive message.Upload documentation and materials to centralized repositories, and organize content for multiple users. Serves as interface with center project leads and NASA HQ managers. Provide regular communication with major stakeholders of upcoming milestones and deliverables.Plans, schedules, and coordinates activities and processes to support key activities and meetings such as project and program reviews (attending meetings as appropriate).Coordinates meetings on behalf of the customer, taking notes, and disseminating minutes and actions. Tracking and following up on actions of responsible parties.

Name: Business Systems Analyst II

From defensive and offensive cyber operations to data analytics and strategic consulting, the XOR team provides the insight, expertise and dedication to ensure mission success. Our solutions deliver certainty the certainty clients need to make critical decisions and lead with confidence. The Role: XOR Security is actively seeking Business Systems Analyst II's whom will be responsible for supporting the efforts of our USPS customer, focused on delivering Cybersecurity and Digital Integration support services to the Postal Service.  The ideal candidate will have a understanding of systems engineering, software development and have a desire to develop a deeper understanding of information security topics related to Postal Service requirements. The ideal candidate would be familiar with security technologies, systems integration, systems development. Preferred Skills:Required Qualifications:AA or BS degree in an IT or Engineering field, 2-4 years of expertise in IT engineering.Experience in a technology driven position focused on IT Delivery.Ability to identify and determine software, services and process necessary to exact into sustainable cyber solutions.Ability to analyze operational requirements, business needs, and operational data to support the development of applications and systems.Strong logical/critical thinking abilities, especially analyzing existing application and systems architectures.Strong desire to learn new and emerging techniques and technologies to solve complex cyber security related tasks.Experience working within an Agile and/or Dev/Ops framework.Familiar with concepts of big data, big data processing and analytic systems.Desired Qualifications:Understanding of Cybersecurity organization practices, operations risk management processes, principles, architectural requirements, engineering threats and vulnerabilities, including incident response methodologiesKnowledge of key cybersecurity domains including but not limited to IDAM, Network Defense, Application security etc.Experience with Customer Relationship Management software is a plusSecurity certifications such as Security+ or SANS are a plusExperience with IDAM, BlockChain, and Rapid Prototyping efforts.Closing Statement: XOR Security offers a very competitive benefits package including health insurance coverage from first day of employment, 401k with a vested company match, vacation and supplemental insurance benefits. Name: Senior Consultant, Environmental Solutions
Description: About FTI Consulting FTI Consulting, Inc. is a global business advisory firm dedicated to helping organizations manage change, mitigate risk and resolve disputes: financial, legal, operational, political & regulatory, reputational and transactional. With more than 4,600 employees located in 28 countries, FTI Consulting professionals work closely with clients to anticipate, illuminate and overcome complex business challenges and make the most of opportunities. The Company generated $1.81 billion in revenues during fiscal year 2017. For more information, visit www.fticonsulting.com and connect with us on Twitter (@FTIConsulting) , Facebook and LinkedIn .  FTI Consulting continually strives to offer employees and eligible dependents, including domestic partners and eligible domestic partner children, a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Please click here for more information.  FTI Consulting does not accept unsolicited resumes from external firms or agencies. FTI Consulting will not be responsible for placement fees associated with unsolicited resumes.  FTI Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, protected veteran status, religion, physical or mental disability, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, or any other basis protected by law, ordinance, or regulation. About Forensic & Litigation Consulting The Forensic and Litigation Consulting practice at FTI Consulting provides multidisciplinary, independent dispute advisory, investigative, data acquisition/analysis and forensic accounting services to the global business and legal community. Our team supports clients facing high stakes litigation, arbitration and compliance investigations, and regulatory scrutiny. About the Opportunity: FTI Consulting Inc.'s Environmental Solutions practice is seeking a senior consultant with experience in forensic historical research to assist with the execution of environmental-related forensic history projects. The consultant will work under the direction of a Senior Managing Director and other senior staff members to complete historical research assignments that involve the use of libraries, archives, corporate and regulatory agency collections, electronic databases, and other sources of documentary evidence. The senior consultant will also be required to synthesize historical and technical data and develop narratives, presentations, and other work product. Types of applicable experience covers a broad range of topics, including: Site-specific operational history and waste management practicesNatural resource damagesEnvironmental statutes and regulations, with an emphasis on CERCLA and the National Contingency PlanSite investigation and remediation of contaminated propertiesTechnical literature researchSewer infrastructure and wastewater treatment plantsIndustry standards of practiceThe ideal candidate will be able to (1) conduct historical research in a variety of record repositories to identify and obtain potentially relevant records; (2) recognize key information obtained from historical sources; (3) summarize collected historical and technical materials for presentation to our clients; and, (4) work independently.Major Duties and Responsibilities:Conduct detailed historical research at libraries and archives and in various electronic databases and specialized industry resourcesSynthesize records obtained from primary and secondary source materialsDevelop written work product and presentation materials for clientsEmploy commonly used software tools to organize, analyze, and present work findings (at a minimum, skill in Adobe Acrobat and Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint is required)Prepare time and expense reports, participate in practice group and office meetings, and handle general case administration dutiesUndertake other duties as assigned, including out-of-state research trips lasting up to two weeks per tripQualification Requirements:B.S./B.A. in History or related fieldThree years related experienceStrong writing and organizational skillsLibrary research skills, including experience using library catalogs, journal and topical indices, maps, microfilm, and microficheArchival research skills, including familiarity with finding aids and collection inventoriesAbility to analyze primary and secondary source historical records and understand their context in historical perspectiveAbility to think analytically and criticallyAbility to plan and prioritize work plans and assignmentsTeam player with positive and energetic attitude, professional demeanor, and high work quality standardsAbility to work well under pressure and to work independentlyFlexibility in working on multiple assignments concurrently and taking direction from several senior professionalsValid driver's licensePreferred Skills:Experience conducting research at the National Archives facilities and the Library of CongressExperience with public records requests to federal, state, and local agenciesExperience using Microsoft Access and VisioKnowledge of GIS-related mapping and geospatial platformsExperience using document management systems (Relativity, Concordance, Summation, etc.)Ability to perform a wide variety of tasks and respond appropriately to unexpected delays or schedule changesGood verbal and written communication skillsPosition Classification: Exempt
