Name: Financial Analyst III
Description: POSITION: Financial Analyst III LOCATION: 810 Vermont Ave NW, Washington DC 20420 DEPARTMENT: Veterans Administration (VA) - Human Resources and Administration (HR&A) CLEARANCE: N/A  BACKGROUND The mission of The Assistant Secretary for Human Resources and Administration (HR&A) is to lead human capital management strategies, policies, and practices, which cultivate an engaged, proficient, and diverse workforce to transform and continually improve services to Veterans and their families.  Currently, there are a number of separate initiatives to improve HR training, develop HR leadership, and to develop or improve the tools that HR&A uses to accomplish its mission. The contractor shall be responsible for providing strategic and/or operational support to the HR&A Office of Management Planning and Analysis (MP&A)) and the HR&A program offices or business offices, as required. The contractor shall provide support to the Program Offices that manage all HR&A initiatives and shall be accomplished through portfolio management approaches, project management process governance and oversight, and support of contract actions and interagency agreements using a distributed asset concept. The majority of monitoring and oversight is maintained specifically within MP&A. Program Management Office (PMO) assets, consisting of Business Analysts/Program Oversight Managers (POMs) are also located within various HR&A offices or business lines to assist in development and management of transformational initiatives.  The contractor shall provide an enhanced support services model and technically competent personnel to fulfill all Government requirements for program management within HR&A and HR&A Deputy Assistant Secretary (DAS) Offices including integrated enterprise planning and architecture, disciplined capital planning and investment management, resource management, and transition and change management. To best achieve the organization's strategic goals, HR&A must create core competencies in the planning, execution, and sequencing of HR&A projects. The contractor will assist HR&A in establishing a set of values, techniques, and technologies that enable visibility, standardization, performance measurement, and continuous process improvement throughout HR&A. Specifically, the PMO support must include facilitation of effective governance, acquisition, program management, executive communications cross-project integration, performance monitoring, financial management and cost control, and project management. This enhanced PMO support services model will enable HR&A to manage the continuous flow of projects from concept to completion. All POM contractor personnel shall be experienced, knowledgeable, and certified in project management and capable of operating all equipment including IT and associated software programs within their functional area(s). The Government will not be responsible for training. KEY ROLE The Financial Analyst III serves as a leader ensuring that a group of analysts are working in concert to systematically integrate business, cost estimating and financial management processes to ensure the efficient stewardship of effected funds. Must be able to formulate strategic financial plans, prepare cost estimates and correlate financing requirements into executable budgets. Must be able to assess products and or procedures for compliance with government standards, accounting principles, internal controls, and multi-tiered system application standards. Must be able to grasp interrelationships between financial management requirements and automated solutions, considering the current system environment and the potential integration of added systems. Manages completion of work within the time frame specified by the client, ensuring that all requirements are met. Prepares milestone status reports and presentations for colleagues, subordinates, and end user representatives. Is familiar with activity based costing, business case analysis and outsourcing requirements. Such experience shall include support of like size organization that includes, but not limited to: Experiences in financial management / accounting with demonstrated ability to supervise or lead a team of financial analysts.Demonstrates ability in areas such as Cost Estimating, Procurement Strategic Planning and Execution or Business Management.Possesses a thorough knowledge of Federal financial and accounting policies and systems requirements.Demonstrates experience in working with multi-year/no-year appropriations and differing appropriations (e.g., O&M and Procurement).Identifies financial performance issues, analyzes and addresses them in a timely manner. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSBS and/or BA degree, preferably in Accounting, finance, Business Administration or ManagementProject Management Professional (PMP) Certification or its equivalent - preferredEight (8) years financial management experienceHighly recommended and preferred to possess knowledge of the following:(1) Procurement Overview(2) Procurement ProcessNOTE: Your resume must reflect each item under "KEY ROLE" in order to be considered.

Name: Workday Business Analyst
Description: The HRISBusiness Analyst will work with the Lead Business Analyst during a limited-term operations system migration project. The successful candidate will have extensive knowledge of Human Resources processes, protocols, and procedures, and ideally, will have experience with the Workday application. The HRIS Business Analyst will be joining a team of Business Analysts dedicated to the operations system project and will be the lead BA for Human Capital Management within Workday. Preference will be shown to those with ERP exposure and/or those with systems migration experience. The HRIS Business Analyst will serve as an application Subject Matter Expert and help guide end-users on how best to configure the system for our organization. This is a limited term position for the duration of one year. Work closely with end-users and Subject Matter Experts to review existing business processes. Identify improvements and opportunities for efficiency where possible.Elicit and analyze requirements from end-users. Transform requirements into new and updated existing business processes, ensuring alignment with designed configuration of our selected ERP applications.Develop and maintain formal business process documents and diagrams comprehensive of actions to, from, and within the Workday application, inclusive of budgeting tool Adaptive Insights and grants management tool SmartSimple.Work with WWF IT staff and vendors to create, test, and confirm new process solutions, including configurations and integrations.Support Testing Lead by assisting with test script creation and execution during unit testing, end-to-end testing, and integration testing.Support Training Lead by relaying opportunities for user guides and change management.Serve as a Subject Matter Expert of the Workday application to all project team members and end-users.Document technical solutions in user friendly language that combines needed business information with functional technical writing.Communicate frequently, effectively and professionally with internal and external customers and vendors.Performs other duties as assigned.Bachelor’s degree in a business administration or IT related field desired. Relevant work experience may be substituted.Minimum 4 years in a business analyst capacity, with at least 2 years focused on Human Resources processes.Must have systems implementation experience.Strong knowledge of ERP systems desired.Experience with Workday application strongly preferred.Experience with diagraming tools a plus.Ability to quickly grasp complex business processes and transition to documentation for various audiences – both end-user and technical.Ability to work independently.Ability to think creatively and solve problems.Strong attention to detail.Strong organization and prioritization skills.Strong interpersonal and communication skills.Team player and willingness to jump into any project.To Apply:Submit cover letter and resume through ourCareers Page, Requisition #19026Due to the high volume of applications we are not able to respond to inquiries via phoneAs an EOE/AA employer, WWF will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant’s race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Name: Agile Business Analyst
Description: About ExcellaExcella Consulting is a leading provider of Agile software development and data and analytics solutions to clients in the federal, commercial and non-profit sectors. We believe that great work leads to great things –- our experts measure success by the positive impact we make on our clients, community, and colleagues. We are growing fast and need passionate, innovative people who love working with technology and are ready to make an impact.  Here's what you can expect from us: We care about our employees. In fact, The Washington Post and The Washington Business Journal consistently rank us as a "Best Place to Work."You'll work with great people who love what they do: our team includes published authors, certified trainers, and internationally renowned speakers.We have a "bring your own device" workplace and will share the cost of a new computer of your choice -- Mac or PC. It's up to you.We'll invest in your career by providing 3 days of paid professional development every year, including travel and registration fees to attend classes and conferences, in addition to tuition assistance for degrees and certifications.Starting day one, every employee is bonus eligible and receives 17 days of paid vacation.You can bike, drive, or metro to work -- our commute reimbursement plan has you covered.We cater dinner once a month, and always have healthy snacks available!You'll have fun! We hold monthly happy hours and events all year long, including a summer weekend getaway for you and your family OverviewWe are looking for thought leaders in Agile Business Analysis to join our team who have a desire to deliver valuable software application solutions which meet client needs. Our business analysts are team-oriented, collaborative, and focus on delivering value in everything we do. We use agile methods to analyze, define and document business requirements for software solutions which align with organizational goals and help our clients achieve their desired outcomes.ResponsibilitiesExperience working independently to deliver results.Requirements elicitation: Apply different techniques to facilitate meetings and workshops, create a shared understanding with stakeholders, and engage team-members without using reams of paper or electronic documents.Requirements analysis: Collaborates with stakeholders and product teams to decompose large epic stories into features and user stories that can be understood and approved by members of the development team.Requirements documentation: Requires a strong experience managing product backlog and product roadmap.Strong experience creating user stories and acceptance criteria to express requirements.Familiarity with Scrum process and role of Product Owner.Experience providing product management support such as prioritization and backlog grooming.Conduct testing such as functional testing, user acceptance testing (UAT), automated acceptance testing (AAT), and specification by example.Strong interpersonal skills to engage team members, clients, and stakeholders and communicate business expectations to the technical development expert in ways they can produce desired outcome.Builds trust and respect, establish relationships, and develop rapport with technical and non-technical team members. QualificationsB.A. or B.S. (focus in Computer Information Systems, Business Management, Engineering, or related area of study is a plus)4+ years’ experience in IT or related industryPrior consulting and client management experience is a plusExceptional interpersonal and communication skills (verbal, written, and presentation)Strong knowledge of office productivity toolsExcellent organizational skills and detail orientationStrong analytical aptitude, and an ability to structure complex or undefined business problemsUnderstanding of change management practices In addition, we are seeking individuals with applicable certifications such as CBAP, CCBA, CSM, CSPO, CSP, and ITIL.

Name: Business Analyst - OLA/SLA
Description: Overview DRT Strategies delivers expert management consulting and information technology (IT) solutions to large federal agencies, the U.S. Navy, state and local government and commercial clients in health care, technology, and the financial services industries.  The three letters of our name, DRT, stand for Driving Resolutions Together, which is the core philosophy on which the company was founded. That is, we collaborate with our clients to solve their most pressing IT challenges - together.  We are problem solvers dedicated to your success, combining Fortune 500 experience with small business responsiveness. We have established a reputation with our clients as a forward thinking consulting firm with demonstrated success in implementing solutions that lead to meaningful results. Our world-class consultants unite people to work collaboratively to achieve project goals and make your vision a reality. Project Summary DRT provides FDA IT leadership the means to make informed decisions on the IT which supports FDAs mission for public health. DRT provides performance management support services to develop and manage IT Operational Level Agreements (OLAs) and the associated performance metrics. Additionally, DRT supports the IT Service Level Agreement (SLA) and the associated Key Performance Indicators (KPI) through annual reviews, monthly data gathering, and quarterly performance reporting. ResponsibilitiesWork closely with various IT departments, business stakeholders, user groups, management support, user feedback, and other IT teams to gather the information needed to develop and maintain the SLA, KPIs, and OLAsDevelop process models and narratives related to IT service departmentsPrepare agreements for IT leaderships review and signaturesEvaluate current operational level agreements and propose updates or changes based on best practicesPerform peer reviews on teams work products through a process comprised of a review of the documentation against pre-defined acceptance criteria of quality characteristics on an ongoing basisMentor and train other team members in KPI development methods, processes, and implementation of those methods as well as information visualization and presentationDeliver quarterly KPI performance reports including building and delivering presentations to leadershipLead annual reviews with service brokers and process owners to capture new and changed KPIsPerform root cause analyses and build corrective action plans for missed KPI targetsDevelop innovative means of reporting IT performance metrics and KPIsFacilitate governance board meetings including developing presentations and taking meeting minutesWork on other tasks as assigned by the managerRequired ExperienceFive (5) or more years of professional business analyst and project management experienceExperience working as part of a consulting team that is managing multiple client projects within an enterprise IT environmentAbility to work well with team members as well as with all levels of stakeholders, management, staff, and clientsProficiency with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Project, Visio, Excel and SharePointExcellent written and verbal communication skillsEducation and TrainingBachelor's DegreePreferred CertificationsITIL Foundations or higherData Visualization experiencePMP Certification DRT Strategies, Inc. (DRT) celebrates diversity and is proud to provide Equal Employment Opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetics, disability, or protected veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, DRT complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Name: Acquisition Intermediate Business Analyst
Description: Acquisition Intermediate Business AnalystPentagon, DCSpectrum is looking for an Intermediate Business Analyst with Air Force Acquisition Process expertise and documented process improvement experience. The Intermediate Business Analyst will support the Secretary of the Air Force Acquisition Excellence and Change Office (SAF/AQXC) and other Air Force acquisition activities.Job Responsibilities:Serve as direct customer liaison who anticipates and manages customers evolving needs and provides a wide range of support in real time.Facilitate and document Rapid Improvement Events (RIE) and Continuous Process Improvement (CPI) events. Includes scoping meetings, problem definition and research meetings, face-to-face meetings, follow-up meetings and all associated documentation.Track Rapid Improvement Events across time for ROI, best practices and impacts to the acquisition process. Archive of historical efforts. Integrate results into strategic alignment, strategic communications, training and professional development of workforce.Conduct process alignment events across AQ/A4/AFMC/AFSPC and other organizations with Acquisition equity/impact. Provide facilitation, documentation, research, and analysis of alignment to strategic objectives, Key Process Indicators and processes.Develop and maintain working engagement with academia to identify and recommend emerging trends in CPI and to identify encouraging new techniques.Required Skills and Experience:Air Force Acquisition experience5 years of current relevant (i.e., headquarters staff) experienceKnowledge of Air Force structure inter-dependencies and organizational inter-relationshipsU.S. citizenshipActive Secret clearanceBachelor's degreeAdvanced Microsoft Office skills (specifically PowerPoint, Excel and Word)Desired Skills and Experience:LEAN / SixSigma Black Belt level CPI certificationExperience working in the Pentagon environmentMaster's degreeSpectrum is proud of our diverse workforce and diligently committed to remaining an Equal Opportunity Employer. Spectrum governs all employment-related decisions without regard to an individual's race, color, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected classification.[Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer minorities/females/veterans/individuals with disabilities/sexual orientation/gender identity]

Name: Intelligence Analyst (Junior level)
Description: Job Description:No two career paths will ever look the same. At Leidos, we know the most talented and diverse IT and engineering professionals will always have a multitude of career choices; your time at Leidos will be a wise investment in your career and in yourself.Our Civil business is helping to modernize and manage infrastructure, systems and controls, and cyber security for civilian agencies and commercial clients around the globe. With core competencies in information technology, energy and environment, complex logistics, and specialized engineering, we solve technical challenges and implement newfound efficiencies on a number of programs!Protect yourself and your family, with the benefits of working for a world-class employer. When you join Leidos, you join a Fortune 500 company and one of Ethisphere Institute's "World's Most Ethical Companies" Leidos...We strive to make the complex clear.***Applicant must have an ACTIVE "Top Secret" security clearance***What You'll Get to Do:-Provide intelligence analysis services to the Counterintelligence Division (CD).-Assist with thorough research and analysis of various transactions for threats to US national security. This written intelligence analysis shall be completed using Intelligence Community (IC) standards and other guidance.-The analyst will conduct extensive, comprehensive research and basic analysis.-In addition, he/she will assist with researching and analyzing transactions of ongoing programs and projects as assigned; assess threats both to the United States and specific departments, evaluate telecommunication license applications for implications to the broader telecommunication market and must assess if license request will impact law enforcement equities or present national security issues; conduct in-depth research and analysis of specified foreign merger, acquisition, or investment transactions.You'll Bring These Qualifications:-Requires a BA degree or equivalent experience and less than 2 years prior relevant experience.-Minimum of 5+ years of intelligence analysis experience in support of the Intelligence Community.-Experience using analytic techniques and tools to identify trends, fill information gaps, develop assessments (e.g. Palantir).-Experience analyzing and evaluating intelligence against a wide range of data sources.-Substantial knowledge of intelligence operations, procedures, techniques and terminology of the IC; knowledge of developing and presenting products and information.-Experience with Interagency Collaboration.-Excellent oral and written communications; ability to argue a position and effectively share concepts with other IC entities. -Proficient in utilizing basic computer applications and intelligence related automation to support analytical efforts and product development.

Name: P1001.017 Jr. Business Process Analyst
Description: This is an entry level position. Assists in formulating system requirements based on user needs. Participates in application systems analysis activities. May use requirement development tools. Assists in on-going analysis of requirements. Must be able to perform with limited supervision. Participates in requirements peer reviews with customers. Performs as a member of a team. Demonstrates good oral and written communication skills.  Years of Experience: 1

Name: Business Analyst (Agile) - Contract
Description: Our client is an established informatics solutions company for clinical trials and research. They empower patients and providers with technology-based healthcare solutions. Through the use of IT, they help organizations produce efficient and effective outcomes. Their business is the capture, storage, and use of information in health and biomedical science.  They are currently seeking a highly motivated and experienced Business Analyst (BA) to collaborate with and support our Agile Scrum software development project teams. The ideal candidate has at least three to five years of experience capturing stakeholder business needs and translating them into the appropriate requirement artifacts e.g. product features, user stories, epics and wire-frames. The ideal candidate would also have experience working with solutions developed for the clinical research, health information or government IT industry.  Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or higher in a technology related field or equivalent work experience 3-5 years business analyst experience in an agile software development environment  Proficient understanding of Agile/Scrum Software development methodology  Proficient with Microsoft Office products  Experience with user-centered design practices and research  Experience with Jira, Confluence or similar work management tools  Preferred Skills:  Professional Certifications i.e. CCBA®, CBAP® , PMP, Certified Product Owner or Scrum Master  Understanding of GCP and other clinical research regulations/standards  Experience with using portal technologies (e.g., SharePoint)ABOUT KORE1 Specializing in creative and technical recruiting, KORE1 is committed to supporting top IT and Creative professionals in their career paths. We build deep relationships with leading companies, connecting them to exceptional talent every day. With extensive industry expertise and unmatched opportunities, our goal is to provide a unique experience for our contractors and consultants as they prepare for their next role. We are passionate about matching the right people with the right companies. Kore1 provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Kore1 complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Kore1 expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.Improper interference with the ability of Kore1's employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

Name: Part-time Business Operations Analyst
Description: Summary/ObjectiveThe Office of Information Technology is seeking a Part–time Business Operations Analyst to provide general business process support and to serve as an operational point of contact for the department.The incumbent is expected to manage the daily office operations to include: initiating procurement; processing invoices; expense chargebacks; and budget transfers while ensuring their compliance with University policies and departmental procedures. The incumbent will also be responsible for tracking payments, journal entries, budget transfers while ensuring their accuracy and proactively addressing and resolving potential issues using the various tools available through American University (Colleague, Business Intelligence, etc.). The incumbent is expected to run, and create monthly budget reports for the OIT Sr. Leadership Team and support the OIT budget as needed. The incumbent is also responsible for assisting with executive level calendar management in initiating the scheduling of meetings; revising existing meetings; planning, coordinating department wide meetings and events; making room reservations; maintaining office supply inventory; ordering and maintaining an oversight of office supply deliveries; and initiating and following up on all facility related requests. Salary RangeCommensurate with experienceRequired Education and ExperienceStrong Excel skillsWorking knowledge of accounting principlesMust show strong initiativeMust have the ability to multitaskMust be able to set prioritiesAbility to function within a high-pressure environment and meet deadlines while working under pressureThis position may supervise part-time, and interns as necessaryMust be punctual, reliable, and detail orientedMust be able to function independently with minimal supervisionExcellent oral and written communication skillsExcellent interpersonal skills and a professional demeanorMust be able to respond to the changing needs of the officeMust demonstrate excellent problem solving and self confidencePreferred Education and ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Business or Finance, Accounting or related fieldMinimum of 2 years of financial experience in accounting and/or budgeting (may include internships)Current American University Employees:If you are a current full-time or part-time staff member at American University, please log into AsuccessfulU through the myAU portal. Once in AsuccessfulU, please select the Careers tile which will take you to our internal career page. Contact Us:For more information or assistance with the American University careers site, email theworkline@american.edu.American University is an equal opportunity, affirmative action institution that operates in compliance with applicable laws and regulations. The university does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, sex (including pregnancy), age, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, personal appearance, gender identity and expression, family responsibilities, political affiliation, source of income, veteran status, an individual’s genetic information or any other bases under federal or local laws (collectively "Protected Bases") in its programs and activities.
